"[81-father ninian] The next instant [he]81-father ninian had embarked , with a certain sense of pique lending perfection to [his]81-father ninian phrasing , on the prelude ; but perfect as [his]81-father ninian tone was , it seemed to fall dull and dead before the voice which rose and echoed into the arches . " [He]114-oh!--handel shall feed [[His]114-oh!--handel flock]3650-his flock like [a Shepherd]3651-a shepherd . "[81-father ninian] Pure , peaceful , free from every touch of passion ; absolutely , utterly , beyond [this world]342-this world and its works , it rose and filled [the garden]433-the garden ; [the orange - scented garden]553-the orange - scented garden with [its]553-the orange - scented garden fretted marble cascades and water - maze , where the feet of [laughing girls]554-laughing girls had chased [each other]3586-each other , the latticed balconies where [lovers]556-lovers had sat . It floated out over [the river]333-the river where [the dead girl]558-the dead girl had drifted , making a light come to a pair of bronze eyes . Out beyond [the garden]433-the garden , into [the city]3556-the city , a faint far echo of the call made [men]312-men and [women]479-women pause in the struggle for life , and say , " [They]3652-they are singing in [the palace]3477-the palace . "[479-women] The promise of all religions , the cry which makes all creeds one , rose and fell , as the afternoon sun , shining into [the loggia]491-the loggia , put a canopy of stars above the head of [the singer]564-the singer . [Some of [the audience]566-the audience]565-some of the audience said " Thank [you]71-vincent , "[565-some of the audience] politely when [she]564-the singer ended . [Vincent Dering]71-vincent did not . [He]71-vincent stood on one side , and , being musical to the heart 's core , gave [himself]71-vincent the luxury of silence . Only when [Father Ninian]81-father ninian , ever mindful of ceremonies and courtesies , crossed to acknowledge the services of [the accompanist]497-the accompanist , [he]81-father ninian said briefly,-- " Who taught [her]564-the singer that ? "[81-father ninian] [The old man]3483-the old man looked at [him]71-vincent almost wistfully : " [I]3483-the old man heard [[her]564-the singer grandmother]3654-her grandmother sing it , nearly sixty years ago . [I]3483-the old man have never forgotten it . "[3483-the old man] " [I]71-vincent do not wonder , "[71-vincent] said [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , and [his]71-vincent eyes , forgetful of [others]569-others , followed [the girl whose dress ought to have been creamy and soft , instead of white and starched]570-the girl whose dress ought to have been creamy and soft , instead of white and starched . [The river [Hara]2-the hara]571-the river hara , after skirting [the fort]3493-the fort , the bathing - steps below [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , [the palace]3477-the palace , and [the palace garden]3504-the palace garden , continued its course , still hemmed in to swift current by [a high bank on the opposite side]576-a high bank on the opposite side , and on the near one by a wall set with [spiked temples sacred to [Siva]116-siva]577-spiked temples sacred to siva ; for [Hara]2-the hara is one of [his]71-vincent many names . But , on reaching the apex of [the triangle formed by [the city]3556-the city]578-the triangle formed by the city , [the banks]580-the banks fell away , [the river]333-the river spread itself out to greater rest , until , at the uttermost end of [a long spit of sandbank and tamarisk]582-a long spit of sandbank and tamarisk , [it]333-the river met the waters of [[its]333-the river twin river]583-its twin river , [the Hari]3-the hari , in [the broad placid lagoon which lay between [Eshwara]1-eshwara and the south]584-the broad placid lagoon which lay between eshwara and the south ; that is [the dry stretch of desert]585-the dry stretch of desert , against whose barrenness Western ingenuity -- aided by [[Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's horde of fifteen hundred ruffians]586-dr. dillon 's horde of fifteen hundred ruffians -- had been digging defiance for months . From [the spit of sand]587-the spit of sand [you]588-you could see the result . A broad seam on the face of [patient Mother Earth]13-patient mother earth , a first wrinkle telling of millions to come from the ploughshares of [men]312-men . As yet , however , [the canal]3421-the canal was as dry as [the desert around]591-the desert around [it]3421-the canal ; and was to remain so until [the great Lord - sahib]592-the great lord - sahib came in state , on [his]592-the great lord - sahib way to [the hills]343-the hills , to open the sluices . There was to be [a big camp]594-a big camp , a big function on the occasion , and even [sleepy Eshwara]1-eshwara felt a vague excitement regarding it . For [the older men]595-the older men remembered the days when [the Hosts of [the Lord - sahibs]597-the lord - sahibs]596-the hosts of the lord - sahibs had regularly passed through [the city]3556-the city , and had tales to tell about [them]596-the hosts of the lord - sahibs ; a fact which prevented the coming event from being too strange even to be thought about ! Then the opening of [the canal]3421-the canal was another disturber of primeval calm . True , the idea of [it]3421-the canal had been with [Eshwara]1-eshwara ever since the first sod had been turned two years before ; but now the thing stared [it]1-eshwara in the face . Within a few days the waters of [the sacred rivers]600-the sacred rivers would have to lie in a new bed . Would [they]601-they like it ? Would [the gods]3472-the gods like it ? Would [men]312-men like it ? Those were the questions being asked from [one end of [Eshwara]1-eshwara]604-one end of eshwara to another . Even outside [it]3421-the canal , on [the long narrow spit of sand - bank]605-the long narrow spit of sand - bank set with sparse tussocks of grass and tamarisk which reached beyond [[the city]3556-the city 's triangle]607-the city 's triangle into [the rivers]3592-the rivers -- and where , after a flood , the white gypsum silt lay like a robe of righteousness -- they were being discussed ; for [the strange race who lived on [it]3421-the canal , shifting [their]609-the strange race who lived on it , shifting their wigwams of grass wigwams of grass]609-the strange race who lived on it , shifting their wigwams of grass to [the low - lying land opposite when the waters rose]610-the low - lying land opposite when the waters rose , lived by [the river]333-the river ; by the fish in it , and the logs of wood which came floating down it . So this question of the canal was in the mind of [the naked man]612-the naked man , attired in the complete suit of blue beads which marks [an aboriginal race , who , in the dawn following]613-an aboriginal race , who , in the dawn following , squatted on the highest curve of [the spit]614-the spit . [He]612-the naked man was small , swart to positive inkiness , and [his]612-the naked man thin legs and arms shewed grey lights on their tense muscles , as if these were truly iron . Behind [him]612-the naked man rose a wigwam of reeds , at the entrance to which a spear was stuck in the sand in order to display the head of a bottle - nosed alligator impaled on its point . At [his]612-the naked man right hand was a reed basket , a rude net of reed twine . In front of [him]612-the naked man lay one of those small shark - like scaleless fishes which [the learned]615-the learned call [Silurian]14-silurian , and tell [us]616-us are relics of a creation older than [ours]616-us . So might [the man]3467-the man have been . So might have been the background of sand and reed , spear and wigwam , the foreground of net and fish . Yet [the fisher]618-the fisher was not all uncivilized . This little survival of [an aboriginal race , shifting about in the shifting]619-an aboriginal race , shifting about in the shifting [river - bed]620-river - bed , had always had an attraction for [the Missionaries]621-the missionaries , who , as a rule , find [the inferior races easiest to deal with]622-the inferior races easiest to deal with . [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu therefore -- [his]117-gu - gu name being as primitive as [his]117-gu - gu appearance , since it is the first effort of infant tongues -- belied [his]117-gu - gu looks . [He]117-gu - gu had at any rate a civilized eye to business , a civilized notion of the relations between supply and demand , for [he]117-gu - gu shook [his]117-gu - gu head at [the customer opposite [him]117-gu - gu]623-the customer opposite him . " Not [a cowrie less]3655-a cowrie less , [Khân - jee]89-roshan . ' Tis the only one in [the market]3656-the market , see [you]3657-you ; besides on this day [the ' Missen ' miss]3658-the ' missen ' miss comes to [[us]3659-us folk]3660-us folk , and [she]3658-the ' missen ' miss never haggles . [She]3658-the ' missen ' miss will pay the five annas gladly to be let read [her]3658-the ' missen ' miss book to [[my]117-gu - gu women]3661-my women . "[117-gu - gu] The mumble - apparently a pious aspiration that [the Most High]624-the most high would smite [infidels hip and thigh]625-infidels hip and thigh -- was the only recognizable point in the figure on the other side of the fish ; for [Akbar Khân]110-akbar , [doorkeeper]626-doorkeeper , [messenger]627-messenger , [assistant waiter]628-assistant waiter , had not only discarded [Saturn]97-saturn 's rings -- the loss of which about [his]110-akbar head made [his]110-akbar baldness something of a shock -- but also every article of clothing except [his]110-akbar waist - cloth . The reason for this was , in a way , like many another thing about [the old sinner]629-the old sinner , pathetic . Briefly [he]110-akbar liked to dissociate [his]110-akbar inner self from occupations which [he]110-akbar considered were beneath the dignity of [the Akbar Khân of the past]630-the akbar khân of the past . Therefore being , for the nonce , [a bazaar coolie in search of fish for [[his]110-akbar master]3639-his master 's breakfast]631-a bazaar coolie in search of fish for his master 's breakfast , [he]110-akbar got up for the part ; so finding it , at once , easier to forget , and to remember that past . [He]110-akbar mumbled of it as [he]110-akbar strenuously opposed the price . " Everything grows dearer , every day , "[110-akbar] yawned [the aboriginal Gu - gu]117-gu - gu . " Even [women]479-women , as [thou]3663-thou shouldst know . "[117-gu - gu] [Akbar Khân]110-akbar clucked a pious denial . " [We]110-akbar spread no nets for that game in [the palace]3477-the palace nowadays . Those evil times are gone ; [we]110-akbar live sober and virtuous . "[110-akbar] The piety held a distinct flavour of regret . " And as for fish , "[117-gu - gu] continued [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , " they will be dearer ere [they]3665-they are cheaper . When [the deep water]3666-the deep water begins to run canalwards , the fish will run too . Then good - by to [our]110-akbar trade , since [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors allow [us]110-akbar nothing in [their]118-the huzoors waters without payment . "[117-gu - gu] [He]117-gu - gu whined , however , to the wrong quarter for sympathy , [the old retainer]633-the old retainer 's views on preserving being absolutely those of [a Shropshire squire who is also a [J. P.]119-a shropshire squire who is also a j. p. " neither did we " Neither did [we]110-akbar]119-a shropshire squire who is also a j. p. " neither did we , "[117-gu - gu] [he]117-gu - gu replied , indifferently . " [Thy]110-akbar like , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , would have had to bring [thy]110-akbar fish to [the palace]3477-the palace and be satisfied with [our]110-akbar leavings . Out on [thee]110-akbar for [an upstart]3668-an upstart ! Take [thy]110-akbar four annas , and be thankful -- [slave]3669-slave ! "[117-gu - gu] [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's ill - tempered face became aggressive . " Not I!--the Miss will give it ; nay ! six , mayhap , since [the child]543-the child is sick , and [she]543-the child will be wanting leave to dose it . So -- hands off [-- eunuch]3671--- eunuch ! "[117-gu - gu] The title , once dignified , was opprobrious now , and [old Akbar]110-akbar rose in a perfect fury , [his]110-akbar bald head wobbling , the flaming fringe of red hairs about [his]110-akbar face giving [him]110-akbar a ludicrous resemblance to a toothless old man - eating tiger , face to face with [his]110-akbar lawful prey , yet unable to injure it . " Oh ! for [the bastinado]3672-the bastinado ! "[110-akbar] [he]110-akbar stuttered , impotently . " Oh , for the cutting off of bodily members ! Oh ! even , for the tying up of heels , and roastings and duckings . But [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors have taken them from [us]110-akbar , and gifted [them]118-the huzoors to [the police , who know not the proper methods]3673-the police , who know not the proper methods . [Yâh]120-yâh ! [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , had [I]110-akbar but had [thee]120-yâh fifty years ago ! "[110-akbar] [his]110-akbar anger lessened with sheer wistful regret . " Fifty years ago when [the Nawab]3674-the nawab gifted [me]110-akbar as body - servant to [the new Wazeer Bun]121-bun - avatâr - sahib - avatâr[1]-sahib because [he]3674-the nawab brought [him]3674-the nawab a bird that would sing of itself from [Italy wilayat]11-italy . "[110-akbar] " But all birds do that , "[117-gu - gu] [cavilled Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , feeling nevertheless a reverent curiosity about those legendary days . [Akbar]110-akbar gave a crackling , contemptuous laugh . " Not palace birds ! they have to be wound up ; and [Bun - avatâr - sahib]121-bun - avatâr - sahib sent for this across [the black water]3675-the black water . So [he]3674-the nawab kept favour with [the Nawab]122-nawab . Birds that sing , and flowers that smell , and boxes that make music , and dolls that dance when [you]3676-you wind them . [Lo]123-lo ! these , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , are the pleasures of [palaces]3677-palaces ; but how canst [thou]3678-thou know , who hast not lived in [them]3677-palaces even , as [I--]110-akbar "[110-akbar] The sense of [his]110-akbar own superiority soothed [him]110-akbar still more ; [he]110-akbar squatted down again , and hubble - bubbled for a space at [the hookah]634-the hookah which was an integral part of all [his]110-akbar impersonations . " Yea ! those were times , "[110-akbar] [he]110-akbar mumbled half to [himself]110-akbar . " Even [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan -- may Heaven protect [him]84-pidar narâyan -- could not say ' please [God]96-god ' to every mouthful , as [he]84-pidar narâyan does now -- as [we]3679-we all do now , and rightly , seeing that [we]3679-we have grown old . "[110-akbar] Once more the piety smacked of pity , and [the old man]3483-the old man , finding [a listener]636-a listener , went on with a certain gusto . " Look [you]636-a listener ! [he]84-pidar narâyan had to walk like the tongue among thirty - two teeth in those days , with [Bun - avatâr - sahib]3680-bun - avatâr - sahib , [[my]3483-the old man master]3681-my master , like two peas in one pod with [the Nawah]124-the nawah . Except for [women]479-women . [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan took [his]84-pidar narâyan way [there]3509-there -- mostly ! "[3483-the old man] The interrupting gurgle of [the hookah]634-the hookah gave time for an elaborate wink of a wicked old eye . Possibly this was due to the smoke , for the old voice went on as before almost dolorously . " [He]84-pidar narâyan had the money - bags , [you]636-a listener see , and looked after the rents . But [[my]638-he master]3681-my master , [Bun - avatâr -- lo]121-bun - avatâr - sahib ! [thou]3685-thou shouldst have seen [him]84-pidar narâyan when [he]84-pidar narâyan came first -- the picture of [a man!--they]3686-a man!--they say [he]84-pidar narâyan was [a prince in [[his]84-pidar narâyan [own country]3689-own country]3688-his own country]3687-a prince in his own country , but fell into trouble ; so came to make [his]84-pidar narâyan fortune here with [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan -- was called [Wazeer]121-bun - avatâr - sahib . And let [me]638-he tell [thee]636-a listener , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , it means something to be body - servant to [a Wazeer]3690-a wazeer ! [Lo]123-lo ! to think [I]638-he might have been it still but for that jade , [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum ! "[638-he] Despite the epithet , [he]638-he smiled , and [his]638-he pipe this time gave out quite a chuckling sound . " As ill to keep within walls as a butterfly ! "[638-he] [he]638-he muttered . " Up and down [the garden]433-the garden , in and out [the balconies]3692-the balconies , and [the Nawab]3674-the nawab in two minds to use force , or put [her]3674-the nawab in a sack . For [she]3674-the nawab flouted [him]638-he . [The prettiest ones]3694-the prettiest ones play that game for power always , and [she]3674-the nawab was [Walidâd]126-walidâd , [[her]3674-the nawab brother]3695-her brother 's , last hope of favour . [Walidâd]126-walidâd , [Kanjara]127-kanjara , who had been [[king]3696-king 's caterer]3697-king 's caterer for years before [[my]638-he master]3681-my master , [Bun - avatâr - sahib]121-bun - avatâr - sahib , came to make [all the court]3699-all the court cry sour buttermilk ! [Walidâd]126-walidâd , who had once stood so high , that , in a drunken bout , [the Nawab]3674-the nawab promised [him]638-he [[his]638-he half - sister]3701-his half - sister to [wife]3702-wife . And [he]638-he got [her]3701-his half - sister too ! [She]3701-his half - sister wept on [her]3701-his half - sister wedding day , but [we]3703-we in [the lower storey]3704-the lower storey heeded not tears in the upper . For , see [you]3705-you , [[mine]638-he uncle]3706-mine uncle was [chief eunuch]3707-chief eunuch -- [we]3703-we kept the honour thus in [the family]3708-the family from generation to [generation]3709-generation -- so [I]638-he was in and out , seeing what went on . Until somehow ( [[mine]638-he uncle]3706-mine uncle with the bowstring round [his]3706-mine uncle neck -- as was right , [honest man]3711-honest man -- swore [he]3706-mine uncle knew not how ) [Bun - avatâr - sahib]121-bun - avatâr - sahib caught a sight of [her]3701-his half - sister ! [Some]3712-some say it was a plot , from beginning to end , of [Walidâd]126-walidâd 's ; others that [[his]639-his enemies]3713-his enemies feared lest [Anâri]125-anâri begum should succeed . There be balls within balls , even in a plaything , if [the workmen]3714-the workmen are cunning ! Anyhow , [he]639-his saw [her]3701-his half - sister . "[638-he] And [I]0-i , [[his]639-his body - servant]640-his body - servant , was able to come and go where [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan hath made [[his]639-his church]641-his church nowadays . But there ! what matters it ? ' Tis all one . Love and the Faith are in and out of [men]312-men 's minds like a shelldrake in weedy water ; a body can not tell which way its head may be and which its tail ! Nevertheless [I]0-i felt a choke at [my]0-i throat , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , many a time , as [I]0-i waited for [him]639-his in [the boat]643-the boat below [the balcony]644-the balcony ; yet in the end , it was not [my]0-i throat , but [[mine]0-i [uncle]646-uncle]3706-mine uncle 's . [He]639-his died in the faith , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , cursing [women]479-women . [His]639-his head was that way at the last!--'Tis mostly so -- [he]639-his -- he-- " The chuckle of [his]639-his pipe was fiendish , yet [his]639-his wizened face was wistful . "[639-his] Still , [God]96-god knows , [one]3501-one could scarce look on at such a wooing , and not beat the drum in time , as [musicians]649-musicians to [a dancer]650-a dancer . And it runs in [our]651-our blood , see [you]652-you , to watch , and beat the drum . That is [our]651-our profession ; and , by [[mine]0-i ancestors]653-mine ancestors ! [I]0-i deemed it enough for [mortal man]654-mortal man . But [Bun - avatâr - sahib]121-bun - avatâr - sahib , see [you]652-you , was not of [[our]651-our race]655-our race . [He]639-his was of [Italy wilayat]11-italy and [a prince]656-a prince . So , one day , [my]0-i liver dissolved hearing that the butterfly was over the walls ! But , as [I]0-i said , it was [[mine]0-i [uncle]646-uncle]3706-mine uncle 's neck , not [mine]0-i . Yet the game ended for [me]0-i when [Bun - avatâr - sahib]3680-bun - avatâr - sahib died . " "[660-they] [They]660-they poisoned [him]639-his , [folk]661-folk say ; is't true ? " asked [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu . It was a point in the oft - told tale which was still discussed by [[Eshwara]1-eshwara gossips]3715-eshwara gossips . "[660-they] That is [other folks]662-other folks ' news , not [mine]0-i , " replied [Akbar]110-akbar , discreetly . "[662-other folks] May be , may be not . [The Huzoors]118-the huzoors , anyhow , sent [the Nawab]3674-the nawab to die in [Calcutta]12-calcutta on a pinson[2 ] for it ; but [they]118-the huzoors have ever an excuse to take [land]664-land ! [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan had a hard fight to keep [Bun - avatâr - sahib]3680-bun - avatâr - sahib 's grants -- [the Nawab]3674-the nawab was ever generous to [[his]3674-the nawab favourites]667-his favourites , look [you]668-you -- for [[Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum 's baby]669-anâri begum 's baby ; ay ! though [he]3674-the nawab showed a writing of marriage , and had made [the infant Christian]670-the infant christian after [their]671-their habit . Still [he]3674-the nawab got [them]672-them , [land]664-land and [palace]674-palace and all . So [I]0-i stayed on serving [[my]0-i master 's child]675-my master 's child , and when [she]676-she died , [[her]676-she child]677-her child , [the Miss - baba]678-the miss - baba , even to the haggling for fish . Lo ! [slave]3669-slave ! it grows late . Give it to [me]0-i and have done with it -- [Thou]680-thou wilt not . Oh ! for the devil that was in [[her]675-my master 's child grandmother]3654-her grandmother Anâr to be in [this Miss - baba]682-this miss - baba , and for [her]682-this miss - baba to come to [Bun - avatâr - sahib]121-bun - avatâr - sahib 's rights as [Wazeer]121-bun - avatâr - sahib -- then would there be loppings and-- " "[89-roshan] Or if [Roshan Khân]89-roshan should come to [his]89-roshan , " sneered [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu . "[89-roshan] [The canal sahib 's ayah]683-the canal sahib 's ayah was telling [me]0-i [thou]680-thou didst prostrate [thyself]684-thyself in the dust as if [he]89-roshan were indeed [Nawab]122-nawab ! Have a care ! [eunuch]685-eunuch - jee , [the police]686-the police are agog nowadays to find disloyalty even in newspapers . " "[685-eunuch] May [her]3654-her grandmother gossiping tongue be slit ! " stuttered [the old retainer]633-the old retainer . "[685-eunuch] Can a body not do obeisance to [[his]89-roshan masters]687-his masters ? For look [you]688-you , [Roshan]89-roshan is [true grand - nephew to [the Nawab]3674-the nawab through [[his]89-roshan grandmother]530-his grandmother , [[Walidâd]126-walidâd 's wife]692-walidâd 's wife -- ay]689-true grand - nephew to the nawab through his grandmother , walidâd 's wife -- ay ! and for that matter , [cousin to [the Miss]694-the miss]693-cousin to the miss , through [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum , [[Walidâd]126-walidâd 's sister]695-walidâd 's sister ! [I]0-i did but welcome [him]89-roshan ; [I]0-i did but [my]0-i duty -- [I]0-i did but show [my]0-i manners -- [I]0-i did but what [we]696-we have done from generation to generation . " [He]0-i moved away muttering , full of virtuous resentment that a suspicion of anything save sheer servility should have been imputed to [him]0-i . After a lifetime of [trucklings]3717-trucklings and bootblackings , to be credited with higher motives was too bad . To prove [his]0-i innocence [he]0-i would that very evening , [he]0-i told [himself]0-i , seek out [Roshan]89-roshan , not at [the Fort,--that]16-the fort,--that might be misunderstood,--but at [[his]0-i grandmother]530-his grandmother 's . [[His]0-i grandmother]530-his grandmother , who , though [she]530-his grandmother had been [upstart Walidâd 's wife]3720-upstart walidâd 's wife , was still [[the late Nawab]3721-the late nawab 's half - sister]3722-the late nawab 's half - sister ! [[His]0-i sister]3723-his sister ! ! What could be nearer than that ! ! ! And [he]0-i would prostrate [himself]0-i again , and assure [the family]3708-the family of [his]0-i services . That was [his]0-i birthright . [Meanwhile Gu - gu]117-gu - gu looked after [him]89-roshan , and laughed . [He]89-roshan was [a clever fellow]3725-a clever fellow , was [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , and in a previous generation of [scholars]3726-scholars had been [pet pupil in a little school started by [another Miss from [another Missen]129-another missen]3728-another miss from another missen]3727-pet pupil in a little school started by another miss from another missen . [He]89-roshan had got pennies for attending it , which had come in useful before [he]89-roshan was big enough to face [the river]333-the river . But now [he]89-roshan was [the best man on either [the Hara]2-the hara or [the Hari]3-the hari]3730-the best man on either the hara or the hari , save one . And [he]89-roshan ? [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's beady black eyes , watching the curve of the current mechanically , gave a sudden flash . [He]89-roshan was on [his]89-roshan feet in a second . There was something dipping , diving , sidling , drifting , out yonder which might be secured for [his]89-roshan wigwam before [anyone else]3731-anyone else saw it ! But as , silently , like a seal 's , [his]89-roshan black head came up from [his]89-roshan first forge under water which was to give [him]89-roshan a fair start from [the shore]3732-the shore without even a splash to attract notice , another black head showed to the right of [him]89-roshan , a yard or two behind . But it was [his]89-roshan head ! [Am - ma]3733-am - ma 's head ! [Am - ma]131-am - ma , the frog - like , [Am - ma]131-am - ma , whose wide hands and feet looked as if webbed in the water . [Am - ma]131-am - ma , [the only man who could touch [him]89-roshan]3734-the only man who could touch him . [He]89-roshan set [his]89-roshan teeth , gave up silence , and surged ahead with an overhand stroke , [his]89-roshan hand seeming to clutch and hold the water . It was a faster stroke than [Am - ma]131-am - ma 's ; for a time the swifter . Then with a backward glance [he]89-roshan drew a quick breath , knowing it would be a race indeed , for the black head had gone , and only a faint wale on the smooth water told where [[his]89-roshan rival]3735-his rival , avoiding the slight resistance of the air , swam like a fish . Dangerous tactics for [most men]3736-most men , ending often in a sudden collapse , bleedings from nose and ears , or , at least , time lost in coming to the surface . But [Am - ma]131-am - ma was not as [other men]3737-other men . Half - witted , except in river lore , uncouth , misshapen , [he]131-am - ma was practically amphibious . [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ground [his]117-gu - gu teeth impotently as the faint wale crept up and up . [The man]3467-the man must have air in [his]3467-the man stomach like a fish ! Ah ! if [the river]333-the river had been in flood , if this had been a race with air bladders , indeed,--one black head of inflated skin under each arm , and [your]3740-your own in the middle -- the issue would have been certain ; for [no one]3741-no one , in [the whole tribe]3742-the whole tribe , knew the backward rip of a knife from below which would leave [a rival]3743-a rival helpless , lopsided , bound to seek safety on [shore]3744-shore , so well as [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ! But it was not flood time , so [he]89-roshan must risk all . Like a porpoise at play the curve of [his]89-roshan dark back disappeared , and now there were two wales upon the water side by side . And ahead , sidling , dipping , diving to the current was [a deodar log with the broad arrow of government on it , now visible , now out of sight]3745-a deodar log with the broad arrow of government on it , now visible , now out of sight . It was a question of steering ; steering without eyes , steering by instinct , steering by sheer experience of logs and their ways , of the meeting currents of [the two rivers]3746-the two rivers and [their]3746-the two rivers ways . And over against [them]3746-the two rivers , to the right across [the broad lagoon]3747-the broad lagoon , were [low brick buildings]3748-low brick buildings , and [a horde of fifteen hundred ruffians with fascines and earth - baskets finishing a dam that was to alter the currents , and protect the canal]3749-a horde of fifteen hundred ruffians with fascines and earth - baskets finishing a dam that was to alter the currents , and protect the canal ! [They]3746-the two rivers looked like swarming ants in the sunshine . [The wales]3750-the wales were neck and neck now , side by side , straight as a die on the log . Then suddenly , the right - hand one swerved outward . Only a yard or two ; a yard or two nearer to the ants in the sunshine . A second after the log swerved also -- swerved to the right . The next , two black heads rose silently ; but one of [them]3746-the two rivers was two yards to the left of [that dancing , dipping prize]3751-that dancing , dipping prize ! [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , breathless as [he]117-gu - gu was , gave an inarticulate cry of rage , and shook [his]117-gu - gu fist at the swarming ants . Already [their]3746-the two rivers work was altering the currents [he]117-gu - gu had known for so long . That it was possible to allow for this , as [Am - ma]131-am - ma had done , did not comfort [him]117-gu - gu . [He]117-gu - gu swam back sulkily , [his]117-gu - gu wrath increased by the knowledge one glance had given [him]117-gu - gu , that the log on which [[his]117-gu - gu rival]3735-his rival was paddling to shore triumphantly bore its broad arrow so lightly , and so near its end , that a little dexterous manipulation would have left [the runaway unmarked]3753-the runaway unmarked , and so given [its captor]3754-its captor the right , not merely of ransom , but of sale ! Truly , it was [an ill world for [the poor]538-the poor]3755-an ill world for the poor ! But [Lance Carlyon]68-lance laughed , as [he]68-lance lounged over [his]68-lance early tea and watched [the river]333-the river through [his]68-lance field - glass , in [a balcony of [the fort]3493-the fort]3758-a balcony of the fort , dressed in a gorgeous ring - streaked sleeping suit which [he]68-lance could only wear when on outpost duty , as [the regiment]3760-the regiment had tabooed it . In truth it made [him]68-lance not unlike [Tom Sawyer]132-tom sawyer 's "[0-i] [Royal Nonsuch]133-royal nonsuch . " "[133-royal nonsuch] [The little ' un]697-the little ' un 's got it ! [I]0-i say ! [Dering]71-vincent , [I]0-i believe [I]0-i shall like [Eshwara]1-eshwara . It's -- it's -- new -- don't [you]71-vincent know . " [His]68-lance eyes rested , as [he]68-lance spoke , on [the low , bastioned building , all hemmed in by temple spires]3761-the low , bastioned building , all hemmed in by temple spires , at the very point of [[the city]3556-the city 's triangle]607-the city 's triangle , which [Erda Shepherd]105-erda had told [him]68-lance was [the mission house]3764-the mission house . Truly , [he]68-lance thought , [she]105-erda was in the thick of it ! "[71-vincent] New ! " echoed [Vincent Dering]71-vincent captiously , "[71-vincent] [I]0-i should have called it old . [I]0-i thought that sort of thing had died with the pagoda tree . " "[0-i] What sort of thing ? " [Vincent]71-vincent nodded towards [the palace]3477-the palace with an odd , cynical laugh . "[0-i] That ; it 's ghostly . Does n't belong to the nineteenth century ! " [Lance]68-lance turned curiously . "[0-i] [I]0-i said that to -- to [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan -- [I]0-i ca n't call [him]84-pidar narâyan anything else , somehow -- when [he]84-pidar narâyan was showing [me]0-i over yesterday . And -- [you]698-you know that inscrutable smile of [his]84-pidar narâyan -- [he]84-pidar narâyan just pointed up to the telegraph wires -- they go right across [the garden]433-the garden [you]698-you know -- and said , ' There is half the news of half [the world]404-the world over [our]701-our heads , anyhow . ' [It]702-it knocked [me]0-i over , [I]0-i tell [you]698-you , to think of it ; and by [Jove]76-jove ! [Dering]71-vincent , next week when [the Lord - sahib]3420-the lord - sahib comes-- " [Vincent Dering]71-vincent laughed boisterously . "[3420-the lord - sahib] There 'll be the millennium , of course . Come along , [Lance]68-lance ! It 's time [we]701-our were off to prepare [his]3420-the lord - sahib way . [Dashwood]72-dashwood wants it done A1 . [They]704-they are going to lay on electric light , and all that . By the way , [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith told [me]0-i to tell [you]698-you [she]75-mrs. smith expected [you]698-you to breakfast . " Ten minutes afterwards [they]701-our were riding over [the boat bridge]3766-the boat bridge to superintend the laying out of [the Vice - regal camp]3767-the vice - regal camp against the coming of [the Lord - sahib]3420-the lord - sahib and [[his]3420-the lord - sahib hosts]3769-his hosts . [Mumtâza Mahal]134-mumtâza mahal , [[Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's grandmother]3770-roshan khân 's grandmother , lived in a queer little backwater of [a house which had eddied itself away from [the main stream of [the town]331-the town]3772-the main stream of the town]3771-a house which had eddied itself away from the main stream of the town , and jammed itself against a wall of [the palace]3477-the palace as if seeking dignity thereby . For all that [it]3771-a house which had eddied itself away from the main stream of the town belonged irredeemably to [the city]3556-the city , and to [[its]3556-the city evil - smelling lanes]3776-its evil - smelling lanes . The word house , however , is misleading to western ears , since this was simply [a well - like courtyard]3777-a well - like courtyard , with a great wooden bed set in the centre under a miserable attempt at a tree which was used as a clothes - peg , a rack for saucepans , and a variety of other domestic purposes . It fulfilled them to the perfect satisfaction of [[its]3771-a house which had eddied itself away from the main stream of the town proprietress]3778-its proprietress , [a roundabout old lady]3779-a roundabout old lady , plump as a button - quail , who , when [she]3779-a roundabout old lady was not asleep inside the arcaded slip of [a room]3780-a room on one side , passed [her]3779-a roundabout old lady time on the bed in the scanty shade , keeping company with a sausage - roll of a pillow and a quilt , both covered in faded , greasy silk . As a rule [she]3779-a roundabout old lady did nothing save eat pân ; though sometimes , as a favour to [Erda Shepherd]105-erda , who came to read to [her]3779-a roundabout old lady once a week , [she]3779-a roundabout old lady would give a few more stitches to a knitted comforter which never seemed to get any longer . It had been begun , indeed , under the auspices of [another "[75-mrs. smith] Miss , " who had returned to [England]17-england only to die , as so many do , from exposure , and overwork , and homesickness]3781-another " miss , " who had returned to england only to die , as so many do , from exposure , and overwork , and homesickness . For the rest , [Mumtâza]134-mumtâza mahal was [an arrogant , yet good - natured old soul , who , despite those tears on [her]3779-a roundabout old lady wedding - day]3782-an arrogant , yet good - natured old soul , who , despite those tears on her wedding - day , had kept dissolute [Walidâd]126-walidâd under [her]3779-a roundabout old lady thumb , and [[his]126-walidâd son]3783-his son also . Therefore , it was one of [her]3779-a roundabout old lady pet grievances -- and [she]3779-a roundabout old lady had many -- that [Roshan]89-roshan , [[her]3779-a roundabout old lady grandson]3784-her grandson , should have defied [her]3779-a roundabout old lady authority and entered [the army]3785-the army . The great standing grievance , however , was that the "[75-mrs. smith] pinson " [she]3779-a roundabout old lady received from [Government]3786-government because [[her]3779-a roundabout old lady husband]3787-her husband had been deported with [the Nawab]3674-the nawab to [Calcutta]12-calcutta , was not so large as one received by [a neighbour]3789-a neighbour and [gossip whose husband had been hanged in the mutiny]3790-gossip whose husband had been hanged in the mutiny ! [The two old ladies]3791-the two old ladies came to loggerheads over [their]3791-the two old ladies respective claims once a month , regularly , when pay - day came round ; [Mumtâza]134-mumtâza mahal asserting shrilly that to die in [a strange country]3792-a strange country was more painful than hanging , [Ashrâf - un - nissa]135-ashrâf - un - nissa contending roundly that if [Walidâd]126-walidâd had had as much respectful affection for [[his]126-walidâd widow]3793-his widow as [[her]3779-a roundabout old lady husband]3787-her husband had had for [his]126-walidâd , [he]126-walidâd could easily have caused [himself]126-walidâd to be hanged ; since [he]126-walidâd had certainly deserved it . Whereat there would be war , until some one in [the alley]3795-the alley , or round the corner did something outrageous,--threw slops over [some one]3796-some one , or had [twins]3797-twins , or imported [a new mother - in - law]3798-a new mother - in - law ! Then , friendly discussion becoming a necessity of life , the big wooden bed would once more hold [two old ladies]3799-two old ladies , two roly - poly bolsters , two quilts -- also two tongues ! But these confined [themselves]3791-the two old ladies , for a time , to lesser grievances ; such as the general decadence of the age , manifested by the reluctance of [young people]3800-young people to obey the old . There was , however , no sign of displeasure in the reception prepared for [Roshan]89-roshan , when one afternoon , immediately after [his]89-roshan arrival at [Eshwara]1-eshwara , [he]89-roshan appeared to prostrate [himself]89-roshan at the feet of age ; at least so [he]89-roshan had said in [his]89-roshan letter of intimation . [Mumtâza Mahal]134-mumtâza mahal knew [her]134-mumtâza mahal duty towards [men]312-men - folk better than to show temper at once ; knew also the suffocating effect of ceremonials . So the tarnished treasures of past state had been dug out of the mounds of litter heaped up in all four corners of [the arcaded room]3802-the arcaded room , and set about [the courtyard]386-the courtyard . An old elephant - housing covered the wooden bed , and to it [Roshan]89-roshan was conducted : [[his]89-roshan grandmother]530-his grandmother , despite [her]530-his grandmother best green satin trousers , squatting below , on a mat . [The young soldier]3805-the young soldier felt and looked thoroughly uncomfortable . Out of sheer funk of [the old lady]3806-the old lady 's remarks if [he]89-roshan had appeared in [his]89-roshan usual mufti of English tweed and a close - fitting turban , [he]89-roshan had reverted to the airy muslins and embroidered smoking - caps of [[his]89-roshan forbears]3807-his forbears . [He]89-roshan felt chilly , barely decent in them ; and , indeed , the whole environment was absolutely repugnant to [him]89-roshan . [[[His]89-roshan grandmother]530-his grandmother 's tramways]3809-his grandmother 's tramways could scarcely be otherwise to one who had gone ahead by [express train]3810-express train like [Roshan Khân]89-roshan . Thoroughly well - educated , [he]89-roshan knew [himself]89-roshan to be considered [one of [the smartest native officers in [the army]3785-the army]3812-the smartest native officers in the army]3811-one of the smartest native officers in the army . [A first - class polo player]3814-a first - class polo player , [a fair cricketer , able to handle cue and racket , and without equal at the foils]3815-a fair cricketer , able to handle cue and racket , and without equal at the foils , [he]89-roshan had for years met [Englishmen]3816-englishmen on equal terms in sporting matters . What wonder , then , that [he]89-roshan sat looking inexpressibly bored beside the hookah which was the pride of [[his]89-roshan grandmamma]3817-his grandmamma 's heart , in that it had belonged to [many dead and gone Nawabs]3818-many dead and gone nawabs ? [He]89-roshan was simply longing for the solace of a smoke , yet [he]89-roshan did not dare to use the silver cigarette case with [his]89-roshan initials , "[75-mrs. smith] R.K. " on it , which [Lance Carlyon]68-lance had given [him]89-roshan at Christmas in return for the fencing lessons . Fortunately , however , boredom and yawns are correct during visits of ceremony , so [Mumtâza Mahal]134-mumtâza mahal crossed [her]134-mumtâza mahal little fat hands over [her]134-mumtâza mahal little fat green - trousered legs , and told [herself]134-mumtâza mahal [the lad]3819-the lad was improved in both manners and looks ; was distinctly more like [[her]134-mumtâza mahal brother]3695-her brother , [the late and sainted Nawab]3821-the late and sainted nawab . The fact emphasized [her]134-mumtâza mahal regret that , after a brilliant career in [a mission school]3822-a mission school , a career which must have led to a minor clerkship , [[her]134-mumtâza mahal grandson]3784-her grandson should have taken the unheard - of course of entering [the army]3785-the army ! If [he]3784-her grandson could even have gone as [[the Nawab]3674-the nawab 's grand - nephew]3826-the nawab 's grand - nephew , with [a dozen troopers or so as following]3827-a dozen troopers or so as following , it might have been bearable ; but , as [Walidâd]126-walidâd 's extraction barred all claim to noble descent , enlistment meant something very different . [The old lady]3806-the old lady , accustomed to obedience all round , when the dreadful defiance had occurred , ten years before , had called the stars to witness that it was all -- that everything was -- [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's fault ! And then [she]3806-the old lady had fallen a - whimpering , knowing right well that but for [the latter]336-the latter 's intercession , [she]3806-the old lady [herself]3806-the old lady would have had no "[75-mrs. smith] pinson " ; since [Government]3786-government bars [those who can be proved to be personally implicated in evil doings]3831-those who can be proved to be personally implicated in evil doings . And now , as [she]3806-the old lady sat looking at [[her]3806-the old lady grandson]3784-her grandson , the same conflicting estimates made [her]3806-the old lady irritable . Why had [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan ever put [his]84-pidar narâyan finger in the Eshwara pie ? Yet , without [him]84-pidar narâyan , where would [they]3833-they all have been ? Still , [he]84-pidar narâyan need not have taught [the lad]3819-the lad to fence , and so turned [him]3819-the lad into [a mean , common soldier]3835-a mean , common soldier . Now , whether this was true , whether [his]84-pidar narâyan skill with the foils had turned [Roshan]89-roshan 's thoughts towards a fighting life , or whether it was simply the result of natural aptitudes that way , the choice of professions had been wise . [His]89-roshan Colonel,--of the old school though [he]89-roshan was,--had admitted , when pressed , that [the young Mahomedan]3836-the young mahomedan , given practice , might be able to lead [the regiment]3760-the regiment as well as [a fresh - joined English subaltern]3838-a fresh - joined english subaltern . [The newer school]3839-the newer school , again , playing the Krieg spiel against [him]89-roshan at [Simla]18-simla , and finding [itself]3839-the newer school in grips with a genuine gift for tactics , had shaken its head and confessed the hardship of such a talent being barred from finding its proper level . Still it was impossible to legislate for exceptions without upsetting the every - day army apple - cart . [Roshan]89-roshan [himself]89-roshan , being sensible -- above all , being of [a nation which accepts limitations as a law of [God]96-god]3840-a nation which accepts limitations as a law of god -- was , as a rule , satisfied with [[his]89-roshan future risaldar majorship]3841-his future risaldar majorship , and , if [he]89-roshan was lucky , [Aide - de - Camp]3842-aide - de - camp to [the Queen]3843-the queen , and a few other titles tacked on to it . Like [all natives of [India]8-india]3844-all natives of india [he]89-roshan lived largely on the approbation of [[his]89-roshan immediate superiors]3845-his immediate superiors , and this [he]89-roshan had without stint ; besides , [his]89-roshan whole line of thought had become too military for any subversion of rule and discipline to seem desirable . Yet the curb made itself felt sometimes ; never more keenly than at [[his]0-i grandmother]530-his grandmother 's scornful look , when , in reply to [her]530-his grandmother catechising , [he]0-i named [his]0-i income . "[75-mrs. smith] Only that ! Bâh ! Tis the pay of [a coolie]705-a coolie ! " "[705-a coolie] ' Tis the pay of [my]0-i rank , anyhow , " [he]0-i replied sulkily , "[0-i] and [I]0-i can not expect promotion yet ; the rules-- " [She]530-his grandmother waggled [her]530-his grandmother be - veiled , be - jewelled head cunningly . "[0-i] Rules ! What have rules to do with favour , either for [men]312-men or [women]479-women ? Lo ! [[thy]0-i grand - uncle]708-thy grand - uncle , [the Nawab]3674-the nawab , gave twice that to [a coachman who had one eye black and the other blue]710-a coachman who had one eye black and the other blue because [he]710-a coachman who had one eye black and the other blue fancied [him]710-a coachman who had one eye black and the other blue ! So , if [thou]0-i art in favour , as [thou]0-i sayest , ask for more . [The Huzoors]118-the huzoors will give it , sooner than lose [thee]0-i . " [Roshan]89-roshan did not attempt explanation ; [he]89-roshan simply evaded the point by asserting that the pay was sufficient for [his]89-roshan wants . In a way it was an unfortunate remark , since it precipitated the lecture lurking in [the old lady]3806-the old lady 's mind . "[118-the huzoors] And for [the wife]711-the wife 's that is to come ? " [she]3806-the old lady asked , not without dignity,--the dignity of age reminding [youth]3848-youth that its turn for duty has come . "[711-the wife] And for [the son]712-the son 's that has yet to be born ? Why are these old arms still empty of [[thy]0-i children]713-thy children , [Roshan]89-roshan ? " [He]89-roshan had [his]89-roshan answer ready ; one that had hitherto baulked even the matrimonial desires of [[his]89-roshan mother]531-his mother , who , having gone to live with [[her]3806-the old lady own people]3850-her own people , was backed up by [sisters]3851-sisters and [sisters - in - law]3852-sisters - in - law . "[89-roshan] Because the Most High decreed freedom for [wife]3702-wife and [son]715-son . " It was true . [The wife]711-the wife found for [him]89-roshan as [a boy]523-a boy had died in child - birth . But [Mumtâza]134-mumtâza mahal had made up [her]134-mumtâza mahal mind to refuse this excuse any longer . Matters were getting desperate . Here was [Roshan]89-roshan past thirty , and never [a child]3605-a child 's voice to soothe the passion which seems to come back , vicariously , to [Indian women in [their]3856-indian women in their old age old age]3856-indian women in their old age . [She]134-mumtâza mahal had been brooding over an appeal ever since [she]134-mumtâza mahal had heard that , after ten years ' absence , [the lad]3819-the lad was once more to be within reach of [her]134-mumtâza mahal tongue . So [she]134-mumtâza mahal edged closer to [him]89-roshan , an almost pathetic authority in [her]134-mumtâza mahal face . "[89-roshan] That is but the skin of the orange , [Roshan]89-roshan ; [I]0-i take not that as a gift ! There be more [wives than one]716-wives than one , if [the one]717-the one die , even for [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors whom [thou]718-thy apest . Nay ! Light of [the house]719-the house ! frown not , " [she]134-mumtâza mahal continued , in sudden alarm at [his]89-roshan look . "[0-i] [I]0-i did but mean that [thou]718-thy wert different from [[thy]718-thy fathers]720-thy fathers . How canst help it ? Think not [the old woman]721-the old woman can not understand . Was [I]0-i not young once ? Was [I]0-i not wedded with tears to [[thy]718-thy grandfather]722-thy grandfather -- on whom be peace ! So [I]0-i know the heart hath fancies , and [thine]723-thine -- listen while [I]0-i whisper it -- is -- is for [a wife like a mem]724-a wife like a mem ! Wherefore not ? [Thou]718-thy hast seen and talked with [them]725-them -- [they]725-them have seemed better to [thee]718-thy than a cow of [a black girl]726-a black girl ! What then ? Have not [mems]727-mems married [[our]728-our people]729-our people ere now ? And with [thee,"--she]718-thy looked round quickly , to be certain of privacy , then leant closer still,--"with[718-thy] [thee]718-thy it would be easy -- for there is [[thy]718-thy cousin]730-thy cousin . " "[731-my cousin] [[My]0-i cousin]731-my cousin ? " [he]0-i echoed stupidly . "[731-my cousin] [Yea]732-yea ! [[thy]718-thy cousin]730-thy cousin , when all is said and done , " [she]125-anâri begum repeated , with faint scorn . "[730-thy cousin] Is not [the Miss at [the palace]3477-the palace Anâri [[Begum]125-anâri begum 's granddaughter]736-begum 's granddaughter]734-the miss at the palace anâri begum 's granddaughter ? Was not [Anâri Begum [[thy]718-thy grandfather]722-thy grandfather 's sister]737-anâri begum thy grandfather 's sister ? If that is not [cousin]739-cousin , what is it ? " [He]0-i had known these facts before , of course , but they had never presented [themselves]3858-themselves to [him]0-i in this connection . Yet they came instantly , accredited by custom . [[His]0-i cousin]3859-his cousin ; if so , [[his]0-i wife]3429-his wife , if [he]0-i chose , almost by right . And yet from custom also , [he]0-i -- too sensible not to have gauged the vast difference between [his]0-i position as regards [Englishmen]3816-englishmen , and [his]0-i position as regarded [[their]3816-englishmen wives]3862-their wives , [sisters]3851-sisters , [mothers]3864-mothers -- was conscious of distinct revolt . "[740-thou] [Thou]740-thou shouldst not say such things , " [he]0-i exclaimed almost angrily ; "[741-the miss] [the Miss]741-the miss - sahib-- " "[741-the miss] [Miss - sahib]742-miss - sahib indeed ! " interrupted [Mumtâza]134-mumtâza mahal with a forced giggle . "[741-the miss] Who knows [she]742-miss - sahib is that ? Not even [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan . " "[84-pidar narâyan] Wherefore ? " asked [Roshan]89-roshan coldly . "[742-miss - sahib] [[Her]742-miss - sahib mother]514-her mother was [[Bonaventura - sahib]86-laila 's child]744-bonaventura - sahib 's child and heir . That is certain ; else [the Government]19-the government would not have continued the grants given to [him]84-pidar narâyan by [the Nawab]3674-the nawab . " An expression of infinite cunning crossed [the old lady]3806-the old lady 's face ; [she]3806-the old lady tucked another budget of pân into [her]3806-the old lady cheek , preparatory to a lengthy explanation . "[3674-the nawab] Not if it was payment for evidence given , by which [Government]3786-government could find excuse for seizing the rest , and sending [innocent people]747-innocent people to die in [Calcutta]12-calcutta ? [Thou]748-thou knowest the tale , [Roshan]89-roshan ? How [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan said no word when [everyone]749-everyone was searching , after [Bun - avatâr]121-bun - avatâr - sahib 's death , for [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum , who had disappeared , and how , when [the land]750-the land was being taken , [he]84-pidar narâyan appeared with [a baby]751-a baby , [a baptized baby]752-a baptized baby , and swore it was [Bun - avatâr]121-bun - avatâr - sahib 's lawful heir -- that [he]84-pidar narâyan [himself]84-pidar narâyan had married [them]753-them . Mayhap [he]84-pidar narâyan did . But , look [you]89-roshan , [Anâri]125-anâri begum was in [the palace]3477-the palace zenâna ere [she]125-anâri begum disappeared . Who is to say [she]125-anâri begum is not [[thy]84-pidar narâyan cousin]730-thy cousin twice over ? ... [I]0-i say not that [she]125-anâri begum is , look [you]89-roshan , but who can tell . Yet this is certain , [Roshan]89-roshan ; [she]125-anâri begum hath [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum 's eyes . For [I]0-i have seen [her]125-anâri begum ; but a month ago [the Miss who reads]756-the miss who reads brought [her]125-anâri begum , not knowing of these tales ; for [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan keeps a silent tongue . [Her]125-anâri begum name is [Laila]86-laila , and thine Roshan.[4 ] Is not that a fate ? and [she]125-anâri begum hath [[thy]84-pidar narâyan grand - aunt]757-thy grand - aunt 's eyes ; ay ! and [[thy]84-pidar narâyan grandfather]722-thy grandfather 's land too ; for would it not have been [Walidâd]126-walidâd 's , if [Bun]121-bun - avatâr - sahib - avatâr had not ousted [him]126-walidâd from [the wazeer - ship]759-the wazeer - ship with singing birds ? " [Roshan Khân]89-roshan stood up feeling as if [he]89-roshan was being suffocated . It was ten years since [he]89-roshan had had experience of the fine - drawn meshes of vague , almost useless , conspiracy for which [Indian women]3866-indian women have such vast capability ; it was ten years since , with eyes open to [his]89-roshan own advantage , [he]89-roshan had cast in [his]89-roshan lot loyally with [the Government [he]89-roshan served]3867-the government he served . In that time there had not been wanting -- there never is in [India]8-india -- [others]569-others , less scrupulous , ready to trade on [his]89-roshan connection with [a dispossessed family]3869-a dispossessed family , and [his]89-roshan possible sense of injustice . [He]89-roshan had known how to treat [them]569-others . But this idea bit shrewdly at a feeling which [men of]3870-men of [his]89-roshan stamp have inevitably -- the desire for [a wife more suitable to [their]3870-men of own culture]3871-a wife more suitable to their own culture than [they]3870-men of can hope to find among [[their]3870-men of own people]3872-their own people . [He]89-roshan gave an uneasy laugh . "[760-grandmother] These be dreams , indeed , [grandmother]760-grandmother . To begin with , [Pidar Narâyan--]136-pidar narâyan-- " "[84-pidar narâyan] [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan ! [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan ! " echoed [the old diplomatist]3873-the old diplomatist tartly , "[84-pidar narâyan] Art turned [Hindoo]137-hindoo , that [thou]761-thou dost count [Narâyan[5]138-narâyan[5 ] [the Creator of all]762-the creator of all ? " Then [she]760-grandmother suddenly clapped [her]760-grandmother hands together in absolute impatience and anger . "[761-thou] Yet is it true . [He]136-pidar narâyan-- is the cause of all ! But for [him]136-pidar narâyan-- [Bun]121-bun - avatâr - sahib - avatâr would have been as an over - fried fritter , a burst bladder , a drum on a hen 's back ! But for [his]136-pidar narâyan-- teaching [thee]763-thee to fence-- " A quick frown came to [[her]760-grandmother hearer]3874-her hearer 's face . "[136-pidar narâyan--] Teaching ! Ay ! but only enough to make [me]0-i fit for [his]136-pidar narâyan-- skill to play with . [I]0-i know that now . Well ! let [him]136-pidar narâyan-- try it again-- " [Roshan]89-roshan 's sudden fierceness died down to sombre discontent--"but[136-pidar narâyan--] that is [fool 's talk]764-fool 's talk . [He]136-pidar narâyan-- is too old . [I]0-i could not meet [him]136-pidar narâyan-- on equal terms . " [He]89-roshan drew [himself]89-roshan up proudly ; yet [he]89-roshan felt a vague regret at [his]89-roshan own acquired sense of fair play . Below it lay a savagery that could rejoice in revenge at any price , and [Mumtâza Mahal]134-mumtâza mahal , watching [him]89-roshan , thought [him]89-roshan still more like [[his]89-roshan ancestors]3875-his ancestors , and nodded approvingly . "[89-roshan] Think of it , at least , [Roshan]89-roshan , " [she]134-mumtâza mahal said , "[89-roshan] and remember that it is not as if [the girl]481-the girl were [a real mem]766-a real mem . [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , for all [he]84-pidar narâyan is so clever , was put to it to find [a husband]767-a husband for [the mother]768-the mother , [the baptized baby]769-the baptized baby ! [He]84-pidar narâyan took [a poor creature from [[Martin]139-martin 's school]771-martin 's school at [Lucknow]20-lucknow , at last , who could not even speak English like [a Huzoor--]772-a huzoor-- " "[84-pidar narâyan] Because [he]84-pidar narâyan was Italian and [a Catholic]3461-a catholic]770-a poor creature from martin 's school at lucknow , at last , who could not even speak english like a huzoor-- " " because he was italian and a catholic , " put in [Roshan]89-roshan , then shrugged [his]89-roshan shoulders impatiently . "[84-pidar narâyan] But [thou]774-thou canst not understand . ' Tis impossible ! Dreams , [grandmother]760-grandmother , dreams ! " "[760-grandmother] Dreams come true even when forgotten , and [torchbearers]776-torchbearers never see [their]776-torchbearers own way , " retorted [the old lady]3806-the old lady , ending the discussion with proverbial wisdom as a clincher . "[776-torchbearers] So think of it , since thoughts cost nothing , and tell no tales . " [Roshan]89-roshan felt as if [they]776-torchbearers did the former at any rate , as [he]89-roshan strode back toward [the fort]3493-the fort , telling [himself]89-roshan [he]89-roshan would feel better when [he]89-roshan had on [his]89-roshan uniform once more . This was [his]89-roshan metier , not marriage . [The best soldiers]3878-the best soldiers , [the really great soldiers]3879-the really great soldiers -- [he]89-roshan paused , the knowledge that [he]89-roshan could never rise to real greatness coming to make [him]89-roshan clinch [his]89-roshan right hand as if on [his]89-roshan sword - hilt . The tempest of revolt which swept through [him]89-roshan left [him]89-roshan dazed , for [he]89-roshan had reasoned the matter out with [himself]89-roshan thoroughly , and thought [he]89-roshan had accepted the situation , thought that [he]89-roshan had realized that [his]89-roshan dignity in [the regiment under the present system]3880-the regiment under the present system went side by side , and not behind , that of [the English officers]3881-the english officers . Yet here [he]89-roshan was at the mercy of something too strong for acquired wisdom . [He]89-roshan walked on faster to escape into a more wholesome environment , and by sheer force of will succeeded in driving away all thought of the past interview save a triviality . That was the remembrance that [her]3882-her name was [Laila]86-laila , [[his]89-roshan [Roshan]89-roshan]3883-his roshan . Light and Darkness , Day and Night . A fate indeed . As [he]89-roshan passed into [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , however , on [his]89-roshan way to the door in [the river bastion]3885-the river bastion , a group in [its]3885-the river bastion centre , round the old gun , brought [his]89-roshan attention back to realities , and [he]89-roshan went towards it , [his]89-roshan slipper - shod feet making no martial clank , this time , on the union - jack of [raised paths]3886-raised paths . [The group]3887-the group consisted of half a dozen or so of [men]312-men listening to something which was being declaimed , with much gesticulation , by [an ash - smeared jogi , whose wide - pierced ears , distended by conch - shell rings]3889-an ash - smeared jogi , whose wide - pierced ears , distended by conch - shell rings , and transverse bar of white on [his]3889-an ash - smeared jogi , whose wide - pierced ears , distended by conch - shell rings forehead , showed [him]3889-an ash - smeared jogi , whose wide - pierced ears , distended by conch - shell rings to belong to [the sect which claims to have transcendental powers]3890-the sect which claims to have transcendental powers . Apparently [he]89-roshan had been making the claim , for [a young man , whose costume smacked of Western culture , and whose face was acute , litigious]3891-a young man , whose costume smacked of western culture , and whose face was acute , litigious , interrupted [him]89-roshan impatiently . "[777-yea] Yea , [yea]777-yea ; possibly [thou]778-thou couldst come over the obstruction , [Gorakh - nâth - jee]779-gorakh - nâth - jee ; but the question is whether the obstruction be legal . Is it not so , [Lala Ramanund]140-ramanund ? " [Lala Ramanund]140-ramanund , whose dress was even more Western , and who had a certain air of distinction , due , evidently , to position , assented ; adding , as [a rider]3892-a rider , and with some contempt , that at present [they]3887-the group had only [jogi Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth 's word that any interference was intended . [Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth , [a tall , muscular man]3893-a tall , muscular man , naked save for [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth grass - rope girdle , [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth wild hair twined and twisted to a tiara , [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth wild , half - insane eyes telling of drugs , shot a glance of absolute defiance at [Ramanund]140-ramanund . "[778-thou] [Thy]778-thou name , [pundit - jee]780-pundit - jee , is not likely to give friendly witness to [mine]781-mine , " [he]781-mine began , alluding to the fact that [they]3887-the group were respectively called after [the founders of [[their]3887-the group absolutely antagonistic sects]3895-their absolutely antagonistic sects]3894-the founders of their absolutely antagonistic sects , "[778-thou] and yet methinks [thou]778-thou couldst , seeing-- " Here [Dya Ram]142-dya ram , [the first speaker]3896-the first speaker , alarmed in [[his]142-dya ram lawyer]3897-his lawyer 's soul at the militant tone of [the jogi]3898-the jogi , suggested hastily that [they]3887-the group might inquire , say at the gate ; or stay ! there was [the risaldar]3899-the risaldar coming ; [he]142-dya ram must know . Once more , as [he]142-dya ram listened to the question put to [him]142-dya ram , the expression of [his]142-dya ram race and creed came to [Roshan]89-roshan 's face , hiding its culture . "[778-thou] Of a certainty ! " [he]142-dya ram replied haughtily . "[778-thou] The gun belongs to [the Fort]3493-the fort . [It]783-it is not to be used as a shelter for -- for [saints]784-saints ! " [His]142-dya ram contempt was palpable . "[0-i] [I]0-i deny [your]0-i premise , " put in [Dya Ram]142-dya ram eagerly . "[0-i] The gun is [the people]3552-the people 's by prescriptive right . [I]0-i can use it if [I]0-i choose . [The Government]19-the government professes neutrality ; therefore , [no one]3741-no one has a right to interfere with [my]0-i religion . " [Roshan]89-roshan 's face was a study . "[123-lo] [Lo]123-lo ! [Dya Ram]142-dya ram , for [thou]787-thou art [[my]0-i old class - fellow]788-my old class - fellow surely , hast gone back to the old beliefs since the days when [thou]787-thou didst sign [thyself]789-thyself at the end of [thy]787-thou essays , and in [thy]787-thou books , ' [Dya Ram]142-dya ram , [Agnostic]790-agnostic ' ? " [Dya Ram]142-dya ram gave an uneasy cough . "[142-dya ram] It is a question of legality-- " [he]0-i began . "[142-dya ram] And of money also , " put in a new voice cringingly . "[142-dya ram] [The pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims come hither to see [the saint]3520-the saint , and then bathe . But if there is [no saint]793-no saint , [many]794-many will not come , and [I]0-i , who have [my]0-i right on the steps as marker of the caste marks-- " "[0-i] Right ! " echoed [the Mahomedan]95-the mahomedan curtly . "[0-i] Have a care , caste - marker , lest [we]795-we do not claim [the courtyard]386-the courtyard also . " Here [Ramanund]140-ramanund , who had hitherto listened indifferently , took up the cudgels . "[92-risaldar] That can scarcely be , [risaldar - sahib]92-risaldar , " [he]140-ramanund said ; "[92-risaldar] [[our]795-we pious folk]797-our pious folk have come hither to perform [their]797-our pious folk offices since time began . " [Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth turned on [him]140-ramanund at once . "[797-our pious folk] Not so , [Vaishnava]143-vaishnava ! " [he]140-ramanund said . "[143-vaishnava] [Thou]798-thy and [thine]798-thy know naught of the Beginning of Things . Come to [us]795-we and Holy [Shiv - jee]144-shiv for that ! [Thou]798-thy art as far from the great wisdom as [he"--here]144-shiv [he]140-ramanund pointed wildly to [Roshan--"yea]145-roshan--"yea[798-thy] ! further , despite [thy]798-thy pretence of purity ! Despite [thy]798-thy hunger yesterday when , returning to [thy]798-thy lost faith , [thou]798-thy didst come here to eat as [the twice - born]405-the twice - born should , and a shadow fell upon [thy]798-thy food ! Despite [thy]798-thy deafness to [this world]342-this world just now,"--here [he]0-i laughed jeeringly,--"which[144-shiv] kept [thee]798-thy back from bearing witness to [my]0-i truth , to the truth of [[Shiv]144-shiv - [jee]144-shiv 's servant]801-shiv - jee 's servant ! " [Dya Ram]142-dya ram looked at [him]142-dya ram , then at [Ramanund]140-ramanund perplexedly . "[801-shiv - jee 's servant] What means [he]801-shiv - jee 's servant ? " [he]0-i said aside . "[801-shiv - jee 's servant] Didst [thou]798-thy really come hither ? " "[801-shiv - jee 's servant] [[My]0-i wife]802-my wife was dying , " replied [Ramanund]140-ramanund in a low , rapid undertone , "[0-i] and [I]0-i -- [you]0-i understand -- there -- there is nothing certain , [you]0-i see -- and any chance -- [one]3501-one goes back at such times-- " [he]0-i broke off almost desperately in [his]0-i confession . [Dya Ram]142-dya ram , who had signed [himself]142-dya ram Agnostic , nodded . [He]0-i understood what it was to be rudderless in a familiar current , and came to the rescue of [[his]0-i friend]3900-his friend 's consistency by asserting that any such decision regarding the gun , if one had been made , would certainly be disputed . That [he]0-i and [his]0-i -- though [they]3901-they demurred to its being counted against [them]3901-they for faith in the worshipping of mere matter -- would , if necessary , carry the case to [the High Court]3902-the high court . "[146-indra] Carry it to [the Court of [[thy]0-i god]804-thy god [Indra]146-indra]21-the court of thy god indra , if need be , [Dya Ram]142-dya ram , " retorted [Roshan]89-roshan , and as [he]89-roshan strode off [he]89-roshan spat deliberately in the dust . That also surprised [him]0-i faintly , for [he]0-i had thought [he]0-i had learnt tolerance of [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors . So , with a frown and yet with relief , [he]0-i put [his]0-i hand on the latch which would open the way back to a less disturbing environment . As [he]0-i did so , another hand was on it also . The door opened from within , and [Father Ninian]81-father ninian stood on the threshold barring [it]3903-it ; but barring it with smiles . "[142-dya ram] Ah ! [[my]0-i pupil]805-my pupil , " [he]0-i said in English . "[805-my pupil] [I]0-i have been listening to [your]805-my pupil praises from [Captain Dering]71-vincent , and from [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon too . [He]106-mr. carlyon says [you]805-my pupil are [the best fencer in [the army]3785-the army]806-the best fencer in the army . " [Roshan]89-roshan , as [he]89-roshan stepped aside elaborately to let [the old man]3483-the old man pass , drew [himself]89-roshan up and saluted . "[0-i] If [you]0-i please , [sir]3491-sir ; but [I]0-i have learnt new things since -- since those days . " [His]0-i tone made [Father Ninian]81-father ninian pause to look at [him]0-i for an instant ; then [he]0-i replied , "[0-i] And [I]0-i have not forgotten the old ; that makes [us]810-us equal . " [Roshan]89-roshan gave a little hard laugh as [he]89-roshan went in ; if [the old man]3483-the old man liked to think so , let [him]89-roshan . But [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's face as [he]81-father ninian passed -- a black shadow in the sunshine -- across the level steps leading down to [the river]333-the river wore a wistful smile . Old and new , [he]89-roshan thought . New and old . Senseless , useless words , fit only for [humanity]3907-humanity to juggle dreams from , since [no man]3908-no man knew the unseen beginning , knew the unseen end ; knew even [his]3908-no man own birth and death . In the endless band of life , naught came first , naught last , and the things of to - day might be old , the things of yesterday might be new . "[0-i] [Margherita]147-margherita ! " The name came soundless to [the priest]3909-the priest 's lips , and a quick flush of youth , and hope , and joy seemed to smooth away the wrinkles of [his]0-i face . A faint laugh , a happy laugh , went further towards a hearing than the name . It was sixty years ago , nearly , since [he]0-i had left [her]147-margherita . An old story indeed , and yet how new . The new wine of it ran in [his]0-i old veins , thrilled to [his]0-i old brain , and took [him]0-i back absolutely to [a palazzo on [the outskirts of [Rome]4-rome]3911-the outskirts of rome]3910-a palazzo on the outskirts of rome , with the pale flood of [the Tiber]22-the tiber flowing beneath [a marble loggia]3912-a marble loggia . [He]0-i had never looked on [running water]3913-running water since without remembrance , and now -- [his]0-i feet having led [him]0-i unconsciously to [the river]333-the river 's edge -- [he]0-i stood smiling at the pale flood of [the Hari]3-the hari . For [he]0-i knew that [he]0-i had fought a good fight , that [he]0-i had kept the promise [he]0-i had made in order to still [her]147-margherita soul ; that [he]0-i had kept [[her]147-margherita boy]3915-her boy , [Pietro Bonaventura]148-pietro bonaventura , so far as [he]0-i could , from harm , and [[his]0-i child]3916-his child , and [[[his]0-i child]3916-his child 's child]3918-his child 's child , gathering [them]3919-them as lambs into the arms of [Holy Church]3920-holy church . And then something in the last thought drove the tender human smile from [his]0-i face . [He]0-i murmured a "[0-i] Mea culpa , mea maxima culpa , " bent to the stream , and dipping [his]0-i fingers in it , crossed [himself]0-i . "[0-i] May [Shiv]144-shiv - jee 's blessing go with [his]144-shiv holy water , [Baba]149-baba - jee , " said a voice behind [him]0-i . It was [Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - nâth [the jogi , who , [[his]144-shiv sympathizers]3922-his sympathizers having departed , had come to fill [his]144-shiv gourd]3921-the jogi , who , his sympathizers having departed , had come to fill his gourd . [Father Ninian]81-father ninian turned ; so for a space [they]3923-they stood face to face ; representatives of the two great supernaturalisms of [the world]404-the world ; the one which has held [the West]23-the west , the one which has held [the East]24-the east . [The old man]3483-the old man 's face , at first , returned to kindly human tolerance ; for [his]3483-the old man fifty years of [Eshwara]1-eshwara had widened [his]3483-the old man sympathies . But , as [he]3483-the old man stood before [the jogi]3898-the jogi it hardened , and the priestly arrogance of [the naked ash - smeared figure]3927-the naked ash - smeared figure , stretching a right hand in claim over the sanctifying power of [the river]333-the river , was reflected in [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's as [he]3483-the old man spread [his]3483-the old man left hand upwards , and turned on [his]3483-the old man heel with the words , "[149-baba] [Vade retro Satanas]150-vade retro satanas ! " "[150-vade retro satanas] [You]811-you are tired to death as it is -- why should [you]811-you fuss any more over a pack-- " "[150-vade retro satanas] Ssh ! [sir]3491-sir ; do n't talk rubbish . [I]0-i am all right ; and [Eugene]74-eugene smith is so anxious everything should be a success that [I]0-i must . Besides [I]0-i -- [I]0-i like it . " [Mrs. Walsall Smith]75-mrs. smith sent [the hostess]3929-the hostess ' gathering smile round [her]75-mrs. smith long luncheon table , and rose . So did [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , who had sat at [her]75-mrs. smith right hand -- a position due to [his]71-vincent rank as [commandant of [Eshwara]1-eshwara]3930-commandant of eshwara -- and , as [he]71-vincent did , [he]71-vincent drew [his]71-vincent chair aside to let [the girl on [his]71-vincent left]3931-the girl on his left pass , with [his]71-vincent usual somewhat voyant courtesy , though it was only [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila . [He]71-vincent had met [her]86-laila several times during the past few days , and the effect which [her]86-laila singing had made on [him]71-vincent had vanished before [her]86-laila general failure to interest [him]71-vincent in the least . And to - day [she]86-laila actually wore a blue sash ! In addition [she]86-laila had filled up the time between [her]86-laila monosyllables in methodically crumbling [her]86-laila bread and ranging the results in a pattern , until the inanity of it had got on [his]71-vincent nerves , and [he]71-vincent had felt inclined to beg [her]86-laila to desist . And yet , as in passing [her]86-laila black eyes looked into [his]71-vincent with one curious yet comprehensive flash , a memory of the extreme regularity of the curves and lines which had annoyed [him]71-vincent , made [him]71-vincent -- quite irrelevantly -- wonder hastily if [he]71-vincent could have said anything to [Muriel]151-muriel which-- [He]71-vincent broke off in [his]71-vincent own thought impatiently , and gave an apologetic glance after [Mrs. Walsall Smith]75-mrs. smith 's fragile figure . There never was anything , never ! Never a word said , never a deed done , which all [the world]404-the world -- even [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith [himself]74-eugene smith -- might not hear and know . [Vincent Dering]71-vincent felt a pulse of sheer virtue as [he]71-vincent looked down the long table at [[his]71-vincent host]3933-his host , with the vague irritation which [the possessors of [women]479-women]3934-the possessors of women often arouse in [those who are not [[their]3934-the possessors of women possessors]3937-their possessors]3936-those who are not their possessors . For [Muriel Smith]151-muriel 's half - playful , half - wistful rejection of sympathy had held that faint hint of dutiful martyrdom which seems so purely angelic to [selfish man]3938-selfish man -- unless [he]71-vincent happens to be [the wretch who inflicts it]3939-the wretch who inflicts it ! Curious , [he]71-vincent thought ; [Eugene]74-eugene smith was n't much of [a gentleman]3940-a gentleman , but [he]74-eugene smith was n't a bad sort , and [he]74-eugene smith was fond of [[his]74-eugene smith wife]3429-his wife , in a way . Yet [he]74-eugene smith was blind to the fact that [Muriel]151-muriel was not fit to go trapesing about [[his]74-eugene smith blessed old canal works]3942-his blessed old canal works with [the pack of padrés]3943-the pack of padrés and [people]3436-people [he]74-eugene smith had got together to do honour to [his]74-eugene smith skill . [She]151-muriel would do it , of course , and get through with it , too ! Here [he]74-eugene smith helped [himself]74-eugene smith to a glass of sherry , and felt incoherently that [she]151-muriel was [the dearest and best woman in the world,--the one woman in [the world]404-the world]3945-the dearest and best woman in the world,--the one woman in the world , so far as [he]74-eugene smith was concerned . As [he]74-eugene smith sat between those two empty chairs where [those two women]3947-those two women , so absolutely unlike , had fenced [him]74-eugene smith in on either side , a faint wonder tinged [his]74-eugene smith virtue in comparing the last three years with the time before it . If [anyone]3948-anyone had told [him]74-eugene smith , then , that [he]74-eugene smith would write every day to [a woman]3949-a woman and expect [her]3949-a woman to write to [him]74-eugene smith without a word or a deed-- "[0-i] Please , [Dering]71-vincent - darlin ' , " said an imperious small voice , "[3622-mum] [mum]3622-mum wants ' oo , ' tos pup'll go off , [she]3622-mum says , wis ' [all a gemplemen]814-all a gemplemen , an ' [she]3622-mum wants ' oo to go off wis ' [a ladies]815-a ladies ! " "[3622-mum] All right , [little ' un]816-little ' un , " [he]74-eugene smith laughed gladly , finishing [his]74-eugene smith sherry at a gulp , and , ere catching the little mite in [his]74-eugene smith arms , giving [himself]74-eugene smith that smartening pull together which was so characteristic of [the man]3467-the man . " "[75-mrs. smith] Ay ! that it will ! " assented [the good lady]3953-the good lady in a mournful Scotch accent . "[75-mrs. smith] ' Deed if it were not for [Dr. James--]153-dr. james-- " [she]3953-the good lady glanced fearfully at [a tall man in a black frock coat]3954-a tall man in a black frock coat -- [a man whose patriarchal beard had once been red and was now the colour of a carpet whisk]3955-a man whose patriarchal beard had once been red and was now the colour of a carpet whisk -- who was buttonholing [Father Ninian]81-father ninian ; the latter , with [his]3954-a tall man in a black frock coat straight slenderness , looking almost youthful beside the other 's burly bulk .
