[He]71-vincent had seen [the two sitting together]3959-the two sitting together at lunch , apparently interested in [each other]3586-each other , and [he]71-vincent had noticed how [Lance]68-lance , on entering [the drawing - room]3545-the drawing - room , had made [his]68-lance way straight to those coils of red - bronze hair which had a trick of being the most conspicuous point in any group of which [they]3959-the two sitting together formed part . So [Lance]68-lance would enjoy [himself]68-lance simply ; [he]68-lance would not have to gain pleasure in complex fashion by dragging about [a posse of [uninteresting old ladies]3963-uninteresting old ladies]3962-a posse of uninteresting old ladies , for the sake of [a lady who was neither]3964-a lady who was neither . [Vincent]71-vincent 's face had a bored look as [he]71-vincent began [his]71-vincent task by piloting [his]71-vincent charge into [the verandah]3965-the verandah , and so on into the open . It was hot work crossing the stretch of sand which lay between [the bungalow]3966-the bungalow and [the red brick abutments of [the canal head]3968-the canal head]3967-the red brick abutments of the canal head ; but once there , with [the broad still basin of [the united rivers]3970-the united rivers before [you]3971-you]3969-the broad still basin of the united rivers before you , a cool breeze blew pleasantly from that blue barrier of hills with the gold - spiked temples of [Eshwara]1-eshwara enamelled against it , and a soft white mist hiding the feet of [the far - distant snows]3972-the far - distant snows ; so hiding the "[106-mr. carlyon] Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods ! The floods had gone , however , and so had the robe of righteousness . [The sandbanks]826-the sandbanks lay bare , of [the earth]827-the earth , earthy . The logs , too , were no longer dipping and dancing in the currents . Some were piled criss - cross on [the spit]614-the spit , awaiting [ransomers]829-ransomers , and a few lay like straight shadows , half in , half out of the receding water . " A log ! not a bit of it ! "[498-someone] said [someone]498-someone , stooping for a stone . " Look ! "[498-someone] The missile fell far short of the low streak of sand and shadow , but did its work . The shadow disappeared , as a bottle - nosed alligator slipped silently into [the stream]831-the stream . [Most eyes]832-most eyes watched it , but [Lance Carlyon]68-lance 's turned to [Erda Shepherd]105-erda . [He]68-lance had only met [her]105-erda once , casually , when [he]68-lance was out fishing on [the spit]614-the spit , since the day when [Father Ninian]81-father ninian had introduced [them]834-them , and [they]834-them had seen something else in [the river]333-the river that was also not a log . " Do [you]105-erda remember , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance began impulsively , " the first time [we]834-them met ? "[68-lance] A shadow slipped into [her]105-erda limpid bronze eyes also . " Certainly , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda interrupted coldly . " It is not so very long ago -- is it ? "[105-erda] [She]105-erda had fenced with [his]68-lance assumption of friendliness more than once already ; feeling vexed with [herself]105-erda , the while , that [she]105-erda should do so . Since what did it matter ? However much [she]105-erda might regret -- and [she]105-erda had regretted with foolish unseen blushes as [she]105-erda had lain awake at night wondering what had possessed [her]105-erda -- the almost indecent unveiling of realities in that first five minutes , [she]105-erda could not undo it . Besides , [she]105-erda had told [herself]105-erda , [he]68-lance had in all probability forgotten it in polo , and partridge - shooting , fishing , and such things . But [he]68-lance had not , apparently ; and [he]68-lance parried [her]105-erda fence with a still more friendly laugh . " [I]68-lance did n't mean that , of course ; but [we]3973-we wo n't talk of it , if [you]68-lance 'd rather not . It is n't a very Mark Tapleyish subject , is it , for an afternoon party ? "[68-lance] The blush was to be seen this time . " So [I]105-erda have been thinking [myself]105-erda , [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon , ever since last Wednesday , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda began , still more coldly , " and [I]68-lance am sorry-- "[68-lance] [He]68-lance interrupted [her]105-erda quite cavalierly . " [I]68-lance did n't mean that , either , and [you]105-erda know [I]68-lance did n't . However , [we]3973-we 'll leave it alone . So [you]105-erda 're not coming to the ball ! Do [you]105-erda know , [I]68-lance think it 's an awful pity ; [I]68-lance 'm sure [you]105-erda 'd dance beautifully . "[68-lance] [She]105-erda felt outraged , in a way , and yet [she]105-erda smiled . [He]68-lance seemed so much younger than [she]105-erda was . Younger ; but stronger and more vital . That calm assertion , too , that [she]105-erda knew [she]105-erda was playing feminine tricks with [him]68-lance , had been manly and dignified to quite a crushing degree . [She]105-erda could not help being at once meek and indulgent . " [I]105-erda do n't dance , [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda said quietly ; adding , as a rider and salve to [her]105-erda conscience , " [I]105-erda -- [I]105-erda think it wrong . "[105-erda] " [I]68-lance thought [you]105-erda might , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance returned , evidently pleased at [his]68-lance own acumen , " but [I]68-lance do n't see it that way . Of course if -- if [you]105-erda go in for those ideas , [you]105-erda know , [you]105-erda can make it seem -- well -- awful low ; but [I--]68-lance "[68-lance] [he]68-lance paused before even a possible sounding of [his]68-lance own trumpet--"you see [I]68-lance think it 's awfully jolly ; besides , it 's such ripping good exercise , and [I]68-lance have to be careful , [I]68-lance tell [you]105-erda , not to put on flesh . [I]68-lance ride thirteen - four , as it is . "[68-lance] [His]68-lance face grew grave over the confession . " Is that much ? "[105-erda] [she]105-erda said , [her]105-erda eyes caught and held by [the splendid figure beside [her]105-erda]836-the splendid figure beside her . " [You]68-lance are very tall , surely . "[105-erda] There was almost a pride in [her]105-erda tone , certainly a tenderness . [He]68-lance shook [his]68-lance head . " Not so tall as [[my]68-lance people]3462-my people are generally . [We]3462-my people [Carlyons]155-carlyons run to size . [[My]68-lance uncle]3975-my uncle , [Sir Lancelot]68-lance 's , six - three , and [[his]68-lance son]3783-his son is six - four ; but [he]68-lance 's a bit weedy . So when [you]68-lance 're only six - one and a half [you]68-lance ca n't afford to wax fat ; [you]68-lance 've got to keep the body in subjection . That 's right , is n't it ? "[68-lance] [His]68-lance pride in [his]68-lance Scriptural knowledge made it impossible for [her]105-erda to be stern , though [she]105-erda felt [she]105-erda ought to be . " Quite right , [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda assented , hurriedly , " but see ! "[105-erda] Take care ! " [he]68-lance said , [his]68-lance hand on [hers]105-erda to give support ; a cool , strong hand , with an insistence in its clasp which seemed to single [her]105-erda out from [the world]404-the world to stand so , hand fast in hand . "[105-erda] [You]105-erda were very nearly over that time , " [he]68-lance said , smilingly , as [he]68-lance released [her]105-erda . "[105-erda] Now let 's come on , or , as [you]105-erda say , [we]837-we shall be too late for the fair . " Perhaps it was the slip which had made [her]105-erda dizzy , but [she]105-erda walked beside [him]68-lance feeling as if [she]105-erda were in a dream . And , in truth , the scene which grew upon [them]837-we as [they]837-we went on had a strange unearthliness and unreality . [She]105-erda paused , and gave a little gasp of pleasure and surprise . "[838-his] It seems impossible ! " [she]105-erda said . "[838-his] A week ago , when [I]0-i was [here]3395-here , it was all sand , sand ; and now-- " [Her]105-erda eyes met the wide , flower - set walks , [the stately white palaces of [the Vice - regal camp]3767-the vice - regal camp]3979-the stately white palaces of the vice - regal camp with absolute incredulity . " [She]105-erda felt inwardly as if [he]71-vincent had , somehow , for [her]105-erda . "[75-mrs. smith] Oh ! [Vincent]71-vincent did a lot of the decorations , [you]75-mrs. smith know . But it looks all right , does n't it ? " [It]3981-it did , indeed,--absolutely and entirely all right . So white , so straight , so disciplined ; even to the very twist on the tent ropes . "[71-vincent] That peg 's out of line , " said [Lance]68-lance , pausing suddenly . "[844-sergeant] Here , [sergeant]844-sergeant ! " [She]105-erda looked at [him]68-lance critically . Older by some months than [he]68-lance , full of strong character , almost overfull of strong convictions , [she]105-erda was yet -- as [women]479-women must be until experience of work - a - day life teaches [them]479-women , as it has taught [men]312-men , the value of subordination -- curiously undisciplined , curiously lawless . And this striving after uniformity impressed [her]105-erda . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i learn that sort of thing in [the army]3785-the army , " [she]105-erda said , with a new respect . [He]68-lance laughed . "[0-i] [I]0-i should think so ; buttons and bootlaces all to pattern . It 's an awful bore , but it keeps things going . Now , here [we]846-them are ! Now , [you]0-i can see properly . " [They]846-them stood in [the centre of [the camp]3490-the camp]3991-the centre of the camp , in front of [the huge durbar tent]3993-the huge durbar tent , [that wandering throne of an empire fixed and immovable as the stars]3994-that wandering throne of an empire fixed and immovable as the stars . In front of [them]846-them , rising out of [a wilderness of roses]3995-a wilderness of roses , blossoming where nothing but sand had shown since [the primeval sea]3996-the primeval sea receded from [the hills]343-the hills , was the flag of [that empire]3998-that empire , its folds drooping round the mast . And beyond it , past the two brass guns pointing down [the long vista]3999-the long vista , was [an avenue of palms]4000-an avenue of palms , bordered by [green grass and beds of flowers]4001-green grass and beds of flowers , and intersected by broad paths leading back to [the solid white squares of [the tents]839-the tents]4002-the solid white squares of the tents . " [Erda]105-erda 's eyes travelled to it , and from it to the other vistas , similar yet smaller , stretching to the right and left of [her]105-erda . Then to the orderly rows on rows of [tents]4005-tents , looking like solid blocks of marble behind [her]105-erda . The whole shut in from [the world]404-the world by a high white wall ; still , silent , empty , waiting for the Hosts of [the Lord]3426-the lord . " It was almost pitch dark in [the huge tent]4016-the huge tent , and as [they]860-we slipped in through the closed portieres , [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's voice called to [them]860-we . "[0-i] Be quick , please ; and , [Carlyon]68-lance , tell [them]855-poor devils to shut down the outer screens . [We]860-we want to have a real flash - up , and [I]0-i believe [we]860-we are all here now . " Whether that was so or not [Erda]105-erda could not tell . The brief ray of light caused by [their]860-we entrance had only shown [her]105-erda [Captain Dering]71-vincent 's figure beside [[his]71-vincent hostess]4017-his hostess , and given [her]105-erda a glimpse of [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila 's white dress close by . So it was eerie , in a way , to wait in the darkness , knowing it to be full of [[people]3436-people [she]105-erda knew]4019-people she knew ; yet to have consciousness of nothing save [their]3436-people voices , since age , sex , position , even race , were alike awaiting this new light which was to make [them]3436-people manifest . Perhaps the eeriness struck [[her]105-erda companions]4020-her companions also , for the voices came clearly ; not in a babel , but answering each other in the listening , waiting silence . "[0-i] [We]860-we are all full of sparks , [I]0-i assure [you]861-you , [Mrs. Campbell]152-mrs. campbell . " "[152-mrs. campbell] [I]0-i am weel aware o ' it , [Doctor Dillon]158-dillon ; but it 's too much like a brand snatched frae the burning to [my]0-i taste ; for [Doctor James]159-doctor james will have it-- " "[159-doctor james] Undoubtedly , [[my]0-i dear]823-my dear [Ann]160-ann . It appears to [me]0-i , [sir]3491-sir , and [I]0-i trust it will to [you]861-you , as a most interesting scientific fact , calculated to confound those who scoff at the possibility of eternal punishment in a fire that is not quenched-- " "[861-you] Or to comfort those who believe in a cleansing one -- who seek a place in the crown of stars about [[their]864-their Mother]865-their mother 's head -- who feel the flame of immortality . " Its faint hesitancy betrayed this voice , as the dryness did the next . "[861-you] If [I]0-i 've got to generate [my]0-i own heaven or hell , [I]0-i prefer to pass ; but if one could turn on a fifty - candlepower reflecting lamp during a post mortem or a bacillus hunt , it would be useful . " "[861-you] Yes ! Fancy being able to get up at night and see , at once , in all corners of [the room]3952-the room if there were snakes ! " This brought a laugh till a fragile voice said plaintively , "[861-you] That 's just the worst of it . When [one]3501-one begins to see things too clearly , they are so apt to be nasty . " "[0-i] That , [[my]0-i dear]823-my dear Madam , has always appeared to [me]0-i as an additional argument against those who contend that Perfect Wisdom could not wisely have produced so imperfect [a being as Man]869-a being as man . Who is it says the soul of [man]361-man lies in [his]361-man imagination ? " [Captain Dering]71-vincent 's voice could not be mistaken . "[361-man] Just so -- and nowhere else . " This came in an aside , and was followed in the same tone by the eager , hesitating voice . "[874-scoffer] [Scoffer]874-scoffer ! " said [Captain Dering]71-vincent , "[76-jove] it will make a difference to the durbar . As a rule [you]874-scoffer ca n't see the diamonds and jewels ; and they are half the show . " Palpably there could be no fear of that . Ah - h - h ! " It had gone ! and in the black night which settled blankly on [speaker]4025-speaker and [audience]4026-audience , a faint , far cry came from outside . More than [one woman]4027-one woman 's voice echoed it with a little startled gasp of suspense . "[884-the ignorant] It is all right ! " called [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , "[884-the ignorant] the thing is always popping in and out -- [I've]890-i've seen it at [Euston]25-euston -- it will come back directly . " And then , in response to something [he]71-vincent alone had heard , [he]71-vincent whispered , "[0-i] Do n't be alarmed ; [Eugene]74-eugene smith will set it right in a moment -- really-- " As [he]71-vincent bent [his]71-vincent head a scent of violets -- the scent [she]4027-one woman always used -- assailed [him]71-vincent ; and that half - heard appeal--"Oh[71-vincent] , what is it , [Vincent]71-vincent ? " seemed still in [his]71-vincent ears . Even in the darkness [he]71-vincent knew [she]4027-one woman must be close to [him]71-vincent . [He]71-vincent felt the soft ruffle of the lace about [her]4027-one woman hand upon [his]71-vincent wrist . It trembled , surely . Did it ? Or was it only [his]71-vincent own bounding pulse . A sudden imperious desire to know -- to be certain -- swept through [him]71-vincent . Then , with a sort of suffocating rush to heart and brain , came the knowledge that [his]71-vincent clasp was answered by that small hand -- so small , so clinging , so trustful -- so dear -- so absolutely dear -- so dear!--so very dear ! ! As [he]71-vincent stood in the darkness , [he]71-vincent knew that every mooring was gone , knew that this -- this thing -- would change -- must change -- the whole position . It was a light , indeed ; a light showing the way -- a different way ! A sort of fierce exultation took possession of [him]71-vincent . [He]71-vincent knew , now , that [he]71-vincent had been dreaming till then ; that [he]71-vincent had been blind . "[71-vincent] Ah ! what a relief ! That dreadful darkness was getting on [my]0-i nerves , " said a calm voice coming to [him]71-vincent from out of the flood of white light which seemed to have rent [their]4028-their hands asunder . [Their]4028-their hands -- when [she]4027-one woman stood yonder ? [He]71-vincent turned , bewildered , to find a pair of grave black eyes fixed critically on [him]71-vincent . "[0-i] [I]0-i -- [I]0-i -- [he]0-i began . " It does n't matter , "[0-i] said [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila , with stolid indifference . " [You]71-vincent thought it was [her]4027-one woman hand , of course . [I]891-i quite understand . "[891-i] Did [she]891-i ? Did -- could -- [anyone]3948-anyone ? even [he]0-i [himself]0-i ? [God]96-god ! How content -- how happy [he]0-i had been -- how certain-- " [Dillon]158-dillon ! [Dillon]158-dillon ! For [God]96-god 's sake , where 's [Dillon]158-dillon ? "[891-i] came an excited voice , as [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith burst into [the tent]857-the tent , bringing the afternoon sunshine to war with that unearthly light . " Come along , [man]361-man ! There 's been an accident in [the workshop]4030-the workshop ! [I]74-eugene smith warned [them]4031-them not to touch -- one -- [a mere boy]4032-a mere boy -- did . [Got]162-got startled , [I]74-eugene smith suppose , and fell over -- onto the circular saw -- it was going . [His]158-dillon leg -- [I've]74-eugene smith tried a tourniquet , but [I]74-eugene smith ca n't stop-- "[74-eugene smith] The remainder was inaudible ; [the caller]894-the caller and [the called]895-the called , followed by [Vincent]71-vincent , glad of any interruption to the intolerableness of [his]0-i confusion , were already running as for dear life down [the palm - set avenue]896-the palm - set avenue towards [the canal workshop]897-the canal workshop outside the walls . That it was for death , however , not life , [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon saw at a glance ; though , without a pause , [he]69-dr. dillon knelt down in the fateful , irresistible tide of life blood which was ebbing and flowing with such awful insistency , and set [his]69-dr. dillon teeth in fight . Yet once [he]69-dr. dillon gave an upward glance to the long , low roof so full of driving bands and wheels and levers , so full of [men]312-men 's power , so empty of [men]312-men 's passion ; and then a straight one to [the circle of ignorant , awe - stricken , dark faces closing in round [him]69-dr. dillon]900-the circle of ignorant , awe - stricken , dark faces closing in round him . And as [he]69-dr. dillon did so , [he]69-dr. dillon muttered to [himself:--]69-dr. dillon " [I]69-dr. dillon would n't have had this happen for a thousand pounds -- and [a high - caste man]4033-a high - caste man , too ! "[69-dr. dillon] Undoubtedly ; the sacred thread showed on the shoulder under the broad arrow -- for [the twice - born]405-the twice - born are twice - born even in [gaol]902-gaol . " Lay [him]69-dr. dillon on [Mother Earth]13-patient mother earth to die , [ye]69-dr. dillon of [[his]69-dr. dillon caste]4034-his caste ! "[81-father ninian] said a voice from behind . It was [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's . [His]81-father ninian haste had driven the colour from [his]81-father ninian face ; [he]81-father ninian stood breathless , yet calm , [his]81-father ninian right hand raised . In the awestricken circle [none]403-none stirred ; there was no sacred thread upon [their]904-their shoulders . " Give [me]3483-the old man a hand , please , [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , "[3483-the old man] said [the old man]3483-the old man quietly ; " [he]81-father ninian will not die easy there . "[3483-the old man] So , between [them]904-their , [they]904-their shifted [the slight figure]906-the slight figure from the wooden platform on which it had fallen , to the ground all sodden and stained with that tide of blood . A faint content seemed to come to the half - conscious face ; the head nestled itself into the soft earth as if to rest . [The circle of dark and white faces]907-the circle of dark and white faces fell back alike , leaving [the doctor]334-the doctor and [the priest]3909-the priest alone with [death,--the doctor with both hands detaining that ebbing tide of life]910-death,--the doctor with both hands detaining that ebbing tide of life , [the priest]3909-the priest with the viaticum of another faith on [his]3909-the priest lips speeding it on its way . " [Lo]123-lo ! "[3909-the priest] whispered some of the circle . " Hark to [his]131-am - ma ' [Ram Ram]4035-ram ram ! ' [He]131-am - ma knows -- [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan knows . "[3909-the priest] [Am - ma]131-am - ma was fishing . Breast deep in the water , which in the early dawn stretched like a shining shield to meet the pale primrose vestments of the coming day , [his]131-am - ma bodiless head and shoulders slid sedately over the surface like some strange kind of wild - fowl ; for [his]131-am - ma hands , clasped at the back of [his]131-am - ma curly frizz of hair , held the apex of a conical , reed - distended net , shaped like a pair of wings . [His]131-am - ma eyes were closed , and , despite all lack of visible movement , the tenseness of every muscle , the strained look of every curve , showed that [he]131-am - ma was on the alert for something ; that something , being the first hint of possible prey sent by [his]131-am - ma hidden feet as [they]912-they felt , like hands , over the bottom . Felt lightly , buoyantly , with scarce more pressure than the water itself , until , at the first suspicion of a fish lying half - buried in the sand , [they]912-they would fling [themselves]912-they air - wards to change places with [his]131-am - ma head ; and that , with the net twirled dexterously above it , would go down like an extinguisher over the suspicious ridge or furrow . Sometimes -- most often , of course,--they proved to be nothing else ; but sometimes , again , there would be a pause , during which the black legs would remain uppermost , and then , once more , the black head would come air - wards with a wriggling fish , held , if it happened to be a small one , in its white teeth . For [Am - ma]131-am - ma had not been provided by nature with a pouch , like [the pelicans who were fishing hard by ; and , being absolutely destitute of clothing and pockets]913-the pelicans who were fishing hard by ; and , being absolutely destitute of clothing and pockets , had to sidle sedately to [the bank]914-the bank with each prize before seeking another , since both hands and feet were needed for its capture . Otherwise , [his]131-am - ma method of fishing was little removed from the birds,--the net being considered as [his]131-am - ma beak . If anything , it was the more primitive of the two , since [the pelicans]915-the pelicans fished in companies , drawing a serried line round each likely shallow ; whereas [Am - ma]131-am - ma had all the distrust of [[his]131-am - ma fellow]916-his fellow which marks [man]361-man in [his]361-man earliest development . For , even amongst [his]131-am - ma kind , [Am - ma]131-am - ma was held to be barbarian ; though , Heaven knows ! the six or seven millions of wild tribes and forest races in [India]8-india which go to make up its two hundred and eighty , are primitive enough . [Those six or seven millions]918-those six or seven millions , frankly , absolutely savage , who , as the census puts it , are ' not to be specified ' ; remaining , as [they]918-those six or seven millions do , untouched by either the civilizations or religions with which [they]918-those six or seven millions have come in contact . [Six or seven millions , whose very superstitions]919-six or seven millions , whose very superstitions are [their]918-those six or seven millions own monopoly ! Some there were among [these fisher folk of [Eshwara]1-eshwara who , like [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu]920-these fisher folk of eshwara who , like gu - gu , were faintly leavened with latter - day learning , faintly amenable to latter - day standards ; but [Am - ma]131-am - ma 's dull brain was satisfied with what it had inherited ; which included , amongst other things , sight , hearing , touch , keen almost beyond belief . So [he]131-am - ma opened [his]131-am - ma eyes at a sound which , to [an ordinary person]921-an ordinary person , would have been as inaudible as the swift coming of sunlight in the sky ; and [his]131-am - ma sight told [him]131-am - ma immediately what it was in detail . [A canoe]922-a canoe was coming down [the lagoon]923-the lagoon with [two men]924-two men in it . Now there was only one canoe in [Eshwara]1-eshwara , and that belonged to [Pundit Ramanund]163-ramanund . [He]131-am - ma had been over [the black water]3675-the black water , and learnt , amongst a number of other strange new things which were of no use , how to paddle [a canoe]922-a canoe -- [his]131-am - ma own or another 's ! For what good was [a canoe]922-a canoe when [you]928-you did not know [the sandbanks]826-the sandbanks ? And how could [you]928-you know [the sand - banks]930-the sand - banks unless [you]928-you swam over [them]930-the sand - banks and dived down to them ? Then , if [you]928-you could do that , what was the good of [a canoe]922-a canoe ? An air - bag , or even an earthen pot under the pit of [your]928-you stomach , on which [you]928-you could lie , was sufficient for all practical purposes . Therefore [one of [the men Am - ma]933-the men am - ma knew]932-one of the men am - ma knew must be [Ramanund]163-ramanund ; the other , by [his]934-his turban , was [a Mahomedan]95-the mahomedan . Did [he]131-am - ma know [the sand - banks]930-the sand - banks ? [Am - ma]3733-am - ma shaded [his]3733-am - ma eyes with one hand , and watched to see . Evidently not ; [the canoe]937-the canoe stuck here , there , everywhere , yet still came on slowly . But if [the occupants]938-the occupants wanted -- as [everybody]939-everybody seemed to want nowadays -- to cross over to [the other side]940-the other side -- that other side where [the red brick headworks of [the canal]3421-the canal]941-the red brick headworks of the canal showed like a plinth -- to [those strange , new white tents where [the Lord]3426-the lord was expected]943-those strange , new white tents where the lord was expected ; then [they]938-the occupants would find the navigation more intricate . [Am - ma]131-am - ma being conservative inevitably , smiled at the certainty , closed [his]3733-am - ma eyes , and went on fishing ; till [he]3733-am - ma opened them again at a shout . " Which way ? "[3733-am - ma] [he]3733-am - ma echoed , [his]3733-am - ma voice sounding hollow from its nearness to [the water]945-the water . " By [the deep stream]4036-the deep stream , always . "[3733-am - ma] " And which is that , [fool]4037-fool ? "[89-roshan] came [Roshan]89-roshan 's voice angrily . " Where there is most water , "[3733-am - ma] returned [Am - ma]3733-am - ma calmly . " Cease from paddling , and [the canoe]937-the canoe will tell [you]4037-fool without fail . Such things know of [themselves]938-the occupants . [They]938-the occupants are wise . "[3733-am - ma] " But [we]938-the occupants want to get over to [the camp]3490-the camp as quickly as [we]938-the occupants can , "[163-ramanund] said [Ramanund]163-ramanund , interrupting an impatient retort of [Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's , with an aside to the effect that [they]938-the occupants had better not alienate [their]938-the occupants only hope . [The river]333-the river was lower than [he]3733-am - ma had expected , or [he]3733-am - ma would never have suggested crossing in [the boat]643-the boat , as quicker than [the bridge]373-the bridge ; yet there was not time to go back . [Am - ma]3733-am - ma smiled cunningly . " [None]403-none will get quicker than [he]403-none can , [[my]3733-am - ma masters]4041-my masters ; that much is certain . "[3733-am - ma] Being pleased with [his]3733-am - ma own wit , [he]3733-am - ma laughed , and kicking up [his]3733-am - ma heels , ducked [his]3733-am - ma head , to come up again a few yards nearer in shallower water , where [he]3733-am - ma could stand and salaam . " [The noble people]4042-the noble people , "[3733-am - ma] [he]3733-am - ma said gravely , " must surely follow [the stream]831-the stream if [they]4042-the noble people go in company ; but if [they]4042-the noble people will quit comfort , and wade , carrying [[their]4042-the noble people boat]4044-their boat here and there , [I]3733-am - ma , [Am - ma]3733-am - ma , will show [them]4042-the noble people . But it is annoyance . Without going with [the stream]831-the stream there is always annoyance . "[3733-am - ma] " It is better than going back or sticking still , anyhow ! "[89-roshan] remarked [Roshan Khân]89-roshan to [[his]89-roshan companion]476-his companion ; adding in [Hindustani--"Then]164-hindustani--"then come quick -- there is room for [thee]476-his companion and [thy]476-his companion net , and [we]4047-we will pay [thee]476-his companion . "[89-roshan] [Am - ma]3733-am - ma shook [his]3733-am - ma head . " There is weight enough for difficulties without [me]3733-am - ma , [[my]3733-am - ma masters]4041-my masters ; and here or there is one to [a fisher]4049-a fisher . "[3733-am - ma] So saying , [he]3733-am - ma closed [his]3733-am - ma net with one dexterous twist , slipped [his]3733-am - ma arms through it so that it hung behind [his]3733-am - ma back , and struck across the shallows . " Yonder is [our]4047-we aim , "[3733-am - ma] [he]3733-am - ma said briefly , pointing to a blue thread of smoke rising from [the water]945-the water 's edge a good way down [stream]954-stream . " [They]4047-we burn [a dead man]4050-a dead man there to - day ; it is ever a good guide to [the living]4051-the living . "[3733-am - ma] " ' Twill be [the Brahmin lad [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors]4052-the brahmin lad the huzoors killed by mistake with [their]118-the huzoors Dee - puk - râg . Didst hear the tale ? "[163-ramanund] asked [Ramanund]163-ramanund . Why , [he]3733-am - ma would have been puzzled to tell , since [he]3733-am - ma had no definite desire to foster ill - feeling or fear ; but it had been the talk of [the town]331-the town till those small hours which end gossip , even in [India]8-india , and the talk had confirmed the theory , which so many of [[his]3733-am - ma kind]956-his kind hold firmly , if vaguely , that [the mass of [the people]3552-the people]957-the mass of the people feel the English rule to be unjust . But [Am - ma]131-am - ma was not of [the people]3552-the people . [He]3733-am - ma was of [the six million and odd barbarians]960-the six million and odd barbarians . [He]3733-am - ma turned , showing [his]3733-am - ma broad white teeth in a grin . " Ay ! ' Twas well done . Now , as in old days , [folk]661-folk will know who is [true leader]4054-true leader . "[3733-am - ma] There was no doubt , no fear in [his]3733-am - ma mind . Had not [[his]3733-am - ma tribe]961-his tribe always , of old , chosen as [[its]961-his tribe chief]962-its chief and [God]96-god [the man who could hold a torch in each hand at arms ' length , one lighted , the other unlit]963-the man who could hold a torch in each hand at arms ' length , one lighted , the other unlit , and bid the flame pass from one to the other seven times ? And as for [a man]533-a man 's life , was it not always expedient that [one]3501-one should die for [the people]3552-the people upon occasions ? [Ramanund]163-ramanund frowned ; perhaps because [Am - ma]131-am - ma concluded by ordering [the crew]967-the crew out of [the boat]643-the boat , and [the water]945-the water was cold . It could scarcely have been anything else which brought annoyance , since [he]3733-am - ma , like most of [[his]3733-am - ma kind]956-his kind , prided [himself]3733-am - ma on being truly [a British subject]971-a british subject . So , paddling and pushing , wading , and even carrying , [they]972-they crossed from shallow to shallow , from [sand - bank]973-sand - bank to [sand - bank]973-sand - bank , led by [Am - ma]131-am - ma , swimming and diving like a duck , or walking on ahead unconcernedly , [his]3733-am - ma eyes fixed in keen - sighted approval on that group close to [the water]945-the water 's edge , towards which [he]3733-am - ma steered . Yet it was a gruesome group , in truth , which circled round that solitary and still more gruesome figure in the centre . [A figure squatting like the rest]976-a figure squatting like the rest ( since , when wood is dear , funeral piles must be restricted ) in full view , yet mercifully obscured for the most part by the heavy column of smoke which rose straight to a level with the leaping flames , then , tilting sideways before the intermittent breeze of early dawn , drifted westward , to hide those white tents upon the horizon . " Above or below , [fool]4037-fool ! "[163-ramanund] called [Ramanund]163-ramanund , sharply , as [they]972-they neared [the shore]3732-the shore . " [I]163-ramanund am [no Dôm]4056-no dôm , like [thou]4057-thou , to choose [my]163-ramanund way among [dead men]4058-dead men 's bones . "[163-ramanund] The allusion to [the semi - aboriginal tribe who earn [their]978-the semi - aboriginal tribe who earn their livelihood by streaking the dead livelihood by streaking the dead]978-the semi - aboriginal tribe who earn their livelihood by streaking the dead , brought a frown this time to [Am - ma]131-am - ma 's face . " [I]3733-am - ma am [no Dôm]4056-no dôm , either , "[3733-am - ma] [he]3733-am - ma retorted , " and were [I]3733-am - ma one , [thou]4057-thou wouldst be glad of [my]3733-am - ma guidance to the fire some day , Pundit - jee ! "[3733-am - ma] [Roshan Khân]89-roshan listened with the wholehearted contempt of [his]89-roshan race and creed . " Be quick , either way , "[89-roshan] [he]89-roshan said , scornfully . " [We]4060-we have bare time , as it is . "[89-roshan] Yet [he]89-roshan , also , swerved from that gruesome group , which , as [the two -- dressed as Europeans]979-the two -- dressed as europeans , save for [their]979-the two -- dressed as europeans turbans -- stepped ashore and hurried off in the direction of [the camp]3490-the camp , stood up in a linked semi - circle to [salaam]27-salaam , then squatted again with a clank of leg irons . [Am - ma]131-am - ma , [his]131-am - ma task over , had paused in [the deeper water]981-the deeper water , and was once more sidling sedately . The sun had risen with the inconceivable swiftness with which it rises from [a dead - level , treeless plain]982-a dead - level , treeless plain , and shone reddish - yellow , like a fire , on [his]131-am - ma wet skin . The shadow of that dense column of smoke sidled sedately on [the water]945-the water also , shifting with the shifting spirals of the reality . " Had [he]131-am - ma spilt blood ? "[131-am - ma] asked [Am - ma]131-am - ma , suddenly , as that something , half - hidden in the smoke , seemed to dissolve , sending a great fountain of sparks , bright even in the sunlight , up into the air . One in the semicircle clucked denial . " [A jogi]4061-a jogi -- [they]4062-they say of [Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - [nâth 's monastery]4063-nâth 's monastery -- had [him]131-am - ma for [disciple]4064-disciple . And there was dhatoora in the sweetmeats , for sure . Whether [he]131-am - ma was strangler , God knows ! Perhaps . Yet [such travellers]4065-such travellers deserved poison ; who but [a fool]4066-a fool trusts a strange hand ? [The Viceroy 's camp]3419-the viceroy 's camp was no longer [a city of dreams]998-a city of dreams . [Its]3419-the viceroy 's camp silence had gone , lost in that indefinable sense of sound which seems to come from the heart - beats , even , of unseen humanity ; and the whiteness , the purity of it , was stained and smirched by the scarlet - as - sin coatees of the innumerable orderlies , who bustled about from [tent]999-tent to [tent]999-tent , with huge files of references , or lingered at the tent doors extorting shoe - money from [the native visitors]1001-the native visitors , who came in shoals to plead for patronage from one or another of [the bigwigs belonging to [the Hosts of [the Lord - sahib]3420-the lord - sahib]1003-the hosts of the lord - sahib]1002-the bigwigs belonging to the hosts of the lord - sahib . It was a difficult task , involving as it did the classification of the aristocracy , plutocracy , and democracy of [India]8-india , in one generally satisfactory Court - guide . " It cann't be done in this wurrld , "[1009-the commissioner] remarked [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , in one of those suave , plastic , Cork brogues which might be made of Cork butter from the softness and lack of friction they bring to the English language . "[1008-the under secretary] said [the Under Secretary]1008-the under secretary , still more resignedly . Then [the devil]4118-the devil fly off with [him]142-dya ram for complicating the problem of British rule in [India]8-india . Why should [he]142-dya ram want to come to durbar at all ? When [people]3436-people change [their]3436-people dress [they]3436-people should change [their]3436-people desires , but the only effect [our]4109-our civilization has upon [some men]4120-some men [I]1019-his tormentor know , is to make [them]4120-some men want to keep [their]4120-some men hat and [their]4120-some men boots on at the same time ! "[1019-his tormentor] While this sort of thing was going on inside [the tent]857-the tent , [Dya Ram]142-dya ram and [the Thakoor of [Hodinuggur]175-hodinuggur]1022-the thakoor of hodinuggur were in full view of [each other]3586-each other , outside [it]857-the tent . [The former , having scorned the sinful scarlet coatees]1024-the former , having scorned the sinful scarlet coatees even to the point of refusing to have [his]1024-the former , having scorned the sinful scarlet coatees patent leather shoes dusted , was walking up and down in English fashion . [The latter]336-the latter , in a wonderful parcel - gilt coach , was awaiting the effect of [his]1024-the former , having scorned the sinful scarlet coatees ten - rupee tip with perfect patience and serenity ; while [his]1024-the former , having scorned the sinful scarlet coatees retinue , which consisted of [a dozen ragged retainers carrying lances festooned with tinsel and yaks]1026-a dozen ragged retainers carrying lances festooned with tinsel and yaks ' tails , stared contemptuously at [the two sentries pacing up and down below the flagstaff]1027-the two sentries pacing up and down below the flagstaff ; who -- to tell truth -- seemed so monotonously part of the general show as to suggest that [they]1028-their also were under the charge of [the two yellow - legged policemen who stood on either side of the rose - bed]1029-the two yellow - legged policemen who stood on either side of the rose - bed . It was high noon , and the various departmental gongs had begun to give [their]1028-their version of the meridian , with that unbiased disregard for that of [[their]1028-their neighbours]1030-their neighbours which makes the time of day an absolute uncertainty in [a big camp]594-a big camp . But it was calling time evidently ; for [two superb red - coats , blazoned with gold]1032-two superb red - coats , blazoned with gold , appeared in company with two big books and a silver inkstand , and disappeared with [them]1032-two superb red - coats , blazoned with gold into [the durbar tent]1033-the durbar tent . And shortly afterwards [an aide - de - camp]1034-an aide - de - camp sloped over to it , yawning . Both [Dya Ram]142-dya ram and [the Thakoor]178-the thakoor knew that this meant preparation for those , who , having the entrée to [the Government House]1035-the government house , had the right to put down [their]1028-their names in those big books ; but the fact itself affected [their]1028-their two types very differently . [The old Rajput]179-the old rajput 's visit of ceremony was of another sort . [He]179-the old rajput , obeying definite orders , would come at a specified time , and get [his]179-the old rajput specified salute with [his]179-the old rajput compeers . But [Dya Ram]142-dya ram was like the wild tribes in one way ; [he]142-dya ram was unspecified ! [He]142-dya ram was neither fish nor fowl , flesh nor good red herring . So , as [he]179-the old rajput watched [a young Englishman]1036-a young englishman drive up in [a bamboo cart]1037-a bamboo cart , dash into [the tent]857-the tent , and dash out again as if [the place]3423-the place belonged to [him]1036-a young englishman , [he]179-the old rajput felt aggrieved . [He]179-the old rajput even went so far as to formulate [his]179-the old rajput grievance in mental words , and then these appeared to [him]179-the old rajput so apposite to a leading article , that [he]179-the old rajput took out a note - book , and , after some corrections , stored away , for future use , the assertion , that ' the time will come when the colour of the hand which holds the pen will be no bar to its writing its name in the Book of---- ? ' [He]179-the old rajput did not feel sure of the qualitative noun , and after trying Fate , Fame , Life , and [Lord]1040-lord , left a blank instead . [Meanwhile carriages]1041-meanwhile carriages and dogcarts all of sorts had begun to drive up , [[their]1042-their occupants]1043-their occupants disappearing into [the tent]857-the tent for a second or two , then coming out with the smile of [the elect]1045-the elect on [their]1043-their occupants faces . [Father Ninian]81-father ninian was one of the first , resplendent in a new soutane and sash , with [Akbar Khân]110-akbar in [[his]110-akbar orderly]1046-his orderly 's get - up , oscillating between a palsy of delighted servility , and a catalepsy of dignity ; the one for [[his]110-akbar superiors]1047-his superiors , the other for [[his]110-akbar equals]1048-his equals . "[481-the girl] As [she]481-the girl drove off , however , [her]481-the girl head was in a whirl ; and as , when pausing to pick up [Dr. Campbell]154-dr. campbell , the whole panorama of [the camp]3490-the camp , [the hills behind [it]3490-the camp]1076-the hills behind it , [the distant temples of [Eshwara]1-eshwara]1077-the distant temples of eshwara , the busy place - seekers in the foreground , the scarlet - sin - stains of [the chuprassies]1078-the chuprassies ' coats against the dazzling whiteness of [the tents]839-the tents , lay before [her]481-the girl , one of those rare , incomprehensible moods came upon [her]481-the girl when the soul retreats into [its]1080-its spiritual body , so that the sight grows clear , the touch keen , and [you]1081-you can feel [the round world]1082-the round world spin beneath [your]1081-you feet , see the shadow of earth stretching far among the stars . [The World]31-the world 's Desire ! What was it ? Brought up to believe that the heart of [man]361-man -- that mainspring of [the spinning world]1084-the spinning world -- was vile , [she]481-the girl had never asked [herself]481-the girl why this was so . [She]481-the girl had read the story of [Adam]186-adam and [Eve]187-eve with unquestioning faith , yet never sought to know what had changed the good to evil . But now , as [her]481-the girl eyes rested on [those far - distant peaks with that faint mist about [their]1078-the chuprassies feet hiding the " Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods]4150-those far - distant peaks with that faint mist about their feet hiding the " cradle of the gods , "[481-the girl] and followed , as far as the eye could follow in [the nearer hills]1085-the nearer hills , the climbing track worn by the weariness of that eternal search after righteousness , [she]481-the girl asked [herself]481-the girl what it was which kept [mankind]1086-mankind so long upon [the road]3494-the road ; asked [herself]481-the girl , for the first time , what that first sin had been which had lost [Paradise]9-paradise . No lack of desire after salvation , surely . [Generation]188-generation on [generation of Eastern pilgrims]1088-generation of eastern pilgrims had worn that path out of [the sheer rock]1089-the sheer rock , had agonized after good , and remained evil . A little shudder of memory ran through [her]481-the girl at the thought -- how evil ! And now [the West]23-the west , with [its]23-the west white tents , [its]23-the west white face , its white creed , had come to show a newer , a better way . Had it ? But what had it done for [itself]23-the west ? [She]481-the girl had worked for two years in [London ere]34-london coming out to [India]8-india ; and another shudder of memory swept over [her]481-the girl of what [she]481-the girl had seen [there]3509-there . [The World]31-the world 's Desire ! "[1095-one of its sentries] " [It]4152-it is [that pernicious fellow]4153-that pernicious fellow , [Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - nâth , "[154-dr. campbell] remarked [Dr. Campbell]154-dr. campbell , sententiously . " [He]4153-that pernicious fellow wishes , no doubt , to appeal against [Captain Dering]71-vincent 's order , of which [I]154-dr. campbell , for one , am heartily glad . "[154-dr. campbell] [Erda]105-erda 's eyes were still clear ; clear with what [those who do not see , call dreams]1097-those who do not see , call dreams . "[189-david--] Oh ! [Davie]190-david will take care of [her]823-my dear , never fear ; [he]190-david is not [a ninny]1100-a ninny ! " [Erda]105-erda flushed scarlet all over [her]105-erda face and neck . It seemed to [her]105-erda as if [she]105-erda had forgotten [[her]105-erda cousin]4158-her cousin , [the Reverend David Campbell]190-david , altogether . And yet [she]105-erda was engaged to be married to [him]190-david as soon as [he]190-david returned from a well - earned holiday in [England]17-england . A swift remorse left [her]105-erda pale again . [Davie]190-david , who was so much in earnest , who looked to [her]105-erda as -- as-- That vision of [a woman with a red - gold edging to [her]4159-a woman with a red - gold edging to her white robe and a red - gold apple in her hand white robe and a red - gold apple in [her]4159-a woman with a red - gold edging to her white robe and a red - gold apple in her hand hand]4159-a woman with a red - gold edging to her white robe and a red - gold apple in her hand came to send the blood to [her]105-erda face once more . [The long durbar tent]4160-the long durbar tent was packed from end to end with the cane - bottomed seats of [the mighty]4161-the mighty ; and in each sat [its appointed occupant,--patient]4162-its appointed occupant,--patient , grave , silent . But in the two rows behind [the Viceroy]3418-the viceroy 's still empty chair of state [the Englishmen in political dress or uniform who sat in the front]4164-the englishmen in political dress or uniform who sat in the front , and [the Englishwomen in the latest Paris fashions who sat behind ,]4165-the englishwomen in the latest paris fashions who sat behind , were talking and laughing ; in a perfectly well - bred way , yet , to [the majority of those silent spectators , at the expense of decency]4166-the majority of those silent spectators , at the expense of decency , since a durbar is , like a West Indian ball , not for ' talkee . ' There was , however , no disapproval on those indifferent dark faces . Such things were part and parcel of that general eccentricity of [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors , before which it behoved calmness to remain calm . Yet [those same faces]4167-those same faces would have been quick to notice and resent the faintest breach of etiquette in regard to [their]4167-those same faces own treatment , or position . Those being correct , the rest was immaterial . And now , the sudden strains from without of "[190-david] [God]96-god Save [the Queen]3843-the queen " sent [those talking , laughing rows]4168-those talking , laughing rows to [their]4168-those talking , laughing rows feet silently , with the proud alacrity so noticeable in [India]8-india when the act is a confession of faith , indeed ! But [the mass beyond]4169-the mass beyond followed suit obediently , with a starry shiver of diamond - flash , a milky way of pearl - shine ; for [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith 's electric light was working full power . Finally , as if wafted on the full chords , came [a small man , with that inevitable look of coming into church which Englishmen]4170-a small man , with that inevitable look of coming into church which englishmen consider dignity ; possibly because public worship is , really , the only function in which [they]4164-the englishmen in political dress or uniform who sat in the front are not inwardly ashamed of taking part . The great gold chair , the great gold footstool , seemed all too large for everything about [[their]4164-the englishmen in political dress or uniform who sat in the front occupant]4171-their occupant , save the diamond star , the ribbon on [his]4171-their occupant breast . Yet , in a way , the scene gained by [his]4171-their occupant inadequacy when , after a decent pause , a decent silence , [he]4171-their occupant rose , small , insignificant , to give voice to [Empire]191-empire -- in a strong Scotch accent , it must be admitted , which equalled [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner 's Irish one , when , its proper exponent , [the Secretary]4173-the secretary , having a cold , [he]4171-their occupant read a translation of [the Viceroy]3418-the viceroy 's speech , and [his]4171-their occupant soft brogue ran riot among the clamorous Persian vowels . "[190-david] Ai Mâhârâjâhân , râjâhân , nawâbân wâ sâhibân âlishân . " The diamonds and pearls sat too still for play , so the electric light contented itself with the white teeth of [Englishwomen]4175-englishwomen as [they]4164-the englishmen in political dress or uniform who sat in the front yawned . But even these failed it when , the speech ending , that front row began its file past ; [the civilians]4176-the civilians first , [the soldiers]4177-the soldiers next . A quick file , a formal bow as a rule ; but , every now and again , a pause would come in the monotonous string of names , for a few words from [the Viceroy]3418-the viceroy , and another bow ere [the recipient]503-the recipient passed on . [Muriel Smith]151-muriel , who sat behind -- [the best dressed woman there]4180-the best dressed woman there , as [Erda Shepherd]105-erda had judged [her]151-muriel -- watched [[her]151-muriel husband]3787-her husband 's tall gaunt figure approaching , and wondered if that pause would come to [him]4171-their occupant . [Her]151-muriel heart beat so when it did that [she]151-muriel could hear nothing except "[190-david] graciously pleased , " "[190-david] eminent services , " "[190-david] distinguished order " ; but a whisper from [[her]151-muriel neighbor]4182-her neighbor , "[190-david] All right ! C. S. [I.]1102-i. , not C. I. E. , " left [her]151-muriel sick and faint with relief . Even so , [her]151-muriel eyes instinctively sought [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's sympathy ; but [he]71-vincent , to [her]151-muriel surprise , was looking at [the tall gaunt man whose face was a "[1102-i.] nunc dimittis " in itself]4183-the tall gaunt man whose face was a " nunc dimittis " in itself , as [he]71-vincent made [his]71-vincent way back to [his]71-vincent seat , forgetful even of [[his]71-vincent wife]3429-his wife . But [he]71-vincent had forgotten [her]3429-his wife , amid a host of other things , for three whole years : forgotten them in a ceaseless effort , an untiring energy . And now that the necessity for this was over , sleep and rest were [his]71-vincent first thoughts . [He]71-vincent took both , apparently , in [his]71-vincent chair , while [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , causing this time a fresh flashing of jewels , began on a fresh string of titles . "[0-i] Sri râja - [i]0-i - râjân , furzund - i - khâs - munsoor - [i]0-i - zamân - mâhârâj - dhirâj - rasâkh . " And , as [they]4186-they rolled on , the atom of humanity belonging to [them]4186-they -- someone in faded brocade , with ropes of ill - shaped pearls and uncut stones wound about [him]71-vincent , or a jauntier figure fresh and glittering from [[a Calcutta jeweller]4187-a calcutta jeweller 's shop]4188-a calcutta jeweller 's shop -- would be singled out by [its political in charge]4189-its political in charge , like a sheep from a flock , and guided dexterously to the exactly proper spot in [the whole round world]4190-the whole round world wherein obeisance and offering could be made with dignity to itself , and [the recipient]503-the recipient . Then it would be swept on , regardless of an invariable desire to break back , in an endless circle to its seat , while fresh titles rolled out , and [a fresh owner]4192-a fresh owner was hemmed in and swept forward . For two whole mortal hours , this , and nothing but this ; with , every now and again , that pause for a few words , translated now into Irish - Urdu , producing an expression as of a cat licking cream , on a face as it was was hustled back , blindly obedient , as [sheep]4193-sheep are with [a collie [they]4193-sheep know and trust]4194-a collie they know and trust . So , at last , long after [everyone]749-everyone , even [Dya Ram]142-dya ram -- who looked terribly disjointed between [his]142-dya ram frock coat , white tie , grey trousers , and the gold mohur which [he]142-dya ram persisted in holding after native custom in [his]142-dya ram gloved right hand -- had passed , [the politicals]4196-the politicals gathered in a knot , like [church - wardens]4197-church - wardens for the offertory plates , and the distribution of atta and pân , that sacrament of servitude and sovereignty , began . It , too , was exactly like an offertory ; that is , a languid passing round of a plate by [an official]4198-an official , and yawns for [the rest of [the congregation]4200-the congregation]4199-the rest of the congregation . Finally , with a vigour savouring -- like a voluntary -- of relief , [the band]4201-the band attacked "[96-god] [God]96-god Save [the Queen]3843-the queen " once more , [the Viceroy]3418-the viceroy retired , [the durbarees]4203-the durbarees trooped out , still calm and silent , yet satisfied , and [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , sinking into a vacant seat , said:-- "[3426-the lord] Thank [the Lord]3426-the lord ! That 's over without a hitch . So [India]8-india 's safe for another six months at the cost of a trumpery title or two . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see on what ground , " began [the Under Secretary]1008-the under secretary , laboriously . "[0-i] Then [ye]1105-ye do n't read [your]1105-ye Bible . Did n't [Adam]186-adam , when [he]186-adam was given dominion over the lower animals , begin by bestowing names on [them]1106-them ? Ah ! [[my]0-i dear]823-my dear [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith , [I]0-i did n't know [ye]1105-ye were so close . A thousand congratulations , [[my]0-i dear lady]1108-my dear lady . " "[0-i] [You]0-i do n't mean it , [sir]3491-sir , " [she]75-mrs. smith interrupted , laughing . "[0-i] Do [you]3491-sir think [I]0-i have forgotten the consolatory verses [you]3491-sir wrote [me]0-i last year when [Eugene]74-eugene smith did n't get anything ? [You]3491-sir are [a fraud]1110-a fraud . " "[1110-a fraud] Not a bit of it ; only [an Irishman]1111-an irishman , " put in [Father Ninian]81-father ninian , with an almost tender smile for the keen , whimsical face which had been friend to [him]81-father ninian , and foe to [him]81-father ninian , for many a long year . "[1111-an irishman] Let [us]1112-us have the verses , [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith . " "[75-mrs. smith] Say [ye]1105-ye do n't remember them , there 's [a kind soul]1113-a kind soul , " urged [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , persuasively . "[1113-a kind soul] But [I]0-i do : " Striven -- heaven ! "[1009-the commissioner] groaned [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , amid the clapping of hands . " [[My]1009-the commissioner dear madam]4207-my dear madam , did [I]1009-the commissioner commit such a crime -- [I]1009-the commissioner mean rhyme ? But [the poet]4208-the poet 's right . [Ye]1105-ye ca n't go wide of the mark , annyhow , even in a song , but [you]1105-ye 're sure to find the fact again in the heart of [a friend]4209-a friend . "[1009-the commissioner] So , with that curiously light - hearted , almost reckless , frivolity of Indian society -- a not unnatural recoil , perhaps , from the perpetual presence of the greatest social problem [the world]404-the world has ever seen , or is likely to see , that is , the mutual assimilation of [East and West]1116-east and west without injury to either -- [the little company of English men]1117-the little company of english men and [women]479-women , [empire makers]1119-empire makers and [breakers]1120-breakers , drifted out into the sunshine , and so on to [the [Viceroy]192-viceroy 's private enclosure]1121-the viceroy 's private enclosure , where [the band , weary of national anthems]1122-the band , weary of national anthems , was already at work on a selection of street tunes , beginning with " [Tommy]132-tom sawyer , make room for [[your]4210-your uncle]4211-your uncle . "[1122-the band , weary of national anthems] So the pageant of power passed into a garden - party , and nothing remained to show the hand - grip which had made [that garden]1123-that garden out of [a wilderness]1124-a wilderness , to tell of the tireless effort to solve the problem , the ceaseless striving to be just , which underlay all the quips and cranks , the foibles and follies , of [the great camp]1125-the great camp , save the premature baldness of a few heads , as [[their]1126-their owners]1127-their owners fought desperately at badminton ; fought to prevent [a child]3605-a child 's shuttlecock from falling in [the wrong court]1129-the wrong court ! A fight which was watched with blank courtesy , as a further exhibition of sheer eccentricity , by those of [the jewelled and brocaded owners of titles who had the entrée to this Holy of Holies]1130-the jewelled and brocaded owners of titles who had the entrée to this holy of holies . [Roshan Khân]89-roshan , [however,--who]193-however,--who looked splendid in [his]89-roshan uniform,--fought with the best ; and won , too , though [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila , who played on [his]89-roshan side , stood still , taking , it is true , the shots which came within reach dexterously enough , but never stirring an inch for one beyond . And , as [he]89-roshan played , the curious chance which had brought [him]89-roshan into [her]86-laila company made [his]89-roshan blood run fast . [Captain Dering]71-vincent had bidden [him]89-roshan join the set ; bidden [him]89-roshan curtly , almost savagely , as [the best player available , in answer to a challenge from [Muriel Smith]151-muriel to play [her]151-muriel , [[her]151-muriel husband]3787-her husband]1131-the best player available , in answer to a challenge from muriel smith to play her , her husband , and [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner . And this challenge had come curtly , also , because [Captain Dering]71-vincent was standing beside [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila , to whom [he]71-vincent had been giving a cup of coffee . Not because it gave [him]71-vincent pleasure , but from sheer determination not to let [his]71-vincent mistake in the darkness count for anything . Yet , as [the girl]481-the girl 's hand took the cup from [his]71-vincent , [he]71-vincent had remembered with a thrill the gladness , the content it had brought [him]71-vincent . Though [he]71-vincent refused to acknowledge the fact , the puzzle of this mistake had been [his]71-vincent chief thought ever since it occurred , and a smouldering resentment regarding [his]71-vincent past relationship with [one who was still to [him]71-vincent the best and dearest of [women]479-women]1135-one who was still to him the best and dearest of women was the result . [He]71-vincent felt vaguely that [she]151-muriel , as well as [he]71-vincent , ought to have known that [their]1137-their sentiment , [their]1137-their monopoly , as it were , of friendship , could only mean -- what it had meant to [him]71-vincent during those few moments of blindness which had , paradoxically , opened [his]71-vincent eyes . So [he]71-vincent had felt bitter , and [she]151-muriel had known it instinctively . If [she]151-muriel had ever faced facts , this alone might have opened [her]151-muriel eyes also ; but [she]151-muriel was [too good a woman]1138-too good a woman , too helplessly bound by [[her]151-muriel woman]1139-her woman 's cult of love , to disassociate it from friendship . So , without bringing a doubt even , the jealous desire of appropriation which draws a line clear and clean as a sword - cut between the two , had risen up in [her]151-muriel from the absence of the sympathetic look [she]151-muriel had expected from [Vincent Dering]71-vincent . So [she]151-muriel had challenged [him]71-vincent , and so it came to pass that [Roshan Khân]89-roshan played badminton with [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila . [She]151-muriel took no notice of [him]71-vincent beyond a casual inspection of [his]71-vincent uniform ; still the mere fact of being [her]151-muriel equal within the white lines which separated [[their]1140-their badminton court]1141-their badminton court from the realities of life seemed a fate . When the game was over , [his]71-vincent eyes followed [her]151-muriel closely , and [he]71-vincent , [himself]71-vincent , at a respectful distance ; and as [he]71-vincent followed [her]151-muriel , [his]71-vincent desire to speak to [her]151-muriel grew as [he]71-vincent pondered on [his]71-vincent right to do so . After all , as [[his]71-vincent grandmother]530-his grandmother had said , [she]151-muriel was [[his]71-vincent cousin]3859-his cousin . And fate was on [his]71-vincent side once more . A well - bred crowding round a table where some photographs of [the camp]3490-the camp were being shown , brought [him]71-vincent so near [her]151-muriel that [she]151-muriel caught sight of [his]71-vincent yellow , silver - laced uniform behind [her]151-muriel , and turned quickly . Turned with a look in [her]151-muriel big black eyes which dazzled [him]71-vincent . It vanished , however , in a second ; yet [her]151-muriel words , spoken with a faint resentment , made the memory of the look give rise to a swift pulse of angry suspicion . " [I]151-muriel thought [you]71-vincent were [Captain Dering]71-vincent , "[151-muriel] [she]151-muriel said . " Why do [you]71-vincent wear the same uniform ? [I]151-muriel thought [natives]4212-natives could n't be [officers]4213-officers . "[151-muriel] The assumption , in [his]71-vincent present state of mind , made all [his]71-vincent fierce temper flash to [his]71-vincent face ; but ere [he]71-vincent could choose English words to express it , [she]151-muriel laughed , and , after [her]151-muriel fashion when amused , became confidential . " [You]71-vincent are angry at being called [a native]4214-a native ; but [you]71-vincent are [one]3501-one , are n't [you]71-vincent ? Then it is so foolish . [You]71-vincent are like [[my]1145-i guardian]3542-my guardian . [He]3542-my guardian ca n't bear [the bazaar people]4217-the bazaar people to call [me]1145-i ' Begum - sahiba ' ; but [they]4217-the bazaar people do sometimes , [you]71-vincent know , because [I]1145-i own a lot of [[their]4217-the bazaar people houses]4218-their houses and lands , and [[my]1145-i grandmother]3455-my grandmother was [a native princess]4220-a native princess . [I]1145-i know that , though [[my]1145-i guardian]3542-my guardian never speaks about it . [He]3542-my guardian is ashamed , [I]1145-i think -- like [you]71-vincent are . [I]1145-i 'm not . [I]1145-i did n't choose [[my]1145-i grandmother]3455-my grandmother . Why should one fuss about such things ? If they 're true , it ca n't be helped , and if [they]4217-the bazaar people 're not , what does it matter ? Besides , it must be rather nice to be [a real Begum]4223-a real begum . [You]71-vincent have n't seen any , of course ; [they]4217-the bazaar people would n't let [you]71-vincent , would [they]4217-the bazaar people ? That must be horrid . How could [you]71-vincent like [people]3436-people if [you]71-vincent did n't see [them]3436-people ? Besides-- "[1145-i] [she]1145-i added , with an access of demure , pious conviction , " it would be wicked to marry [them]3436-people , [you]71-vincent know . [You]71-vincent should never marry anyone [you]71-vincent do n't love . Even [the Sisters]4225-the sisters told [me]1145-i that . "[1145-i] [Her]1145-i voice had deepened , broadened ; [her]1145-i eyes , occupied with [his]1146-you uniform , not [his]1146-you face , had grown soft . Hitherto [he]1146-you had been too much at a loss before [her]1145-i sudden garrulity to interrupt ; now , that vague suspicion recurred , making [him]1146-you feel inclined to say brutally , " [I]1146-you am [[your]1145-i cousin]4226-your cousin ; [I]1146-you claim [you]1145-i . "[1146-you] The very thought of [her]1145-i outraged face attracted [him]1146-you . But English words were inadequate for such emotions , so , as [he]1146-you paused , [she]1145-i went on:-- " As [you]1146-you are [here]3395-here , [I]1145-i suppose [you]1146-you 'll be asked to the ball , also . It is to be in [[my]1145-i palace]4228-my palace , [you]1146-you know , because [Captain Dering]71-vincent thinks [it]4228-my palace [the best place]4229-the best place . [He]71-vincent says [the gardens]4230-the gardens will be beautiful all lit up-- "[1145-i] [She]1145-i smiled as if at some secret mystery , then continued : " Of course , [I]1145-i do n't know yet ; [I]1145-i have n't seen it , but [I]1145-i think it will be lovely . Only [I]1145-i wish [my]1145-i dress was different . [I]1145-i am [Beatrice]194-beatrice -- [Dante]195-dante 's Beatrice -- and [I]1145-i think it stupid . But [[my]1145-i guardian]3542-my guardian chose it because-- "[1145-i] [she]1145-i smiled again with the same secret amusement--"I do n't know , of course , but [I]1145-i expect it is because [[my]1145-i great - grandmother]4232-my great - grandmother went as [Beatrice]194-beatrice to some ball long ago . It is generally that . [I]1145-i think [he]81-father ninian must have been in love with [her]4232-my great - grandmother -- isn't it funny ? "[1145-i] " [Laila]86-laila , "[81-father ninian] came [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's voice from behind , " [I]81-father ninian have been looking for [you]86-laila everywhere . It is time to go . "[81-father ninian] [His]81-father ninian usually kind old face was stern . [He]81-father ninian gave the curtest of recognitions to [Roshan Khân]89-roshan , and , as [he]81-father ninian carried [his]81-father ninian ward off , said sharply , " Who introduced [you]86-laila to [that native]4233-that native ? "[81-father ninian] " [No one]3741-no one , "[1145-i] [she]1145-i replied , indifferently ; " [I]1145-i thought [he]81-father ninian was [Captain Dering]71-vincent ; [their]4235-their uniforms-- "[1145-i] [she]1145-i broke off to add , with more animation , " [I]1145-i do like the gold and silver lace . Though of course the jewels , like [the rajahs]4236-the rajahs wore , look best . "[1145-i] [He]81-father ninian interrupted [her]1145-i in Italian , giving a quick gesture of dissent . " Say not so , [cara mia]3645-cara mia , [they]4235-their would look ill on -- on [Englishmen]3816-englishmen . And listen , [child]3649-child ! [You]86-laila should not speak to [strangers]4240-strangers ; and [I]81-father ninian would rather [you]86-laila did not speak to [such natives]4241-such natives at all . [They]4241-such natives -- cannot understand -- quite -- for [they]4241-such natives look on [women]479-women differently from what [we]4243-we do . "[81-father ninian] [Laila]86-laila 's eyes narrowed sullenly . " Very well , [guardian]3576-guardian , "[1145-i] [she]1145-i said resignedly , " only [I]1145-i suppose [they]4241-such natives must know what [[their]4241-such natives women]4245-their women are really like -- and -- perhaps [the native ladies]4246-the native ladies prefer it . "[1145-i] [The old man]3483-the old man looked at [her]1145-i , startled , but said nothing . When [he]3483-the old man had gone to find [Akbar Khân]110-akbar and [the carriage]1055-the carriage , [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , seeing [her]1145-i alone , came up -- so , at least , [he]3483-the old man told [himself]3483-the old man -- out of sheer politeness , to ask if [she]1145-i wanted anything . Yet something in [her]1145-i face sent [him]3483-the old man beyond mere courtesy at once ; something almost childishly apparent . " [I]3483-the old man 'm afraid [you]1145-i have n't been enjoying [yourself]1145-i , "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man said kindly . " Why not ? [I]3483-the old man thought it rather pleasant . "[3483-the old man] " Very pleasant ! "[1145-i] [she]1145-i assented wearily . " Only [[my]1145-i guardian]3542-my guardian has been telling [me]1145-i not to do things ; and [I]1145-i do n't know why , but [I]1145-i always want to do them at once -- don't [you]3483-the old man ? "[1145-i] [He]3483-the old man could not actually deny the fact . " Sometimes . [One]3501-one has to pretend-- "[1145-i] [She]1145-i raised [her]1145-i eyes to [his]3483-the old man blindingly ; [he]3483-the old man caught a glimpse in them of the lawless approval [Roshan Khân]89-roshan had seen , yet of something else -- a lawless disdain . " Why must one ? "[1145-i] [she]1145-i asked . " [I]1145-i never mean to , never ! If [I]1145-i want to do a thing [I]1145-i 'll do it . [I]1145-i do n't mean wicked things , of course-- "[1145-i] [she]1145-i returned here to demure , almost plaintive piety--"I do n't want to do them , and nothing can be wrong when it seems right to [you]4249-you , and it is real -- ever so real , and [you]4249-you give [yourself]4249-you to it , every bit of [you]4249-you , without thinking , and -- and -- ask nothing -- nothing at all-- "[1145-i] [Her]1145-i vehemence , [her]1145-i passionate assertion , roused a quick response in [him]3483-the old man . " Would [you]1145-i do that ? "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man asked , [his]3483-the old man voice vibrating . " Would [you]1145-i -- really ? "[3483-the old man] [She]1145-i smiled slowly . " Of course [I]1145-i do n't know , "[1145-i] [she]1145-i said , " [I]1145-i have n't tried yet ; but [I]1145-i never pretend . [I]1145-i do n't even pretend to like [my]1145-i dress for the ball . It is so stupid . "[1145-i] [He]3483-the old man felt annoyed at being led into a burst of emotion , and then baulked . " [You]1145-i will look charming , [I]3483-the old man 'm sure , "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man said in [his]3483-the old man worst manner . " [I]151-muriel feel as if [I]151-muriel had this moment arrived , "[151-muriel] said [Muriel Smith]151-muriel , as [she]151-muriel looked down into [the garden]433-the garden from a balcony which jutted out upon one side of the wide flight of marble steps that led upwards to [the loggia of [the palace]3477-the palace]1186-the loggia of the palace . " Yet [I]151-muriel know [I]151-muriel 've been [here]3395-here for hours . [I]151-muriel wonder when the sheer beauty will cease to -- to take [my]151-muriel breath away . [You]4275-you understand , do n't [you]4275-you ? "[151-muriel] " Yes ! "[71-vincent] assented [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , half grudgingly . [He]71-vincent would rather not have understood more than [others]569-others . But [he]71-vincent did ; that was the worst of it . [He]71-vincent was looking [his]71-vincent best in the old cavalry uniform of grey , and silver , and cherry colour , all laced , embroidered , and glittering with epaulettes , sabretasche , and high stock,--the uniform of a hundred years ago , when [adventurers]1189-adventurers ruled half [India]8-india , and [Englishmen]3816-englishmen were [demi - gods]1191-demi - gods . It seemed to have brought something of [their]1192-they pride and recklessness , something of the dreams [they]1192-they dreamt into [his]71-vincent whole bearing , as [he]71-vincent stood leaning over the balustrade gazing fixedly at the scene before [him]71-vincent . It was beautiful indeed ! Beautiful with that unearthly stillness which only comes to illuminations in a windless Indian night . The lines on lines , the curves on curves of tiny lights which outlined each pillar and arch , each buttress and recess of [the palace]3477-the palace , [the battlemented wall of [the garden]433-the garden]1194-the battlemented wall of the garden , and [the turreted town rising above [it]1197-it]1196-the turreted town rising above it , were steady as the stars . The fine fret of the acacia trees , showing white against the purple of the sky , was still as if carved in stone . There was no flicker in the soft radiance , which made the solid marble seem translucent , illumined mysteriously from within . The very shadows slept . Such scented shadows , clinging to the burnished orange trees , hidden in the wilderness of roses , dreaming on the perfumed cushions of the quaint balconies and cupolas which overhung [the river]333-the river . But it did not sleep . [It]1199-it moved , sliding on and on ceaselessly . So did the water which dimpled and tinkled -- after [Heaven]78-heaven only knew how many sad years of silence and decorum -- over the fretted marble water - slides . How it laughed and babbled to the cunning coloured lights placed behind it ! And the fountains below , rising out of the water - maze,--where there was but room for the flying feet of [a laughing girl]471-a laughing girl on the marble ledges between the lotus - leaves,--laughed and tinkled , also , as [they]1192-they sent showers of diamonds back on the pale blossoms . The " jewel in the lotus "[1192-they] indeed ! There was no colour to be seen anywhere . Only that soft , steady , white radiance , those soft , sleeping , black shadows . Except in [the drifting water - maze]1201-the drifting water - maze , and [the drifting men]1202-the drifting men and [women]479-women around [it]1201-the drifting water - maze . Restless , [both of [them]1192-they]1204-both of them ; going on and on . Whither , and wherefore ? It was an idle question , [Vincent]71-vincent told [himself]71-vincent , if the move brought , as it did here , fresh laughter , fresh colour . Almost-- [He]3483-the old man gave an exclamation , and rose to [his]3483-the old man feet . [She]481-the girl was coming , indeed , but not as [she]481-the girl had gone . There is no dress in [the world]404-the world which is at once so dainty and so sensuous , as the court dress of [a Mahomedan lady]1280-a mahomedan lady , and [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila was wearing one as [she]481-the girl came slowly down [the stairs]1281-the stairs towards [him]3483-the old man , a radiant white figure against the radiant white marble . The folds of [her]481-the girl long silver - gauze skirt -- so cunningly fashioned that it trailed in rolling shimmer - crested billows behind [her]481-the girl , yet left no beauty of [her]481-the girl round limbs hidden -- clipped [her]481-the girl about the waist like a serpent 's skin . So hiding , yet revealing , was the soft film of fine muslin over the scented , ivory - tinted corselet , which fitted close to the full curves of [her]481-the girl figure . So was it with the silver - streaked veil , through which the jewels in [her]481-the girl dusky hair , the bracelets on [her]481-the girl fair arms , shone undimmed . So was it even with the chiming fringes of [her]481-the girl silver anklets , as they slid merrily to cover and uncover the small feet , tucked so carelessly into the little silver - tipped slippers . To hide and to reveal , that was the note of all ! As [she]481-the girl came nearer , too , [he]3483-the old man saw that [her]481-the girl lips were reddened , [her]481-the girl dark eyes darkened artificially . And yet [her]481-the girl face did not correspond to all this . It was curiously grave , dignified , almost anxious . " Do [you]3483-the old man like it ? A dainty prisoning indeed ! The suggestion of it set [his]3483-the old man head whirling . Like it!--His very admiration kept [him]3483-the old man silent .
