"[89-roshan] But as [he]89-roshan walked on , [his]89-roshan hands clenched themselves to the tune of the words which sang in [his]89-roshan brain , " [God]96-god smite [his]96-god soul to hell ! [God]96-god smite [his]96-god soul to hell ! "[89-roshan] The two great stabilities , Love of [God]96-god and Love of [woman]534-woman , had joined hands , as they always do . A formidable combination . [Lance Carlyon]68-lance was not , as a rule , given either to loss of spirits or temper , yet both were at vanishing - point as [he]89-roshan flung off the garb of [[his]89-roshan namesake of [the lake]1300-the lake]1299-his namesake of the lake ; swearing as [he]89-roshan did so that [he]89-roshan would never wear the blessed thing again . It cramped [him]89-roshan all over ; body and soul . And then -- for [he]89-roshan knew [[his]89-roshan Tennyson]1301-his tennyson well , as one of [his]89-roshan name could hardly fail to do -- [his]89-roshan memory raced swiftly over [the love - loyal knight]1302-the love - loyal knight 's career ; until suddenly [he]89-roshan laughed at a phrase which had always tickled [him]89-roshan . " So groaned [Sir Lancelot]68-lance -- not knowing [he]89-roshan should die [a holy man]4381-a holy man . "[89-roshan] If [he]89-roshan had?--what would have been the result ? Would [he]89-roshan simply have refrained from remorseful pain , or from the honour rooted in dishonour which caused it ? With a mighty stretch of [his]89-roshan sound young muscles at the relief , [Lance]68-lance caught up [his]89-roshan Indian clubs , and went elaborately , conscientiously , through [his]89-roshan daily series of exercises before putting on [his]89-roshan dust - coloured shooting - suit , and swathing [himself]89-roshan with the necessary plentitude of belts , cartridge - boxes , and gaiters . The latter -- being , after Indian fashion , simply a couple of bandages neatly twined -- were , as a matter of fact , much tighter than [his]89-roshan discarded greaves ; but the clip of them about [his]89-roshan calves was familiarly reminiscent of many a day spent out in [the jungle]1303-the jungle alone , or at most with [some companion of Am - ma]1304-some companion of am - ma 's type . [A man whose only claim to be called one in these later days]1305-a man whose only claim to be called one in these later days was [his]1305-a man whose only claim to be called one in these later days undoubted dominion over the birds of the air , the fish of [the sea]1306-the sea , the beasts of [the field]1307-the field . How jolly it had been ! And how [the deuce]1308-the deuce could [a fellow like [Vincent Dering-- Lance]211-lance]1309-a fellow like vincent dering-- lance , sorting cartridges systematically with an eye to a possible snipe , whistled a tune which [Vincent]211-lance was always asked to sing at [the Smiths]85-the smiths ' , " Sweet is true love -- and sweet is Death . "[211-lance] Well , [he]68-lance preferred the Death . So , catching up [his]89-roshan gun , [he]89-roshan made [his]89-roshan way to the crypt - like flight of steps which , half way down the straight river - edged wall of the Fort -- between [its]1310-its northern bastion where [the stream turned hillwards at a sharp angle]1311-the stream turned hillwards at a sharp angle , and the southern one beside [the bathing - steps]1312-the bathing - steps -- led to [a tiny landing - stage]1313-a tiny landing - stage . Here [the canoe]937-the canoe , which [he]89-roshan had hired for such excursions from [[Ramanund]140-ramanund ( whose last experience of boating had rather sickened [him]89-roshan of its pleasures]1315-ramanund ( whose last experience of boating had rather sickened him of its pleasures ) , lay moored . Keeping the paddle ready for steering , [he]89-roshan let [the stream]831-the stream , which here clung swift and smooth to the wall , take [him]89-roshan with it ; partly because [he]89-roshan had no wish to be seen by [any revellers in [the palace]3477-the palace]1317-any revellers in the palace . But the sight of the latter made [him]89-roshan slip the paddle - blade into the sliding water , and send [the canoe]937-the canoe swerving out for a better view . [It]1320-it was wondrously beautiful , seen from [the river]333-the river , with every line and curve of light reflected almost as clear as the reality . The sight held [his]89-roshan attention , so that [he]89-roshan was abreast of the bathing - steps ere [he]89-roshan remembered [his]89-roshan desire for secrecy , and , in [his]89-roshan haste , [the canoe]937-the canoe -- answering to [his]89-roshan swift stroke -- almost spun round , bringing [him]89-roshan , in an instant , within an ace of collision with the hard brick . As it was , [he]89-roshan heard a faint grating sound . " By Jove ! that was a near shave , "[89-roshan] [he]89-roshan muttered to [himself]89-roshan . Out of the darkness of [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , for the unilluminated block of [the palace]3477-the palace rose between [it]386-the courtyard and the white radiance , came a voice:-- " Is't [thou]1326-they ? Hast brought the tool -- [we]1326-they must get the job done ere dawn and-- "[1326-they] The rest was inaudible as [the river]333-the river slid [him]89-roshan on . What were [they]1326-they up to ? [he]89-roshan wondered idly ; taking advantage , doubtless , of the absolute desertion of [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , the entry to which had been blocked for the night , the main entrance to [the palace]3477-the palace having been prepared for the reception of [the guests]1329-the guests . Were [they]1326-they meddling with the padlock [Dering]71-vincent had put on the tampion which stopped the muzzle of the old gun ? Time to see to that in the morning . [He]89-roshan was now steering [his]89-roshan way just on the edge of the shadow cast by the wall on [the water]945-the water , and in front of [him]89-roshan jutted out [a balcony]1331-a balcony smaller than the rest , and nearer [the river]333-the river . [Those upper ones]1333-those upper ones , [he]89-roshan knew , were part of [the chapel]1291-the chapel ; but this-- [He]89-roshan looked at [it]1331-a balcony narrowly , wondering if [he]89-roshan had ever noticed it before , then let the paddle sink idly across [the boat]643-the boat , and sat staring at what [he]89-roshan saw . [Dering]71-vincent , of course ! But [the woman]1071-the woman ! Who on earth was [she]1071-the woman ? [A native]4214-a native ? Hardly ; and yet [he]89-roshan did not remember seeing [anyone at the ball whose dress was in the least like this]1338-anyone at the ball whose dress was in the least like this ; even in the dark it glittered . " Do [you]89-roshan call that love ? "[1071-the woman] came a voice echoing softly over [the water]945-the water . " [I]1071-the woman do n't . When [I]1071-the woman love , [I]1071-the woman mean to give , not to take ; and the more [I]1071-the woman give , the more [I]1071-the woman 'll have to give ; because , [you]89-roshan see , love will come back -- it must . "[1071-the woman] By all that was incomprehensible , [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila ! And , if there was any certainty in these shadows , [Dering]71-vincent 's arm-- Phew ! [Lance]211-lance knew [his]211-lance Shakespeare also ; had , in fact , a curiously ingenuous and human acquaintance with even the exact words of [the great master]1340-the great master . So as [he]211-lance drifted on , leaving [those two]1341-those two in [the balcony]644-the balcony , a line drifted with him:-- [He]211-lance felt a righteous relief at the idea , for [he]211-lance was eminently virtuous . [Poor old Vincent]71-vincent ! This was better than the other -- [he]211-lance paused doubtfully -- Well ! [different people]1343-different people had different tastes . [He]211-lance , for instance , had never admired [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith . And then [Dering]71-vincent , good chap as [he]71-vincent was , had , [everybody]939-everybody knew , a touch of the tar - brush [himself]71-vincent . Only a touch , still it made a difference ; for [one]3501-one had to consider [the children]1346-the children . For instance , when [he]211-lance married -- Why a vision of [a child]3605-a child 's head [he]211-lance had once seen , far away in [the north]1348-the north , covered with soft , waving curls of sun - bright red - gold hair , chestnut -- yes , chestnut hair , the very colour of that beast of a pony who boshed [him]211-lance at polo -- should have come to [him]211-lance at that moment [he]211-lance did not know ; but [he]211-lance fled from it , bashful as [any girl]1349-any girl over [her]1349-any girl first fancy , and , bending forward , sent [the canoe]937-the canoe racing the foam - bubbles on the swifter current with all the strength of [his]211-lance young arms . That was [the mission house]3764-the mission house , ending [the long curve of [the city]3556-the city]1352-the long curve of the city . [The mission house]3764-the mission house , where [she]1349-any girl slept -- [the boat]643-the boat raced harder here -- where [she]1349-any girl lived in the thick of it -- [God]96-god bless [her]1349-any girl ! Here [the boat]643-the boat slackened , partly because [the spit]614-the spit was reached , and in the darkness , made visible by that soft white radiance behind [him]211-lance , [he]211-lance must not miss [[Am - ma]131-am - ma 's hut]1358-am - ma 's hut . [Am]131-am - ma - ma , who had dominion over wild duck , among other things in that munificent gift of [the Creator]1359-the creator to [His]1359-the creator own image . Am - ma , who must come out and show those who had fallen from [[their]1360-their high estate]1361-their high estate through civilization how to lure the birds to [their]1360-their death . The refrain came back in this connection , and [Lance]211-lance 's voice , as [he]211-lance sang it , if not musical , held a hint of something beyond the mere maudlin expression - stop of the ordinary song - singer . [He]211-lance need not , [he]211-lance told [himself]211-lance , have feared to overlook [[Am - ma]131-am - ma 's wigwam]1362-am - ma 's wigwam ; for there , not far from the point of [the spit]614-the spit [it]1362-am - ma 's wigwam stood , all lit up ; circled round closely with a row of little lights like those at [the palace]3477-the palace . Were [the primitive folk down here]1365-the primitive folk down here aping [[their]1365-the primitive folk down here masters]1366-their masters and having a ball of [their]1365-the primitive folk down here own ? Smiling at the thought , [he]211-lance ran [the canoe]937-the canoe on [shore]3744-shore and walked up to [the reed hut]1369-the reed hut . Then [he]211-lance saw that the circle of lights was broken by a dark patch . It was [Am - ma]131-am - ma [himself]131-am - ma , squatting on [his]131-am - ma heels . To one side of [him]131-am - ma , firmly fixed in the sand , was a freshly - killed crocodile 's head , its jaws ingeniously distended by a thin cane to which a string was attached . By pulling this the dead mouth seemed to open and shut , as [the pliant rattan]212-the pliant rattan bent under the strain and sprang back again . In [his]211-lance other hand [he]211-lance held a bloody spear . Despite these fearful preparations , however , the first glimpse of [an approaching figure]1370-an approaching figure set [him]211-lance visibly trembling with fright ; until , on its coming nearer the lights , [he]211-lance sprang to [his]211-lance feet with a sudden blubbering shout of relief . " [I]211-lance thought -- [this fool , this atom of dust]4382-this fool , this atom of dust , thought -- [the Huzoor]90-huzoor was the devil ! "[211-lance] [he]211-lance explained , capering and chuckling to make much of the joke , now that the fear of its being a reality was over . " The devil ! "[211-lance] echoed [Lance]211-lance . " What the dickens should [the devil]4118-the devil come here for ? "[211-lance] Am - ma looked half - grave , half - important . Did not [the Huzoor]90-huzoor know , [he]211-lance explained , that when life was coming into [the world]404-the world , [all the demons in [it]404-the world]1372-all the demons in it wanted to get hold of [the new - born thing]1373-the new - born thing ? Hence the lights , hence the crocodile 's head and the spear ; also [his]131-am - ma own valiance . Hence , also , the impossibility of [his]131-am - ma accompanying the Presence after duck . If [he]131-am - ma , [the father of the thing to be born]1374-the father of the thing to be born , was not there to fight the demons , what hope could there be for the son?--and here this quaint , broad , ugly face grew wistful -- for it must be [a son]1375-a son , surely , this time . No ! [he]131-am - ma had [no children]1376-no children ; the demons had taken [them]1376-no children all , every one ; though [he]131-am - ma had left nothing undone , though [he]131-am - ma had sought out [one medicine - man]1377-one medicine - man after another . What did it matter ? [he]131-am - ma asked pathetically , if the charm were of one faith or another , if it brought [a child]3605-a child . [He]131-am - ma had tried all . [His]131-am - ma own and [everybody else]3548-everybody else 's . But [they]1376-no children all died , [the children]1346-the children , [girls]4271-girls and [boys]1382-boys ; died when [they]1376-no children were born . [The demon]1383-the demon somehow slipped through the lights ; the charm was not strong enough ; that was all . So this time , when [he]131-am - ma had seen that [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors had the Dee - puk - râg , the sign of [kings]1384-kings , that [they]118-the huzoors were , indeed , [light - bringers]1385-light - bringers , as [[his]131-am - ma people]1386-his people had been of old , [he]131-am - ma had sent for [the Miss - sahiba]1387-the miss - sahiba , and [she]1387-the miss - sahiba had come . [She]1387-the miss - sahiba was there in [the hut]1388-the hut , even now , fighting the demons . [Lance]211-lance gave a quick catch of [his]211-lance breath , and stood silent . Right over [the miserable reed hut]1389-the miserable reed hut , clear against the violet of the moonless sky , rose those palaces of stars lit up for pleasure . It almost seemed to [him]131-am - ma that the slight breeze , which was beginning to whisper of the dawn , held in it the faint rhythm of a distant waltz . And here , at [his]131-am - ma feet , was [this hut , lit up for pain]1390-this hut , lit up for pain . [He]131-am - ma heard that also , in a faint moan , which sent a shiver through [him]131-am - ma ; the shiver of one who finds [himself]131-am - ma bare of accustomed covering , out in the open , far from any shelter from the cold sky . " Of course [you]3733-am - ma ca n't come , [Am - ma]3733-am - ma , "[131-am - ma] [he]131-am - ma said , moving off . " Well ! [I]131-am - ma hope [the Miss - sahiba]4385-the miss - sahiba will -- will keep [the devil]4118-the devil away . [I]131-am - ma -- [I]131-am - ma -- expect [she]4385-the miss - sahiba will ! "[131-am - ma] As [he]131-am - ma floated a little further down stream , vaguely obeying the instructions which [Am - ma]3733-am - ma , regretful for all [his]131-am - ma anxiety , had shouted after [him]131-am - ma , [he]131-am - ma told [himself]131-am - ma that if [anybody]1392-anybody could , [she]3733-am - ma would . If [a fellow]1393-a fellow married [her]3733-am - ma , for instance-- [He]131-am - ma drew [the canoe]937-the canoe on to [the sand - bank]1395-the sand - bank , [Am - ma]131-am - ma had spoken of , somewhat sooner than [his]131-am - ma directions warranted , in order to stifle thought by action . And it needed every sense on the alert to tell in the darkness if one was keeping a fairly straight path . That scarcely audible " lip , lip "[131-am - ma] on the right meant that the water was close by , running an inch or two below a sheer yet crumbling edge of earth . That yielding softness on the left meant [the ridge of dry sand]1396-the ridge of dry sand . [His]131-am - ma way was between the two . Every now and again a watchful quack , a distant flutter , told [him]131-am - ma that the ducks were not far off . And in the east the faintest lightening of the purple warned [him]131-am - ma [he]131-am - ma was none too soon , since the dawn in [India]8-india comes quickly . But this must be [the place]3423-the place ; [a sort of bunker right at the end of [the bank]914-the bank]1398-a sort of bunker right at the end of the bank . Here , cuddling down almost luxuriously into loose dry sand , still warm from yesterday 's sun , [he]131-am - ma waited for that hint of light in [the far east]1400-the far east to grow strong enough for [him]131-am - ma to see . It is always an experience to sit and wait for daylight , ignorant , helpless till it comes , of what lies close at hand . [Lance Carlyon]68-lance , crouching in [that still warm sand]1401-that still warm sand , felt a sudden forlornness , a sense of having parted with something . But , almost on the heels of this , came a sense of having found something ; of strange , quick , new , yet familiar companionship . It seemed to [him]131-am - ma as [he]131-am - ma watched that faint grey lightening in [the far east]1400-the far east , that [he]131-am - ma did so , not as [Lance Carlyon]68-lance , but as an atom in [the great , round , spinning world]1403-the great , round , spinning world [whose curved edge grew darker against the coming light]1404-whose curved edge grew darker against the coming light . [He]131-am - ma laid [his]131-am - ma gun beside [him]131-am - ma , and , kneeling in the soft , still warm sand , rested [his]131-am - ma arms on the edge of the bunker , ears and eyes alert as [any wild creature]1405-any wild creature 's . [He]131-am - ma could hear the soft rustle of feathers in the dark , the soft swish of the water as something stirred in it , the soft sob with which an inch or two of [that tiny , unseen sand - cliff]1406-that tiny , unseen sand - cliff gave way to [the stream]831-the stream , the softer gurgle , as of laughter , with which the water took its toll of earth . So , thinking not at all , simply as a sand grain in the sand around [him]131-am - ma , the mystery , the certainty of dawn held [him]131-am - ma , as it held all things . The curved line of [the world]404-the world darkened , the shadow of it deepened , as the grey of the sky grew tender as the eye of [a mother]1409-a mother watching [[her]1409-a mother child]677-her child asleep . But only for a space . Then the grey hardened , and a trumpet call from a whistling teal told that the great fight of dawn had come . So , for another space , the Dark and the Light faced each other , waiting for that second trumpet call . It came , borne on a faint rustle of wind which crept over the edge of [the world]404-the world from the footsteps of the coming day . The shiver of it swept through the shadows ; [they]1412-they broke into battalions to face [the foe]1413-the foe . So into companies , till , as the red spear - points of the sun showed over the horizon , [they]1412-they rallied darkly , desperately , behind each hint of rising ground , in each hint of sheltering hollow . Rallied in vain , for below the spear - points a glittering curve , as of a golden helmet , came resistless . Then [Lance Carlyon]68-lance stood up , hastily , gun in hand . But [he]131-am - ma was too late . The mystery of Dawn had held [him]131-am - ma helpless , as it had held the birds ; and now [they]1412-they , too , were [freemen of the conquering day]1414-freemen of the conquering day . [He]131-am - ma fired a couple of shots after [them]1412-they , more as a salute to [the victor]1415-the victor than in any hope of slaughter ; so , with a laugh , turned homeward . [The canoe]937-the canoe shot against [the stream]831-the stream gaily , but , as [he]131-am - ma neared [the spit]614-the spit , a sudden desire to go [home]3521-home by [land]664-land assailed [him]131-am - ma . [Am - ma]131-am - ma could take [the boat]643-the boat back ; there might be a chance of a snipe , in [that low - lying bit below [the mission house]3764-the mission house]1422-that low - lying bit below the mission house , and-- [He]131-am - ma blushed , even in solitude , at [his]131-am - ma own moral turpitude . Why not tell the truth ; to [himself]131-am - ma , at least ? [He]131-am - ma found [Am - ma]131-am - ma , worn out by [his]131-am - ma night 's anxiety , with [his]131-am - ma head between [his]131-am - ma knees , fast asleep ; leaving the crocodile , at the agony point of an unending yawn , in sole charge of the little circle of flickering lights . Some of [them]1424-them had gone out , the rest looked trumpery in the growing blaze of day . But what matter ? Since , half an hour before , [Erda Shepherd]105-erda had come out of [the wigwam]1425-the wigwam with [a living child]1426-a living child , wrapped quite daintily in an orthodox square of new flannel . " It is [a son]1375-a son , [Am - ma]3733-am - ma , and [I]105-erda think it is very like [you]3733-am - ma , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda had said , with a laugh at the wrinkled , wizened old face peering out at its new world . But [Am - ma]131-am - ma had grovelled on the ground with tears and cries of blubbering joy . [He]131-am - ma had been right . [The Huzoors]118-the huzoors were [kings]1384-kings . [They]118-the huzoors knew [the Dee - puk - râg]161-the dee - puk - râg . [They]118-the huzoors were [the light - bringers]1428-the light - bringers , [the life - bringers]1429-the life - bringers . [He]131-am - ma had never asked after [[his]131-am - ma wife]3429-his wife , but when [Erda]105-erda had gone inside again , [he]131-am - ma sat , and in [his]131-am - ma anxiety to keep [the devil]4118-the devil from [those inside]1432-those inside , had twitched away at [his]131-am - ma string so fiercely that the crocodile 's head lost its ferocity in what appeared to be a fit of laughter , until sleep , from sheer relief , overtaking the puller , the laugh had ended in that steady yawn . [Am - ma]131-am - ma was on [his]131-am - ma feet , alert in a second , however , at [Lance]68-lance 's touch , like a wild beast . " ' Tis all right , [Huzoor]90-huzoor "[131-am - ma] [he]131-am - ma grinned broadly . " ' Tis [a son]1375-a son . "[131-am - ma] Then once again the exuberance of [his]131-am - ma delight made [him]131-am - ma grovel in the sand at the feet of [the Master]451-the master . " And [the Miss - sahiba]4390-the miss - sahiba ? Hath [she]1435-she gone ? "[68-lance] asked [Lance]68-lance , blushing once more , now that [his]68-lance own self - deception became impossible . " Nay , [she]1435-she remains inside , "[131-am - ma] asserted [Am - ma]131-am - ma . But a look which [he]131-am - ma gave in [the hut]1388-the hut proved [him]131-am - ma wrong . [She]1435-she must have gone out the other way while [he]131-am - ma slept , [he]131-am - ma confessed , sheepishly ; but there was nothing wrong . [The devil]4118-the devil had not won a way in ; both [mother]1437-mother and [son]715-son were dozing peacefully . [Lance]68-lance , [his]68-lance hope of walking back with [Erda]105-erda gone , felt inclined to take to [the canoe]937-the canoe again . Then a savage desire to kill something , at least , suggested the possibility of a snipe in [the little swampy bit below the city wall , not far from [the mission house]3764-the mission house]1440-the little swampy bit below the city wall , not far from the mission house ; so bidding [Am - ma]131-am - ma take [the canoe]937-the canoe up at [his]68-lance leisure , [he]68-lance walked off , feeling , for [him]131-am - ma , in a very bad temper . [He]68-lance forgot [his]68-lance quarrel with fate , however , in a second , when , [the bit of swamp]1443-the bit of swamp reached , something buzzed up to fall slantwise like a stone ; something which , on picking it up , [he]68-lance found to be the rare Sabine snipe , painted , absolutely beautiful , in its delicate harmony of colour . And the luck did not come singly , for from behind a clump of tiger - grass came [Erda Shepherd]105-erda , a trifle alarmed at the possibility of being shot if [she]105-erda did not show [herself]105-erda . [Lance]68-lance walked up to [her]105-erda , swiftly , the dead bird in [his]68-lance hand . " [You]105-erda must be awfully tired , being up all night , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance began-- [He]68-lance had a way of rushing things , [Erda]105-erda thought , which was disconcerting when [one]3501-one was anxious to keep on the surface . " And [you]68-lance too , [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda interrupted ; " did [you]68-lance enjoy the ball ? "[105-erda] [She]105-erda felt pleased at this able evasion . " Who -- [I]68-lance -- Oh ! dear [me]68-lance , no , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance replied , absently ; then [he]68-lance smiled . " [I]68-lance say , was n't [Am]68-lance - [ma]68-lance pleased . [He]68-lance slobbered and blubbered with joy all over [my]68-lance boots , and yet-- "[68-lance] [he]68-lance paused reflectively , " [I]68-lance do n't think [a little Am - ma]4391-a little am - ma could be a very pleasing object . "[68-lance] For the life of [her]105-erda [she]105-erda could not help a smile . " It was not , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda confessed frankly ; " in fact [I]105-erda think it was the ugliest baby [I]105-erda ever saw . "[105-erda] [She]105-erda pulled up short , wondering what possessed [her]105-erda to be so confidential with [this strange young man]1445-this strange young man . " So [Am - ma]131-am - ma told [me]68-lance , "[68-lance] said [Lance]68-lance . " [He]131-am - ma called [you]105-erda [the Life - bringer]4394-the life - bringer . It is a nice name . " And [you]68-lance are [the Death - bringer]4395-the death - bringer , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda retorted lightly , pointing to the painted beauty in [his]68-lance hand . " So [you]68-lance and [I]105-erda are at opposite poles , [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon . "[105-erda] [He]68-lance stood looking at [her]105-erda for a moment with a smile . " [I]68-lance do n't know , [Miss Shepherd]105-erda . ' Death and Birth are the pivots of the Wheel of Life . ' [I]68-lance remember reading that , in [Sanskrit]38-sanskrit , when [I]68-lance went up for [my]68-lance higher ; for [I]68-lance 've passed it , [you]68-lance know . [I]68-lance 'm really not bad at languages when [I]68-lance try . "[68-lance] It was the first time [she]105-erda had ever heard [him]68-lance claim credit for anything , and the fact touched [her]105-erda more than [she]105-erda cared to own . "[334-the doctor] " That 's quick , is n't it ? "[476-his companion] asked [[his]69-dr. dillon companion]476-his companion , calmly . " Rather . [I]334-the doctor 've seen [a man]533-a man go out in ten minutes , though . The worst of it is , "[334-the doctor] [he]334-the doctor added , with a frown , " if there really is some conspiracy at the bottom of the discontent , it is as likely as not [the devils who are working it]4481-the devils who are working it , may take advantage of this -- [I]334-the doctor do n't mean of this death -- that goes without saying . But when cholera is about , poison is hard to detect , and even if [I]334-the doctor stamp out the disease , which [I]334-the doctor mean to do , [they]4478-they may simulate it .
