"[69-dr. dillon] When [Roshan Khân]89-roshan had joined those two great stabilities , Faith and Love , into one passionate desire for [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's damnation , [he]89-roshan had meant to follow the English etiquette on such occasions , and keep [his]89-roshan aspiration to [himself]89-roshan . But it had been impossible for [him]89-roshan instantly to rejoin [the society in which [he]89-roshan found [himself]89-roshan]1573-the society in which he found himself ; that is , [a society which shared that fundamental crime -- which more even than any definite jealousy had roused [his]89-roshan anger against [Captain Dering]71-vincent]1574-a society which shared that fundamental crime -- which more even than any definite jealousy had roused his anger against captain dering -- of being alien to [his]89-roshan creed , [his]89-roshan customs , [his]89-roshan code of conduct towards [women]479-women . So [he]89-roshan had wandered off into [the garden]433-the garden again , shadowed by old [Akbar]110-akbar 's incredulity , curiosity , and sympathy ; until , partly from sheer impatience , but mostly from sheer inherited habit of employing such as [Akbar Khân]110-akbar in anything approaching an intrigue , [he]89-roshan had made a clean breast of the situation . Even the latter , however , had , as it were , shied at the extreme novelty of the idea when it was first mooted ; but , by degrees , its vast possibilities of advantage to [faithful old retainers]1577-faithful old retainers overpowered [his]89-roshan abject terror at the bare idea of [Father Narâyan]80-father narâyan suspecting such a thing . [The old master]1578-the old master , [he]89-roshan told [himself]89-roshan , was old , indeed ! [God]96-god only knew if [he]1578-the old master would last a year or a day ; therefore it would be well to ensure the favour of [the new mistress]1579-the new mistress . And there could be no harm in sounding [her]1579-the new mistress as to what course that favour would follow . [One]3501-one could never tell with [a woman]3949-a woman ; and [his]89-roshan wicked , experienced old eyes had caught many a hint of [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum in [Laila]86-laila 's childhood . Perhaps [she]125-anâri begum had changed since [she]125-anâri begum went to [Calcutta]12-calcutta . [He]89-roshan could but try . So when , on the morning after the ball , [Laila]86-laila , in obedience to [her]86-laila pious resolve to do nothing really wrong , had bidden [him]89-roshan -- with threats of vengeance if [he]89-roshan betrayed the fact of [their]1582-their having come at all -- remove and return certain trays of clothes and jewels which had been smuggled by [someone]498-someone into [[her]86-laila room]1584-her room , [he]89-roshan had fallen at [her]86-laila feet , confessed falsely that [he]89-roshan was [the offender]1543-the offender , and besought [her]86-laila not to impose so unmerited a disgrace on [[his]89-roshan employer]1586-his employer , who had been actuated by the ordinary rules of native etiquette which prescribed some recognition of [[his]89-roshan cousin]3859-his cousin , [the head of [[his]89-roshan family]1589-his family]1588-the head of his family . Naturally enough , this brought [the girl]481-the girl 's curiosity , long restless , to [his]89-roshan aid ; and [she]481-the girl sat listening to the many things [he]89-roshan had to tell [her]481-the girl , with that faintly mysterious smile of [hers]481-the girl . And as [she]481-the girl listened , [she]481-the girl watched a pigeon , all jewelled about its bosom in rainbow hues , and with a dainty little pair of silver jingles about its jasper feet , which was coquetting and pirouetting to attract the attention of [its neighbours]1591-its neighbours on the wide marble sill of [her]86-laila latticed window . For [Laila]86-laila had [a room in [the upper storey]1237-the upper storey all painted , carved , and set with little balconies , which was worthy of [any king]1594-any king 's favourite]1592-a room in the upper storey all painted , carved , and set with little balconies , which was worthy of any king 's favourite . And [Father Ninian]81-father ninian , mindful lingeringly of [the fine ladies ' boudoirs of [his]81-father ninian youth in [Rome]4-rome]1595-the fine ladies ' boudoirs of his youth in rome , had filled [it]1592-a room in the upper storey all painted , carved , and set with little balconies , which was worthy of any king 's favourite , against [her]86-laila return from [school]1596-school , with all the prettiest spoils of [the palace]3477-the palace . Sèvres vases , rare old cabinets , quaint carved tables which had been brought thither for [the dead Nawabs]1598-the dead nawabs ; treasures that were also , inevitably , of [the king's]1599-the king's - favourite type,--therefore unlike [the owner of [the room]3952-the room]1600-the owner of the room , as [she]86-laila sat in [her]86-laila white muslin frock , heavy - eyed , almost sallow , from the last night 's dissipation . " So [she]86-laila -- [[my]86-laila grandmother]3455-my grandmother , [you]86-laila say -- was [a dancing - girl]4519-a dancing - girl -- [a real dancing - girl]4520-a real dancing - girl ? "[86-laila] Even [her]86-laila surprise and curiosity were listless . Yet the next moment , while [Akbar]110-akbar was protesting the superiority of [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum over [all the dancing - girls of [his]110-akbar vast experience]1602-all the dancing - girls of his vast experience , [she]86-laila had burst into a sudden laugh , uncovered one of the trays with kicks which sent first one , then the other of [her]86-laila bronze slippers flying , seized on a pair of silver anklets , and there [she]86-laila was centring a Persian rug spread on the marble floor as if [she]86-laila had been born to it . Coquetting , pirouetting , with a challenging clash , a half - impudent jerk of the jingles , for all [the world]404-the world like the pigeon on the window - sill . Like something else also ; so that [old Akbar]110-akbar felt a shiver run through [him]110-akbar , lest , after all , [his]110-akbar first impression should prove right , and this be no more than a simulacrum,--a ghost , a changeling , come to possess [the usually indifferent lazy Miss - baba]1604-the usually indifferent lazy miss - baba . Yet when , all of a sudden , [she]86-laila raised [her]86-laila white muslin skirt high in both hands and began to sing , at the top of [her]86-laila voice , the wicked little love song which [Vincent Dering]71-vincent had sung the first day [she]86-laila met [him]110-akbar , [old Akbar]110-akbar 's dread turned to sheer wonder . This was not a ghost , but [a devil]1605-a devil ; reckless , unrestrained , with a fling of white arms , a kick of white feet , all held to rhythm by the outrageous frivolity of the song , until , with that last staccato note , [she]86-laila threw [herself]86-laila in a chair , breathless , gurgling with laughter and sheer mischief . " Lo ! [Akbar]110-akbar , "[86-laila] [she]86-laila gasped , " [[my]86-laila grandmother]3455-my grandmother never danced like that , did [she]3455-my grandmother ? [I]86-laila do n't believe [she]3455-my grandmother was [[my]86-laila grandmother]3455-my grandmother ! [I]86-laila believe [you]110-akbar are telling stories ! "[86-laila] [Akbar]110-akbar looked wise , and thrust out [his]110-akbar folded hands in cringing protest . " [The most noble]4523-the most noble says true , [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum never danced thus . But there is [the grandfather]4524-the grandfather , [Bun - avâtar - sahib bahadur]121-bun - avatâr - sahib , to be accounted for also . "[110-akbar] [Laila]86-laila frowned . The reminder brought back the other side of the story , to which [she]86-laila had listened so often from [[her]86-laila guardian]1606-her guardian 's lips , while [her]86-laila pretended indifference masked a real pride . Of [[her]86-laila grandfather]1607-her grandfather 's gallantry , [his]1607-her grandfather good looks , [his]1607-her grandfather love of adventure . And of [someone else]3538-someone else , also , who had always had a secret attraction for [the girl]481-the girl . [That most beautiful woman in [Rome]4-rome]1610-that most beautiful woman in rome , [the companion of princes]1611-the companion of princes , [the divine singer]1612-the divine singer , [the best]1613-the best , [the dearest--]1614-the dearest-- [Laila]86-laila 's laughter failed [her]86-laila ; [she]86-laila rose , and going over to the window looked out absently , startling the pigeon into flight . The sun turned its breast purple , and green , and gold , as it fluttered down to renew its pirouetting on a cupola below , just above [the river]333-the river . And below that again was the roof of the balcony where [she]86-laila had sat with [Vincent]71-vincent . [The girl]481-the girl 's eyes grew soft . [She]481-the girl understood now . [That best]1617-that best , [that dearest , that most beautiful]1618-that dearest , that most beautiful , must have loved [[her]481-the girl guardian]1606-her guardian . That was the secret of [his]1606-her guardian remembrance . How could [one]3501-one ever forget that one had sat in [a balcony]1331-a balcony hand in hand ? So content , yet saying so little -- only feeling . But [he]1606-her guardian had said some things . [He]1606-her guardian had said [she]481-the girl was beautiful , that [she]481-the girl ought always to wear that dress , and [she]481-the girl had told [him]1606-her guardian [she]481-the girl could not,--that [she]481-the girl must send it back -- that [he]1606-her guardian must learn to like [her]481-the girl as much in [her]481-the girl ordinary clothes -- that [he]1606-her guardian would never see [her]481-the girl in that dress again . But , after all , why not -- if-- ? [She]481-the girl turned suddenly to the go - between . " There is no need to take them back to - day , "[481-the girl] [she]481-the girl said , sharply ; " but [thou]4525-thou canst tell [the person who sent [them]4527-them]4526-the person who sent them -- [he]4526-the person who sent them who claims [cousinship]4528-cousinship -- that [I]481-the girl will not keep [them]4527-them , that [I]481-the girl know nothing of [them]4527-them ; that [he]4526-the person who sent them must send and take [them]4527-them away . "[481-the girl] [Akbar]110-akbar , with an inward determination to do nothing so palpably foolish , salaamed down to [the ground]1622-the ground . [The Presence]220-the presence , [he]110-akbar said , in doing this showed [her]481-the girl dignity ; it was undoubtedly the right course to pursue . But , in the mean time , would [the Begum - sahiba]1623-the begum - sahiba -- [she]1623-the begum - sahiba must excuse a tongue which could not always bear with the paltry present , which remembered the facts of the past , the possibilities of the future -- not temper [her]481-the girl noble severity with the usual courtly favour ? [[Her]481-the girl cousin 's grandmother]1624-her cousin 's grandmother , [a most virtuous princess , sister to [the late Nawab]3721-the late nawab]1625-a most virtuous princess , sister to the late nawab , was still alive . [Her]481-the girl memory of [Bun - avatâr - sahib]121-bun - avatâr - sahib was still so green that doubtless [she]481-the girl would be able to tell [the Begum - sahiba]1623-the begum - sahiba many things of which [a mere mean slave]1628-a mere mean slave could not be cognizant . And [this most virtuous , most interesting one]1629-this most virtuous , most interesting one , had long been anxious to return a visit which [the Begum - sahiba]125-anâri begum had graciously paid [her]481-the girl , in company with [a missen - miss--]1630-a missen - miss-- " What ! [That funny old fat woman]4529-that funny old fat woman ! "[86-laila] interrupted [Laila]86-laila , with a laugh . " That dirty old thing ? [I]86-laila remember , [she]4529-that funny old fat woman did claim to be [a relation of [the Nawab]3674-the nawab 's]4530-a relation of the nawab 's . And when [I]86-laila asked [her]4529-that funny old fat woman why [she]4529-that funny old fat woman wore such dirty clothes [she]4529-that funny old fat woman was angry , and said [she]4529-that funny old fat woman had beautiful ones all tied up in bundles ! [I]86-laila do n't believe [she]4529-that funny old fat woman had , though-- "[86-laila] " The dress [the Begum - sahiba]1623-the begum - sahiba wore last night is one of them , "[110-akbar] interrupted [Akbar]110-akbar , quietly ; " it belonged to [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum , [Huzoor]90-huzoor , and there are plenty more like it . And all are really [the Huzoor]4533-the huzoor 's ; [no one else]4534-no one else 's . "[110-akbar] [Laila]86-laila looked down on the trays with a new interest . " Did it really belong to -- to [her]4529-that funny old fat woman ? "[86-laila] [she]86-laila asked ; " and the jewels also ? "[86-laila] " The jewels also . There are plenty of them . And if [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum was really [[the Begum - sahiba]125-anâri begum 's grandmother]4535-the begum - sahiba 's grandmother , then the jewels are [hers]4529-that funny old fat woman by right . "[86-laila] " [She]4529-that funny old fat woman can come if [she]4529-that funny old fat woman wishes , "[86-laila] interrupted [Laila]86-laila , impatiently . " [I]1631-i see [thy]4529-that funny old fat woman craft , [Akbar]110-akbar , but [I]1631-i care not for that . Yet it will be fun to receive [her]4529-that funny old fat woman as -- as [a Begum]4259-a begum . And no harm either , since [the missen ladies]4537-the missen ladies receive [her]4529-that funny old fat woman , [I]1631-i know , and [her]4529-that funny old fat woman like -- when [they]4537-the missen ladies will come ! It will be at night , of course , to ensure [her]4529-that funny old fat woman privacy , so [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan need know nothing . [Only"--she]221-only"--she[1631-i] paused , a change swept over [her]1631-i face , leaving it dimpled , cunning , full of mischief and cajolery . " [I]110-akbar do naught for naught ! If [I]110-akbar please [thee]4529-that funny old fat woman , [thou]4529-that funny old fat woman must please [me]110-akbar ! If [thou]4529-that funny old fat woman art [[their]4537-the missen ladies messenger]4538-their messenger , [thou]4529-that funny old fat woman must be [mine]110-akbar also ; or [I]110-akbar tell [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan ! "[110-akbar] [Akbar - khân]110-akbar 's wicked old eyes positively leered approval ; [he]110-akbar waggled [his]110-akbar head and chuckled . Wherefore not ? Was there [a better , more careful messenger]1632-a better , more careful messenger in [the world]404-the world than [he]110-akbar , or one more capable of deft arrangings ? " [I]1631-i want none , "[1631-i] [she]1631-i put in with a quick distaste , a shrinking from [his]110-akbar manner . " ' Tis but to take a note to [Dering - sahib]71-vincent ; [he]71-vincent must know somewhat before [he]71-vincent comes with [the other sahib logue]4539-the other sahib logue this afternoon . There is no arrangement needed , no fuss . "[1631-i] How could there be , [she]1631-i asked [herself]1631-i , as , after [the old sinner]629-the old sinner had gone off , charmed at this renewal of a once familiar occupation , [she]1631-i sat on the window - sill looking down on the roof of [the balcony]644-the balcony where [she]1631-i had been so content . For what could be simpler than to make it quite clear that [you]1636-you were real , that [you]1636-you did not pretend , that [you]1636-you were not even afraid ? That , briefly , [you]1636-you were not like [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith , who took so much -- [one]3501-one could not help seeing that!--and gave so little -- [one]3501-one could not help seeing that , also ! For what was a " Thanks ! many , [Captain Dering]71-vincent , "[110-akbar] in return for all the trouble [he]110-akbar lavished on [her]1631-i ? So it came to pass that when [Vincent Dering]71-vincent went to [the palace]3477-the palace that afternoon , some words were haunting heart and brain , as [Juliet]100-juliet 's words must have haunted [Romeo]99-romeo 's . No more ; no less . But they slid into and filled up the blanks between some words of [his]71-vincent own which [he]71-vincent had spoken carelessly , not five minutes before [he]71-vincent had first seen [Laila]86-laila , and which came back to [his]71-vincent memory unbidden . " It is n't altogether despicable to let [yourself]1636-you loose in [Paradise]9-paradise without an arrière pensée of flaming swords , especially if [you]1636-you can give pleasure to [someone else]3538-someone else thereby ! [One]3501-one could play [Romeo]99-romeo and [Juliet]100-juliet in [this garden]3540-this garden nicely . "[1640-her] Well , [he]71-vincent had played it for an hour or two , swept off [his]71-vincent feet by chance . Whether [he]71-vincent would continue to play it was unsettled till [her]1640-her note came . That ended [his]71-vincent vague reluctance , and [he]71-vincent went over to [the palace]3477-the palace , eager as [any lover]1642-any lover could be for the interview [she]1640-her suggested in " [the old place]4543-the old place when it grows dusk , and [the people]3552-the people will mostly have gone . "[1640-her] For [those of [the camp]3490-the camp who were bound to follow [the Viceroy]3418-the viceroy 's whim of riding by [the old road]1646-the old road]1643-those of the camp who were bound to follow the viceroy 's whim of riding by the old road -- [[the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims ' road]1648-the pilgrims ' road -- while [the big camp]1649-the big camp went round by [the longer , easier route]1650-the longer , easier route , had promised to look in on [the palace]3477-the palace on [their]3444-the pilgrims way past [it]3477-the palace , for a cup of tea , a good - by . Since already , the functions over , [the dream - city]1652-the dream - city had begun to melt away ; [the Hosts of [the Lord - sahib]3420-the lord - sahib]1003-the hosts of the lord - sahib were passing on . " [Glory]222-glory be ! "[1009-the commissioner] said [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner with heart - felt gratitude , " [we]1009-the commissioner 've done [our]1009-the commissioner worst and leave [you]4545-you to take the consequences . That 's sound policy . Anyhow , [we]1009-the commissioner are ahead of [everybody]939-everybody on [the road to [heaven]4548-heaven]4547-the road to heaven , and [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims will have to swallow the dust of [our]1009-the commissioner feet ! [I]1009-the commissioner wonder how [they]3444-the pilgrims 'll like it . "[1009-the commissioner] [He]1656-he was in wild spirits , like [a schoolboy]1657-a schoolboy escaped from [school]1596-school ; yet as [he]1656-he paused to shake hands with [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , [he]1656-he said aside , " Any more cases ? "[1656-he] " Two , "[334-the doctor] said [the doctor]334-the doctor , laconically , " both dead . It is a bad type . "[334-the doctor] [[His]1656-he hearer]1660-his hearer 's face was unmovable as [he]1656-he turned to [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith , who stood close by . " Good - by , [[my]1656-he dear lady]1108-my dear lady , "[1656-he] [he]1656-he said cheerfully , " remember [me]1656-he [house]4551-house is [yours]1108-my dear lady if [you]1108-my dear lady , or [the child]543-the child , want it . [Doctor]3435-doctor , could n't [you]1108-my dear lady conscientiously recommend change of air to [the hills]343-the hills ? Could n't [ye]1108-my dear lady swear the close proximity to [an open canal]4555-an open canal and [a gaol]4556-a gaol is unwholesome ? If [ye]1108-my dear lady could , [you]1108-my dear lady 'd oblige [a grass - widower , whose wife]4557-a grass - widower , whose wife is at [Baden - Baden --]39-baden - baden -- or is it Marienbad?--living prodigally , while [he]4557-a grass - widower , whose wife has to fill [himself]4557-a grass - widower , whose wife with husks which [no self - respecting swine]4558-no self - respecting swine would eat . Faith , [[me]1656-he dear madam]4287-me dear madam , [I]1656-he 'd bless [you]1108-my dear lady if [you]1108-my dear lady 'd come and kill [the cook]4560-the cook . It 's [a woman]3949-a woman 's work ; not [a man]533-a man 's . "[1656-he] [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , with a quick look , backed [him]69-dr. dillon up instantly . " Certainly . [I]69-dr. dillon told [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith a long time ago that [she]75-mrs. smith and [Gladys]109-gladys had had enough of [Eshwara]1-eshwara . Indeed , as [[her]75-mrs. smith doctor]4563-her doctor , [she]75-mrs. smith would be doing [me]69-dr. dillon a personal favour if-- "[69-dr. dillon] [Muriel Smith]151-muriel swept round on [him]69-dr. dillon sharply . [She]151-muriel was looking [her]151-muriel very best , in [her]151-muriel very best gown ; white , mystic , wonderful , with a faint gleam of silver embroidery about waist and hem . And [she]151-muriel had been obtrusively , unnecessarily friendly with [Vincent Dering]71-vincent all the afternoon ; even now [she]151-muriel was standing with [him]71-vincent attached to [her]151-muriel apron - strings . " [I]151-muriel do n't think nervous headaches are dangerous , "[151-muriel] [she]151-muriel said , eying [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon coolly . " But thanks all the same . [I]151-muriel should love to kill [somebody]4084-somebody ; even [a cook]4565-a cook . Perhaps [I]151-muriel may , by and by , when [all the nice people]4566-all the nice people leave . [I]151-muriel 'm so sorry [you]69-dr. dillon 're going , but [we]4567-we are still to be quite gay , are n't [we]4567-we , [Captain Dering]71-vincent ? And that reminds [me]151-muriel [we]4567-we have to settle when that riding party is to come off . Good - by -- good - by ! "[151-muriel] [She]151-muriel waved [her]151-muriel hand to [the departing Commissioner]1661-the departing commissioner , and carried [Vincent Dering]71-vincent off , with a defiant look at [the doctor]334-the doctor . [He]71-vincent , knowing [her]151-muriel , smiled indulgently ; but [Father Ninian]81-father ninian , who had come down to see [[his]81-father ninian guest]1663-his guest off , looked after [her]151-muriel with a wistful pain in [his]81-father ninian kind old face . " That is a mistake , "[81-father ninian] [he]81-father ninian said briefly ; then the wistfulness grew into a puzzled look , and [he]81-father ninian added , half to [himself]81-father ninian , " It need not be , surely ; there is something wrong . [I]81-father ninian ca n't understand-- "[81-father ninian] [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , catching the end of the remark , gave a cynical laugh and turned on [his]69-dr. dillon heel . " [No one]3741-no one does , "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon said as [he]69-dr. dillon went off . [He]69-dr. dillon would not discuss [her]151-muriel even with [dear old Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan . For the rest , though [he]69-dr. dillon was keen to get back to [[his]69-dr. dillon jail]1664-his jail , [he]69-dr. dillon would wait till [she]151-muriel tired of [her]151-muriel game , and then drive [her]151-muriel [home]3521-home [himself]69-dr. dillon to [her]151-muriel idiot of [a husband , who was too busy over [his]69-dr. dillon blessed search - light to see things that were going on under [his]69-dr. dillon very eyes]1666-a husband , who was too busy over his blessed search - light to see things that were going on under his very eyes . [Captain Dering]71-vincent , however , was already impatient . It was growing dusk ; the shadows were claiming [the garden]433-the garden bit by bit , and as the glint left the varnished leaves of the orange trees , the white flowers stood out like little stars against the gloom and sent a bewildering perfume into the darkening air . [He]71-vincent could see no hint of [Laila]86-laila anywhere ; [Laila]86-laila in that detestable white muslin garment which made [him]69-dr. dillon long vainly to get rid of the surroundings which suited [her]86-laila so ill , drive [all that civilized crew]1668-all that civilized crew from [the garden]433-the garden , and claim it as [his]69-dr. dillon own -- and [hers]86-laila ! [She]86-laila must have gone to [the balcony]644-the balcony already . [She]86-laila must be waiting for [him]69-dr. dillon . And yet a soft - heartedness for [this other woman with whom [he]69-dr. dillon had been friends , whom for a few days [he]69-dr. dillon had imagined [he]69-dr. dillon loved]1671-this other woman with whom he had been friends , whom for a few days he had imagined he loved ( it had come to this now ) forbade [him]69-dr. dillon from leaving [her]86-laila cavalierly . So it was long past dusk , and the short Indian twilight was hovering on the edge of night , ere [he]69-dr. dillon made [his]69-dr. dillon escape ; and , full of anxiety lest [Laila]86-laila should have lost patience or hope , hurried down to the wide archway , and so , by the turn riverwards , to the right , into [the balcony]644-the balcony . [Most girls]1673-most girls , [he]69-dr. dillon told [himself]69-dr. dillon , would by this time have taken offence ; but [she]86-laila was there . As [he]69-dr. dillon entered , [her]86-laila figure showed dimly against the light beyond . " [I]69-dr. dillon 'm afraid [I]69-dr. dillon am awfully late , "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon began , then paused ; for , as [she]86-laila turned , there was a faint clash of silver , a faint gleam of it too . [His]69-dr. dillon heart gave a great throb of glad recognition . It was [Laila]86-laila ! [Laila]86-laila indeed ! [the Laila of that dream last night]1674-the laila of that dream last night . And [she]86-laila had risked this to please [him]69-dr. dillon ! " Are [you]69-dr. dillon ? "[86-laila] [she]86-laila said . " [I]86-laila thought [I]86-laila was late ; for this took time ; but [I]86-laila wanted to be the same -- always the same to [you]69-dr. dillon , always -- always ! "[86-laila] [She]86-laila stretched [her]86-laila hands to [him]69-dr. dillon , but [he]69-dr. dillon set them aside , took [her]86-laila in [his]69-dr. dillon arms , and kissed [her]86-laila passionately . " Yes ! [Laila]86-laila ! always [Laila]86-laila -- [[my]69-dr. dillon [Laila]86-laila]4569-my laila ! "[69-dr. dillon] [She]86-laila gave [him]69-dr. dillon back [his]69-dr. dillon kisses joyfully . " [I]86-laila knew [you]69-dr. dillon would come , "[86-laila] [she]86-laila said . " Love comes to love , [you]69-dr. dillon know . "[86-laila] [He]69-dr. dillon called [her]86-laila [Juliet]100-juliet then , and [many another lover]1675-many another lover 's name . [She]86-laila took them all , and gave [them]1676-them back again without reserve , until , as [they]1677-they stood there , [someone passing outward from the arched passage]1678-someone passing outward from the arched passage to [the garden]433-the garden , paused to listen at the half - heard sound of voices . For [Father Ninian]81-father ninian -- who had come down to [[his]81-father ninian own rooms]1680-his own rooms for a pair of foils wherewith to give [Lance Carlyon]68-lance a lesson in the " Addio del Marito , "[1678-someone passing outward from the arched passage] until [Captain Dering]71-vincent should choose to come out of the recesses of [the garden]433-the garden and allow of [their]1677-they going back to [the Fort]3493-the fort together -- knew of none likely to use , or even to be aware of , [the balcony]644-the balcony . So [he]71-vincent turned thither curiously , then stood arrested , so that the clash of the foils on the stone , as [he]71-vincent purposely lowered their points , came as a warning to those two that [they]1677-they were observed . [Laila]86-laila , with a catlike noiselessness , withdrew in a second . [She]86-laila , a yard or two away , in deepest shadow , stood leaning in a careless , easy attitude over the balustrade . [Her]86-laila only possibility of escape lay , [she]86-laila felt instinctively , in showing no desire to do so . [Vincent]71-vincent , for [his]71-vincent part , turned to face [the old priest]1250-the old priest , prepared to brazen it out ; for [his]71-vincent blood was running like wild - fire in [his]71-vincent veins . Yet scarcely so fast as the heart 's blood had once leapt , and was even now leaping , in [the old man who came forward , facing [him]71-vincent also]1685-the old man who came forward , facing him also . Came forward slowly , shortsightedly , a foil in each hand . If [he]71-vincent had held out one , bade [him]71-vincent take the button off and fight for [his]71-vincent life , [Vincent Dering]71-vincent would scarcely have been surprised , would almost have been pleased . It would have raised [him]71-vincent in [his]71-vincent own self - esteem . For [he]71-vincent knew perfectly well [he]71-vincent had no right to be [there]3509-there ; that , as yet , [he]71-vincent was not sure of [his]71-vincent own footing . But [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan did not . [He]84-pidar narâyan paused , as [he]84-pidar narâyan generally did , a few paces away , a slender , straight shadow in black , girt about with that pale sash , on which , and on [his]84-pidar narâyan pale face , such light as there was fell softly . For there was no anger in the latter ; only an almost passionate regret and pity . Even so , [his]84-pidar narâyan words startled [the young man , who stood prepared for defiance]1687-the young man , who stood prepared for defiance . " Oh ! [Captain Dering]71-vincent ! "[84-pidar narâyan] [he]84-pidar narâyan said courteously , " it is [you]71-vincent , is it ? [You]71-vincent have found [a pleasant place]418-a pleasant place , indeed ! But scarcely a very safe one for [[your]71-vincent companion--]4571-your companion-- "[84-pidar narâyan] [he]84-pidar narâyan turned to that faint gleam of white and silver in the arched shadow.--"The air grows chill , [madam]4334-madam , so close to [the river]333-the river , "[84-pidar narâyan] [he]84-pidar narâyan continued , [his]84-pidar narâyan voice taking a tone almost of command , " and [you]4334-madam are lightly clad . Will [you]4334-madam not be wise , and leave [us]4574-us ? "[84-pidar narâyan] [Vincent]71-vincent 's surprise had passed by this time into a rush of vexation , almost indignation , for [he]71-vincent had grasped [the old man]3483-the old man 's mistake . For an instant [he]71-vincent felt bound to undeceive [him]3483-the old man , then the impossibility of doing so held [him]71-vincent silent , feeling [a coward]1689-a coward indeed ; so , desperately , [he]71-vincent could only join [his]71-vincent voice to [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's . It seemed the only way out of the impasse . " Perhaps [you]3483-the old man had better go-- "[86-laila] [Laila]86-laila did not need more . Already , under cover of the shadow , [she]86-laila had dexterously slipped off [her]86-laila silver jingles , lest they should betray what really seemed to [her]86-laila [her]86-laila worst , nay ! [her]86-laila only offence;--the taking and wearing of [Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's present . And now , wrapping [her]86-laila veil about [her]86-laila like a cloak , gathering [her]86-laila trailing skirts to orthodox length with an appalling presence of mind , [she]86-laila was off with just the little uneasy laugh which might well befit the situation . [She]86-laila left [[her]86-laila companion]1449-her companion bewildered , yet still facing [the old man]3483-the old man recklessly . Since [he]3483-the old man could not explain , [he]3483-the old man did not mean to be hectored . Yet , once again , the old voice took [him]3483-the old man unawares . " Memory plays strange tricks with [us]4575-us at times , "[86-laila] it said slowly , but with a suggestion of the fateful , hopeless rhythm of a Greek chorus in it . " [She]86-laila has taken [me]1692-i back , this evening , nearly sixty long years . [The river]333-the river before [us]4575-us is the yellow flood of [the Tiber]22-the tiber , [the woman who has just left [us]4575-us]4577-the woman who has just left us is [the woman [I]1692-i loved]4578-the woman i loved -- sixty long years ago -- [I]1692-i had kissed [her]86-laila , as [you]4579-you have kissed [her]86-laila . [I]1692-i had told [her]86-laila [I]1692-i loved [her]86-laila , as [you]4579-you have just told [her]86-laila -- and then , like an echo from [the river]333-the river below where [a boat]4374-a boat was moored , came to [our]4575-us ears , the same words , ' [I]1692-i love [you]4579-you . '--They were spoken , [Captain Dering]71-vincent , by [a boy , barely in [his]4582-a boy , barely in his teens teens]4582-a boy , barely in his teens , to [a waiting - maid]4583-a waiting - maid . [The boy]4584-the boy was [[her]4583-a waiting - maid son]4585-her son . [She]4583-a waiting - maid had been married , as [they]4586-they marry [them]4586-they in [Italy]11-italy , almost before [her]4583-a waiting - maid girlhood , and [I]1692-i , [[the boy]4584-the boy 's tutor]4588-the boy 's tutor , was nearer [her]4583-a waiting - maid age than [[his]4584-the boy father]4589-his father -- [a better man]4590-a better man , too , [Captain Dering]71-vincent ! But those [words--'I]4591-words--'i love you'--parted [us]4592-us once , and for all . [They]4591-words--'i mirrored the truth for [us]4592-us -- the truth of the love which hides in [balconies]4593-balconies -- in [pleasure boats--]4594-pleasure boats-- "[1692-i] [he]1692-i took a step forward , and [his]1692-i whole presence changed . [He]1692-i raised [his]1692-i hand , [priest]1693-priest to its finger tips . " Let it mirror the truth to [you]1692-i also , [[my]1692-i son]4595-my son -- leave [this poor lady]4596-this poor lady to [her]4596-this poor lady duty , as [I--]1692-i "[1692-i] [Vincent Dering]71-vincent broke in on [him]1692-i haughtily , [his]1692-i pride in arms , impatience at the falseness of [his]1692-i position making [him]1692-i discourteous . " [You]1692-i do n't understand ; [you]1692-i are absolutely mistaken -- [I]71-vincent refuse to explain , but [I]71-vincent really must ask [you]1692-i not to interfere . "[71-vincent] [The old man]3483-the old man 's whole bearing changed again . [He]1692-i drew [himself]1692-i up , and , foils in hand , bowed , as [fencers]1695-fencers do at the salute . " Were [I]1692-i [[the lady]4597-the lady 's husband]4598-the lady 's husband , [sir]3491-sir , [I]1692-i would make [you]1692-i answer . As [a priest of [God]96-god]4600-a priest of god , [I]1692-i must warn [you]1692-i that [I]1692-i will speak , if-- "[1692-i] [Vincent Dering]71-vincent interrupted [him]3483-the old man again . " [I]3483-the old man ca n't prevent that -- but [you]1692-i will wrong [us]4601-us -- [her]4597-the lady at any rate -- the best , [the kindest woman--]4602-the kindest woman-- "[3483-the old man] [He]3483-the old man paused , for [Father Ninian]81-father ninian had come close , laid a hand on [his]3483-the old man , and the touch seemed to bring silence . " It is sixty long years , [Captain Dering]71-vincent , "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man said , and [his]3483-the old man eyes seemed to pierce through the darkness , " since [I]3483-the old man have laid [my]3483-the old man hand on [[my]3483-the old man fellow - men]4603-my fellow - men save in the hope of healing . It was a fancy of [mine]3483-the old man after -- after [we]4601-us kissed , and parted . But [I]3483-the old man touch [you]71-vincent as [a second self]4604-a second self , [a fellow - sinner]4605-a fellow - sinner ; for [she]4606-she too was the best -- the kindest-- "[3483-the old man] [His]3483-the old man old voice failed . Despite [his]3483-the old man anger at the whole miserable mistake , [Vincent]71-vincent was touched ; but despite [his]3483-the old man emotion , [his]3483-the old man annoyance strengthened . " Possibly , "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man broke in , " but [I]3483-the old man must really refuse to discuss the matter further . Shall [we]4607-we end this , [sir,--unless--]4608-sir,--unless-- "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man gave a reckless laugh and pointed to the foils--"you would like to fight it out ? "[3483-the old man] Once more [Father Ninian]81-father ninian bowed , as [fencers]1695-fencers bow in the salute , [the priest]3909-the priest , [the wise counsellor]1698-the wise counsellor , lost in [an older entity than these]1699-an older entity than these ; in [the high - born Scotch student , who , for a while , had forgotten [his]1700-the high - born scotch student , who , for a while , had forgotten his vocation to ruffle with the best blood in italy vocation to ruffle with the best blood in [Italy]11-italy]1700-the high - born scotch student , who , for a while , had forgotten his vocation to ruffle with the best blood in italy . " [I]3483-the old man have not the privilege of being [[the lady]4597-the lady 's protector]4610-the lady 's protector , "[3483-the old man] [he]3483-the old man answered hotly . " If [I]3483-the old man were,"--He[3483-the old man] paused , then said courteously , " Shall [we]4607-we come [upstairs]3544-upstairs ? [I]3483-the old man came down for these foils in order to teach [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon the thrust [we]4607-we spoke of once . ' [L'Addio del Marito]113-l'addio del marito , ' [they]4612-they called it in [my]3483-the old man youth -- [I]3483-the old man doubt if the name has changed now . [He]106-mr. carlyon will be wondering what has become of [me]3483-the old man , and -- and it ! "[3483-the old man] As [Vincent]71-vincent followed [him]3483-the old man , [he]71-vincent felt a thrill at the savageness of [the old man]3483-the old man 's tone , and told [himself]71-vincent that here was the Church Militant indeed . [He]71-vincent might have said so with still more reason ten minutes after , when [Father Ninian]81-father ninian was left alone . For the hour proved too late for lessons , and [Lance Carlyon]68-lance -- who had been out of sorts ever since [his]68-lance walk at dawn with [Erda Shepherd]105-erda -- was obliged to give in to dinner , grumbling the while , that [Vincent]71-vincent was [the worst chum [he]68-lance ever came across]1702-the worst chum he ever came across . Never to be found when [he]71-vincent was wanted , then turning up when [dear old Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan looked as if [he]71-vincent could have licked creation . Possibly [Lance]68-lance might have repeated this assertion , also , with greater fervour , could [he]68-lance have been witness to [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's actions , when , [[his]68-lance last guest]1703-his last guest gone , [he]68-lance went to put the foils back in [the armoury next [the chapel]1291-the chapel]1704-the armoury next the chapel . For [he]68-lance would have seen [him]68-lance , with head bowed over the crossed foils [he]68-lance held , repeating a " mea culpa "[68-lance] as [he]68-lance passed the altar ; but ere the second foil matched its fellow on [the armoury wall]1706-the armoury wall , [he]68-lance would have seen as pretty a bit of sword - play as could well be seen . Many a dexterous turn of wrist , many a quick imaginary parry , many a sharp riposte , following each other accurately , as if memory held each attack , each defence of [an unseen foe]1707-an unseen foe ; until finally , swift as a flash , would come a falter back , as if from a blow , then a thrust forward . There was a little silver bell -- such as [men]312-men put to a falcon 's hood -- no bigger than a sixpence , shaped like [a man]533-a man 's heart , upon the tassel of a resting lance beneath the solitary foil . And the tassel swayed gently in the cool river breeze . Yet at each thrust the heart - shaped bell chimed a feeble protest under the button of the foil , making [the Church Militant]223-the church militant smile cheerfully . The darkness which holds the dawn was , as a rule , silent as the grave in the sand - stretches beyond [the river]333-the river , where the wide cut of [the canal]3421-the canal , the huge mud - heap of [the gaol]1501-the gaol , with [[its]1501-the gaol scattered workshops and [houses]1714-houses]1713-its scattered workshops and houses , showed as mere spots and lines on [the illimitable plain]1715-the illimitable plain . But on the night after [the band]4201-the band had played " God save [the Queen]3843-the queen , "[4201-the band] while the first drops of sacred water trickled over the chink of the sluice into [the dry bed of [the canal below]1718-the canal below]1717-the dry bed of the canal below , [its]1719-its silence was broken by unfamiliar sounds . First of all , by the now ceaseless splash of the thin , glassy curve of water on its way to find out [this new road to [the sea]1306-the sea]1720-this new road to the sea . [It]1719-its had a sort of dreamy whisper in it , as if it were telling its first impressions , [its]1719-its hopes , its fears , to [the river it was leaving behind]1722-the river it was leaving behind . And on this background of ceaseless sound came [two others]1723-two others intermittently . The first -- a muffled hammering from the darkness which hid [[the Viceroy]192-viceroy 's camp]3419-the viceroy 's camp -- told of departure , letting the night know that [another white - winged tent]1725-another white - winged tent was flitting , and that the dawn must be prepared to find [its]1725-another white - winged tent place empty , [the dream - city]1652-the dream - city in ruins , [the Hosts of [the Lord]3426-the lord - sahib]1003-the hosts of the lord - sahib gone . The second told of arrival . It was a strange cry , soft , almost musical:-- " Hârâ -- Hârî -- Hârâ -- Hârî ! "[3444-the pilgrims] Then every now and again in a sort of chant : " Râm -- Râm -- Sita -- Râm ! "[3444-the pilgrims] It was [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims ' cry , [their]3444-the pilgrims call on [the Creator]1359-the creator , [the Destroyer]1731-the destroyer , [their]3444-the pilgrims appeal to the godhead in [man]361-man and [woman]534-woman ; for [the forerunners of the great host to come]1734-the forerunners of the great host to come were already nearing [Eshwara]1-eshwara on [their]1734-the forerunners of the great host to come road to [the " Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods]4614-the " cradle of the gods . "[3444-the pilgrims] But there was a fourth sound , inaudible -- by reason of that ceaseless noise of water through the chink of the sluice -- except to [those close by it]1735-those close by it , like [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon , as [he]69-dr. dillon stood on the hand - bridge above the closed gates looking down idly into the darkness which prevented [him]69-dr. dillon from seeing the cause of the sound . [He]69-dr. dillon had been up all night . On [his]69-dr. dillon return,--later than [he]69-dr. dillon had intended , owing to [his]69-dr. dillon determination not to be defied by [any woman,--he]1736-any woman,--he had found that in [his]69-dr. dillon absence cholera had been hard at its work . So [he]69-dr. dillon had buckled to [his]69-dr. dillon , expecting one of those awful nights which live , even in [a doctor]1737-a doctor 's memory , as a horror , as a warning to [those best fitted to stem the stream of death]1738-those best fitted to stem the stream of death , that they are but straws on [its]1739-its surface . But [he]69-dr. dillon had been mistaken . True , for an hour or so , cases had come in quicker than they could be attended to ; then , suddenly , [they]1738-those best fitted to stem the stream of death ceased to come in at all . That had been eight hours ago . Too short a respite for certainty , but [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , being [no novice in such work]1740-no novice in such work , had [his]69-dr. dillon hopes ; the more so because the disease , from the very outset , had become steadily less and less virulent . Even so , seven dead bodies lay awaiting the first glint of dawn ; therefore , as ill - luck would have it , there would be seven columns of smoke on [the river]333-the river 's edge for all to see ! It was inevitable , however , nor could [he]69-dr. dillon do more to prevent [others]569-others coming . So [he]69-dr. dillon had been on [his]69-dr. dillon way back to [[his]69-dr. dillon own house]1743-his own house for a few hours ' rest when the dreamy splash of [the water]945-the water made [him]69-dr. dillon pause to lean over the hand - rail and listen to it , as [he]69-dr. dillon finished [his]69-dr. dillon cigar in the open . Then it was that [he]69-dr. dillon heard a faint tap , tapping , as of a ghostly hand on a door . What was it ? It was quite distinct , though almost as low as the " lip , lipping "[69-dr. dillon] of the water , made restless by that glassy curve against the gates . A curiosity to know seized on [him]69-dr. dillon . There was already a glimmer of dawn in [the east]1745-the east ; [he]69-dr. dillon might as well wait and see . It was not long before a streak of something faintly white made [him]69-dr. dillon call [himself]69-dr. dillon [a fool]4066-a fool . The cause was a log of wood . [He]69-dr. dillon might have thought of that . Even that faint setting of a stream towards a new way must have drifted it here . The thought made [him]69-dr. dillon frown , for this fulfilment of [the river - people]1747-the river - people 's prophecy was annoying ; the more so from its absolute unlikelihood . Years might pass without such a chance coming again ; yet it had come the very first day ! It was too bad . The stars in their courses were fighting against [him]69-dr. dillon . In a pet [he]69-dr. dillon threw the remains of [his]69-dr. dillon cigar from [him]69-dr. dillon , and was striding off , when a faint glimmer , as of a candle , made [him]69-dr. dillon turn sharply and look down whence it came . The lighted end of [his]69-dr. dillon cigar had fallen on something dry , inflammable , which had blazed up . But it was only for a second ; the next found darkness , save for that still , faint , glimmer of white . But the brief gleam had told [him]69-dr. dillon it was not a log which had drifted astray-- It was [a corpse]1748-a corpse . That tap , tapping [he]69-dr. dillon had heard had been from the dead feet seeking vainly to pass through the chink of the sluice , swerving with the side current , coming back , again and again . [He]69-dr. dillon stood , grasping the rail , staring down at the dim outline almost incredulously , and feeling , despite [himself]69-dr. dillon , a trifle shivery . Then the remembrance that this was a thing which must be seen by none , which somehow , and as quickly as possible , must be set on [its]1749-its right road again , made [him]69-dr. dillon hurry back to where [he]69-dr. dillon knew some coils of rope , which had been used for bunting at the ceremony , were lying . Seizing one -- still gaily decorated -- [he]69-dr. dillon tied a brick to one end , and hurried back to [the bridge]373-the bridge . By dropping this weighted rope over the dim white streak [he]69-dr. dillon was able to edge it gradually to one side , until it lay moored against the wall of the basin . Kneeling down for a closer look , [he]69-dr. dillon could see , in the fast - growing light , that it was the corpse of [a woman]3949-a woman . [He]69-dr. dillon could even guess the death [she]3949-a woman died , and if proof was needed , it could be found in the hands folded at full stretch down the body ; the thumbs , pointing upward , linked by an iron ring . To this iron ring had been looped a little tuft of the tri - coloured hank of cotton which plays so large a part in marriage ceremonial . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon stood up and swore under [his]69-dr. dillon breath . The fates were , indeed , inexorable in [their]1752-their spite . Of all things unlucky for the changing stream to claim , a corpse seeking union with [Mother Ganges]224-mother ganges was the worst ; and of [all corpses]1753-all corpses , this -- the cursed one , which had held two lives and could send one back to haunt [men]312-men -- was the worst . [He]69-dr. dillon must get rid of it somehow , if [he]69-dr. dillon could . Fastening the rope , so strangely out of keeping , all hung as it was with gay colours , to the iron ring which showed about the ankles , [he]69-dr. dillon proceeded to tow the body back along [the basin]1755-the basin , past the first gates , and so to [the river]333-the river itself . Thus far was simple . But how was [he]69-dr. dillon to get it afloat on a current strong enough to sweep it beyond danger of its returning to tap at the gates once more ? The dawn was hastening with great leaps of light that shot in broad bars from the darkest spot in all the dark horizon ; [the spot which would soon be the brightest , ablaze with the sun [himself]69-dr. dillon]1757-the spot which would soon be the brightest , ablaze with the sun himself . Already the broad shield of [the river]333-the river was changing its heraldry -- the sable was turning to steel , sign that [the world]404-the world would side with the light . What was to be done ? [He]69-dr. dillon looked over [the wide waste of sand and water]1760-the wide waste of sand and water , with a perplexity which vanished suddenly in a smile , as [he]69-dr. dillon caught sight of a round shadow like [a man]533-a man 's head dipping and dancing on the surface . [He]69-dr. dillon walked on to [the last dry spot of land]1762-the last dry spot of land and shouted-- " Ai ! [fisherman]4616-fisherman ! Ai ! [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ! [Am - ma]3733-am - ma ! [anybody]1392-anybody ! Come and earn a gold mohur ! "[69-dr. dillon] It was [Am - ma]131-am - ma . Luckily , perhaps , since the idea of even towing a dead body such as this might have been too much for [semi - civilized Gu - gu]1763-semi - civilized gu - gu . [Am - ma]131-am - ma , however , had not ever borrowed [[his]131-am - ma neighbours]1764-his neighbours ' superstitions . In fact , ever since [he]131-am - ma , [the Miss - sahiba]1765-the miss - sahiba and [the Dee - puk - râg]161-the dee - puk - râg had bested the devil between [them]1766-them , [he]131-am - ma had felt [himself]131-am - ma to be invulnerable . So , [he]131-am - ma assured [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon affably , were [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors ; therefore [he]131-am - ma obeyed [them]118-the huzoors . Consequently , less than five minutes after the call , with a vague wonder as to what sixteen rupees would feel like , all at once , in [a man]533-a man 's palm , [he]131-am - ma was heading hard to the nearest stream capable of carrying the thing [he]131-am - ma had in tow back to [the path of purification]1768-the path of purification . This happened to be towards [Eshwara]1-eshwara , and beyond [a sandy point set with tamarisks]1769-a sandy point set with tamarisks which jutted out above [the canal head]3968-the canal head . There was , of course , [a certain stream against [him]131-am - ma]1771-a certain stream against him , and to save [himself]131-am - ma exertion and finish the job -- as [he]131-am - ma had agreed to do -- before dawn , [he]131-am - ma swam for the most part under water , only coming up , after [his]131-am - ma habit , for air . Now it so happened , also , that [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu had thought fit to set nets for wild - fowl , and was even now dozing , while [he]131-am - ma waited for the result , in [the same tamarisk jungle]1772-the same tamarisk jungle . But the sound of something swishing through the water against [the stream]831-the stream roused [him]131-am - ma in a second , and even without the glimpse , which the coming dawn gave [him]131-am - ma , of a long streak parting [the river]333-the river with a curved ripple like the prow of [a boat]4374-a boat , [his]131-am - ma experience told [him]131-am - ma what it was sure to be . Briefly , someone of the river people,--Am - ma for choice , since who but [Am - ma]131-am - ma had the luck of such things -- had happened on the chance of stealing a log from the piles about [the canal workshops]1776-the canal workshops . [He]131-am - ma was now , after time - honoured precedent , towing it to [the stream]831-the stream where , having set it adrift , [he]131-am - ma would recapture it , and , of course , claim [his]131-am - ma reward for so doing ! But two could play that game . When secrecy made it necessary for [a thief]1778-a thief to swim for the most part under water , it was easy to swim under water too , across the track of [the robber]1779-the robber , cut [his]1779-the robber prize adrift , and put [your]1780-you weight on the rope instead . Then [you]1780-you could either choose revenge , and let [an enemy]1781-an enemy tow [you]1780-you [home]3521-home -- which was a side - splitting trick,--or [you]1780-you might wait till [[your]1780-you adversary]1783-your adversary came up breathless , and dash after the prize [yourself]1780-you . Even if [you]1780-you could not secure the whole , half profits were generally possible . Therefore , slipping noiselessly into [the stream]831-the stream like an alligator , [he]131-am - ma was off across [the track]1785-the track in a second ; swimming , of course , under water . [He]131-am - ma came , up once for air , and smiled to see how far [he]131-am - ma had come ; so , fearing lest [the holder of the unseen tow - rope]1786-the holder of the unseen tow - rope might chance to come up at the same time , [his]131-am - ma black head went under once more . When it came up again , it was within a few yards of the long white streak . [He]131-am - ma gave one look at it , let loose a yell of abject terror , and almost turning a somersault in [his]131-am - ma haste to escape , [his]131-am - ma head went down again , [his]131-am - ma feet went skywards , and though [his]131-am - ma lungs nearly burst in the effort , [he]131-am - ma came up no more till [he]131-am - ma felt certain [he]131-am - ma must have put a screen of tamarisk between [him]131-am - ma and the horror . [He]131-am - ma had ; but [his]131-am - ma teeth chattered , [his]131-am - ma eyes were half out of [his]131-am - ma head when [he]131-am - ma scrambled , hands and knees , on to [the bank]914-the bank , and lying face down on the dry sand , moaned and shuddered . What else could [a man]533-a man do who had seen a cursed corpse breasting [the stream]831-the stream on [its]1790-its way back to [Eshwara]1-eshwara ? To [whose house]1791-whose house ? That , however , was quite a secondary consideration to [a man who was already as good as dead]1792-a man who was already as good as dead ; since [what man]1793-what man had ever survived the sight of [a churail]1794-a churail ? The certainty of [his]131-am - ma own fate , after a while , made [him]131-am - ma absolutely , recklessly , calm . [He]131-am - ma gathered up [his]131-am - ma nets , wrung the necks of the few birds [he]131-am - ma had caught pitilessly , and went with [them]1795-them , as usual , to [the bazaars]1796-the bazaars . Not only for profit , however . [Other men]3737-other men should taste of [his]131-am - ma fear . [Other men]3737-other men should know that [they]3737-other men too might have to die ! [Am - ma]131-am - ma , meanwhile , having seen nothing when [he]131-am - ma came up wondering what the sound was which had filtered to [his]131-am - ma ears through the water , had gone on [his]131-am - ma way unwitting , found [the stream]831-the stream , cut the corpse adrift [himself]131-am - ma , and gone back to [[his]131-am - ma fishing]1800-his fishing . It was not until [he]131-am - ma also went into [the bazaar]372-the bazaar with [his]131-am - ma basket , that [he]131-am - ma found it ringing with the direful portent ; yet for all that going its way buying and selling , squabbling over the uttermost part of a farthing ; since portents are ever with [an Indian bazaar]1802-an indian bazaar . At first , when called upon to verify [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's story , [Am - ma]131-am - ma , remembering [his]131-am - ma promise of secrecy , gave it stout denial ; but when the real truth of what had occurred dawned on [his]131-am - ma slow brain , the opportunity for piling agony on to [[his]131-am - ma rival]3735-his rival was too strong for [him]131-am - ma , and [he]131-am - ma burst into details , all of which made [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's chance of escape still more remote . [The corpse]1804-the corpse had shot after [him]131-am - ma with a speed only equal to [the fire - boats in which [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors came across [the black water]3675-the black water]1805-the fire - boats in which the huzoors came across the black water ; it had sat up , and beckoned , and called " [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ! [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ! "[1804-the corpse] " But if [thou]4619-thou hast seen all this , [thou]4619-thou , too , must die ! "[1807-the syrup - seller round whose shop] remarked [the syrup - seller round whose shop]1807-the syrup - seller round whose shop the talk was loudest . [Am - ma]131-am - ma laughed vaingloriously . "[1811-a tall man] That might well be , seeing that [he]1811-a tall man was none other than [the gosain Gopi]165-gopi , who , scarcely an hour agone , had been given [his]165-gopi ticket - of - leave and the clothes in which [he]165-gopi had been convicted two years before . "[1811-a tall man] [The long bazaar]1814-the long bazaar lay flooded with sunshine and life . The quails were calling from [their]1815-their hooded cages , the sacred monkeys were chattering about the sweetmeat - sellers ' shops , [men]312-men and [women]479-women were going about eager on [their]1818-their own affairs , and [a group of schoolboys on [their]1819-a group of schoolboys on their way to a mission school way to [a mission school]3822-a mission school]1819-a group of schoolboys on their way to a mission school came along , [their]1819-a group of schoolboys on their way to a mission school books under [their]1819-a group of schoolboys on their way to a mission school arms,--a quaint collection , for the most part . ' "[312-men] It would have been easy enough for [[his]1831-the priest in charge rival]3735-his rival to throw doubts on the genuineness of the pool miracle , had it been sound policy to do so ; but before those patient , trustful faces , desirous only to save [their]1825-the boys souls alive at any cost , it was unwise to sap at the foundations of faith . So the reply contented itself with assertions that there was no fear either , for [them]1825-the boys . [Tampion]229-tampion or [no tampion]1836-no tampion , [jogi Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - nâth had promised to be inside the gun as ever . And that would be a newer , a better , miracle , than any other in [Eshwara]1-eshwara ! Here a fresh voice put in its word ; for [[the syrup - seller]1837-the syrup - seller 's shop]1838-the syrup - seller 's shop , being at [one corner of [the central square]1840-the central square or chowk of [four bazaars]1841-four bazaars]1839-one corner of the central square or chowk of four bazaars , [no one who had any errand of any sort]1842-no one who had any errand of any sort in [Eshwara]1-eshwara could fail to pass it sooner or later . " True . "[165-gopi] A curious shiver ran through [the crowd of men]1856-the crowd of men . "[481-the girl] [He]68-lance had a most ingenious way of appealing to [her]481-the girl sense of humour , and though it was partly at [[her]481-the girl cousin]4158-her cousin 's expense , [she]481-the girl laughed as [they]1892-they set off together -- [a most incongruous couple]1893-a most incongruous couple . [He]89-roshan was disturbed beyond bounds . The foolish dream of [a foolish old woman]1908-a foolish old woman had come to be so far a reality , that the jealousy which had blazed up instinctively at the sight of [Laila]86-laila in that dress -- so like [a woman of [his]89-roshan race]1909-a woman of his race -- alone with [a strange man]1910-a strange man , had come to be deliberate . More than once [he]89-roshan had felt inclined to tell [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan what [he]89-roshan had seen , even to write an anonymous letter of warning . But [he]89-roshan saw none ; on the contrary , [they]532-these two seemed to avoid [each other]3586-each other in public ; and though this might be a blind , on the other hand [Roshan]89-roshan had seen too much of [some English women]1913-some english women 's ways not to know how trivial an offence against the proprieties it was to sit out dances in [a balcony]1331-a balcony ! "[89-roshan] [Akbar]110-akbar , as [he]110-akbar capered off , the rupees jingling in [his]110-akbar pocket , to more legitimate and less lucrative pursuits , winked and leered to [himself]110-akbar over [his]110-akbar own surpassing wickedness and wisdom . Miracles ! Ay ; but it was nature worked them , not [he]110-akbar . Given youth , proximity , a touch of surprise , a flavour of the forbidden , and the result , in [his]110-akbar evil experience , was sure . In the meantime [his]110-akbar part was to keep the ball from falling until [the players]1919-the players took to playing the game for [themselves]1919-the players ; then the fun was over for the true go - between . [He]89-roshan had to take a back seat and watch -- [he]89-roshan ! [he]89-roshan ! [he!--the]1920-he!--the miracle ! A pretty miracle , indeed ! The idea tickled [him]89-roshan so that [he]89-roshan could not keep it to [himself]89-roshan , and as [he]89-roshan passed through [the bazaar]372-the bazaar , doing [his]89-roshan daily marketing , [he]89-roshan used [his]89-roshan new avocation of miracle - monger as a reason for good bargains . [The shop - keepers]1922-the shop - keepers , however , shook [their]1922-the shop - keepers heads . Miracles paid [the priests]1923-the priests , and might suit such as [he]110-akbar , but for [their]1923-the priests part [they]1923-the priests considered that there were too many miracles in [Eshwara]1-eshwara . What was the good of [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims coming at all if all [their]3444-the pilgrims money went to [the temples]1925-the temples , and [they]3444-the pilgrims had not a pice left for a relic , or even a toy to take [home]3521-home to [the toddlers whose feet were not yet strong enough for pilgrimage]1927-the toddlers whose feet were not yet strong enough for pilgrimage ? Baskets where [a pious pilgrim]1929-a pious pilgrim could purchase a whole pantheon , and secure a modicum of divine favour -- all duly trade - marked by [Christians]1930-christians -- for a few farthings . "[3444-the pilgrims] Even [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims laughed ; for laughter at a ready gibe comes easily in [India]8-india . Yet [they]3444-the pilgrims , too , felt inclined to agree with [the drug - seller]1944-the drug - seller . [One]3501-one can get blasé even in miracles . Therefore , naturally enough , when there was a choice , [they]3444-the pilgrims chose the newest ones . And the newest of all was [jogi Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - nâth 's promise of defying tampions , and locks , and chains , and , as in other years , blessing the crowd of [worshippers]1946-worshippers from [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth self - inflicted penitentiary , inside the " Teacher of Religion . "[141-jogi gorakh - nâth] And what was more , [he]141-jogi gorakh - nâth had kept [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth promise . That very dawn , as a kind of walk over the course , [he]141-jogi gorakh - nâth had performed the miracle before [a select band of [pilgrims]1948-pilgrims]1947-a select band of pilgrims , [mostly jogies of [[his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth own sect who were now engaged in telling the tale to all and sundry in [the city]3556-the city]1950-his own sect who were now engaged in telling the tale to all and sundry in the city]1949-mostly jogies of his own sect who were now engaged in telling the tale to all and sundry in the city . What had occurred was briefly this . [He]141-jogi gorakh - nâth had received [[his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth followers]1952-his followers squatted on the stone steps in front of the gun , and had treated [them]1952-his followers to a dissertation on the mysteries of [Yoga]235-yoga . [Other less eminent practitioners in the art of miracles]1953-other less eminent practitioners in the art of miracles , [he]141-jogi gorakh - nâth said , might have found it necessary to withhold the sight of [the sacred person]1954-the sacred person from devoted eyes . [He]141-jogi gorakh - nâth , however , meant to show [them]1952-his followers [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth absolute independence of the body . [He]141-jogi gorakh - nâth would leave it lying there , dead , while [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth soul went inside the gun , and blessed [the pious ones]1955-the pious ones . Accordingly [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth jaw had dropped ; [he]141-jogi gorakh - nâth had become rigid , callous apparently to the prickings of pins with which [[his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth assistants]1956-his assistants strove to make [him]141-jogi gorakh - nâth wince , and , just as one of [them]1956-his assistants withdrew a dagger , covered , of course , with gore from [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth very heart , a muffled voice of blessing had come from the very bowels of the gun . If that was not a miracle , what was ? Anyhow , it caught on , so that as the day grew , the growing tide of [pilgrims]1948-pilgrims passed by the side - shows run in connection with the Pool of Immortality by [its priests]1958-its priests , and drifted off to the opposition show , leaving [the impresarios]1959-the impresarios behind [them]1959-the impresarios in a state of rage and despair . Rage , for if this sort of thing continued on the morrow [they]1959-the impresarios would lose [their]1959-the impresarios year 's harvest , since [the Host of [God - seekers]1961-god - seekers]1960-the host of god - seekers were ever [the natural prey of [priests]1963-priests]1962-the natural prey of priests ; despair , because exposure of what experience told [them]1959-the impresarios must be a fraud , would only result in counter exposure . There must be honour among [thieves]1964-thieves to make the profession a lucrative one . So [they]1965-they met in conclave , each with [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth miserable earnings in [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth hand , to point the dire urgency of action , and agreed on the wisdom of finding a cat's - paw to filch [their]1959-the impresarios chestnuts from the fire . Thus it happened that [Vincent Dering]71-vincent came over to [[Lance Carlyon]68-lance 's quarters]1966-lance carlyon 's quarters half an hour before the time [they]1965-they had settled to start for [the mission house]3764-the mission house , and asked [him]71-vincent to look sharp , and send round to [Roshan Khân]89-roshan to come along also , as [he]71-vincent had private information -- here , with a laugh , [he]71-vincent threw a letter on the table -- that miracles were being illegally performed in [cantonments]1968-cantonments , and [he]71-vincent expected some fun . [Lance]68-lance laughed also as [he]68-lance read the following:-- " To [the Major General commanding]4715-the major general commanding . This is to give notice to [all concerned]4716-all concerned that illegible miracles is now being performed by [bare men in belly of great gun , contrary to astringent orders issued by [[my]68-lance lord god]4718-my lord god]4717-bare men in belly of great gun , contrary to astringent orders issued by my lord god . Therefore [[your]4719-your petitioners]4720-your petitioners pray for correct diagnosis of same , and removal from Cantonment boundaries with exhibitions not to miracle any more . "[68-lance] " By [Jove]76-jove ! "[71-vincent] [he]71-vincent said , " [[our]4721-our petitioner]4722-our petitioner is [a medical man -- hospital dresser]4723-a medical man -- hospital dresser , [I]71-vincent expect . Not to miracle any more!--h'm . "[71-vincent] [His]71-vincent tone changed , [his]71-vincent honest blue eyes clouded , for , ever since [Erda Shepherd]105-erda had told [him]71-vincent what [her]105-erda future life was to be , [the young fellow]1213-the young fellow had been painfully aware that [Eshwara]1-eshwara had wrought a miracle on [him]71-vincent ; that [he]71-vincent was no longer content to take life as [he]71-vincent found it ; that already [he]71-vincent had begun to look forward and think of what life would be by and by . " [I]71-vincent expect that would be a difficulty in [Eshwara]1-eshwara , "[71-vincent] [he]71-vincent went on ; " it 's [an awful place]4724-an awful place for upsetting the proper odds . Seems to [me]71-vincent impossible to -- to make a safe book on anything . "[71-vincent] [Vincent Dering]71-vincent shrugged [his]71-vincent shoulders . [He]71-vincent had been in the highest spirits for the last few days . " A safe book ! The dullest thing in creation . That 's why [I]71-vincent like [Eshwara]1-eshwara .
