If [she]481-the girl had lived [her]481-the girl life in [a vaudeville at [the Folies Bergères]2084-the folies bergères]2083-a vaudeville at the folies bergères [she]481-the girl could scarcely have been more at [home]3521-home in intrigue , yet [her]481-the girl absolute sincerity and unconsciousness of wrongdoing was as palpable . On the whole , [he]1606-her guardian felt vexed ; the more so because the vaudeville dialogue proved unnecessary , since a sudden concentration of [the party]2086-the party to hear the verdict of [the Adullamites , who at that moment came out of the dining room]2087-the adullamites , who at that moment came out of the dining room , would have given [them]2079-they ample time for more dignified conversation . [Erda]105-erda was in the front rank of [the eager little crowd]2088-the eager little crowd , [her]105-erda hopes , [her]105-erda enthusiasms , heightened by the deliberate choice [she]105-erda had just made , when [Dr. Campbell]154-dr. campbell , as [the recognized head]2089-the recognized head , began to speak . [They]2079-they had come unanimously to the conclusion , [he]154-dr. campbell said , that absolute revolt at this late hour would be unwise . Whether [Father Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian was justified , by the circumstances , in [his]81-father ninian adverse report was another matter . Personally [he]81-father ninian denied it ; nor did [he]81-father ninian propose that [they]2079-they should sit down quietly under the interference . [They]2079-they were only forbidden to preach in [Eshwara]1-eshwara . Therefore [they]2079-they had come , again unanimously , to the resolution of leaving [Eshwara]1-eshwara for the time in a body . It would be a solemn protest ; and [they]2079-they could thus render both to [Cæsar]45-cæsar and to [God]96-god , since [they]2079-they could preach at [other pilgrim stations on [the road]3494-the road]2090-other pilgrim stations on the road . It would be a noble protest which was certain of proving blessed . The words roused no little enthusiasm , mingled with undoubted relief in most cases ; but [Erda]105-erda , standing beside [[her]105-erda cousin]4158-her cousin , said in an undertone , " Did [you]81-father ninian assent to that , [David]190-david ? "[105-erda] " [I]81-father ninian suggested it , "[81-father ninian] [he]81-father ninian answered , in a louder voice , not without some self - satisfaction . " It appeared to [me]81-father ninian to meet the exigencies of the case admirably , and it will be very useful , let [me]81-father ninian tell [you]190-david , at [home]3521-home . It will emphasize the difficulties and dangers [we]2079-they have to contend against . It will show [our]2079-they meek reasonableness , and then-- "[81-father ninian] [he]81-father ninian looked round with a jubilant smile--"it seems to [me]81-father ninian such a beautiful idea that the only result of this attempt to gag [us]2079-they will be that [the thousands of poor benighted souls]4868-the thousands of poor benighted souls will have a chance of hearing the Truth in many places instead of one . "[81-father ninian] But [Erda]105-erda 's voice broke in on the hum of applause almost harshly , filling [the room]3952-the room with its defiance . " [I]105-erda think it cowardly ; [I]105-erda would fight -- if [I]105-erda were [a man]533-a man . "[105-erda] " [You]105-erda would beat [Jean Ziska]184-jean ziska 's drum ! "[71-vincent] laughed [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , rising from the music stool where [he]71-vincent had been holding [Laila]86-laila 's hand under cover of the new song,--an occupation which always made [him]71-vincent feel as if all the wine of life had gone to [his]71-vincent head . " [You]105-erda refused [my]71-vincent sword just now , [Miss Shepherd]105-erda , so [I]71-vincent place [my]71-vincent drumstick at [your]105-erda disposal . "[71-vincent] So , with a reckless gaiety , [he]71-vincent seized on a painted tambourine which [good Mrs. Campbell]152-mrs. campbell had hung as an ornament on the wall,--it was bedaubed with two white lilies and a butterfly rampant,--and catching up a teaspoon from the table , [he]71-vincent began to sing in [his]71-vincent pretty , light - comedy voice , " Oh ! dem golden slippers ! "[71-vincent] while the tambourine , under [his]71-vincent skilful drumming , throbbed to the words:-- [He]71-vincent sang well , [he]71-vincent played better ; and both voice and drumming echoed out through the open windows . " [They]2096-the pilgrims , who were still gathering to the miracles , like moths round a candle are singing in [the missen]4870-the missen , "[2094-the people in the courtyard] said [the people in [the courtyard]386-the courtyard]2094-the people in the courtyard to [the pilgrims , who were still gathering to the miracles , like moths round a candle]2096-the pilgrims , who were still gathering to the miracles , like moths round a candle . " It is not wise to listen ; [folk]661-folk become as [they]661-folk are , if [they]661-folk do . "[2094-the people in the courtyard] [Some of [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims]2097-some of the pilgrims laughed and [some]3712-some stopped [their]3712-some ears ; but even so , the throbbing of the tambourine was in the air . If the twopenny - halfpenny tambourine -- which had been bedaubed with its white lilies and rampant butterfly by [a suburban maiden lady]2100-a suburban maiden lady for a mission sale , and , remaining over from that , had been bought in at half price by [Mrs. Campbell]152-mrs. campbell for the adornment of [her]152-mrs. campbell drawing - room,--had been indeed [Jean Ziska]184-jean ziska 's famous drum , [Eshwara]1-eshwara could hardly have been more restless than it was on the night after [Vincent Dering]71-vincent had sung , " Oh ! dem golden slippers ! "[71-vincent] to its accompaniment . The tune had occurred to [him]71-vincent in an instant , without thought , simply as one [he]71-vincent had sung more than once when doing bones and tambourine in a nigger troupe at a [soldiers]4773-soldiers ' sing - song . [He]71-vincent had meant nothing by ; it and yet the words , fitted [their]3444-the pilgrims environment ; that atmosphere of effort after something beyond , above the real , the actual ; the inevitable climbing of a golden stair , the inevitable wearing of the golden shoes , the inevitable search after the golden gates which , found , will open upon [Paradise]9-paradise . True , [the Paradise]9-paradise differed to each pair of yearning eyes and weary feet ; but the longing for it as a personal gain , spiritual or bodily , was identical . For [Paradise]9-paradise is the Desire of [the World]31-the world still ; whether [men]312-men find it in the good [they]312-men lost , or the Love which lost it for [them]312-men . And in [Eshwara]1-eshwara that night the desire rose strenuously , militantly . [Erda]105-erda , packing [her]105-erda boxes in haste , since [she]105-erda and [[her]105-erda aunt]2103-her aunt had arranged to start with [the others]3977-the others at dawn , felt as if [she]105-erda had , at last , closed [her]105-erda hand firmly on the plough . There could be no looking back now . The golden slippers were on [her]105-erda feet , the golden stairs before [her]105-erda , the golden gates within sight . [She]105-erda had said good - by to [Lance]68-lance without a quiver . [She]105-erda even smiled softly , tenderly , as [she]105-erda set an unopened deal box to go with [[her]105-erda others]2105-her others . It was one which [the Reverend David]190-david had brought with [him]190-david from [England]17-england , and which had been made over to [her]105-erda , not without nods and winks , smiles and suspicions of tears , from [[her]105-erda aunt]2103-her aunt . For it contained the wedding dress . It was a Moravian wedding dress of the old style , to suit [Erda]105-erda 's fancy ; and [she]105-erda had been quite anxious to see the delicate white muslin robe and the quaint little cap , with its bunch of orange blossoms , which was to mark [her]105-erda as both [bride]2107-bride and [matron]2108-matron . But it had seemed a pity , in careful [Mrs. Campbell]152-mrs. campbell 's opinion , to unpack it only to repack it , and run the needless risk of crushing its daintiness . So there in its box it lay still , untouched , unseen . There would be real orange blossoms and to spare , [the girl]481-the girl told [herself]481-the girl with a smile , in [the garden at [Herrnhut]48-herrnhut]2110-the garden at herrnhut ; for so [the summer resting - place of [the mission]2112-the mission]2111-the summer resting - place of the mission had been called in deference to [the Moravian extraction of those who had built [it]2111-the summer resting - place of the mission and started the Christian settlement in [the tiny valley in which [it]2111-the summer resting - place of the mission stood]2114-the tiny valley in which it stood]2113-the moravian extraction of those who had built it and started the christian settlement in the tiny valley in which it stood . This lay some thirty miles up [the Hara]2-the hara , beyond [the first range of hills]2115-the first range of hills ; and [the river]333-the river , fresh from its mad rush from the snows beyond , ran through [it]333-the river slackly , peacefully , before beginning its long , swift , yet smooth , slide down [the dark ravine which cleft [the outer range]2118-the outer range , until it ended in [the plains]2119-the plains at [Eshwara]1-eshwara]2117-the dark ravine which cleft the outer range , until it ended in the plains at eshwara . It was at [Herrnhut]48-herrnhut that , every year , in turns of two months during the hot weather , [the missionaries]621-the missionaries exchanged work in [the bazaars]1796-the bazaars for the lighter labor of [the agricultural settlement]2122-the agricultural settlement . Naturally , therefore , [it]2111-the summer resting - place of the mission was looked on as a sort of [holiday house]2123-holiday house ; but this year it would be something more . [It]2111-the summer resting - place of the mission would be the headquarters of fight , the centre of the resistance which was to use [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner 's order to cease firing as an excuse for a more determined skirmishing . For [it]2111-the summer resting - place of the mission stood right on [[the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims ' road]1648-the pilgrims ' road . Indeed , [Erda]105-erda and [the other rebels]2127-the other rebels would have to travel a good eight - and - twenty miles along [that very road]2128-that very road [itself]2128-that very road before coming to [the slack water]2129-the slack water where [they]2130-they could cross [the river]333-the river by [a ferry]2132-a ferry , and finish [their]2130-they journey through the level fields on [its]2128-that very road further side to [Herrnhut]48-herrnhut , with [[its]48-herrnhut homelike , peaceful surroundings]2133-its homelike , peaceful surroundings . The memory of [them]2130-they came to [Erda]105-erda , making [her]105-erda sense of that inevitable climbing of the golden stair after righteousness more acute ; since [she]105-erda had to face a good - by to [them]2130-they also . And sooner than [she]105-erda had expected , for the breaking up of winter work a week earlier than usual , owing to this secular interference , had made [David]190-david , eager to begin anew , plead for a speedier wedding . So there were only two or three days left , at most . The knowledge , however , brought [her]105-erda no doubt ; it helped [her]105-erda , rather , to a greater certainty . [She]105-erda had done right . [Her]105-erda feet were indeed upon the golden stair ! And in [the other houses of [the mission]2112-the mission]2134-the other houses of the mission , where [everyone]749-everyone was disregarding sleep in the striving after something that was more to [them]749-everyone than sleep , the atmosphere was electric also , the thoughts militant . So [they]2130-they were in [the streets]1469-the streets , [the alleys of [the town]331-the town]2138-the alleys of the town ; for on [the bridge of [boats]2141-boats]2140-the bridge of boats -- that bridge which spanned [the broad expanse of water]2142-the broad expanse of water between [the city]3556-the city and [the great plain of [India]8-india]2144-the great plain of india -- [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims were passing , now , in [an unending stream]2146-an unending stream -- to take up [their]3444-the pilgrims places as near as might be to [the Pool of Immortality , where , with the dawn , the water would rise miraculously for the cleansing of sin]2147-the pool of immortality , where , with the dawn , the water would rise miraculously for the cleansing of sin . " Hârî ! Hârâ ! Hârâ ! Hârî ! "[3444-the pilgrims] The cry was almost incessant , but the eye could see little , for the moon was young , the night dark . " Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! "[3444-the pilgrims] Hour after hour it came , that cry on the dread Creator , the dread Destroyer . Monotonous , patient , almost indifferent , yet absolutely insistent . The golden - shod feet of [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims , after whose souls [the missionaries]621-the missionaries yearned , were on [the golden stair]2150-the golden stair also , and [their]3444-the pilgrims golden gates would open at the ' Cradle of [the Gods]166-the gods ' ; must open , hidden though the goal was by mist when it was day , by darkness when it was night . What matter if it was hidden ? For the gold - shod feet might falter and fall ere that goal was reached ; but the hidden spring of cleansing at [the Pool of Immortality]4072-the pool of immortality was [theirs]2130-they . It would rise at dawn ; rise as it did always , every year . " Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! "[2130-they] What matter Birth or Death , if the finding of [that lost paradise of purity]2152-that lost paradise of purity was certain . Out on [the bridge]373-the bridge , whence the cry came oftenest , there was no doubt regarding this certainty ; but as each weary pair of feet stumbled on the first stones of [the town]331-the town , it stumbled into an atmosphere in which nothing seemed sure , save that there was change ; that [Eshwara]1-eshwara was not what it had been . To begin with , it held [soldiers]4773-soldiers . Wherefore ? And why had [dead women]2156-dead women been sent back to [it]1-eshwara by [Mother Ganges]224-mother ganges to curse [the men whose love had killed]2157-the men whose love had killed [them]2156-dead women ? But what wonder , when the very logs , the fishes , were stolen from [the river nowadays]2158-the river nowadays ; and from [the people]3552-the people also . Then what of this strange new light ? The light which fed on [men]312-men 's brains!--that came and went at pleasure -- that was quite small at first , when but [seven or eight men]2161-seven or eight men had been sacrificed , but which , only an hour or so agone , had showed in a huge ray , feeling here and there through the darkness for [God]96-god knows what , then settling on it , making it impossible to hide aught , prying into the very Holiest of Holies ! Had it not shot into [[Mother Kali]245-mother kali 's very temple]2162-mother kali 's very temple , and shown [the worshippers]2163-the worshippers that two of [her]245-mother kali mighty arms were stuck on with sealing wax ! What [God]96-god would stand that ! And how could [the very Gods]2164-the very gods [themselves]2164-the very gods work miracles if [everybody]939-everybody could see how [they]2164-the very gods were done ? [They]2164-the very gods had already refused to work them for [pious jogi Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth . What wonder ? [The Gods]166-the gods did not like laughter , especially the laughter of [M'lléchas.[10]246-m'lléchas.[10 ] Therefore , who was to tell if the spring would even rise in the Pool ? So [those who were wise]2166-those who were wise would make certain of at least a modicum of salvation , and go straight to the bathing - steps ; since [the river]333-the river , anyhow , must be there . This suggestion of a cautious hedge was diligently spread by [the bathing - ghat priests]2168-the bathing - ghat priests among [the new arrivals]2169-the new arrivals ; who listened patiently . But so [they]2164-the very gods did also to [the other priests whose business it was to scorn the possibility of failure , and to deny the displeasure of [the Gods]166-the gods]2170-the other priests whose business it was to scorn the possibility of failure , and to deny the displeasure of the gods . To say that [jogi Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth had been found out by [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors in one of [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth usual tricks ; that was all . So that [people who wanted the genuine article , and a real , good , old crusted miracle]2171-people who wanted the genuine article , and a real , good , old crusted miracle , had better come as usual to [the Pool]2172-the pool . [The weary - footed , anxious - eyed climbers of the golden stairs]2173-the weary - footed , anxious - eyed climbers of the golden stairs listened patiently , silently , even when [the antagonists]2174-the antagonists began , in vehement quarrel , to bandy threats , and hint at worse portents to come . To [their]2173-the weary - footed , anxious - eyed climbers of the golden stairs experience , [their]2173-the weary - footed , anxious - eyed climbers of the golden stairs hope , it seemed impossible even to dream [their]2173-the weary - footed , anxious - eyed climbers of the golden stairs pilgrimage in vain . The dawn would show , anyhow . So hour by hour , minute by minute , the tide of [pilgrims]1948-pilgrims set citywards till it brimmed over with faith and hope . And these are dangerous things when charity depends on [them]2166-those who were wise , and there are antagonistic claims to every alms . So [Eshwara]1-eshwara was restless . Over in [the gaol]1501-the gaol , also , by which the golden - shod feet passed so closely with [their]2173-the weary - footed , anxious - eyed climbers of the golden stairs heart - stirring cry , it seemed as if [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's thrumming , following as it did on the heels of [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith 's success with the search light , had set what [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon called [his]69-dr. dillon Hosts of [the Devil]4118-the devil in commotion . Indeed , that thrumming was still going on when [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon had gone raging over to conjure [the experimenter]2178-the experimenter , with oaths , to turn off [his]69-dr. dillon confounded bull's - eye at once , or [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners would go out of [their]1510-the prisoners judgment with thinking of the number who would have to die that night in order to keep up the supply of brain power!--just too , as [he]69-dr. dillon had been congratulating [himself]69-dr. dillon that the cholera scare was over . Seventy - two hours , and not a case ! It was too bad ! [Eugene]74-eugene smith , whom [he]69-dr. dillon found on the roof of [[his]69-dr. dillon house]2180-his house playing with coils , batteries , accumulators , had suggested eagerly that if there was real trouble , [he]69-dr. dillon might end it by turning [his]69-dr. dillon light bang on to [the gaol]1501-the gaol , and so reducing it to a paralysis of sheer terror . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , however , had sworn violently that [he]69-dr. dillon would not have the poor wretches frightened unnecessarily , especially when that triumphant cry of those who were free to defy the devil by seeking sanctification before death reminded [them]1510-the prisoners that [they]1510-the prisoners could not -- that [they]1510-the prisoners must die defiled , helpless , hopeless ! That fear was , [he]69-dr. dillon said , in a way dignified , worthy of consideration . And [he]69-dr. dillon did not anticipate trouble unless there was treachery inside or out , though perhaps [he]69-dr. dillon might , as a precaution , ask [Dering]71-vincent for [an extra guard]2182-an extra guard . But when [the latter]336-the latter happened to come in , as [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith 's escort [home]3521-home , while [the doctor]334-the doctor was still [there]3509-there , [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon apparently changed [his]69-dr. dillon mind . Anyhow , [he]69-dr. dillon pooh - poohed [Captain Dering]71-vincent 's offer to send one , saying , the more [you]2187-you could keep [a gaol]4556-a gaol to [yourself]2187-you the better -- or for the matter of that anything else ! So , with a curt good - night to [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith , [he]69-dr. dillon went back to [his]69-dr. dillon work , leaving [Vincent]71-vincent to remark , carelessly , that [Dillon]69-dr. dillon seemed in a bad temper . At which [Muriel]151-muriel smiled . There was something in the air , [she]151-muriel said , conducive to bad temper . [She]151-muriel , [herself]151-muriel , felt [she]151-muriel must soon have quarrelled with [the doctor]334-the doctor 's assumption of knowing better than [anyone else]3731-anyone else ; so it was as well [he]334-the doctor had not stopped to dinner . [Her]151-muriel quarrelsomeness did not , however , extend to [Vincent]71-vincent , who did ; indeed , [she]151-muriel made [herself]151-muriel so tenderly charming and unconsciously friendly towards [him]71-vincent that [he]71-vincent began to accuse [himself]71-vincent of having been too irresponsive of late . The fact of being in love did not preclude friendship for [someone else]3538-someone else , if , indeed , [he]71-vincent was really in love with [Laila Bonaventura]86-laila ? In one way [he]71-vincent knew [himself]71-vincent to be so ; but the idea of treating this love of [his]71-vincent on conventional lines was still repugnant to [him]71-vincent ; the thought of [her]151-muriel , as [[his]71-vincent wife]3429-his wife , barely attractive . So , after a time spent pleasantly enough for those two , [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith went off to [his]74-eugene smith coils , and accumulators , and batteries , half - sulky , half - bored , and wholly ill - used at having to switch off , when [he]74-eugene smith had at least half an hour 's electricity all ready stored for use . [He]74-eugene smith was grumbling over this fact when [Vincent]71-vincent called good - night to [him]74-eugene smith before starting to drive back ; and [he]74-eugene smith answered that but for [fools]4067-fools , who were afraid of going to [their]4067-fools proper place , [he]74-eugene smith might have given [Dering]71-vincent electric light on [the road]3494-the road . " No , thanks ! "[71-vincent] cried [Vincent]71-vincent , gaily , " there 's enough electricity in the air to - night without that . [I]71-vincent believe [your]74-eugene smith machine has leaked , [Smith]74-eugene smith ! [I]71-vincent feel as if [I]71-vincent should give out sparks if [anyone]3948-anyone touched [me]71-vincent ! "[71-vincent] As [he]74-eugene smith drove across [the bridge]373-the bridge [Eshwara]1-eshwara looked as if it were doing that , too . There were lights everywhere , twinkling , little , restless lights . [The very spit]2196-the very spit , usually dark with the darkness of primitive life after sundown , was alive with them ; for [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims were camping there , as elsewhere . Nor were all [the fisher folk]2198-the fisher folk abed as usual , for that , surely , was one of [them]2198-the fisher folk paddling up stream on [a dug - out,--just under the last span of the bridge]2199-a dug - out,--just under the last span of the bridge . [He]74-eugene smith saw [the man]3467-the man distinctly , not five yards from [him]74-eugene smith in the flash of the lamps as [he]74-eugene smith drove past overhead , and wondered what the mischief [the fellow]2201-the fellow was doing at that time of night , going up stream . Something to be ashamed of , no doubt , else why should [he]74-eugene smith have sent the dug - out beyond the circle of light with a swift stroke ? [Truly Father Ninian]247-father ninian was right ; [Eshwara]1-eshwara was not normal . Its pulse beat irregularly , and things were going on which should not be going on-- A sudden shame made [him]74-eugene smith glance at the shadowed pile of [the palace]3477-the palace looming above [the shadowed town]2203-the shadowed town . [It]2204-it was all dark , save for one row of restless , twinkling lights . Those were the little latticed windows of [[Laila]86-laila 's sitting - room]2205-laila 's sitting - room , that was fit for [any king]1594-any king 's favourite . [He]74-eugene smith had seen it already , might see it again at twelve , if [she]86-laila was in one of [her]86-laila reckless moods when [she]86-laila would risk anything for [his]74-eugene smith sake . Truly ! there were things going on!-- But this was between [themselves]2207-themselves ; this could hurt [no one]3741-no one . By and by , of course , [he]74-eugene smith would insist on a commonplace engagement , and a wedding . Yes ! a commonplace wedding . [He]74-eugene smith had , despite [his]74-eugene smith vague repugnance to [her]86-laila origin , made up [his]74-eugene smith mind to that . [No one]3741-no one but [an utter cad]2210-an utter cad could take what [he]74-eugene smith was taking , and then shake [his]74-eugene smith bridle rein and ride away . But for the present , it was the most absolutely perfect bit of romance in [his]74-eugene smith whole life . [He]74-eugene smith could not , would not give it up . [Laila]86-laila was right ! This was the essence . As a rule , [people]3436-people mixed love , diluted it , were vaguely ashamed of its absorbing influence . But when [you]2212-you came to analyze even the diluted feeling , its virtue lay in this irrational content , this desire for nothing better than this best of pleasures -- this paradise of [a woman]3949-a woman 's or [a man]533-a man 's love . [He]74-eugene smith laughed , suddenly , at the memory of [Laila]86-laila 's quick grasp of [his]74-eugene smith meaning when [Muriel]151-muriel had overheard [his]74-eugene smith remark about the time . Such quickness , in the latter , would have made [him]74-eugene smith revolt from it ; but with [Laila]86-laila it was different . A passionate gratitude to [the girl to whom fear , remorse , the very possibility of change seemed unknown]2215-the girl to whom fear , remorse , the very possibility of change seemed unknown , rose up and claimed [him]74-eugene smith . [Dear little girl]2216-dear little girl ! [She]86-laila was so absolutely single - minded in [her]86-laila love for [him]74-eugene smith . How could [anyone]3948-anyone expect [him]74-eugene smith to forego the luxury of such love yet awhile ? In thinking [Laila]86-laila single - minded , [Vincent]71-vincent thought the truth , so far as [he]74-eugene smith was concerned . If love , passionate as [Juliet]100-juliet 's , and far more innocent in one way , far more rusé in another , ever existed , [hers]2218-she was that love . Nevertheless , its very integrity made [her]2218-she curiously cunning in regard to anything which threatened to disturb that idyll in [the garden]433-the garden . So , at that very moment , when [Vincent]71-vincent looked up at [her]2218-she windows asserting [her]2218-she absolute lack of pretence and single - mindedness , [she]2218-she was pitting [her]2218-she wits against [old Akbar Khân]110-akbar in a manner worthy of [[her]2218-she grandmother]3654-her grandmother , [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum ; since [Akbar]110-akbar , far more than [[her]2218-she guardian]1606-her guardian , was to be feared . [The latter]336-the latter , [honest man]3711-honest man , went to [his]110-akbar bed , beyond [the chapel]1291-the chapel , at ten of the clock precisely ; but [Akbar]110-akbar , who from ancient habit was given to prowling about at night , and napping in odd corners , had many chances of discovery . During the last few days , however , when [she]2218-she , for [her]2218-she own purposes , had let [him]110-akbar talk , [he]110-akbar had become so garrulous regarding [his]110-akbar past that [she]2218-she had recognized in [him]110-akbar an unscrupulous confidant , with whom , in face of the possibility of requiring one , it was wise to remain on terms . So , as [she]2218-she lounged on the sofa , [she]2218-she listened to [his]110-akbar endless talk with tolerance . " Nay ! "[2218-she] [she]2218-she interrupted at last . " If , as [thou]4873-thou sayest [she]2218-she will , [she]2218-she brings [me]2218-she more dresses and jewels , [she]2218-she may call [me]2218-she [Begum]125-anâri begum , and hint at [my]2218-she being one , really , a thousand times over ! Why not ? [Begum]125-anâri begum and [Princess]4874-princess are the same , and [[my]2218-she great - grandmother in [Italy]11-italy]4875-my great - grandmother in italy was that . [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan told [me]2218-she so to - day . "[2218-she] The memory of [the old man]3483-the old man 's voice , when , with new - found courage , [she]2218-she had questioned [him]110-akbar concerning those old days , made [her]2218-she eyes soft . Yes ! [he]110-akbar would , [he]110-akbar must understand . So , by and by , when [Vincent]71-vincent and [she]2218-she were tired of playing Romeo and [Juliet]100-juliet ( the story of [the star - crossed lovers]2226-the star - crossed lovers had been [her]2218-she only reading since [Vincent]71-vincent had taken to quoting so much from it ) [they]2227-they would make [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan play [Friar Laurence]248-friar laurence , and marry [them]2228-them on the sly . That would be so much more amusing than a regular wedding . [He]110-akbar could not refuse , since [he]110-akbar had once loved as [she]2218-she loved . [You]2229-you could hear that in [his]110-akbar voice ; after how many years?--fifty or sixty ! And [the Princess]2230-the princess had , of course , loved also in exactly the same way . [Laila]86-laila felt sure of it . That curious , inexpressible feeling had come to [her]86-laila also . [Laila]86-laila , trying to formulate that feeling , slipping [her]86-laila heel idly in and out of [her]86-laila dainty little bronze shoe as [she]86-laila lounged , suddenly remembered [Vincent]71-vincent 's song to the tambourine , and laughed . That was it ! " Golden feet upon [a golden stair]4876-a golden stair . "[96-god] That expressed it exactly . Two pair of feet going side by side up [a golden stair]4876-a golden stair , to golden gates . So contented . Ah , [God]96-god ! how content ! Seeking something , claiming something , yet still content . That feeling came , sometimes , when [you]2229-you were saying [your]2229-you prayers . A sort of yearning for , a sort of satisfaction in , something that was not [you]2229-you ; so , surely if it came then , there could be no harm in it . Harm ! [The very sisters]2232-the very sisters allowed that [you]2229-you must love [the man [you]2229-you were going to marry]2233-the man you were going to marry . And [she]86-laila and [Vincent]71-vincent would be married by and by and live happily , for that was better than having a " statue of pure gold "[86-laila] erected to [you]2229-you ! In the meantime , secrecy , so long as [Vincent]71-vincent wished to play [Romeo]99-romeo and [Juliet]100-juliet , was [her]86-laila cue ; therefore , the more [she]86-laila could blind [old Akbar]110-akbar , the more [he]110-akbar could be turned on a wrong track , the better . Especially when the turning was so delightfully ridiculous ! [She]86-laila managed , however , not to laugh [her]86-laila childish love of mischief into [Mumtâza Mahal]134-mumtâza mahal 's very face when , after much shrinking into white sheets held up as screens , and quick cuddlings into corners at the faintest suspicion of a possible peep , [that good lady]2234-that good lady , in [her]2234-that good lady very , very best pink satin continuations , was ushered in through [the dark deserted passages of [the palace]3477-the palace]2235-the dark deserted passages of the palace , to [[Laila]86-laila 's boudoir]2237-laila 's boudoir . For , despite the amusement , [the girl]481-the girl 's heart was beating fast with determination to climb [her]481-the girl golden stairs without interruption . So [she]86-laila allowed [herself]86-laila to be kow - towed to , and called [Begum - sahiba]125-anâri begum and [she]86-laila accepted the new dress and jewels without protest . Eagerly , in fact , since they were far more gorgeous than the first , and caught [her]86-laila taste better . The former , indeed , had been [Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's own choice , dictated by [his]89-roshan acquired knowledge of the sort of things mem - sahibs admired ; these latter were [[her]86-laila grandmother]3654-her grandmother 's , purely , entirely oriental . The difference was great . Put briefly , this was the costume in which [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum had flouted [the Nawab]3674-the nawab , the other that in which [she]2234-that good lady had caught [Bun]121-bun - avatâr - sahib - avatâr 's fancy . [Laila]86-laila took up one of the heavy , gorgeous , glittering garments . It smelt strongly of musk , attar of roses , and jasmin , and [she]86-laila snuffed at it with a smile . That was ever so much better than the dull lavender water , which was the only scent [[her]86-laila guardian]1606-her guardian said [a lady]1059-a lady could use . [Vincent]71-vincent would like that ; [he]71-vincent , like [she]86-laila did , loved strong scents . If only the stupid old frumpish thing would go away in time , [she]86-laila would put on that dress at once , and so give [him]89-roshan pleasure . That was all [her]86-laila thought . As [she]86-laila sat , with a happy smile , [her]86-laila face half - buried in a tiny , three - cornered corselet of scarlet net embroidered in seed pearls , [Mumtâza]134-mumtâza mahal and [Akbar Khân]110-akbar winked at each other ; and [Laila]86-laila 's sharp eyes , catching this , brimmed over with laughter . [She]86-laila felt glad the rest of [her]86-laila face was hidden , until [she]86-laila was grave enough to reply graciously to the hints , the suggestions ; for [Mumtâza]134-mumtâza mahal had been bound over by oaths not to go too fast , and [she]86-laila obeyed [her]86-laila instructions . Even so , [Akbar Khân]110-akbar , listening with folded hands in a mantis - like attitude , [his]110-akbar angles all crushed together into humility , wondered if [he]110-akbar was standing on [his]110-akbar head or [his]110-akbar heels , as [he]110-akbar heard [Laila]86-laila admit , gravely , that [she]86-laila was certainly , in a way , [the head of [the family]3708-the family]2243-the head of the family , in that [she]86-laila possessed [[its]3708-the family land]2245-its land ; but that , of course , [Roshan]89-roshan was really [the heir]2246-the heir . That it had given [her]86-laila great gratification to see how thoroughly [he]89-roshan had adopted English ways . That , of course , it would be impossible for [him]89-roshan to marry [an uneducated cow of [a girl]1159-a girl]2247-an uneducated cow of a girl . Here , for a moment , [she]86-laila had relapsed to sincerity in order to remark that it must be impossible to love [a person [you]2250-you had not seen]2249-a person you had not seen , and that for [her]86-laila part , [she]86-laila knew in an instant if [she]86-laila was going to like or dislike [people]3436-people . If the latter , [she]86-laila tried never to see [them]3436-people , really , again . Then , remembering [her]86-laila part , [she]86-laila had resumed it hastily by saying that no doubt [she]86-laila would see more of [[her]86-laila cousin,--who]2252-her cousin,--who , by the way , was very nice - looking,--in the future , as [he]89-roshan was quite in society . [Old Mumtâza]249-old mumtâza had hard work at this juncture to prevent [herself]249-old mumtâza from cracking all [her]249-old mumtâza finger - joints over [the girl]481-the girl 's head for luck , and wishing [her]249-old mumtâza a numerous offspring ; while [Akbar]110-akbar gave a gasp that was not all pleasure . [He]110-akbar felt that [he]110-akbar was being rushed , that the crisis might come before [he]110-akbar was ready for it . At this rate , [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan would have no chance of dying . At this rate , [Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's castle in the air must topple over from sheer lack of foundation to such [a lofty structure]2254-a lofty structure . As [he]110-akbar trotted back beside [[Mumtâza]249-old mumtâza 's curtained dhooli]2255-mumtâza 's curtained dhooli to [that little parasite of [a house against the palace wall , where [he]110-akbar knew [Roshan]89-roshan was waiting for the upshot of the interview]2257-a house against the palace wall , where he knew roshan was waiting for the upshot of the interview]2256-that little parasite of a house against the palace wall , where he knew roshan was waiting for the upshot of the interview , [his]110-akbar one consolation was that bow - strings were out of fashion ! In truth , there was [no more restless man in [Eshwara]1-eshwara]2258-no more restless man in eshwara that night than [Roshan Khân]89-roshan . The desire for [this paradise]2259-this paradise had grown overwhelming , and as [he]110-akbar listened to [[his]110-akbar grandmother]530-his grandmother , while [Akbar]110-akbar pointed each triumphant appeal of [the old lady]3806-the old lady 's with a helpless " [Gereeb]250-gereeb - pun - wâs , "[110-akbar] [his]110-akbar face grew pale with emotion ; until , at the mention of [his]110-akbar good looks and [Laila]86-laila 's desire to see [him]110-akbar , [he]110-akbar turned fiercely to the go - between , and bade [him]110-akbar fix a time ; the sooner the better ! [Akbar]110-akbar felt inclined to tell the truth then . To admit that [he]110-akbar had never breathed a word of [Roshan]89-roshan 's pretensions to [the Miss - sahiba]4385-the miss - sahiba and that , so far , the negotiations only existed in [his]110-akbar own imaginings . But the look on [Roshan]89-roshan 's face -- [he]89-roshan had seen it often in [his]89-roshan youth in connection with [women]479-women , and sacks , and bow - strings -- reduced [him]89-roshan to protestations . [He]89-roshan would do [his]89-roshan best , [he]89-roshan said , but with [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan it would be difficult to manage . [Roshan]89-roshan strode about [the little courtyard]2264-the little courtyard like a wild beast in a cage , biting [his]89-roshan mustache , and thinking . Then [he]89-roshan turned to [the old phrase - monger]2265-the old phrase - monger . " [I]89-roshan have settled it . Before dawn to - morrow -- not this dawn , that is too nigh on [us]4877-we now -- but the next , [thou]4878-thou shalt let [me]89-roshan into [the garden]433-the garden . [Thou]4878-thou knowest the little balcony which was not lit up ? [I]89-roshan will stay there , waiting , till [she]4880-she come for an early walk among the flowers . That can be managed . Then , if [the coast]4881-the coast is clear , [we]4877-we can meet and talk . If not , there is no harm done , for [I]89-roshan can slip into [the stream]831-the stream and swim back . That will be best , since it is not possible by day , and at night [the mems]4883-the mems do not receive [visitors]4884-visitors , as [we]4877-we do , without reproach . "[89-roshan] [Roshan]89-roshan 's knowledge of etiquette was sound , yet at that very moment [Laila]86-laila , ablaze with gold and jewels , was meeting [[her]86-laila lover]475-her lover 's eyes with a happy laugh . " What 's in a dress ? "[86-laila] [she]86-laila paraphrased , " it is no part of [me]86-laila ! "[86-laila] Was it not ? Never had [Vincent]71-vincent seen [her]86-laila look like this ; so absolutely desirable , so perfectly adorable . [He]71-vincent caught [her]86-laila in [his]71-vincent arms and kissed [her]86-laila . The heavy scent upon [her]86-laila dress assailed [him]71-vincent . [She]86-laila looked up into [his]71-vincent eyes and laughed . " But trust [me]86-laila , [gentleman]4885-gentleman , [I]86-laila 'll prove more true , "[86-laila] [she]86-laila whispered , " than [those who have more cunning to be strange]4886-those who have more cunning to be strange . "[86-laila] " [Juliet]100-juliet ! "[71-vincent] [he]71-vincent whispered back , lost in [his]71-vincent own mad passion . " [Juliet]100-juliet ! "[71-vincent] [Their]2267-them gold - shod feet were upon the golden stairs ; the gates of [Paradise]9-paradise were before [them]2267-them . " Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! "[86-laila] The cry was incessant now , for there was a glint of light in the east ; and the hosts of [pilgrims]1948-pilgrims to the ' Cradle of the Gods ' were cramming , almost to solidity , [each street]2269-each street and alley in [Eshwara]1-eshwara which could be said , by however long and tortuous a detour , to give access to that small tank where , at dawn , the miraculous waters of cleansing would rise , as [they]2267-them always did on this , the great Day of Atonement . In the sea of slightly upturned faces , upturned in the vain hope of seeing over the heads of [those in front]2270-those in front , the most noticeable thing was the expression of mingled eagerness and patience . And this was most noticeable in [those who stood nearest to the bamboo railing which had been erected ( in [a square some four feet from the first step downwards]2272-a square some four feet from the first step downwards ) as a precaution against a dangerous rush on all sides]2271-those who stood nearest to the bamboo railing which had been erected ( in a square some four feet from the first step downwards ) as a precaution against a dangerous rush on all sides ; and in consequence , a dangerous crush on [those steep steps]2273-those steep steps . The only entrance to [them]2267-them , therefore , was by a sort of double sheep - pen at [the end nearest [the town]331-the town]2274-the end nearest the town , by means of which , when the time came , [some fifty bathers]2276-some fifty bathers would be admitted to [the railed square from [the inner pen]2278-the inner pen]2277-the railed square from the inner pen , [their]2276-some fifty bathers places in which would be taken by the fifty in [the outer one]2279-the outer one ; [[their]2276-some fifty bathers places]2280-their places , in turn , being filled by fifty from [the general crowd]2281-the general crowd . By which [double check no more than fifty]2282-double check no more than fifty could stand at one time with no barrier between [their]2276-some fifty bathers mortality and immortality ! The railing itself was guarded every two yards by [a yellow - legged constable]2283-a yellow - legged constable , and at [the sheep - pens]2284-the sheep - pens stood [the two European police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd]2285-the two european police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd lay . [[Their]2285-the two european police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd assistant]2286-their assistant stood at the exit gate at the other end , and [their]2285-the two european police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd three white helmets showed strangely conspicuous amongst the bare or saffron - turbaned heads . The two at [the sheep - pens]2284-the sheep - pens were talking and laughing to [each other]3586-each other as [Englishmen]3816-englishmen will before business begins ; talking and laughing [London]34-london talk , for [one of [them]2285-the two european police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd]2290-one of them was fresh from home furlough , and had only been detailed for this special duty , on [his]2290-one of them way up [country]2291-country . " Yes ! [I]2290-one of them had a jolly day , "[2290-one of them] [he]2290-one of them was saying . " [The dear old Heath]4887-the dear old heath was looking just as it always did . It was like being born again to come back to [the whole caboodle -- [Aunt Sallies]251-aunt sallies]4888-the whole caboodle -- aunt sallies , [Tommy Dods]252-tommy dods , [Welshers]4889-welshers , and the lot -- and then the enclosure-- "[2290-one of them] A sudden sway in [the crowd]4412-the crowd made [him]2290-one of them look round hastily at [his]2290-one of them own . It was all correct ; so many yards this way , so many that , with yellow legs marking [the yards]2293-the yards , and those three white helmets marking the limits within which regeneration was legal . The sway ceased . The moment had not yet come , though slowly , surely , the light grew , to give the great mass of bronze faces a greyish , corpse - like tint , while , half way up the sky behind [them]2285-the two european police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd , the serrated edge of the sacred snows grew pale , and cold , and stern , like the very face of Death itself . " Hârî ! Hârâ ! Hârâ ! Hârî ! "[2285-the two european police - officers in whose hands the peace and order of the vast crowd] There was a note of anxiety in the cry now ; for the shadow thrown by [the tall houses which hemmed in [the wide courtyard]2295-the wide courtyard]2294-the tall houses which hemmed in the wide courtyard was growing paler , and in another minute , at most , the twelve - foot square of cleansing water , which was all the Gods vouchsafed , must surely begin to rise and show at the bottom of those worn stone steps -- worn by [generations on generations of golden - shod feet seeking immortality]2296-generations on generations of golden - shod feet seeking immortality . " Stand back , please ! Not yet ! "[2297-the multitude] came an English voice , inaudible for the rhythmic roar of [the multitude]2297-the multitude ; but the raised riding whip was sufficient . The eagerness died out for a moment from those nearest faces , lost in a cheerful obedience , a respectful salaam or two , a general acquiescence . " [I]2298-the other englishman wish those devils of [priests]1963-priests would turn on the tap , "[2298-the other englishman] remarked [the other Englishman]2298-the other englishman with a yawn . " Yes ! "[3896-the first speaker] answered [the first speaker]3896-the first speaker ; " if [you]2298-the other englishman are on duty , next year , [I]3896-the first speaker 'd insist on the curtain being rung up at the bill time . It is rough on [the audience]566-the audience ; especially when [they]566-the audience do n't cat - call ! "[3896-the first speaker] [He]3896-the first speaker gave an imitation of a [London]34-london gallery 's sign of impatience , which made some of [the golden - shod ones]2300-the golden - shod ones stare ; for the rhythmic roar had died down in one of those sudden silences which seize upon humanity even when in [masses]2301-masses . So that a faint " rumpa - tum - tum - rumpa - tum - tum "[3896-the first speaker] was distinctly audible from far . It was the tom - tom of [the old Brahmin]2302-the old brahmin , whom [Lance Carlyon]68-lance had seen selling [the endless circles of cut papers as a whole pantheon of Gods]2303-the endless circles of cut papers as a whole pantheon of gods . It is an eminently disturbing sound , that ceaseless , insistent throb of a tom - tom , which has no end , no beginning ; which holds ever in its beat the necessity for something more ; for another repetition , and yet another . So , on its ceaselessness , broke in again that swaying , pulsing roar of many voices . " Hârî ! Hârâ ! Life - Death - Creator - Destroyer ! "[2304-the man who had just come out from england] " Something must have gone wrong with the ball - cock , and as usual , [the plumber]4892-the plumber will be ' in directly from another little job , ' "[2304-the man who had just come out from england] said [the man who had just come out from [England]17-england]2304-the man who had just come out from england , reminiscently . [He]2304-the man who had just come out from england had gone [there]3509-there to settle [[his]2304-the man who had just come out from england wife]3429-his wife and bairns in [a jerry - built villa near [London]34-london]2307-a jerry - built villa near london ; so the memory of something beyond the iniquities of [the plumber]4892-the plumber -- those Borgias of modern life , dealing death unchecked , undiscovered -- made [his]2304-the man who had just come out from england eyes pass beyond [the crowd]4412-the crowd , pass the spires of the clustered temples , and settle on the still dark , western sky , over whose curved edge lay the goal of [his]2304-the man who had just come out from england solitary feet , the end of [his]2304-the man who had just come out from england pilgrimage , the cradle of [his]2304-the man who had just come out from england divinities . " Stand back , please ! not yet ! "[2304-the man who had just come out from england] came [his]2304-the man who had just come out from england order again ; and once more eagerness died down to obedience . Once more that cry on [the Creator]1359-the creator , [the Destroyer]1731-the destroyer , ended in that insistent , restless beat of the old god - selling Brahmin 's drum . It was a strange scene . Above , was the growing light of day ; below , the square stone font of immortality , and between [them]2312-them [a clamouring crowd]2313-a clamouring crowd , [a careless few]2314-a careless few . And between [them]2312-them what ? A light railing of bamboo , the dignity that doth hedge an empire . That was all . And now , with a sudden access of light , came the quick indrawing breath of [thousands]2315-thousands to voice a sort of sharp , short sob , followed by an instant 's silence . Then , long , soft , with the hush in it of some huge wave far out at [sea]4285-sea which swallows up a lesser one , the out - going breath of [those thousands]2317-those thousands voiced a sigh . For [the pool]2172-the pool was still empty , though the dawn had come . Something was wrong . Seriously wrong , to judge by [one English face]2319-one english face , as it turned to give a look round , then settled on [another English face]2320-another english face . " There 's something up -- God knows what -- [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner feared a row , [you]4894-you know . [You]4894-you 'd better go to [the Fort]3493-the fort and ask [Dering]71-vincent to send [us]4896-us down [every man [he]71-vincent can]4897-every man he can ; [men]312-men , [you]4894-you understand , not sabres -- as yet . And tell [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , [he]84-pidar narâyan 's a host in [himself]84-pidar narâyan with these pilgrims,--Ramanund too , [you]4894-you might get [him,--we]84-pidar narâyan want anyone who can help [the crowd]4412-the crowd to keep its temper , though [I]2320-another english face do n't expect [he]84-pidar narâyan 'd be much good -- and there 's [no one else]4534-no one else . [Inspector]4901-inspector ! "[2320-another english face] here [the police officer]2321-the police officer turned to a silver - laced turban beside the outer pen , " leave that in charge of [Govinda]253-govinda and Suchet -- Stay ! [Shiv - deo]144-shiv will be better ; [he]144-shiv is [a high - caste Brahmin]4902-a high - caste brahmin . And [you]4894-you go and send [every twice - born constable [you]4894-you 've got]4903-every twice - born constable you 've got , and can trust , to [every alley]4904-every alley and street that leads [here]3395-here ; for there will be an awful crush when [those in front]2270-those in front do n't move on . And-- "[2321-the police officer] [he]2321-the police officer wrinkled [his]2321-the police officer forehead in hasty thought--"have [we]4907-we [anyone connected with [the temple priests]4909-the temple priests]4908-anyone connected with the temple priests , someone [they]4909-the temple priests can trust ? Ah ! [Annant]254-annant , of [course,--the very man]4910-course,--the very man ! Send [him]4910-course,--the very man to find out if there is anything really wrong ; and-- "[2321-the police officer] [he]2321-the police officer lowered [his]2321-the police officer voice , " if it is anything to do with the siphon , or whatever it is , get [workmen]4911-workmen and set it straight -- pour water down -- anything ! Only there must be a miracle . And be quick . If [this crowd]4912-this crowd gets impatient -- God help it ! "[2321-the police officer] The last was to [himself]2321-the police officer as [he]2321-the police officer looked round [the solid packed mass of humanity]2322-the solid packed mass of humanity . There was no sigh of impatience in it as yet ; only eagerness . " And mind , "[2321-the police officer] [he]2321-the police officer added , " no truncheons drawn till [I]2321-the police officer [myself]2321-the police officer give the order . "[2321-the police officer] The word passed in a low tone round the square of authority , and that done , the head of [it]2323-it pulled out [his]2321-the police officer cigar case . [He]2321-the police officer might as well smoke while [he]2321-the police officer could . [The crowd]4412-the crowd watched [him]2321-the police officer , vaguely interested at [his]2321-the police officer lack of interest in what was coming , until a faint forward sweep , a half - hearted shout came from behind ; from those upturned faces which could not even see [an Englishman]1903-an englishman lighting [his]1903-an englishman cigar . " Not yet ! Stand back ! "[336-the latter] said [the latter]336-the latter again , as the pressure on the sheep pen grew . " [Lo]123-lo ! [brother]4625-brother , "[253-govinda] said [big Govinda]253-govinda , [a Sikh from [Patiala]49-patiala]2328-a sikh from patiala , as [he]253-govinda thrust [him]2321-the police officer back gently , " have patience awhile . "[253-govinda] [Shiv - deo]144-shiv , taller even than [Govinda]253-govinda , [a Saraswati Brahmin]2329-a saraswati brahmin , if ever there was one , at the other side of the pen , twirled [his]2321-the police officer mustache airily , and laughed . " Nay , [Govinda]253-govinda , "[253-govinda] [he]253-govinda called , " let [the beggar]4753-the beggar in . [He]4753-the beggar seeks but to drown vermin . "[253-govinda] The rude jest served its turn , after the manner of [policemen]1514-policemen 's jokes all over [the world]404-the world . [The crowd close at hand]2332-the crowd close at hand tittered , caught up the cue , amused itself with additions ; and [those behind]2333-those behind forgot the great question in curiosity . But not for long . " Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! "[2335-a forward crowd] The roar of relief rose up tumultuously , the mass of [people]3436-people swayed with that curious sidelong motion of [a forward crowd]2335-a forward crowd , as , in the clear light , a trickle of water showed through the crevices of the paving stones at the bottom of the tank . " Look out ! "[2336-the englishman] shouted [the Englishman]2336-the englishman ; but remonstrance in words was useless in that storm of sound . [So big Govinda]253-govinda promptly snatched [two intruders]2337-two intruders out of [his]253-govinda pen , like puppies , by the scruff of [their]2337-two intruders necks , one in each hand ; and [Shiv]144-shiv - deo , choosing out [the nearest low - caste man]2338-the nearest low - caste man unerringly , caught [him]2338-the nearest low - caste man in [his]2338-the nearest low - caste man arms like [a baby]751-a baby , and literally tossed [him]2338-the nearest low - caste man on to the heads of [the crowd]4412-the crowd , with a shout which , even in that uproar , could be heard of [some in that nearest crush]2341-some in that nearest crush . " [Brahmins]4917-brahmins first , [washerman]4918-washerman ! [Thy]4917-brahmins sort can bathe in the suds of [our]4919-our clothes ! "[2343-a washerman] And those who heard , ducked , and when [the victim]2342-the victim -- who was not [a washerman]2343-a washerman -- fell amongst [them]4412-the crowd , hustled and silenced [him]2342-the victim , and nodded to [the big man whose claim to dignity]2344-the big man whose claim to dignity was writ so plain upon [his]2344-the big man whose claim to dignity face . But despite ready wit and sheer strength , [one determined fellow]2345-one determined fellow would have made good [his]2345-one determined fellow entrance , and so served as a bell - wether to that overwhelming flock , if a white hand and arm with silver buttons on the cuff -- holding a silver - mounted hunting - crop , clubbed savagely short -- had not come down - glinting in the first sunray like a sword -- clear on the bare head as [it]2346-it ducked under the barrier . [The intruder]2347-the intruder , [a big burly devotee]2348-a big burly devotee , dropped on [his]2347-the intruder face like a stone ; then , to [the striker]2349-the striker 's relief , sat up , and apparently howled ; apparently , because that rhythmic roar smothered all individual sound . " Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! Hârî ! "[2348-a big burly devotee] Suddenly , as it had begun , it stopped ; for that faint inrush of water had stopped also ; stopped , hesitated , then sunk out of sight again with a sort of drowning gurgle that came as an accompaniment to the only other sound ; the insistent throbbing of the old God - maker 's drum in the distance . " Not enough pressure ! "[2321-the police officer] murmured [the police officer]2321-the police officer to [himself]2321-the police officer , judging that an attempt had been made to fill the tank in some new way . Then [he]2321-the police officer frowned . There would be pressure enough and to spare among [the crowd]4412-the crowd soon , most likely . What could be done to prevent it ? " Halt ! by [your]2349-the striker right -- single file ! "[2321-the police officer] The order came , far back , from [the widest street]2352-the widest street , and it was full ten minutes ere [Lance Carlyon]68-lance , with a following of [Sikh pioneers , armed with spades and picks]2353-sikh pioneers , armed with spades and picks , could edge through [the crowd]4412-the crowd , though it still yielded room to authority without a murmur . [He]68-lance had been on [his]68-lance way with [a fatigue party]2355-a fatigue party to finish clearing [the camp]3490-the camp , when [the assistant superintendent of police]2357-the assistant superintendent of police had met [him]68-lance , in [the bazaar]372-the bazaar , and told [him]68-lance [he]68-lance was wanted . " Send [four of [[your]2349-the striker men]4921-your men]4920-four of your men to clear the mud from the crevices of the stones , "[2321-the police officer] said [the police officer]2321-the police officer , seizing on a possible diversion gladly , " it will serve to keep [the crowd]4412-the crowd amused till [Dering]71-vincent brings [[his]71-vincent men]4923-his men down . "[2321-the police officer] As [the four stalwart pioneers]2360-the four stalwart pioneers stepped to [their]2360-the four stalwart pioneers work of making miracles , a stir of expectation ran through those first rows who could see . " Surely , "[2360-the four stalwart pioneers] [they]2360-the four stalwart pioneers said to [each other]3586-each other , " if [the Masters]4924-the masters took the job in hand , [the Gods]3472-the gods must needs send the water . "[2360-the four stalwart pioneers] " Of a surety ! "[144-shiv] said [Shiv - deo]144-shiv , catching the comment . " Do not [the Gods]166-the gods always befriend [the bold]4926-the bold ? Do not [we]4927-we , of [Harriana]50-harriana , find [the sacred river]4928-the sacred river which [the devils]4620-the devils hid , though [we]4927-we have to dig [three - hundred - feet wells]4930-three - hundred - feet wells to find it ? "[144-shiv] This allusion to the extraordinarily deep wells dug by [the peasantry]2362-the peasantry in [the almost rainless tract beneath which , so the legend goes , [the river Saraswati]2364-the river saraswati still runs]2363-the almost rainless tract beneath which , so the legend goes , the river saraswati still runs , passed from mouth to mouth consolingly . Yea , if [devils]2365-devils hid water , [men]312-men found it . Why not [these men]2367-these men ? since nothing was impossible to a miracle . The sun was shining broadly now , as if it had been up for hours , and showed , far as the eye could reach down [every lane and street and alley]2368-every lane and street and alley , nothing but that sea of upturned faces converging to one centre ; wonderfully still , wonderfully patient . " [I]68-lance wish [someone]498-someone would stop that cursed drum , "[68-lance] said [Lance]68-lance , suddenly , " it 's enough to give [anyone]3948-anyone the fidgets . [I]68-lance feel myself-- "[68-lance] [he]68-lance broke off , and [his]68-lance memory going back to [his]68-lance jesting remark to [Erda]105-erda , [his]68-lance young face clouded . Was it possible [he]68-lance should never see [her]105-erda again ? Was it possible that [the Reverend David]190-david was to claim [[his]190-david paradise]2369-his paradise ? [He]68-lance felt savage at the very thought , impatient , full of an almost righteous anger at everything , especially [the drum - banger]2370-the drum - banger for making such an infernal noise . And now , far back as before , [an English voice]2371-an english voice could be heard giving an order . It was to loosen scabbards this time , and [the police officer]2321-the police officer looked up hastily . It meant that , for the first time , [the crowd]4412-the crowd must be hesitating in its quick obedience to command ; perhaps because [most of [the troopers]2375-the troopers]2374-most of the troopers were [Mahomedans]255-mahomedans . " [I]2376-the man responsible for peace and order hope [they]2375-the troopers 'll get through without using [them]2375-the troopers , "[2376-the man responsible for peace and order] said [the man responsible for peace and order]2376-the man responsible for peace and order , " but , steady ! please , in case of a rush . Remember that if [we]4933-we yield more foot - room , [someone]498-someone must fall ; then there will be [the devil]4118-the devil to pay . At present [they]2375-the troopers are so tight packed [they]2375-the troopers ca n't . "[2376-the man responsible for peace and order] That , indeed , was the position . So long as authority could prevent those few yards of clear space about the pool being encroached upon , there was safety . So the barrier of [men]312-men waited anxiously . But no rush came ; the reason of this being made clear when the file of [troopers]2378-troopers appeared , led by [old Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , who had joined [the party at the crucial moment]2379-the party at the crucial moment , and piloted [them]2375-the troopers through [the crowd]4412-the crowd , which gave way to [[his]84-pidar narâyan well - known figure]2381-his well - known figure with absolute alacrity . [He]84-pidar narâyan turned at the entrance , to hold up [his]84-pidar narâyan hand in priestly fashion . " Patience , [[my]84-pidar narâyan children]3587-my children ! "[84-pidar narâyan] [he]84-pidar narâyan said sternly . " Tarry [ye]3587-my children [the Lord]3426-the lord 's leisure ! Let [Him]533-a man do what seemeth [Him]533-a man good ! "[84-pidar narâyan] The idea , familiar to the least of [them]2375-the troopers , brought instant assent and a sort of relieved sigh from [those who heard it]2382-those who heard it . Here was something [they]2375-the troopers could understand . [A man]533-a man , set apart from [others]569-others by [his]533-a man dress , [his]533-a man life , [his]533-a man invariable assumption of authority , [his]533-a man unquestioned claim to be mediator between [the dim , inaccessible Creator]2385-the dim , inaccessible creator and [[his]533-a man creatures]2386-his creatures , to be [interpreter of the hidden Mind]2387-interpreter of the hidden mind . But [the police officer]2321-the police officer heaved [his]2321-the police officer sigh of relief over the appearance of more matter . [His]2321-the police officer barrier could now be one of [men]312-men , standing shoulder to shoulder . And such a barrier would soon be needed , since [this latest contingent]2390-this latest contingent brought discouraging news . [The priests]1923-the priests were helpless . The secret supply had somehow been tampered with , but where , not even [they]1923-the priests could tell without help . And though [they]2375-the troopers had sent , long before dawn , to both [Am - ma]131-am - ma and [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu -- [the only two men likely to know anything or be able to do anything]2392-the only two men likely to know anything or be able to do anything -- [neither could be found]2393-neither could be found . " And wo n't be , "[71-vincent] interrupted [Vincent]71-vincent , suddenly remembering , as [he]71-vincent listened , what [he]71-vincent had seen the night before . " [They]2392-the only two men likely to know anything or be able to do anything are most likely in the plot ; one of [them]2392-the only two men likely to know anything or be able to do anything , at any rate , was going up [the Hâri]51-the hâri in [a dug - out]4938-a dug - out late last night . "[71-vincent] " Not [Am - ma]131-am - ma , "[68-lance] put in [Lance]68-lance . " [He]2321-the police officer started before that to go up [the Hâra]52-the hâra and pilot down [a raft]4939-a raft for [the forest officer]4940-the forest officer . [I]68-lance met [him]2321-the police officer as [I]68-lance came back to dinner . "[68-lance] " Well , [he]2321-the police officer is not get - at - able anyhow , and that 's all [we]4941-we have to consider , "[2321-the police officer] said [the police officer]2321-the police officer . " Briefly , the miracle is off the bill . Now , how the deuce are [we]4941-we to get [the audience]566-the audience to go away peacefully ? "[2321-the police officer] " Perhaps if [I]163-ramanund , as [a fellow - countryman]4943-a fellow - countryman , and [a Brahmin]4944-a brahmin , were to address them-- "[163-ramanund] began [Ramanund]163-ramanund , who had come down with [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , feeling important at being summoned . [The latter]336-the latter turned to [the man]3467-the man , whom [he]336-the latter knew had long since rejected the faith of [[his]3467-the man fathers]4269-his fathers , and , so to speak , thrown [the Almighty]2398-the almighty overboard to lighten [[his]3467-the man ship]2399-his ship . " [You]163-ramanund can not argue with that , [[my]3467-the man son]4595-my son ! "[3467-the man] [he]3467-the man said gently , pointing to the sea of [patient , yet eager , faces]2400-patient , yet eager , faces . " [No one of [your]163-ramanund sort]4946-no one of your sort ever has , in all the history of [the world]404-the world . That does not reason . [It]4948-it feels . Show [it]4948-it another miracle , and [it]4948-it will worship . Give [it]4948-it a cause , and [it]4948-it will espouse it . Give [it]4948-it a lead , and it will follow ; but words -- never ! "[3467-the man] " Well , [I]2321-the police officer hope to [God]96-god [no one]3741-no one will supply [it]4948-it with the wrong lead ! "[2321-the police officer] " Not till sunset , [sir]3491-sir , "[3467-the man] said [the man]3467-the man , salaaming . " And it 's now about six , [I]3467-the man suppose . Eleven hours ! [I]247-father ninian left a troop with [Roshan Khân]89-roshan , and orders to send word of any disturbance ; and [I]247-father ninian wired to [Dillon]69-dr. dillon in case-- "[247-father ninian] [Father Ninian]247-father ninian shook [his]247-father ninian head . " There is no fear till this is settled . "[247-father ninian] [He]247-father ninian pointed to [the Pool]2172-the pool . And [he]247-father ninian was right . All through the long hot hours [the crowd]4412-the crowd waited . Sometimes the cry , " Hârâ ! Hârî ! "[247-father ninian] burst out , to be followed by a faint rush . Sometimes [the great mass]2405-the great mass stood silent , listening to the insistent throbbing of [the old God - maker]2406-the old god - maker 's drum in the distance , but through it all the note was patience . And it was patience , also , in [the square enclosure of authority]2407-the square enclosure of authority . Sometimes [a would - be intruder]2408-a would - be intruder would be lifted like a puppy , and chucked back to [[his]2408-a would - be intruder fellows]415-his fellows . Once or twice [an English arm]2410-an english arm would go up , and come down on some more wilful head ; but that was all . And far away at [the Fort]53-the fort the gong chimed the hours regularly up to twelve , and begun at one again . But there was no fuss , no noise . [The crowd]4412-the crowd stood [their]4412-the crowd ground , giving no inch , and authority stood its ground and yielded none , since in that lay safety for all . So , with a horrible slowness , the day dragged on , until at last the red sun sank behind the levels beyond [the gaol]1501-the gaol ; and the strain was over ! " [I]2321-the police officer 'll take a biscuit in [my]2321-the police officer pocket next time , "[2321-the police officer] said [the police officer]2321-the police officer , cheerfully , as , bit by bit , the stones of [the courtyard]386-the courtyard began to show between the golden - shod feet . " It might have been full up , "[2321-the police officer] [he]2321-the police officer said . " [We]4960-we could n't have stopped [them]4921-your men for a moment if [they]4921-your men had had any sort of a lead over . "[1250-the old priest] [The old priest]1250-the old priest stood watching [the crowd]4412-the crowd disperse for a moment in silence . " So was [I]1250-the old priest , "[1250-the old priest] [he]1250-the old priest said , " but [I]1250-the old priest was mistaken , so far . Still , there is danger in the air .
