"[0-i] [I]0-i will look after -- [Margherita]147-margherita . " The last word came in a half whisper to [himself]0-i and [his]0-i eyes met [Vincent]71-vincent 's with a curious dazed defiance . [The latter]336-the latter gave the defiance back , as [[their]5209-their owner]5210-their owner stooped for a second over [Laila]86-laila 's indifferent face , and kissed it . "[147-margherita] Good - by , [Juliet]100-juliet , " [he]0-i said ; and the last word came also in a half whisper to [himself]0-i . The next moment [he]0-i was following [Lance]68-lance down [the dim passage]5211-the dim passage , full of a vague relief , and realizing for the first time that the mist , which for the last half hour had dimmed the reality of all things , was due , not to any aberration of [his]0-i brain , but to the simple fact that an electrical dust - storm was in full blast . [He]0-i realized it with relief . That was at least real , tangible . Almost too much so ; and as the hot wind , charged with those aspiring atoms of earth , met [him]0-i fiercely , [he]0-i realized also that the storm would fight against [him]0-i in [his]0-i efforts to prevent worse from happening . If , indeed , anything could be worse than what had happened ; worse than [Laila's--]270-laila's-- [He]0-i broke off in [his]0-i thought , incredulous . It could not be true . [He]0-i would come back to find [her]86-laila better -- well!-- But that other dream was true . [[His]0-i men]4923-his men had risen . The one thing necessary , therefore , was to get to [the gaol]1501-the gaol before any decided action took place ; and this [he]0-i realised still more clearly from [Lance]68-lance 's curt explanation as [they]4923-his men ran down [the river steps]2769-the river steps . Once there , the sight of [the canoe]937-the canoe [he]0-i had left suggested the feasibility of getting to [the gaol]1501-the gaol in [it]937-the canoe . [His]0-i personal influence might avail . If that failed , [he]0-i would at least be able to save time by choosing a suitable place for [the raft]4626-the raft to come ashore . The great thing was to be on the spot , to be within reach of action at once ; to wait for [the raft]4626-the raft meant needless delay . So , a minute after , the faint splash of [his]0-i paddle was lost in the rising hum of the storm , and [Lance]68-lance was left looking anxiously for sound or sight of [the raft]4626-the raft , which , if all had gone well , should by now have started . But neither came , so , seeing from the light [he]0-i had snatched up as [he]0-i passed through [the balcony]644-the balcony that the air was growing darker , more impenetrable than ever , [he]0-i shoved off [[his]0-i strange craft]5102-his strange craft , to wait further out in [the stream]831-the stream where there was less chance of [the raft]4626-the raft passing [him]0-i unseen , unheard . For this reason also , [he]0-i paddled up along the wall a bit into the faint glow of light which showed still from the arches of [the chapel]1291-the chapel . And as [he]0-i lay in [it]937-the canoe , [his]0-i ears and eyes strained for the least sound , [he]0-i could hear as a kind of background to that muffled drumming of the storm , the sound of [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims chanting as [they]3444-the pilgrims waited for the dawn . The dawn which would bring -- what ? Who could tell ? The sound of other prayers , echoing from [the chapel]1291-the chapel , made [him]0-i shake [his]0-i head , feeling that it was hopeless to look forward -- or backward for that matter ! Why had [Roshan]89-roshan shot [the girl]481-the girl -- if [he]89-roshan had ! And why had [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan called [her]481-the girl [Margherita]147-margherita , and [Vincent]71-vincent called [her]481-the girl [Juliet]100-juliet ? The whole thing was exactly as [he]0-i had said -- an infernal nightmare ! Then a faint sound in front of [him]0-i made [his]0-i strong arms sweep the paddle through the stream as [he]0-i shot into the darkness in search of [the raft]4626-the raft ; in search of [Erda]105-erda . Not that [she]481-the girl needed [him]0-i , really . The memory of [her]481-the girl in that red - and - gold mess jacket above [her]481-the girl wedding dress , giving orders to [the men]2022-the men squarely , came back to make [him]0-i smile . God bless [her]481-the girl ! [She]481-the girl could do well enough without [him]0-i . That was one comfort . And [Dillon]69-dr. dillon could hold [his]69-dr. dillon own too , without much help , for a time -- that was another ; for what with this and that , help was bound to be over - long in coming . [Lance Carlyon]68-lance was right in trusting [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's power of doing without help until [Providence]271-providence chose to send some . This was the easier task , in that [he]0-i had made up [his]0-i mind deliberately beforehand as to what [his]0-i best course of action would be should an alarm of this sort occur . Therefore that imperative kling - kling of the telegraph bell which roused [him]0-i in a second from [his]0-i bed , where , ready dressed for any such emergency , [he]0-i was sleeping the sleep of [the just]5230-the just , found [him]0-i alert , prepared for anything and everything . So it has come , [he]0-i thought , as [he]0-i hastily wired back the comprehensive reply , "[100-juliet] All right , await [you]2897-you . " [He]0-i felt as [a doctor]1737-a doctor does when a dangerous symptom which [he]0-i has foreseen as a possibility , shows itself . [He]0-i had been on the lookout for this for days , but as the dawn would end the period during which it might be expected , [he]0-i had , as in the outbreak of the cholera , had hopes that danger was over . [His]0-i last thought , as [he]0-i slept , had been this ; [he]0-i woke to find that the complication must be faced . Woke with a strong regret , but a stronger instinct of fight . So [he]0-i slipped [his]0-i feet into [his]0-i shoes , jammed [his]0-i big mushroom hat on [his]0-i head out of pure habit , and so , armed cap - à - pie , with a brain quick to work , and [a body ready to follow and obey]5232-a body ready to follow and obey , [he]0-i ran across [the sandy road]5233-the sandy road to [[the Smiths]85-the smiths ' bungalow]5234-the smiths ' bungalow , realizing as [he]0-i did so that a dust - storm was just beginning . That would delay both attack and relief . On the whole , this would be an advantage , since , once things were secure , half an hour or so would make no difference in the latter ; whereas , [he]0-i wanted every minute [he]0-i could get now for preparation . [He]0-i had not warned [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith of [his]0-i fears . There was never any use alarming [people]3436-people by mere probabilities , unless by so doing [you]5236-you could forearm [them]3436-people . And this was not the case here ; since the safest -- in fact the only -- place of refuge for [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith and [the child]543-the child , should trouble arise , was the semi - fortified roof above the gate of [the gaol]1501-the gaol ; and that [he]0-i knew to be ready for use . [He]0-i had , therefore , only to wake [them]3436-people , as quietly as might be , so as not to give the alarm to [the servants]2714-the servants . [Fortune]272-fortune favoured [him]0-i in this ; for , just outside [the verandah]3965-the verandah , [he]0-i ran full tilt upon [Eugene]74-eugene smith [himself]74-eugene smith , tall , gaunt , in [his]74-eugene smith sleeping - suit , carrying a roll of bedding on [his]74-eugene smith back like a snail 's shell . The heat of the evening had enticed [him]0-i to sleep outside , as [he]0-i preferred , à la Robinson Crusoe , and the dust - storm was sending [him]0-i in . "[2897-you] Hello , [Dillon]69-dr. dillon ! " [he]0-i cried , "[69-dr. dillon] what 's up?--nothing wrong with [[my]0-i wife]802-my wife or [the child]543-the child -- [I]0-i hope -- No!-- " [he]0-i gave a sigh of relief , "[0-i] then it 's the beastly dust - storm disturbed [you]69-dr. dillon , [I]0-i suppose . Is n't it sickening to think how many times in the next six months [we]2900-we shall have to take up [our]2900-we beds and walk . " "[0-i] H'm ! Hope [I]0-i shall have the chance , " replied [the doctor]334-the doctor , dryly , recovering [his]0-i breath . "[0-i] No , it is n't the storm . [They]2901-they 're going to try a row , [Smith]74-eugene smith . Just had a wire from [the Fort]3493-the fort . There 's a plot on , to come here and set [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners free , and that 's dangerous . So , till [the troops]2904-the troops come , [I]0-i think [you]74-eugene smith 'd better bring [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith and [Gladys]109-gladys to the gate -- it 's [the safest place]2905-the safest place , and [I]0-i 've got everything ready . It may n't be much ; but the devils , whoever [they]2901-they are , might turn and rend [you]74-eugene smith -- especially if [they]2901-they fail with [me]0-i . " [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith had dropped [his]74-eugene smith snail - shell and sat down on it , aghast , in surprise ; but [he]74-eugene smith was up again before [the doctor]334-the doctor finished . "[2901-they] By [Jove]76-jove ! " [he]74-eugene smith said rapidly , calmly as [the doctor]334-the doctor [himself]74-eugene smith . "[76-jove] That 's a taking up one 's bed with a vengeance . [I]0-i 'll have 'em both ready in a jiffy -- anything else ? " "[0-i] No . [I]0-i 'll rummage round till [you]74-eugene smith return -- one forgets things to the last , sometimes . And [I]0-i shall want [[your]74-eugene smith Remington]2906-your remington and such like -- [I]0-i know where to find ['em]2907-'em . " A moment after [he]0-i was striking a match to light the tall floor - lamp in [[Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith 's drawing - room]1538-mrs. smith 's drawing - room . [She]75-mrs. smith had turned it out [herself]75-mrs. smith a few hours before , thinking , as [she]75-mrs. smith looked round [the room]3952-the room , full of soft rose - shaded light , how pretty , how cosey [it]3952-the room was . [It]3952-the room had the same air of refined security now . Everything , down to a copy of [the last ' Queen]5246-the last ' queen ' lying on an inlaid table by [her]75-mrs. smith favourite chair , was so exactly what [one]3501-one would have expected to find in [[her]75-mrs. smith room]1584-her room ; [the room of [a delicate , cultivated , civilized , society woman]5250-a delicate , cultivated , civilized , society woman]5249-the room of a delicate , cultivated , civilized , society woman . And now ? Now the delicacy , the culture , the civilization , the society , and the security belonging to [them]5251-them , had been invaded in an instant . By what ? The dust -- [you]5252-you could almost see it springing into the air in these sandy stretches -- had already settled thick over the dainty furniture , and as [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , standing by the table in the pink glow of the lamp , asked [himself]69-dr. dillon the question , [he]69-dr. dillon yielded to the imperious fascination which a smooth sand - surface has for humanity . But [he]69-dr. dillon did not write [his]69-dr. dillon name upon it ; only the idle answer to the question . "[0-i] God knows . " The writing lay upon the table beside the latest fashions , staring up into the pink paper shade , after [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon had passed rapidly to [[Eugene]74-eugene smith 's office]5253-eugene 's office to choose this , that , and the other , and make them into a bundle with a table - cloth . When [he]69-dr. dillon returned to [the drawing - room]3545-the drawing - room , [Muriel Smith]151-muriel was standing by that writing in [the sand]5255-the sand : a fragile figure in a blue dressing - gown , all frilled and embroidered like the pictures in the paper . [She]151-muriel looked more forlorn than frightened ; forlorn and pathetic . "[0-i] Is it warm enough ? " said [the doctor]334-the doctor , as [he]334-the doctor entered . "[2908-your] [Your]2908-your dress , [I]0-i mean . There 's a storm on , and it generally brings rain . " "[74-eugene smith] It is flannel , " [she]151-muriel answered , and [he]69-dr. dillon nodded . There was no excitement , no heroics . Only that . That , and the writing on the sand , and [her]151-muriel forlornness -- the forlornness of [a delicate Dresden shepherdess]5257-a delicate dresden shepherdess set to drive a flock of real sheep to the shambles . But the needlessness , the pity of it , made [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon set [his]69-dr. dillon teeth . "[74-eugene smith] [Eugene]74-eugene smith will be [here]3395-here directly with [Gladys]109-gladys , " [she]151-muriel said . "[74-eugene smith] [We]2910-we thought it best not to wake [her]109-gladys , and [he]74-eugene smith said [we]2910-we had better start at once ; for [you]2911-you see [I]0-i ca n't walk nearly so fast as [he]74-eugene smith does . " There was no trace of fear in [her]151-muriel voice , but there was none of resistance either , and [she]151-muriel turned at the door to look back with an almost reproachful acquiescence . "[0-i] [Poor room]2912-poor room , " [she]151-muriel said softly , "[0-i] it seems so strange -- such a pity ; but [I]0-i suppose it ca n't be helped . " [She]151-muriel turned to the darkness again with a little shiver , and went on , "[71-vincent] [Vincent]71-vincent sent the wire , [I]0-i suppose . " "[71-vincent] [I]0-i did n't ask , " replied [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon curtly ; then , repenting [him]0-i , added , "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose so . [He]71-vincent will be here directly [I]0-i expect . And -- and [we]2910-we will all take care of [you]2911-you and [Gladys]109-gladys , as long as [we]2910-we can . [You]2911-you know that ; and [we]2910-we ca n't do more -- can [we]2910-we ? " [She]151-muriel smiled quite tenderly . "[2911-you] Of course [you]2911-you will . And [I]0-i am really not a bit afraid -- except of being in the way . " [She]151-muriel seemed to accept the necessity of this ; perhaps rightly . For the storm itself was no joke in [these desert stretches]5258-these desert stretches , where the sand rose in choking clouds , yet left enough to make each step a toil . [Muriel]151-muriel stumbled along breathlessly , but so slowly that , when [[her]151-muriel husband]3787-her husband joined [them]2910-we , striding along with [Gladys]109-gladys , still sleeping , wrapped in a blanket in [his]3787-her husband arms , [the doctor]334-the doctor bade [them]2910-we come at [their]2910-we leisure and wait until [he]3787-her husband gave the signal before entering , then ran on swiftly to [the gaol]1501-the gaol . For there was no time to lose ; though , on the other hand , there was very little to be done . The less the better , if [his]3787-her husband plan was to be successful ; since that involved the utmost quiet , and the keeping of [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners from all knowledge of what was going on as long as possible . As [he]3787-her husband faced the choking darkness , the hot blasts of causeless wind , blowing all ways at once , [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon reckoned up [his]3787-her husband chances fairly . The storm would certainly make it easier to keep such knowledge from [those within]5263-those within , and make it more difficult for those without to establish communication with [the former]1222-the former . So far , good . On the other hand , no amount of the light at [his]3787-her husband command would enable [him]3787-her husband to see , even from [his]3787-her husband coign of vantage on the gateway roof , what was going on , either outside or inside . And darkness was [[the diggers]5265-the diggers ' best friend]5266-the diggers ' best friend ; while digging was the recognized enemy of mud walls . Especially of those inside walls which divided [the gaol]1501-the gaol into sections . Yet the best , the only chance of keeping [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners quiet , lay in preserving [their]1510-the prisoners segregation into companies . For [the gaol]1501-the gaol was of the cart - wheel pattern . That is , a huge circle of outside wall , thick as an earthwork , the felloes of the wheel , as it were . Then a small central cylinder of brick , like [a lime kiln]5270-a lime kiln , the nave of the wheel , as it were . Between these two the spokes . Spokes of twelve feet high mud wall , dividing the whole into [seven wedges of prison]5271-seven wedges of prison , absolutely distinct , blank , aperture - less , save for one heavily stanchioned door in the apex of each wedge , leading into [the central tower]5272-the central tower . Exit or entry was therefore impossible to six of these wedges , except through [the tower]5273-the tower ; that is the citadel , the key , as it were , of [the gaol]1501-the gaol proper . The seventh wedge , however , gave , at [its]5275-its wider end , on the entrance - gate , which was [a square , semi - fortified building , pierced by a tunnel]5276-a square , semi - fortified building , pierced by a tunnel , gated at each end , and further protected by [an outside yard , or roofless porch]5277-an outside yard , or roofless porch , also gated . The inmost of these three gates opened on to [a small courtyard]5278-a small courtyard , and this narrowed again into [an alley which gave access to [the central tower]5272-the central tower]5279-an alley which gave access to the central tower . Briefly then [the whole gaol]5281-the whole gaol consisted of six wedges opening , by a door in [their]5271-seven wedges of prison narrow end , into the central cylinder ; and a seventh wedge split in two by [an alley leading between high mud walls from the gateway to [that central tower]5283-that central tower]5282-an alley leading between high mud walls from the gateway to that central tower ; the key to the position . In the two halves of the split wedge lay [[the warders]5284-the warders ' barracks]5285-the warders ' barracks , [the solitary cells]1523-the solitary cells , [the cook rooms]5287-the cook rooms , [the hospital]4474-the hospital ; and the entry to these was by a door on either side of [the little courtyard]2264-the little courtyard , just beyond the inner gate . From the corner of this , also , rose the outside stair leading to the roof of the square , brick gateway . Thus [the fifteen hundred prisoners]5290-the fifteen hundred prisoners were broken up into [companies of about two hundred each]5291-companies of about two hundred each , and were absolutely without possibility of communication so long as [the central tower]5272-the central tower was in the hands of [authority]5293-authority . Unless there was time to undermine the mud walls , and tools , also , wherewith to work . Of these , however , there were none in [the gaol]1501-the gaol . Nothing , even , that could be used to take [their]5290-the fifteen hundred prisoners place , except in [that seventh section which held the executive of [the gaol]1501-the gaol]5295-that seventh section which held the executive of the gaol ; and there [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon meant to leave no hands to use them , if [he]69-dr. dillon could compass it . As [he]69-dr. dillon pulled up to regain [his]69-dr. dillon breath before walking up to the gate and giving the countersign , [the whole place]5297-the whole place lay quiet and dark . So far , good . There was the risk , however , of the plot being known , and of [the sentry]5063-the sentry refusing [him]69-dr. dillon entrance . It was not , however , and the next moment , calmly as if [he]69-dr. dillon was merely on one of [his]69-dr. dillon not infrequent rounds of unexpected night inspections , [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon passed from [the outer porch]5299-the outer porch to [the tunnel]378-the tunnel , and told the sentry at the inner gate to light the lamp in [the little office room]5301-the little office room to one side . "[2913-the superintendent] Call [the superintendent]2913-the superintendent , " [he]69-dr. dillon said to [the first man]5118-the first man , "[2913-the superintendent] and [you]2913-the superintendent can tell [him]2913-the superintendent [I]0-i am going to inspect [the solitary cells]1523-the solitary cells . " [He]69-dr. dillon added this because [he]69-dr. dillon knew it would give time , since [the superintendent]2913-the superintendent would be sure to give a private look round , first , to see all was in order , and remove possible traces of tobacco or opium,--those luxuries out of which so much money can be made by [gaol officials]5304-gaol officials . No sooner , however , had [the first sentry]5305-the first sentry gone through the door to [the left section]5306-the left section , than [he]69-dr. dillon sent the second one on a similar message to the right , where [the hospital]4474-the hospital lay . Then , [the coast]4881-the coast being clear , [he]69-dr. dillon rapidly unlocked the private safe in [the office]5053-the office which held [his]69-dr. dillon set of keys in case of accidents , and locked both the right and left doors . Secure for a moment , therefore , from interruption , [he]69-dr. dillon ran outside , saw that [the tool rooms]5310-the tool rooms , etc . , were closed , gave the signal to [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , hurried [the refugees]5311-the refugees up [the stairs]1281-the stairs ; and then , after unlocking the two doors again on [his]69-dr. dillon way back to [the office]5053-the office , sat down in [his]69-dr. dillon usual chair and began to look over a register . [He]69-dr. dillon was engaged in this calm occupation when , a minute or two after , [the native superintendent]5314-the native superintendent -- [a big , dignified person]5315-a big , dignified person , in a blatant undress due largely to [his]69-dr. dillon bulk -- arrived breathless . "[0-i] Darogah - jee ! " began [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , instantly , and the mere tone of the title made [the man]3467-the man quiver , "[0-i] [I]0-i 've had constantly to complain of the tobacco and opium smuggling that is going on among [the warders]5284-the warders , and [I]0-i mean to stop it . [I]0-i 've had information to - night which will clinch the business . So take [the night guard]2916-the night guard , rouse [every warder]2917-every warder , bring [everyone here]2918-everyone here , even [those on guard in [the sections]2920-the sections]2919-those on guard in the sections -- [the hospital orderlies]2921-the hospital orderlies -- [everyone]749-everyone , in fact , who is free to go out of [the gaol]1501-the gaol . [They]749-everyone are to come at once . No time allowed for arrangements . If [they]749-everyone are not all here in five minutes [I]0-i shall think [you]2924-you are in league with [the smugglers]2925-the smugglers . " [The darogah]273-the darogah 's fat flesh shook , yet [he]273-the darogah winked as [he]273-the darogah went off . If [the doctor - sahib]5317-the doctor - sahib expected to find anything in this fashion except , maybe , a smell of the forbidden drugs , [he]273-the darogah was mistaken . On such a night , too , when the dust was in [everyone]749-everyone 's eyes . Well ! it might have been worse ; for , though [he]273-the darogah knew nothing definitely of any plot , [he]273-the darogah could not fail to know that there was more to excite [men]312-men in [the gaol]1501-the gaol , that night , than tobacco or opium ! So [he]273-the darogah went about [his]273-the darogah summons with a sigh of relief , and before the five minutes were over had [[his]273-the darogah posse of [minor officials]5322-minor officials]5321-his posse of minor officials together , including a file of [unfettered prisoners]5323-unfettered prisoners , with good conduct badges , who were used as [gang leaders]5324-gang leaders . [He]273-the darogah [himself]273-the darogah finally coming down [the alley]3795-the alley , with a stupendous bunch of keys , followed by [the little group of night warders [he]273-the darogah had collected from the other sections]5326-the little group of night warders he had collected from the other sections . "[2925-the smugglers] All here ? " asked [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , lighting a cigar . "[2925-the smugglers] [The register]2926-the register , please , darogah . [They]2927-they will answer to [their]2927-they names , pass out through [the wicket]2799-the wicket into [the porch]2929-the porch , and stay there until [I]0-i 've tallied [the lot]2930-the lot . [I]0-i 'm going to have it pakka[11 ] this time . " [Some of [the men]2022-the men]2021-some of the men grinned , [some]3712-some looked uneasy , and [some few]5330-some few frowned ; but [all]4640-all obeyed , though [they]4640-all cuddled [themselves]4640-all into [their]4640-all blankets as [they]4640-all slipped through the wicket , and faced the whirling , swirling storm in [the open porch]5332-the open porch , the doors of which were barred , not solid . "[0-i] [Kishen Rao]274-kishen rao ? " came [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's voice , after a long series of names , followed by brief "[274-kishen rao] presents ! " and swift exits . There was no answer . [He]0-i turned to [the darogah]5333-the darogah for explanation . "[274-kishen rao] Absent ! " explained [the latter]336-the latter , timorously . A little more decision might have saved [him]0-i the quick question , "[274-kishen rao] With or without leave ? " "[90-huzoor] [Huzoor]90-huzoor " palpitated [the fat man]5335-the fat man , "[90-huzoor] [he]90-huzoor went out to bathe in [the Holy Pool]2931-the holy pool by permission this morning . [He]90-huzoor is of the utmost sobriety . [A Brahmin]4944-a brahmin , promoted by [your]2933-your Honour to , as [[your]2933-your Honour]4426-your honour knows , [general head ward - keeper]2935-general head ward - keeper . [He]90-huzoor is not to be suspected . " "[90-huzoor] Leave till 5 P.M. , " commented [the doctor]334-the doctor , looking over the register . "[90-huzoor] Mark [him]90-huzoor down absent without leave . Go on . " So , rapidly , [the last man]5337-the last man ducked under the wicket . "[90-huzoor] Is that [the lot]2930-the lot ? " "[749-everyone] [Everyone]749-everyone , [Protector of [the Poor]538-the poor]537-protector of the poor , " protested [the burly official]5338-the burly official , with smiles . "[749-everyone] [The prison]2940-the prison is empty of the unfettered . " "[749-everyone] Then let [it]2941-it remain so for the present , " said [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , coolly , as [he]69-dr. dillon stepped forward , closed the wicket , slid the bolt to its place , and turned on the darogah , all in one swift sequence . "[749-everyone] Now , then ! " [he]69-dr. dillon went on sharply , "[749-everyone] [you]2933-your and [I]0-i have to settle a bit of business . [Your]2933-your keys-- " [he]69-dr. dillon took out a revolver , and laid it on the table beside him--"every[2933-your] key [you]2933-your have ; duplicates , triplicates , everything ! [I]0-i 'm going to keep [this gaol]2942-this gaol [myself]0-i for a bit . Do [you]2933-your understand ? " "[90-huzoor] [Huzoor]90-huzoor ! " bleated [the man]3467-the man , helplessly , putting [his]3467-the man big bunch on the table . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon smiled sarcastically . "[90-huzoor] Wo n't do , [[my]0-i friend]4424-my friend . [I]0-i want the lot by the list . Where 's the register ? " When it came [he]69-dr. dillon ticked them off rapidly by it . "[90-huzoor] [Sections B]59-sections b and C , [warder]2944-warder 's duplicate ; where 's that ? " [he]69-dr. dillon asked . [The official]1486-the official grew green . "[275-kishen rao--] [Kishen Rao--]275-kishen rao-- " [he]69-dr. dillon began--"but[275-kishen rao--] [he]275-kishen rao-- is of the utmost-- " [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon turned on [him]69-dr. dillon like lightning . "[275-kishen rao--] [You]275-kishen rao-- 're [a damned scoundrel]2945-a damned scoundrel , [sir]3491-sir ! What else is missing ? " [He]69-dr. dillon ran over the rest swiftly , then looked up suddenly with a scowl that made [the man]3467-the man literally collapse . "[2945-a damned scoundrel] So that 's it , is it ? Duplicate of [B and C sections]2947-b and c sections missing , and duplicate of the alley doors . A pretty little game ! " [he]69-dr. dillon laughed sardonically . "[275-kishen rao--] [Kishen Rao--]275-kishen rao-- " gurgled the darogah--"by[275-kishen rao--] [your]275-kishen rao-- Honour 's promotion -- of the utmost-- " "[275-kishen rao--] But it wo n't play , [[my]0-i friend]4424-my friend ; it wo n't play ! " went on [the doctor]334-the doctor , with a curious elation . "[0-i] [I]0-i hold the thirteenth trump , now . [You]275-kishen rao-- go in there,"--he pointed to [an inner store - room behind the slip of [an office]5344-an office]5343-an inner store - room behind the slip of an office ; [a windowless place , pitch dark , where the clothes in which [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners arrived awaited [their]1510-the prisoners release in piles--"and[0-i] thank [your]275-kishen rao-- stars [you]275-kishen rao-- 're in such good quarters]5345-a windowless place , pitch dark , where the clothes in which the prisoners arrived awaited their release in piles--"and thank your stars you 're in such good quarters . " All but that brief order , "[275-kishen rao--] [You]275-kishen rao-- go in [there]3509-there , " was spoken in English , as a sort of outlet for the intense satisfaction which was filling [him]0-i at [his]0-i own success,--so far . The next minute [he]0-i had turned the key on [the darogah]5333-the darogah , and was up the stairs calling [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith in a low voice to come down and help to bolt and bar ; but to come as quietly as [he]0-i could . "[275-kishen rao--] [I]0-i 've got rid of the lot , " [he]0-i said joyously , after [he]0-i had explained the position in a few rapid words ; "[0-i] there is n't [a soul]2950-a soul in [this section]2951-this section except [the solitary cellers]2952-the solitary cellers -- who , of course , are ironed -- [a few sick people]2953-a few sick people , and [the assistant surgeon]2954-the assistant surgeon ; but [baboo - jee]2955-baboo - jee is [an agnostic]2956-an agnostic , and is so confoundedly afraid of the possibility of a future life that [he]2955-baboo - jee may be trusted to go into green collapse if [he]2955-baboo - jee hears a shot fired . " So , rapidly , [the two men]5348-the two men set to work , undisturbed by more than a protesting "[90-huzoor] [Huzoor]90-huzoor , what shall [we]2957-we do ? " from the posse outside the first gate , and a low knocking at the wicket . There were double doors [here]3395-here , however , and of the sort which it would need time to negotiate , without powder . "[90-huzoor] [They]2958-they will hold out for an hour , at least , " said [the doctor]334-the doctor ; "[90-huzoor] then there will be the inner one , and after that the alley door -- unless-- " [he]334-the doctor remembered [Kishen Rao]274-kishen rao , and frowned . That was the only weak spot in [his]334-the doctor armour . "[2957-we] [We]2957-we can count on an hour and a half , at least , " [he]334-the doctor continued , carefully allowing for the worst ; "[2957-we] longer , perhaps . Now then , [Smith]74-eugene smith , for the toughest job ! [I]0-i 've got a couple of crowbars here . Those first six steps -- eight if [we]2957-we can -- of the stairs must come down . There are n't enough of [us]2957-we to hold them . " So , for fully a quarter of an hour , no sound was heard above the curious vibration of the storm except the grinding and crushing of the bricks as they were rapidly eased out , one by one , from the mud mortar . The light of one of the office lamps , set on the ground , showed by that time a sheer drop of eight or ten feet , and [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , working above , jammed [his]74-eugene smith crowbar into a crevice of the wall against which the steps clung like a swallow 's nest , and gave [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , who had been working below , a rope and a hand up . [The latter]336-the latter set down the keys and the lamp [he]336-the latter had brought up with [him]336-the latter , and deliberately dusted the knees of [his]336-the latter trousers . "[74-eugene smith] There , that 's done , " [he]336-the latter said . "[74-eugene smith] Could n't be better . " "[74-eugene smith] Yes , it seems pretty safe , " assented [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , a trifle dubiously . "[74-eugene smith] Safe ! " echoed [the doctor]334-the doctor , enthusiastically , "[0-i] [I]0-i have n't felt so safe for the last fortnight . Hullo ! what 's that ? " That was a sudden bugle - call . [The doctor]334-the doctor 's face fell . "[74-eugene smith] What , already ! [I]0-i did n't expect relief so soon . However , it ca n't be helped . [I]0-i 'll just go up and tell [Dering]71-vincent what [I]0-i 've done , so that [he]71-vincent may be prepared for [the locked out ones]2959-the locked out ones ! " [He]0-i took the light in [his]0-i hand and crossed to [the outer parapet]5354-the outer parapet . "[71-vincent] Hello , [Dering]71-vincent ! " [he]0-i began , peering down . Then a couple of shots whizzed past [his]0-i head and [he]0-i ducked . At the same moment , as if roused by the concussion , the first crackling thunderclap of the dust - storm , sounding muffled through the thick air , followed like a roll - call , and reverberated dully , sluggishly , through the black darkness . When it passed , [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's voice rose quietly . "[71-vincent] There will be no relief , [Smith]74-eugene smith ; those are [the troopers]2375-the troopers , and [they]2375-the troopers 're against [us]2961-us . So now -- [we've]2961-us got it to [ourselves]2961-us , [Smith]74-eugene smith , for some time . " There was a certain satisfaction at the monopoly in [his]69-dr. dillon voice . The sound of those two shots greeted [Vincent Dering]71-vincent as , after infinite difficulty , owing to the darkness , the fitful gusts of wind , and the sand - banks , [he]71-vincent drew up [the canoe]937-the canoe against what [he]71-vincent knew must be [the high bank below the off - take of [the canal]3421-the canal]5356-the high bank below the off - take of the canal . It had only been by trusting [the stream]831-the stream to guide [him]71-vincent , and refraining at times from the use of [his]71-vincent paddle , that [he]71-vincent had managed to steer [his]71-vincent way at all . So [he]71-vincent knew [he]71-vincent was late ; felt , indeed , that [he]71-vincent must be too late to use [his]71-vincent influence with [the men]2022-the men , and yet , despite this knowledge , a keen disappointment filled [him]71-vincent when those shots proved [him]71-vincent to be so ; since by long experience [he]71-vincent knew that once open resistance began , there could be no more question of words . What then , was there for [him]71-vincent to do ? If [he]71-vincent , in [[his]71-vincent light canoe]5360-his light canoe , helped , wherever possible , by every atom of strength [his]71-vincent arms possessed , had taken so long to come down [that mile or two of stream]5361-that mile or two of stream , [the raft]4626-the raft could not possibly arrive for another half hour . [He]71-vincent could not sit still for half an hour ; [he]71-vincent felt , indeed , as if [he]71-vincent could not sit still for half a minute . A passion to act , to sweep away the past , to forget , was upon [him]71-vincent . [He]71-vincent had had time during [his]71-vincent strange journey -- so often idle perforce -- to realize [his]71-vincent position ; time to piece the still stranger events preceding [his]71-vincent journey into a reasonable sequence ; so that [he]71-vincent had , by now , arrived at a fairly accurate guess as to the cause of much , that , when it happened , had seemed causeless . For instance , [Laila]86-laila 's dress , "[498-someone] given [her]2962-her by [someone]498-someone . " That , joined to the knowledge that [she]86-laila was connected with [[the late Nawab]122-nawab 's family]5363-the late nawab 's family , of which [Roshan Khân]89-roshan might with justice claim the headship , had brought [the latter]336-the latter 's action within the bounds of credibility . Jealousy ! revenge ! these were potent causes . [Laila]86-laila , then , must have been playing with [Roshan]89-roshan 's pretensions . Playing like [a child with a toy]5365-a child with a toy ; playing , rather , like [a woman who hesitates at nothing for the sake of [the man [she]5366-a woman who hesitates at nothing for the sake of the man she loves loves]5367-the man she loves]5366-a woman who hesitates at nothing for the sake of the man she loves . And [she]86-laila had hesitated at nothing ; not even at this , to give [him]71-vincent pleasure , to make things match with [his]71-vincent passion ! The thought , the remembrance , made [him]71-vincent for a moment feel inclined to fling up [his]71-vincent hands , and let [the canoe]937-the canoe take [him]71-vincent where it chose ; take [him]71-vincent down stream utterly . Then a half choking , yet wholly strenuous desire to escape from the whole story , a wild instinctive effort for a more wholesome atmosphere , like that of [a drowning man for a breath of fresh air]5369-a drowning man for a breath of fresh air , had sent [the canoe]937-the canoe bounding on [his]71-vincent way ; [his]71-vincent way and none other 's , in swift obedience . With a rush , [he]71-vincent had grasped that there was more in life -- that [he]71-vincent had allowed [himself]71-vincent to be [a slave]5371-a slave ! But that was past,--he would shake [himself]71-vincent together -- [he]71-vincent would forget the thraldom of sex -- and [he]71-vincent would forget the past . Yet , as [he]71-vincent cast about in [his]71-vincent mind for the best method of applying the half hour 's leisure , the remembrance of [a woman]3949-a woman came to [him]71-vincent , as if to mock at [his]71-vincent resolution . [Muriel]151-muriel , and [dear little [Gladys]276-gladys who called [him]71-vincent "[498-someone] [Derin ' darling "]5373-derin ' darling "]276-gladys ; where were [they]5374-they ? [His]71-vincent eyes grew soft in the remembrance , stern at the probability of [their]5374-they being in danger . Why had [he]71-vincent not thought of it before ? How could [he]71-vincent ever have paused , wondering what to do ? [He]71-vincent set the red light , which [he]71-vincent had taken from [the fateful balcony]5375-the fateful balcony , carefully in the canoe -- though , even should some gust of the rising wind not blow the light out , it could scarcely be of any use in that outer darkness -- as a signal to [the raft]4626-the raft should it , by an off chance , drift past in [his]71-vincent absence , then struck across the sand in the direction in which [he]71-vincent knew [[the Smiths]5377-the smiths ' bungalow]5234-the smiths ' bungalow must lie ; that was , a little to the rear of [the gaol]1501-the gaol . The storm , as [he]71-vincent faced it , was so fierce that the doubt rose inevitably if [an unwieldy raft]5380-an unwieldy raft could make way against it . If so , then there would be no help . The only thing would be to defend [himself]71-vincent and [others]569-others until the end came ; the end which would at least end the past . [He]71-vincent had almost to feel [his]71-vincent way , the darkness was so intense . It was a relief to stumble against something which [he]71-vincent knew must be the low mud fence of [[Muriel]151-muriel 's garden]5382-muriel 's garden ; [that garden in which [she]151-muriel tried to defy [Providence]271-providence , and rear English flowers]5383-that garden in which she tried to defy providence , and rear english flowers . [He]71-vincent knew [his]71-vincent feet must be crushing [her]151-muriel treasures as [he]71-vincent passed on towards a faint glow , a red glow . But everything that was not the blackness of outer darkness to - night seemed red -- blood red . A minute after , with a vast relief at the silence , the solitude , [he]71-vincent was in [[Muriel]151-muriel 's pretty drawing - room]5384-muriel 's pretty drawing - room . The pink - shaded lamp was still alight , showing red through the fog of dust . [He]71-vincent passed to it instinctively , and as [he]71-vincent did so , noticed the writing on the table . But many an earth - atom had fallen on that confession of ignorance since [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon had made it idly , and so , as [Vincent Dering]71-vincent bent quickly to see if by chance it was some message left for [those who might come after]5385-those who might come after , [he]71-vincent also had to frown and say , "[5373-derin ' darling "] God knows ! " Was it possible that [Eugene]74-eugene smith and [[his]74-eugene smith wife]3429-his wife were still asleep ? The doors stood open , but that was to be expected at that season of the year , unless [someone]498-someone had been awake to close [them]5388-them against the storm . [He]71-vincent must make sure , however . But there was [no one]3741-no one to be found in [any of [the rooms]5391-the rooms]5390-any of the rooms . It occurred to [him]71-vincent , then , that [they]5392-they must have taken refuge in [the gaol]1501-the gaol , and [he]71-vincent told [himself]71-vincent [he]71-vincent was [a fool]4066-a fool not to have thought of that before . [Dillon]69-dr. dillon would , of course , have seen to that . [He]69-dr. dillon , [Vincent]71-vincent , might have remembered so much , at least ; might have remembered that [he]69-dr. dillon [himself]69-dr. dillon was not [the only slave]5395-the only slave . Then [he]69-dr. dillon gave an odd , bitter little laugh . Was it never possible to get beyond [a woman]3949-a woman 's apron - strings ? And here [he]69-dr. dillon was wasting time over the question , when [he]69-dr. dillon ought to be doing something better . But what ? Go back and wait for [the raft]4626-the raft , or on to [the gaol]1501-the gaol ? There was a big tamarisk tree at the end of [the garden]433-the garden . Only two days before [he]69-dr. dillon had pointed it out to [Muriel]151-muriel and said that [an active man accustomed to trapeze work]5400-an active man accustomed to trapeze work might swing [himself]5400-an active man accustomed to trapeze work from it astride the high mud wall of [the gaol]1501-the gaol , and so gain the roof of the gate . [Dillon]69-dr. dillon had denied it ; and [she]151-muriel had said , laughingly , that [no one]3741-no one ever tried to break into [a gaol]4556-a gaol , only out of one . Curious ; still , if it had only been light , it would have been worth the risking . But it was impossible now in the dark . So , suddenly , a remembrance came to [him]69-dr. dillon . The search - light ! Was it only last night [he]69-dr. dillon had been dining [here]3395-here , in [this house]5405-this house , after bringing [Muriel]151-muriel [home]3521-home from [the Mission]2112-the mission , where [they]5408-they had seen that huge ray piercing the shadows ? Was it only yesterday that [he]69-dr. dillon had listened to [Eugene]74-eugene smith 's lamentations over [his]69-dr. dillon unused electricity , which was sure , [he]69-dr. dillon said , to vanish into space from [his]69-dr. dillon rude contrivances . Was it only yesterday that , in obedience to that pathetic look of martyrdom on [Muriel]151-muriel 's face , which still seemed -- to one part of [Vincent]71-vincent 's nature -- to call for instant sympathy , [he]69-dr. dillon had , to appease [the honest inventor]5409-the honest inventor , shown an interest in search - lights which was purely fictitious , and learned a variety of facts about buttons and stop - cocks ? And had all this happened yesterday on purpose that to - day , when [he]69-dr. dillon was in need of light-- [He]69-dr. dillon was up on the roof with the thought . If only the blessed thing had go enough for that ! As [he]69-dr. dillon picked [his]69-dr. dillon way rapidly through the litter , three or four cigar - ends , a half - finished whiskey - and - soda , seen by the flash of the hurricane lantern [he]69-dr. dillon had sought out and lit , told [him]69-dr. dillon that [Eugene]74-eugene smith must have been at work over [his]69-dr. dillon new toy till late . So much the better for [his]69-dr. dillon chance -- for [everybody]939-everybody 's chance ; since a signal like that might make all the difference to the raft ; all the difference to [Dillon]69-dr. dillon in the gaol-- [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon was , indeed , beginning to realize this [himself]69-dr. dillon . [His]69-dr. dillon almost triumphant mood had passed ; it had come home to [him]69-dr. dillon that the unexpected revelation of [the troopers]2375-the troopers ' complicity in the plot , whatever it was , had changed the whole aspect of affairs . Now , there was no question of keeping [the gaol]1501-the gaol quiet until help should arrive . [He]69-dr. dillon was face to face , now , with the fact that [he]69-dr. dillon must not rely on any aid at all . What had really happened , [he]69-dr. dillon could not guess . For all [he]69-dr. dillon knew , [the troopers]2375-the troopers and [pioneers]5414-pioneers might have risen and killed [[their]2375-the troopers officers]5415-their officers , killed [everybody who would be likely to help]5416-everybody who would be likely to help . [His]69-dr. dillon aim , now , was to sell [his]69-dr. dillon life , and -- and [hers]5417-hers -- as dearly as [he]69-dr. dillon could ; but in the dead darkness , like a rat in a hole , what could be done ? Except wait -- wait for the walls to be dug through , the gates to be mined , that poor eight or ten feet drop at the foot of the stairs scaled . Then a rush , still in the dark , and -- the greatest Darkness of all ! Not even the chance of a shot ; and [he]69-dr. dillon had plenty of ammunition . It would at least have passed the time to take pot - shots at [the devils]4620-the devils ; and though these would have brought retaliation , there would have been no need for exposure . The parapet walls were high enough , and properly loopholed . So , for a few minutes , [he]69-dr. dillon sat almost sullenly beside those , for whom alone [he]69-dr. dillon now felt responsible , in [the little turret , which , as is always the case in [India]8-india]5419-the little turret , which , as is always the case in india , rose at one corner of the flat roof giving fair shelter for the time . In [his]69-dr. dillon first hurried recognition , which had come with the shots , that not help but attack lay outside , [he]69-dr. dillon had blown out [his]69-dr. dillon light , fearing lest [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith might also be exposed to similar attentions ; so it was pitch dark . And the now almost constant reverberations , which seemed to send the sand - laden air in pulse - beats on [your]5420-your face , deadened all other sounds into vague confusion . But [he]69-dr. dillon knew that [the warders within [the porch]2929-the porch]5421-the warders within the porch , [the troopers without]5423-the troopers without , were trying to force the barred gate . That would not take long ; though the two doors blocking the ends of [the tunnel]378-the tunnel would be a tougher job . And [he]69-dr. dillon heard , closer at hand , a sleepy whimper from [the child]543-the child , a low comforting from [a mother]1409-a mother 's voice . The sound made [him]69-dr. dillon set [his]69-dr. dillon teeth . God ! if there was only light to kill withal . And then , in a second , as if by a miracle , it came . A great flood of shining light , contemptuous , at that short distance , even of that outer darkness . For it was electricity against electricity ; [a house]5427-a house divided against itself . The first thing [he]69-dr. dillon saw by it was that fragile figure in its dainty blue frills , [a child]3605-a child 's golden head ; and so , naturally , the next instant found [his]69-dr. dillon hand on a rifle . "[5373-derin ' darling "] The search - light ! by all that 's lucky ! Well ! [everyone]749-everyone has not been killed , anyhow , " cried [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith . "[749-everyone] Killed , " echoed [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , savagely . "[749-everyone] [No one]3741-no one has been killed yet , but it wo n't be long before [they]3741-no one are . " It was not ; for [a trooper engaged in staring stupidly at the velvety black circle out of which the intruding light seemed to spring]5429-a trooper engaged in staring stupidly at the velvety black circle out of which the intruding light seemed to spring , suddenly threw up [his]5429-a trooper engaged in staring stupidly at the velvety black circle out of which the intruding light seemed to spring hands , swirled round , and fell face upwards in a crumpled heap . There was an instant 's scare in [the crowd]4412-the crowd , in that hundred and fifty or more of [troopers]2378-troopers and [conspirators , thrown into black and white relief , like a shadow pantomime]5432-conspirators , thrown into black and white relief , like a shadow pantomime , about the outer gate . Then the startled murmurs of "[749-everyone] the light -- the Dee - puk - râg " which were passing from lip to lip , changed into a yell . The fight had begun in earnest . "[749-everyone] Shoot straight , " remarked [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , a few minutes after , "[749-everyone] [we]2966-we sha n't have such a good chance long . The gate is almost gone . Then most of the game will be out of range -- too close to the wall . And once [they]3741-no one get into [the tunnel]378-the tunnel [we]2966-we shall have to sound cease firing until [they]3741-no one come out on the other side ; but then [we]2966-we ought to do decent damage , if [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners do n't get at [us]2966-we first . " [He]69-dr. dillon paused , and shot on steadily till , with a hoarse shout , [the attackers]5433-the attackers surged inwards . Then [he]69-dr. dillon laid [his]69-dr. dillon rifle aside , remarking that it would be as well to keep an eye gaolwards , in case of complications . So far as could be seen in that curious chequering of dense darkness and sharp glittering light ; light which was palpably [an intruder]5434-an intruder , which seemed absolutely apart from the things it showed -- even from the dust - atoms -- there was none as yet . At least the uppermost portion of that vast wheel of wall stood out , perfect , unbroken . The roof of [[the Smiths]5377-the smiths ' bungalow]5234-the smiths ' bungalow , where the light stood , being , however , but little higher than these walls , much of what lay below in the sections themselves was necessarily hidden in shadow ; especially on the side nearest the light . But [the narrow alley leading up to [the central tower]5272-the central tower]5437-the narrow alley leading up to the central tower , being in straight line with the ray , showed clear as daylight , save just under [the citadel itself]5439-the citadel itself . So did [most of [the little courtyard]2264-the little courtyard]5440-most of the little courtyard , with [its]2264-the little courtyard doors opening to the right and left . [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon gave a sigh of satisfaction at the sight , since , whether [the foe]1413-the foe elected -- when once inside the gates -- to rush the roof , or press on to liberate [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners by those six doors in [the round tower]5444-the round tower , there would be fair chance of a good bag , for a straight shot ! Or , even if [the convalescents in [hospital]5446-hospital]5445-the convalescents in hospital were to set free [the solitary - cell convicts]5447-the solitary - cell convicts -- a contingency which had occurred to [him]69-dr. dillon too late for any plan of minimizing the danger -- and were to swarm into [the courtyard]386-the courtyard to help against the last gate ( which , of course , was partly barred from the inside ) , [he]69-dr. dillon could settle [their]5445-the convalescents in hospital hash also . And that , now , was [his]69-dr. dillon one idea . The idea of [all brave men]5449-all brave men when [they]5449-all brave men find [themselves]5449-all brave men in a tight place -- to kill before being killed . As yet , however , there was no sign of life even within the vast wheel , with [its]386-the courtyard rims and spokes of light , [its]386-the courtyard centre of shadow . [It]386-the courtyard lay dim , curiously still behind the dust - atoms that danced in the ray , like motes in a sunbeam . There was not a sound , not a sign within . Only the tumult of voices , the intermittent shots without , rising above the dull , muffled hum in the air . Stay ! that was something . Half way round the circle , where the shadow of the tall tamarisk tree in [the Smiths ' garden]5450-the smiths ' garden cut a jagged gap in the white rim of wall , there was some change , something that had not been there a moment ago . The gap had moved ; had changed place and form , though for a time the air was still with one of those breathless , suffocating pauses , when the dust above seems to sink on the dust below , and fill [one]3501-one 's very lungs . And now the gap was back again , as it had been before . But it had left something clinging for a second to the wall like a limpet : the next astride it safely . "[0-i] Reach [me]0-i over [my]0-i rifle , [Smith]74-eugene smith , " said [the doctor]334-the doctor , briefly ; "[74-eugene smith] there 's [a brute]2654-a brute trying to sniggle along the wall ; must have come up that tree in [[your]74-eugene smith garden]2970-your garden . Wish [I]0-i 'd taken [Dering]71-vincent 's advice and cut it down . Thanks ! [I]0-i do n't want to take [my]0-i eye off [him]2654-a brute , for fear [he]2654-a brute means to drop into a section . [I]0-i 'll shoot , if that seems [his]2654-a brute game ; if not , [I]0-i 'll wait till [he]2654-a brute comes closer . " [He]0-i leant over the parapet , waiting . Just below [him]0-i , the inner wall of the gate against which the stair clung , and which was prolonged into [the turret where [Muriel]151-muriel and [the child]543-the child were sheltering]5453-the turret where muriel and the child were sheltering , joined [the circular outside wall of [the gaol]1501-the gaol]5455-the circular outside wall of the gaol . [The man]3467-the man , thought [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , trusting to [their]5458-them being occupied in front , must be trying to steal a march on [them]5458-them , slip down [the stair]5459-the stair , and take [them]5458-them in the rear . There was plenty of time to prevent that , however . "[0-i] From the tree in [the garden]433-the garden , " [she]151-muriel said , dreamily . "[0-i] Yes ! [I]0-i remember . " [she]151-muriel gasped ; "[71-vincent] do n't shoot , [doctor]3435-doctor ! It 's [Vincent]71-vincent ! [I]0-i know it ! [I]0-i feel it ! " asked [Eugene]74-eugene smith , still firing steadily at all that was to be seen . " "[2976-your wife] Of course [I]0-i 'm right , " [she]2976-your wife sobbed , half hysterically--"I[2976-your wife] knew [he]71-vincent would come -- [I]0-i knew [he]71-vincent would n't leave [me]0-i to die alone ! " [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith laid down [his]74-eugene smith rifle , and crawled over in cover deliberately , with an odd look on [his]74-eugene smith face . "[71-vincent] Yes ! that 's [Dering]71-vincent ; [plucky fellow]2978-plucky fellow . [He]71-vincent 's swung [himself]71-vincent up . [I]0-i always knew [he]71-vincent was [a nailing gymnast]2979-a nailing gymnast . " There was no grudge in [his]74-eugene smith voice , only a curious challenge as [he]74-eugene smith looked at [[his]74-eugene smith wife]3429-his wife , then laid [his]74-eugene smith big hand on [her]3429-his wife shoulder . "[71-vincent] Keep more down , please -- [your]0-i head 's showing .
