" "[71-vincent] But [I]0-i would rather look -- [I'd]0-i rather see anything happen-- " [she]3429-his wife moaned ; "[0-i] it seems so unkind not to watch -- not to be there -- with [him--]71-vincent " [She]3429-his wife was shivering all over , the patient self - control , the steady acquiescence even in [her]3429-his wife own danger which had been [hers]3429-his wife till then , gone utterly . [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon felt a great pity , a vast impatience . "[71-vincent] So [you]0-i were right , [Smith]74-eugene smith , " [he]69-dr. dillon broke in hastily , to cover [her]3429-his wife sudden break down . "[0-i] [They]2982-they are n't killed ; now [we]2981-we shall have a chance of knowing what 's at the bottom of all this foolery ! " But when , five minutes later , [Vincent Dering]71-vincent reached the roof in safety , [the doctor]334-the doctor felt vaguely that the explanations only added to the general incomprehensibility ; and that something was being kept back . What , [he]69-dr. dillon asked impatiently , had started the show ? Of course there were plots . [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan knew of them , but , as such things generally did , they had seemed abortive . What , then , had upset the apple - cart ? [Vincent]71-vincent gave a gesture of despair . "[0-i] What does it matter ? " [he]71-vincent cried . "[0-i] [We]2981-we can think of that -- if [we]2981-we can think -- when it 's over ! And if [we]2981-we can't -- what does it matter ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i can bet [your]0-i bottom dollar on one thing , " said [Eugene]74-eugene smith , who , in this pause for a council of war , was methodically loading various weapons for future use . "[0-i] It is either the sex , or sin . [This world]342-this world would be [a paradise of peace]2984-a paradise of peace if [people]3436-people did n't want virtue or vice,--I do n't say which is which , mind [you]0-i . " [He]74-eugene smith spoke suddenly , harshly ; and once more [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon came to the rescue . "[71-vincent] As [Dering]71-vincent says , it does n't matter . But the fact that [the pioneers]5081-the pioneers are staunch , and may be expected before long , alters [our]2981-we tactics a bit , [Smith]74-eugene smith . [We]2981-we must husband [our]2981-we ammunition , and stick on as long as possible -- don't [you]74-eugene smith think so , [Dering]71-vincent ? " [Vincent]71-vincent , kindly always , had stooped to take [little Gladys]276-gladys , who had crept over to [him]71-vincent , in [his]71-vincent arms ; and now [the child]543-the child , [her]543-the child arms round [his]71-vincent neck , was cuddling close to [him]71-vincent . "[74-eugene smith] [I]0-i 'm so glad oo 's come , Derin ' darlin ' , " [she]543-the child whispered . "[3622-mum] And so 's [mum]3622-mum -- aren't ' oo , [dearest]2988-dearest ? " [Vincent]71-vincent unclasped the soft , little , clinging hands almost resentfully , and pulled [himself]71-vincent together . "[3622-mum] Yes ! " [he]71-vincent said briefly , "[3622-mum] [we]2981-we 've got to hold out . So it will be better to reserve [ourselves]2981-we , and try to keep [the gaol]1501-the gaol itself quiet . It will take [the brutes]4470-the brutes some time to force those gates unless [they]4470-the brutes get help from within , and then there is [the alley]3795-the alley , and the doors . Still , [we]2981-we shall want every minute ; for , unless the storm lessens , [Carlyon]68-lance will scarcely get [the raft]4626-the raft [here]3395-here before dawn . It was awful on [the river]333-the river . " It was , indeed . Even [Am - ma]131-am - ma had lost [himself]131-am - ma utterly , while [Lance]68-lance , after paddling , and drifting , and shouting after a dozen false hopes , was still as far from finding [the raft]4626-the raft as ever . What could have become of it ? Had it started sooner than [he]68-lance had expected , and passed down before [he]68-lance had found [Vincent]71-vincent ? Or had it never started at all ? Had [the men]2022-the men , after [he]68-lance left , turned round on [her]5468-her ? This fear had come to [him]68-lance early in [his]68-lance search , and [he]68-lance had felt inclined then and there to paddle back to [the Fort]3493-the fort , and satisfy [himself]68-lance it was not so . But the thought of [her]5468-her face , if [he]68-lance allowed care for [her]5468-her to cause delay , had kept [him]68-lance to [his]68-lance task steadily , till [he]68-lance could no longer doubt that something had gone wrong . But what ? And what was [he]68-lance to do ? Then , in a flash , had come back [her]5468-her words after [she]5468-her had bidden [him]68-lance think hard . "[2995-you] [You]2995-you must go down to [the spit]614-the spit , cut across [it]614-the spit by [the mission house]3764-the mission house , get round , if [you]2995-you can , to [the police camp]5067-the police camp . " That had been [her]5468-her verdict , involving [her]5468-her being left to take [her]5468-her chance . And now either the raft , the relief for [the gaol]1501-the gaol , had started , or it had not . If [the former]1222-the former , [he]68-lance might , of course , by a stern chase overtake it ; but [Erda]105-erda was there and [Vincent]71-vincent would meet [her]105-erda ; [they]5472-they could do without [him]68-lance . But if it had not started , what then ? Then matters were exactly as they had been , when [she]5468-her had bidden [him]68-lance leave [her]5468-her . So , with a feeling that , if this were so , [he]68-lance cared little what happened , [he]68-lance steered , so far as [he]68-lance could judge , for the sand - banks of [the spit]614-the spit to the right . [Am - ma]131-am - ma , on the contrary , steered instinctively to the left , towards [the high bank]5474-the high bank , [the deepest stream]5475-the deepest stream . It would at least float [his]131-am - ma logs to [their]5472-they destination , and that was something . [Kings]1384-kings had come and gone , and battles had been won and lost , but the logs had always had to go down [the river]333-the river , whatever happened . And among [the men]2022-the men , also , an apathy seemed to have settled , as [they]2022-the men drifted on and on in the dark . [Erda]105-erda , crouching in [a dry spot beside the ammunition]5479-a dry spot beside the ammunition , alert to the uttermost for the least hint of [Lance]68-lance , realized this from the very tone of [their]2022-the men voices as [they]2022-the men talked under [their]2022-the men breath to [each other]3586-each other . [She]105-erda felt instinctively that the inaction , the darkness , the lack of [a leader]5481-a leader , were lessening the value of [those twenty men]5482-those twenty men each minute . If [Lance]68-lance would only turn up ! What could have become of [him]68-lance ? The time seemed interminable ; [she]105-erda felt sure that [they]5472-they must already have drifted past [the gaol]1501-the gaol ; [she]105-erda began to wonder if [Am - ma]3733-am - ma was not playing false . For the darkness , the uncertainty , had its grip on [her]105-erda also . It was like some horrid nightmare , to drift on and on , hearing the muffled drumming of the storm , feeling the strange vibration in the air , the sharp sand tingling on [your]5485-your face , and to know nothing -- nothing at all , save that [you]5485-your were there . "[3733-am - ma] [Am - ma]3733-am - ma ! " [she]105-erda cried sharply , at last , certain of but one thing , that [she]105-erda must act,--"I[3733-am - ma] believe [we]3000-we have passed [the gaol]1501-the gaol ; steer to the right , do [you]3733-am - ma hear ? " A laugh , not exactly insolent , but tolerant , came from [the group of men]5486-the group of men . "[3733-am - ma] Tis easy to give orders , [Missy - baba]111-the missy - baba , " said a voice ; "[111-the missy - baba] but not so easy to obey [them]3002-them , when [the Lord]3426-the lord is against [your]111-the missy - baba side , and sends darkness ! " [Erda]105-erda 's heart gave a great throb , not of fear , but comprehension . That was the beginning ; a minute or two more and [these men]2367-these men would be out of hand . "[3733-am - ma] [Am - ma]3733-am - ma ! " [she]105-erda called again , "[3733-am - ma] do what [I]0-i tell [you]3733-am - ma . Remember [the child]543-the child ! Remember [we]3000-we have the Dee - puk - râg . " Another laugh came from [the men]2022-the men . "[3000-we] If [you]3733-am - ma have the Dee - puk - râg , send it now . [We]3000-we need light , for sure , and-- " The voice ended in a gasp-- For it was there ! A long ray of light , showing [them]2022-the men that [they]2022-the men were , indeed , just opposite [the gaol]1501-the gaol . "[3000-we] Am - ma ! " came [Erda]105-erda 's voice again , and there was a hush and yet a triumph in it , "[3000-we] to the right -- steer to the right . " [The raft]4626-the raft edged slowly towards [the ray]5491-the ray , but [the soldiers]4177-the soldiers still crouched inactive ; awed , yet not certain . Then suddenly that quick crack of [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's first shot echoed over [the river]333-the river , then the yell , then the answering shots . And following on [their]2022-the men heels rapidly came a stir among [those crouching figures]5494-those crouching figures , and [one of [them]2022-the men]2290-one of them stood up excitedly--"It[3000-we] has begun!--see [you]3733-am - ma , [Prag]277-prag ! [Lehna]278-lehna , give [the boatman]3006-the boatman a hand ! [Lo]123-lo ! do as [the Miss - baba]678-the miss - baba bade [thee]3733-am - ma , quickly , [son of a pig]3008-son of a pig ! Steer for the light -- [they]3009-they have begun ! " [Erda]105-erda gave a sigh of relief . That danger was over . The fact that the quarrel had begun did not , however , have the same effect upon [Roshan Khân]89-roshan . In the first tempest of rage and hate which the sight of [Laila]86-laila and [Vincent]71-vincent in [the balcony]644-the balcony had roused in [him]89-roshan [he]89-roshan had simply let [himself]89-roshan go . [He]89-roshan had not thought at all . Had [his]89-roshan revolver held other cartridges , [he]89-roshan would have gone on shooting at [Vincent]71-vincent , [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , at [everybody]939-everybody , till [he]89-roshan could shoot no more . [He]89-roshan had run â - mak ; that curious phase of the Oriental mind when once it oversteps the hard and fast lines of custom in which it moves and breathes and has its being . The very fact that [his]89-roshan revolver did not contain more possibilities for death , that [he]89-roshan had no other weapon , emphasized [his]89-roshan wild revolt . [He]89-roshan was helpless -- impotent -- before [these strangers]5498-these strangers , who had stolen everything ! Everything , save bare existence . This thought , as [he]89-roshan burst into the open , into the lurid darkness of the new - come storm , had made [him]89-roshan laugh bitterly ; for it was only that bare existence which [he]89-roshan wished to steal ! [They]5498-these strangers might keep the rest ; but that [he]89-roshan would claim from [them]5498-these strangers somehow , in fair exchange . The time was ripe for such exchange too,--for fair exchange . ( The epithet "[3009-they] fair " haunted [him]89-roshan , trying to still the keen remorse for that shot in the dark ; for one part of [him]89-roshan knew it to have been cowardly . ) Yes ! this useless plot , with foolish mischief hidden in its heart , to which [he]89-roshan had just been listening with loyal intent to frustrate it , could be made to serve [his]89-roshan purpose without delay . [[His]89-roshan men]4923-his men would follow [him]89-roshan anywhere . [He]89-roshan had but to say the word -- the word so many of [them]4923-his men wanted . Then , [those thieves of all that made life worth living]5500-those thieves of all that made life worth living would learn a lesson . [They]5500-those thieves of all that made life worth living would fight and win , of course ; but the lesson that without [such men as [he]89-roshan]5501-such men as he -- [men whom [they]5500-those thieves of all that made life worth living thwarted and repressed at every turn -- [they]5500-those thieves of all that made life worth living could not rely upon [[their]5500-those thieves of all that made life worth living regiments]5503-their regiments]5502-men whom they thwarted and repressed at every turn -- they could not rely upon their regiments , would have to be learnt . And in the learning , [one thief]5504-one thief would learn something else . So , without more thought than this desperate clashing of jealousy and despair , [he]89-roshan had dashed through the crowd of [pilgrims who were waiting for the dawn]5505-pilgrims who were waiting for the dawn , gone back to [the Fort]3493-the fort , and given the word . In the excitement which followed , spreading swiftly from [his]89-roshan own , [he]89-roshan had not -- and it was typical of [the man]3467-the man that [he]89-roshan did not -- forget [Lance Carlyon]68-lance 's friendliness ; a more equal friendliness than that of most . There was no need to drag [him]89-roshan into the quarrel , the more so because the disloyalty of [the Sikh pioneers]5508-the sikh pioneers was doubtful . [They]5508-the sikh pioneers might complicate matters at the beginning . So [he]89-roshan had locked and barred [them]5508-the sikh pioneers into [the inner courtyard]2614-the inner courtyard , out of the way . But [Captain Dering]71-vincent , [he]89-roshan knew , was outside ! Let [him]71-vincent be alone with [[his]71-vincent troopers]2683-his troopers , as [he]71-vincent , [Roshan]89-roshan would be alone with [them]2683-his troopers ! Let [them]2683-his troopers both try [their]2683-his troopers influence ; let [them]2683-his troopers try conclusions on these terms . That was but fair . This first step , however , necessitated others . The original plot , with its waiting for the dawn , its cumbrous mechanism of keys , and [pilgrims]1948-pilgrims , and [God]96-god knows what , was not to [his]89-roshan liking . [He]89-roshan meant to fight . And if , as [the conspirators]5512-the conspirators had asserted , [some of [the warders]5284-the warders]5513-some of the warders were [friends]3433-friends hand and foot , [[his]89-roshan men]4923-his men could crack the nut of [the gaol]1501-the gaol in half an hour . The sooner the better . [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , [he]89-roshan knew , had recognized [him]89-roshan , and [he]89-roshan was a fox for wiliness . Then , [Captain Dering]71-vincent must be after [him]89-roshan even now . And [Dillon]69-dr. dillon - [sahib]5518-sahib might be on the alert any time . So the coup de main must come at once . As to what might follow , that might be after the fashion of [Meerut]279-meerut in ' 57 , or not . Who could tell the end of anything ? The beginning would be an opportunity for fair fight between [him]89-roshan and [a thief]1778-a thief . Once more the epithet "[278-lehna] fair " scorched and shrivelled [him]89-roshan with vague remorse , not for [Laila]86-laila -- [she]86-laila was but [a woman]3949-a woman , [a woman who had played [him]89-roshan false and who deserved the worst]5521-a woman who had played him false and who deserved the worst -- but for that shot in the dark . For there were [two Roshans]5522-two roshans , warring fiercely in heart and brain . Then , after [his]89-roshan mad , reckless ride to [the gaol]1501-the gaol , the first realities had come to [him]89-roshan in the sight of [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , standing with the light in [his]69-dr. dillon hand to welcome [friends]3433-friends ; and in the sound of those two snap - shots proclaiming [foes]5525-foes . Why ? The question had come swiftly . What quarrel had [he]89-roshan with [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon ? Or with [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , whose tall , gaunt figure showed behind the other ? [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , who must have brought [[his]74-eugene smith wife]3429-his wife , [[his]74-eugene smith child]3916-his child , with [him]74-eugene smith ! The horror , the terror of what might come , swept through [the quondam prize pupil of [a mission school]3822-a mission school]5528-the quondam prize pupil of a mission school ; the horror , the terror , in the remembrance of the Great Mutiny , which is , alas ! a legacy of wrong to [young India]8-india . Which ties [her]8-india hand and foot ; which makes [those who are worthy of the name]5530-those who are worthy of the name shrink instinctively from anything which may rouse the underlying savagery -- the unavoidable savagery -- of [[their]5530-those who are worthy of the name countrymen]5531-their countrymen . Could [he]89-roshan hold [[his]89-roshan troopers]2683-his troopers ? Could [he]89-roshan be sure ? [He]89-roshan had come to curse . Was it too late to bless ? Then the memory of [Laila]86-laila -- the whole hateful tale which was irrevocable -- struck [him]89-roshan hopeless . [He]89-roshan was damned utterly ; [he]89-roshan could not escape . [He]89-roshan sat rigid as a statue on [his]89-roshan horse for a second ; then with a wild fury gave the orders for [[his]89-roshan troopers]2683-his troopers to dismount and force the gates . "[3009-they] [[Your]3010-your slaves]3011-your slaves , [Nawab - sahib]122-nawab ! " had come the answer , making [him]89-roshan smile proudly . That , at any rate , could not be stolen from [him]89-roshan now . Now [he]89-roshan could fight and die in what should have been [his]89-roshan real position . Yet , once more , when the search - light had come to throw [that group of excited men hacking and hewing at doors closed by authority]5534-that group of excited men hacking and hewing at doors closed by authority into significant black - and - white relief , that doubt had returned ; that desire to be on the side , once more , of [men like [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , whose bold resolve to be alone responsible for [[his]69-dr. dillon gaol]5536-his gaol]5535-men like dr. dillon , whose bold resolve to be alone responsible for his gaol , which [the warder]5537-the warder 's tale revealed , filled [him]89-roshan with admiration . But that sudden throwing up of [a trooper]5538-a trooper 's hands , that sidelong stumble into death , had left [Roshan]89-roshan cruel as death itself ; for [the man thus killed]5539-the man thus killed had been to [him]89-roshan as [a brother]5540-a brother . So [he]89-roshan had gone on with a fresh impulse towards revenge , and for a time found forgetfulness in the excitement , the action . For though the first gate , that one giving on [the open sort of porch]5541-the open sort of porch , had yielded , almost at once , to [the troopers outside]5542-the troopers outside and [the warders]5284-the warders within , the second , barring [the arched tunnel]5544-the arched tunnel , was a tougher job . It was not until this had given way , and [the attacking party]5545-the attacking party were completely sheltered from the fire of the little garrison on the roof , that there was leisure for that thought to return : "[3009-they] What am [I]0-i doing ? Why am [I]0-i doing it ? " [No man]3908-no man , it may be said broadly , ever fights without feeling that the battle is an appeal to [a tribunal beyond [himself]89-roshan]5547-a tribunal beyond himself , and [Roshan]89-roshan did not feel this . Then the remembrance of [the woman]1071-the woman , [the child]543-the child , [upstairs]3544-upstairs came persistently , burdened by the weight of that past tragedy which , in [India]8-india , it is impossible to forget . And this was [a woman who had always been courteous to [him]89-roshan]5551-a woman who had always been courteous to him , [a child to whom [he]89-roshan had given toys]5552-a child to whom he had given toys . What was [he]89-roshan doing ? [The men]2022-the men were at work on the last , the strongest gate , with every tool [they]2022-the men could find . Not many , for [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's forethought had left them before barred doors everywhere . The delay had already been great ; would be greater . [They]2022-the men must be close now on the lines of the original plot , at which [Roshan]89-roshan had laughed , for the dawn was showing faintly -- a mere promise of light to come -- in [the east]1745-the east . And the storm was passing . The dull reverberations of faint thunder were lost now in the cries , the blows of [those at work trying to batter down the iron bars]5555-those at work trying to batter down the iron bars . A sudden distaste -- more than regret or repentance -- came to [Roshan]89-roshan as [he]89-roshan stood silent , watching blow after blow ; a sudden doubt . Which was the right ? [No man worth calling]5556-no man worth calling [a man]533-a man ever fights for anything else ; [every man worth calling one]5558-every man worth calling one fights for that . But which was right ? [Those men , hacking and hewing]5559-those men , hacking and hewing , or [the little garrison [upstairs]3544-upstairs]5560-the little garrison upstairs ? There were no such searchings of heart there , at any rate ; no question as to what [they]2022-the men were doing , though at that exact moment [they]2022-the men were engaged in the trivial occupation of drinking tea . [Muriel Smith]151-muriel had made it , at [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's suggestion , against this very pause ; this "[0-i] cease firing " which [he]89-roshan had foreseen . And in the making of it [she]151-muriel had used a continental tea - basket which more than once had been [her]151-muriel companion on [the [Brindisi]10-brindisi route]5562-the brindisi route . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon had laid hands on it in [his]69-dr. dillon foraging , and as [she]151-muriel had boiled the kettle , the rush and roar of [a train]5563-a train racing through the peaceful French champaignes had seemed to be in [her]151-muriel ears , instead of that rush and roar of blows and shouting which was now rising from [every part of [the gaol]1501-the gaol]5564-every part of the gaol ; though [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners were still helpless for evil in [their]1510-the prisoners sections . So [the three men , haggard , anxious]5567-the three men , haggard , anxious , drank [their]5567-the three men , haggard , anxious tea in silence , hastily ; yet with a curious insistence , as if the triviality gave [them]5567-the three men , haggard , anxious a hold on things familiar , things beyond this midsummer - night 's dream of madness . But [the child]543-the child chattered as [she]543-the child munched a biscuit ; chattered of the charms of this strange picnic on the "[0-i] woof , in the dark with oo 's nighty an ' s'ippers only . " [The unconscious little voice]5569-the unconscious little voice struck a chill to [the men]2022-the men 's hearts , but [the woman]1071-the woman smiled , as [mothers]3864-mothers can do when [they]3864-mothers wish to guard that blessed unconsciousness to the last ; the unconsciousness of which [they]3864-mothers are [guardians]5573-guardians by right . "[0-i] [We]3012-we are doing as well as could be expected , " remarked [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , suddenly , with a quaint professional reminiscence ; then added , "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to [God]96-god , though , [I]0-i knew what [[my]0-i prisoners]3013-my prisoners were up to -- [those solitary cellers]3014-those solitary cellers are on [my]0-i mind -- [I]0-i believe [the convalescents]3015-the convalescents could dig [them]3014-those solitary cellers out with the cook - room platters and ladles . [I]0-i ought to have thought of that . But , as [I]0-i say , [we]3012-we are doing very fairly well -- [your]3016-your light , [Dering]71-vincent , was [a godsend]3017-a godsend . " [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith looked up sharply , almost as if [he]74-eugene smith meant a disclaimer ; then [he]74-eugene smith gave a brief assent . "[3017-a godsend] Yes ! but that will be more of [a godsend]3017-a godsend still -- it is the dawn ! " [He]74-eugene smith pointed to that faint promise of light in [the east]1745-the east , and [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's eyes followed [his]74-eugene smith hand with the doubtful look of [one sick to death]5575-one sick to death , as [he]71-vincent watches the long weary night merge once more into another long weary day of certain pain . There was an utter hopelessness in it . "[68-lance] Yes , " [he]71-vincent echoed slowly , "[68-lance] that is the dawn . " "[68-lance] [Carlyon]68-lance said the attack was planned for dawn , did n't [he]68-lance ? " asked [the doctor]334-the doctor , deliberately helping [himself]334-the doctor to another lump of sugar , deliberately trying to keep the pulse beats of those around [him]334-the doctor as near normal as might be -- and there had been something beyond it in [Vincent]71-vincent 's voice . "[3019-they] [They]3019-they must have meant to use the keys that [brute Kishen Rao]274-kishen rao made off with . [I]0-i wonder what it was that started the show prematurely ? " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i think it was premature ? Why ? " put in [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith . "[3020-we] [We]3020-we should have had [some of [the townspeople]3022-the townspeople]3021-some of the townspeople , some of [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims otherwise . " "[3021-some of the townspeople] Perhaps the storm"--began [Vincent]71-vincent . [The doctor]334-the doctor shook [his]334-the doctor head . "[3021-some of the townspeople] If [they]3019-they had meant to come [they]3019-they would have come . Of course now , with the wind blowing straight off [us]3020-we , [they]3019-they ca n't possibly hear . " [He]0-i paused and listened , for a sudden silence had fallen on the turmoil beneath , and out of it came an all too familiar sound , the clank of leg irons . [Some of [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners]5578-some of the prisoners , therefore , had managed to break out of [[their]5578-some of the prisoners dormitories]5580-their dormitories ; or were these [the solitary cellers]2952-the solitary cellers ? "[3019-they] [I]0-i wish [Carlyon]68-lance would turn up , " [he]0-i muttered , almost petulantly , "[0-i] it 's [our]3020-we only chance-- " But there was to be another ; for , from below , a voice rose loud and clear . "[69-dr. dillon] [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon ! [I]0-i have no desire to hurt [you]69-dr. dillon or [yours]69-dr. dillon , but [I]0-i warn [you]69-dr. dillon that , if [you]69-dr. dillon persist , [I]0-i am not responsible . Open the gates , and [you]69-dr. dillon shall have a safe conduct -- for -- for [everybody]939-everybody . " [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon was on [his]69-dr. dillon feet at once , but [Captain Dering]71-vincent stopped [him]69-dr. dillon ; [his]0-i eyes ablaze . "[0-i] What shall [I]0-i tell [him]3025-him , [Dillon]69-dr. dillon ? " [he]0-i said sharply . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll take [my]0-i orders from [you]69-dr. dillon -- [you're]69-dr. dillon in charge ; but [that man]4278-that man is under [mine]0-i . What shall [I]0-i say ? " [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon gave one glance at [the woman]1071-the woman and [the child]543-the child . "[0-i] Tell [him]3025-him to be universally damned , " [he]69-dr. dillon answered ; and [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , [husband]5584-husband and [father]5585-father , nodded acquiescence . [Roshan Khân]89-roshan was standing in full view as [Vincent Dering]71-vincent stepped up to [the parapet]5462-the parapet . [His]89-roshan face was raised ; there was almost an appeal in it . But every atom of that , every atom almost of humanity , vanished as [he]89-roshan recognized [[his]89-roshan captain]394-his captain . [His]89-roshan hand went instinctively to [his]89-roshan revolver . Then a thought seemed to come to [him]89-roshan . [He]89-roshan drew [himself]89-roshan up proudly , and waited for the answer . It came , keen as a knife . "[0-i] [Risaldar]92-risaldar ! draw off [[your]92-risaldar men]4921-your men and return to [barracks]5031-barracks , or [I]0-i 'll shoot [you]92-risaldar as [a mutineer]3029-a mutineer . " There was half a second 's silence ; then a wild laugh : "[0-i] Close up , [men]312-men , rush that gate -- forward ! " The words and the crack of [Vincent]71-vincent 's revolver -- the bullet of which , aimed too high , passed through [Roshan]89-roshan 's turban - were almost lost in the answering yell . But [the risaldar]3899-the risaldar stood [his]89-roshan ground for a second , then coolly sought shelter . That was over ! [They]5589-they were quits now for the fair fight . And fate had been kind . [He]89-roshan had unwittingly offered [this man]2070-this man -- [[his]89-roshan greatest enemy]5591-his greatest enemy -- a safe conduct ; and it had been refused , luckily . Well ! let [Vincent Dering]71-vincent take the whole consequences . The blood of [one woman]4027-one woman was already on [his]71-vincent head ; so would be the blood spilt here . [He]89-roshan , [Roshan]89-roshan , would need have no further scruples . So , as if it had gained strength from the brief respite , the turmoil recommenced ; and now [Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's voice could be heard urging [the men]2022-the men on . And there were answering shouts from different parts of [the gaol]1501-the gaol . [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon frowned . "[0-i] [They]3031-they mean business now . And [I]0-i fancy [I]0-i hear pounding at the left section door . If so [we]3032-we shall have [the solitary cell men]3033-the solitary cell men -- [[my]0-i worst lot]3034-my worst lot , of course -- out in [the courtyard]386-the courtyard before long . [Dering]71-vincent -- can [you]71-vincent hear anything?--there 's such a confounded noise-- " [Vincent]71-vincent , who was standing at the top of the stairs which led to the ten - feet drop , ran down a few steps and listened . Then [he]71-vincent looked up quickly and nodded . "[3031-they] [They]3031-they are there . The door 's shaking . How many of [them]3031-they are there ? " "[3031-they] Two dozen or thereabouts ; and [the convalescents]3015-the convalescents , of course . That 's nothing -- if [they]3015-the convalescents have n't got [their]3015-the convalescents leg irons off ! [We]3032-we ought to settle most of [them]3015-the convalescents before [they]3015-the convalescents can help with the door . Still , [I]0-i wish [Carlyon]68-lance would turn up . " A sudden hurry and urgency had come to the struggle , and [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon passed restlessly to the other side of the roof . The sky was lightening faintly . More because the dust had sought dust again , [the earth earth]5595-the earth earth , than from any increase of light ; and so the broad ray of the search - light , widening as it went , lost itself in the distant darkness , and there was nothing to be seen riverwards . But close at hand [two men]924-two men -- one in [a warder]4468-a warder 's uniform -- were running towards [the gaol]1501-the gaol , shouting . [The doctor]334-the doctor was back to [the inner parapet]5600-the inner parapet in a second . "[68-lance] Look out ! [they]3031-they 've got the keys now -- not of this door , but some of the sections -- and [the alley]3795-the alley . The game 's up unless [Carlyon]68-lance -- [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith , please -- [you]75-mrs. smith had better go into [the turret]3038-the turret -- [we]3032-we shall be shooting free-- " [Eugene]74-eugene smith , who had been standing beside [her]3039-dear , laid [his]74-eugene smith hand on [her]3039-dear shoulder . "[3039-dear] Yes , [dear]3039-dear ! " [he]74-eugene smith said gently ; "[3039-dear] go inside -- it will be better for [Gladys]276-gladys -- and for [me--]3040-me-- " [Muriel]151-muriel turned white , but stood quite firm , quite calm . "[3039-dear] Come , [little girlie]3041-little girlie , " [she]151-muriel said , holding out [her]151-muriel hand to [the child]543-the child . "[3041-little girlie] [You]3041-little girlie 've had [your]3041-little girlie tea -- it 's bedtime -- [I]0-i ca n't have [you]3041-little girlie sitting up all-- " [she]3039-dear broke down a little , partly because [she]3039-dear was passing [Vincent]71-vincent , and [he]71-vincent , busy loading various rifles and revolvers , kept [his]71-vincent eyes studiously from [her]3039-dear . But [Gladys]276-gladys did not choose to pass [[her]276-gladys friend]5602-her friend in this fashion . [She]276-gladys paused , [a dainty little figure in a blue dressing - gown , like [[her]276-gladys mother]514-her mother , and with the same fluffy golden curls about [her]276-gladys coaxing , delicate little child 's face]5603-a dainty little figure in a blue dressing - gown , like her mother , and with the same fluffy golden curls about her coaxing , delicate little child 's face . "[3039-dear] Dood - night , Derin ' darlin ' , " [she]276-gladys said . " The coaxing face was close to [the haggard , haunted - looking one]5606-the haggard , haunted - looking one . "[0-i] [I]0-i think so , [little one]3045-little one . Good - night . " [He]0-i put [the child]543-the child down hastily , at a crash . The moment for courage had come . "[276-gladys] Shoot as straight as [you]276-gladys can ! " shouted [the doctor]334-the doctor . "[276-gladys] The section door 's gone . Let ['em]3046-'em have it ! " The door had gone , indeed ; and in a second [the courtyard beneath [them]3046-'em]5609-the courtyard beneath them was half full of [naked , desperate men]5610-naked , desperate men ; [the worst characters in [the gaol]1501-the gaol]5611-the worst characters in the gaol . "[3046-'em] Pick off [the ones nearest the gate]3047-the ones nearest the gate -- don't let ['em]3046-'em touch the bolts -- it 's good for another ten minutes if [we]3046-'em can keep them from it , " came [the doctor]334-the doctor 's voice in jerks , as [he]334-the doctor leant over the parapet just above the centre of the door below , and carried out [his]334-the doctor own orders with deadly effect ; though [his]334-the doctor heart sank when [he]334-the doctor saw that [some of [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners]5578-some of the prisoners were unironed -- or rather unironed on one leg , and that [they]5578-some of the prisoners were armed with the other iron ; a deadly enough weapon at close quarters . Besides , it meant more treachery . It meant a previous filing of the ankle - fetters ; and if others in [the remaining sections]5616-the remaining sections were as free-- [He]334-the doctor shot quicker , steadier , while [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith and [Vincent]71-vincent , [one above the other on the top of the stair]5617-one above the other on the top of the stair , did the same , taking [the intruders]2791-the intruders on the flank . It was growing lighter every instant , the air was clearer , the breeze of dawn was sweeping the smoke of the rifles riverwards , the great white wheel of [the gaol]1501-the gaol was growing broader in its outlines , the shadows were shrinking . But the storm seemed still there , in the ceaseless reverberations . "[3048-they] [They]3048-they 're up to something in the far corner ! " called [Eugene]74-eugene smith . "[3048-they] What is it , [Dillon]69-dr. dillon ? [You]69-dr. dillon can see better . " [The doctor]334-the doctor ceased firing for a second , and ran farther down the parapet . "[69-dr. dillon] The keys ! the keys ! " [he]334-the doctor shouted back . "[3048-they] [They]3048-they are trying to pass in the keys ! Shoot [the devils]4620-the devils -- [those in the corner]3050-those in the corner ! Do n't let ['em]3051-'em -- or [the gaol]1501-the gaol is gone ! " So , for the next minute , it was deadly work down in that corner by the crevice through which some unseen hand was thrusting something . Three times [a man]533-a man , clutching at the prize , fell in a heap ere [he]533-a man touched it . Then [a fourth]5622-a fourth pitched forward against the doors with the keys in [his]533-a man hand , and [a fifth]5623-a fifth , groping for them , rolled over on [his]5623-a fifth side with them hidden under [his]5623-a fifth dead body . And from outside the gate came rendings , and crashings , and yells ; from above , that call , "[3051-'em] Shoot straight , or [the gaol]1501-the gaol 's gone ! " [Muriel]151-muriel crept out from [shelter]5624-shelter , possessed once more by that frantic desire to see to the very end , and stood looking down on [those two on the stairs]5625-those two on the stairs . [She]151-muriel gave a faint cry when [Vincent]71-vincent flung [his]71-vincent rifle away , and ran down to that ten - foot drop for revolver practice . At the sound , [[her]151-muriel husband]3787-her husband gave one quick look up , and followed suit . But [their]5625-those two on the stairs own success was against [them]5625-those two on the stairs . The growing pile of [the wounded]5627-the wounded formed a barricade , behind which [a man , squirming with covetous hands among the dead and dying]5628-a man , squirming with covetous hands among the dead and dying , found what [he]5628-a man , squirming with covetous hands among the dead and dying sought . "[3054-him] [He]3054-him 's got [them]3055-them ! Stop [him]3054-him ! stop [him]3054-him ! " There was a fusillade , [the man]3467-the man dropped ; but the keys were in another hand -- another -- another -- passing outwards from the crush -- outwards towards that low door at the end of [the narrow alley]5630-the narrow alley . Without a word , [Vincent]71-vincent , revolver in hand , let [himself]71-vincent drop on the heads below . "[3054-him] Oh , do n't , [Vincent]71-vincent , do n't ! " came [a woman]3949-a woman 's voice ; and at the sound , [another man]1875-another man gave that swift look up once more , and followed suit . "[71-vincent] Let [them]3055-them be ! " said [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , sharply . "[71-vincent] Let [them]3055-them do what [they]3055-them can ; it is about the only chance . " And still , as [he]69-dr. dillon spoke , [he]69-dr. dillon kept singling out [a foe]5633-a foe and firing . The chance , even with [his]69-dr. dillon help , was a poor one in [that crowd]5634-that crowd , where there was always another dark hand to snatch at the prize , and pass it nearer to the door -- that door which was the key to so much ! Yet , the crush through which [they]3055-them fought lessening , [those two Englishmen]5635-those two englishmen found [themselves]3055-them with the straight alley before [them]3055-them for a race . A race against [three men , without arms , but without irons]5636-three men , without arms , but without irons ; and with a fair start . While close behind was the crush -- [the crowd]4412-the crowd ! It was nothing but a race , now , since the revolvers had done [their]3055-them worst , had fired [their]3055-them last shot ; a race with the hope -- if [Vincent]71-vincent could come up with those three -- of using a Goorkha kukri , which [he]71-vincent had thrust into the yellow silk sash [he]71-vincent wore instead of a waistcoat beneath [his]71-vincent red jacket -- thrust it therewith an ugly frown as a last argument for [[his]71-vincent foes]5638-his foes , when [he]71-vincent had seen it lying among the pile of miscellaneous weapons [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon had foraged from [[the Smiths]85-the smiths ' house]5639-the smiths ' house . It had a dainty ivory handle -- [Vincent]71-vincent had given it to [Mrs. Smith]75-mrs. smith [himself]71-vincent , and its last use had been to cut the pages of a fashion paper-- It had a sterner job now . But [Vincent]71-vincent was behind ; [a yard]5640-a yard or two -- no more . [He]71-vincent had fired one more shot before beginning the race , and [Eugene]74-eugene smith 's legs were longer . Yet [the yard]2601-the yard meant all things , and [he]71-vincent knew it ; so as [he]71-vincent ran , [his]71-vincent hand sought the knife . "[71-vincent] Look out , [Smith]74-eugene smith ! look out ! " [he]0-i called . "[74-eugene smith] [I]0-i 'll chuck [you]74-eugene smith [my]0-i kukri ; get on and job [them]3056-them ; [I]0-i 'll keep [the others]3977-the others back -- a bit . " As [he]0-i spoke , a glittering curve sped from [his]0-i hand to [the other man]5642-the other man 's feet . Then [he]0-i pulled up and faced [the crowd]4412-the crowd behind with [his]0-i clubbed revolver . [The lane]5644-the lane was very narrow . [Three men]5645-three men could barely breast it shoulder to shoulder . Surely one could bar [it]5644-the lane by swift blows and slow retreat ! For a time , at any rate -- time for the opening and shutting of a door ! [He]0-i could but try . "[3058-he] Oh ! what is [he]3058-he going to do ? " gasped [the woman who was watching]5646-the woman who was watching . "[0-i] [I]0-i appose [he]3058-he 's going to be brave , [mum]3622-mum , " said [the child]543-the child , who clutched at [her]543-the child hand , watching , too , with great , wide , uncomprehending eyes . But [the man beside [them]5645-three men]5648-the man beside them held [his]5648-the man beside them breath . So retreating , step by step , [Vincent Dering]71-vincent kept [the crowd]4412-the crowd back , lured [the crowd]4412-the crowd on , safe -- so far ! For these , the first , the swiftest , were naturally the unironed , therefore , [the unarmed]5651-the unarmed . But there were [others]569-others , forcing [their]569-others way to the front , who would be harder to deal with . [Vincent]71-vincent threw [his]71-vincent head back and wondered how [Eugene]74-eugene smith was faring ; for [he]71-vincent dared not turn [his]71-vincent face from [his]71-vincent task even for a second . Had [those three]5653-those three been caught up ? Had [the kukri]5654-the kukri helped ? [It]5654-the kukri had . And one of those three had fallen before a flash , as of light . And another ! But [the third]5655-the third had the key in the door ; had turned it , when [Eugene]74-eugene smith struck [him]5655-the third from behind . With a wild yell [he]5655-the third flung [his]5655-the third full weight on the door ; it burst open , and the two fell headlong into [the tower beyond]5656-the tower beyond . But only for a second . [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith was up again , had the key out , and in on the further side . "[3622-mum] All right ! " [he]74-eugene smith shouted ; "[3622-mum] make a rush for it ! [I]0-i 'm ready ! " [Vincent Dering]71-vincent gave one sharp look round . The door was not four yards from [him]71-vincent , but [the crowd]4412-the crowd was not one . There was no time . "[0-i] Shut it , " [he]71-vincent called , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm all right . " [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith stood uncertain ; the door ajar . The keys ! ah ! what could [he]71-vincent do with the keys if [he]71-vincent went back to help -- and if not-- "[0-i] Oh ! please shut it , [Smith]74-eugene smith ! there 's [a good fellow]3060-a good fellow ; please . " The four yards were two now , were one . Then slowly the door closed , and [Vincent]71-vincent had [his]71-vincent back against it . "[3060-a good fellow] Oh , [Vincent]71-vincent ! [Vincent]71-vincent ! " The agonized cry echoed above all other cries , but only for an instant ; the next , [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's hand was gagging the lips which uttered it . "[71-vincent] Hush ! " [he]0-i said fiercely . "[71-vincent] Ca n't [you]71-vincent let [him]3060-a good fellow forget for these last few minutes that there is such a thing as [a woman in [the world]404-the world]3061-a woman in the world . Hush ! [I]0-i say . " And a great hush came . The sound of blows , of iron clashing on iron , and falling with a dull thud on something softer , seemed to fill [the world]404-the world and leave room for nothing else . Nothing except a softer sound still . A shuddering moan , as [a woman]3949-a woman slipped to [her]3949-a woman knees , and covered [her]3949-a woman face with [her]3949-a woman hands ; then slipped lower still to the ground , in a heap . But [the child]543-the child looked at [[her]543-the child mother]514-her mother , surprised . "[0-i] Does n't ' oo like Derin ' darlin ' to be brave , [dearest]2988-dearest ? " [she]514-her mother asked , in a concerned little voice . Had an hour passed , or twain ? [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian could not tell . It seemed to [him]81-father ninian that [he]81-father ninian had been kneeling for a lifetime , there on the altar steps beside [the dying girl]5205-the dying girl , with the glittering red - and - gold drapery trailing to the white marble , and opening to a white breast stained red,--a brighter red ! A long lifetime ; long as [his]81-father ninian own ; that long life in which [he]81-father ninian had seen , had felt , so much . For as [he]81-father ninian waited for [her]5205-the dying girl inevitable death , [his]81-father ninian mind had followed that long life of [his]81-father ninian own , year after year , day after day , hour after hour . And everywhere it had seen [a woman]3949-a woman 's eyes , [a woman]3949-a woman 's soul , looking back from a soul , from eyes , that should have been [a man]533-a man 's . Yes ! the keynote of that long life had been the love of [a woman]3949-a woman . Passionate love , absorbing mind as well as body , claiming its reward in kind ; as such love always does . In kind ! There lay the whole difference between anathema and beata . [They]5667-they were both karma , or desire ! One of [the girl]481-the girl 's white feet slid with a silvery jingle of its anklet to the next step , and , as [he]81-father ninian replaced it to a more comfortable position , a chill struck to [his]81-father ninian heart as [he]81-father ninian remembered what such chiming had meant in the past history of [the world]404-the world . The measure which that provoked was -- anathema . That -- disguised , palliated , refined in a thousand ways -- was one kind . And the other ? The memory of [his]81-father ninian own past surged to [his]81-father ninian brain as [he]81-father ninian bent over [the girl]481-the girl 's whitening face and scanned it narrowly . How like the face was to that other one , now that coming death had sharpened the full , youthful curves . [He]81-father ninian had noticed the likeness often -- it had been clear when [Laila]86-laila had worn the old Italian -- Beatrice's -- dress . But not so clear , not half so clear , as when in this -- this almost shameless one -- [she]86-laila had said--"I[0-i] only want -- [him]3064-him . " It might have been [Margherita]147-margherita speaking,--Margherita , who had wanted [a man]533-a man 's soul . And [she]86-laila had had one . That was the other kind . But both were desire ; the desire which drove humanity from [Paradise]9-paradise , and keeps it vainly seeking for one still . Saturated as [he]81-father ninian was with the mysticism of [the East and West]5672-the east and west , these thoughts came to [him]81-father ninian , dreamily , making [him]81-father ninian feel curiously aloof from [himself]81-father ninian . The pity of it filled [him]81-father ninian , and brought a pity for [the dying girl]5205-the dying girl also ; [the girl who had failed to find a paradise in [this world]342-this world]5674-the girl who had failed to find a paradise in this world , and was seeking a new road to [it]9-paradise ; seeking it alone . The only thing [she]481-the girl craved in [all [God]96-god 's earth]5676-all god 's earth to make [that paradise]5677-that paradise -- gone ! [Priest]280-priest as [he]81-father ninian was , the humanity in [him]81-father ninian rose in passionate hope that [she]481-the girl should not wake to the consciousness of this . What good would it do ? Let [her]481-the girl enter the shadows in peace . But as [he]81-father ninian wished the wish , [her]481-the girl head , which had been resting on [his]81-father ninian arm , turned to the touch of it , and [her]481-the girl smooth cheek nestled closer to what it found . "[3064-him] Kiss [me]0-i , [Vincent]71-vincent , " [she]481-the girl said , and [her]481-the girl voice came back full , rich , round , to make the claim . "[71-vincent] Kiss [me]0-i before [you]71-vincent go , [dear]3039-dear ! " [The old man]3483-the old man gave a slight shiver , and was silent . "[71-vincent] [Vincent]71-vincent ! " came the voice again ; "[71-vincent] [you]71-vincent are there , are n't [you]71-vincent ? [You]71-vincent would n't leave [me]0-i -- now -- surely ? " There was another silent pause , and then , silent still , [Father Ninian]81-father ninian stooped , and the old lips and [the young ones]5679-the young ones met in a [lover]5680-lover 's kiss . And as [they]5681-they met , [he]81-father ninian knew that in that kiss lay the great renunciation of [his]81-father ninian life ; that henceforward there would be [no woman]5682-no woman waiting in [Paradise]9-paradise for [him]81-father ninian ; that [the spiritual presence]5683-the spiritual presence had gone from [his]81-father ninian life like the bodily presence . That [Margherita]147-margherita was [Juliet]100-juliet , and [Juliet]100-juliet , [Margherita]147-margherita ! "[71-vincent] That 's nice , " murmured [Laila]86-laila , softly ; "[71-vincent] that 's nice . " [Her]86-laila head settled to [his]81-father ninian arm again , and the silence went on . On and on , till [he]81-father ninian stooped lower to listen for an unheard breath ; then lower still to shift that head from [his]81-father ninian arm to the ground . For the need of a human touch , a human sympathy , had gone forever . [He]81-father ninian made the sign of the cross over the dead body , rose to [his]81-father ninian feet unsteadily , and looked about [him]81-father ninian , dazed , uncertain . In truth , [he]81-father ninian felt all [his]81-father ninian years for the first time ; felt that [his]81-father ninian last hold on life had somehow gone from [him]81-father ninian in that kiss ; that something more than [one woman]4027-one woman lay dead before [him]81-father ninian . Then the sight of [Akbar Khân]110-akbar , still rocking [himself]110-akbar backwards and forwards , a perfect pendulum of protesting innocence and helpless remorse , roused [the old priest]1250-the old priest to the present . [He]81-father ninian took up the rapier [he]81-father ninian had laid aside in crossing [the chapel]1291-the chapel , and passed over to where [the old eunuch]2631-the old eunuch was bemoaning the high - handedness of fate . It was a tyranny , indeed ! Who could have foreseen such an ending to a very ordinary intrigue ? Who could even have dreamt of it ? Had not [men]312-men and [women]479-women loved and met , thus , since the beginning of time ? So , to [the sinner]5690-the sinner 's outraged experience of life and love came [the saint]3520-the saint with [his]3520-the saint , and with the face and sword of [St. Michael]281-st. michael and [All Angels]5692-all angels . "[71-vincent] Tell [me]0-i the truth , " [he]0-i said sternly ; "[71-vincent] and tell it quickly , for there is no time to lose . " In truth there was not much to tell . It was all so simple , viewed as a whole ; so complex in detail . And , as [he]0-i listened , the anger left [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's face wistful , wondering . More so than ever at the last mumbling excuse . "[71-vincent] It all comes , [Ge - reeb]282-ge - reeb - pun - wâz , from [the Almighty]2398-the almighty having made [the Missy - baba]111-the missy - baba so like [her]3067-her sainted ancestress -- [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum -- on whom be peace . " [Anâri Begum]125-anâri begum ! On whom be peace ! [[Her]125-anâri begum sainted ancestress]5693-her sainted ancestress , on whom be peace ! [He]0-i stood for an instant looking towards [the Altar]5145-the altar , towards [the dead girl]558-the dead girl ; then [he]0-i echoed under [his]0-i breath , "[2398-the almighty] On whom be peace ! " That was the end . Peace on [those women who had loved and died]5696-those women who had loved and died ; and on [the men who had loved [them]5696-those women who had loved and died -- lived for [them]5696-those women who had loved and died]5697-the men who had loved them -- lived for them -- perhaps died for [them]5696-those women who had loved and died . But for [the rest who lived and loved still]5698-the rest who lived and loved still ? A quick life seemed to come back to [him]0-i at the thought of these , a desire to save [them]5698-the rest who lived and loved still from death . "[2398-the almighty] Follow [me]0-i , " [he]0-i said briefly to [the old retainer]633-the old retainer ; "[2398-the almighty] it must be close on dawn -- [I]0-i must see what [I]0-i can do . " So , still in [his]0-i robes , with [the blubbering old pantaloon]5700-the blubbering old pantaloon -- apostle of [another cult]5701-another cult -- at [his]0-i heels , [he]0-i passed down [the arched passage]5702-the arched passage to the door at [its]5702-the arched passage end which opened on to [the courtyard between [the palace]3477-the palace and [the Fort]3493-the fort]5703-the courtyard between the palace and the fort . And as [he]0-i went , [his]0-i brain , confused as to the past , clear as to the present , was busy making plans for peace . So far as helping [those at [the gaol]1501-the gaol]5706-those at the gaol went , [he]0-i knew [himself]0-i to be powerless . Physically , [a couple of old men]5708-a couple of old men -- mere shadows of [men]312-men -- could give no help , and [he]0-i could not hope for influence there , among [the Hosts of [the Devil]283-the devil]5710-the hosts of the devil . But here in [the city]3556-the city , among [those Hosts of [the Lord]3426-the lord]5712-those hosts of the lord -- [the pilgrims for whom [he]0-i had always had a secret sympathy , who knew [him]0-i , at least , by reputation -- with whom , at least , [he]0-i stood on common ground]5714-the pilgrims for whom he had always had a secret sympathy , who knew him , at least , by reputation -- with whom , at least , he stood on common ground -- [he]0-i might have some . [He]0-i could but try ; try to persuade some , at least , of [the great mass of [seekers]5716-seekers after the "[0-i] Cradle of [the Gods]166-the gods]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods " to go on [their]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods way in peace when the dawn came ; try to save some of [them]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods from following [a wrong road]5717-a wrong road . The door was slightly ajar ; [he]0-i widened the chink and looked out with a sinking heart over [the courtyard]386-the courtyard with [its]386-the courtyard raised union - jack of paths . Much larger than [the yard about the Pool of Immortality]5719-the yard about the pool of immortality , [it]386-the courtyard was crammed from end to end now with [a crowd]5720-a crowd , the first look at which told [him]0-i that [his]0-i chance of a hearing was small indeed , for the dawn was closer than [he]0-i had thought for amid the shadows of [the chapel]1291-the chapel , and the grey glimmer of coming light showed [him]0-i once more a sea of upturned eager faces . But the patience of the previous dawn was gone . [They]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods were restless now , restless with the vague , uncertain restlessness which is so dangerous in [a crowd , which tells that the fuel for the flame]5722-a crowd , which tells that the fuel for the flame is only awaiting a match , any match , to fire it . And there were [many only waiting to be struck]5723-many only waiting to be struck . The next instant might bring one . [Father Ninian]81-father ninian felt this instinctively , felt that here in [this courtyard]5724-this courtyard lay the mine which [the returning troopers]5725-the returning troopers , [the desperadoes from [the gaol]1501-the gaol]5726-the desperadoes from the gaol , were to fire first . [All Eshwara]1-eshwara might rise afterwards , but the great danger lay here , must be grappled with here . But how ? Not by words . The ear of [a crowd]5720-a crowd is always difficult to gain , unless the eye is taken first , and [a man]533-a man had both already . For aloft , on the barrel of the big old gun which centred [the square]1462-the square , [jogi Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - nâth was expounding [their]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods wrongs to [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims , [their]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods inevitable damnation if the wrath of [the Gods]3472-the gods was not instantly appeased . [His]141-jogi gorakh - nâth wild , weird figure , in all its nakedness , its austerity , could be seen above the little circle of lamps which [[his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth immediate supporters]5733-his immediate supporters held upwards at arm's - length . And above [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth head , like a canopy , drifted the wisps of tired earth - atoms which were being driven sideways by the breeze of dawn as [they]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods fell in [their]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods search for rest . For the storm was over , [their]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods brief ambition for something beyond [mere earth]5734-mere earth was past . Wisps , which , as [they]5715-the great mass of seekers after the " cradle of the gods swept over the circling lights , took a lurid glow , then faded into the dim shadows again . And something else caught the light redly . The chaplet of human skulls , [the dread Mother]5735-the dread mother 's necklace , which [the jogi]3898-the jogi swung from one hand to the other as [he]3898-the jogi called for blood -- for blood to appease [Her]5735-the dread mother -- the Mother of all -- the Eternal Womanhood ! Since without the shedding of blood there is no remission of sins . The tenet of all religions echoed into the ear of [the crowd]4412-the crowd , the strange demoniacal figure , in its lurid setting , held [its]4412-the crowd eye . What chance was there for a single voice ? None . Yet something must be done . For the dawn was nigh . Every instant the light grew . Any moment might bring that inrush of evil from the gaol which would breed violence among [these still peaceful folk]5738-these still peaceful folk ; [the ignorant , helpless folk who were being held captive by words against the coming of that inrush]5739-the ignorant , helpless folk who were being held captive by words against the coming of that inrush . Suddenly , for a second , the attention of [the crowd]4412-the crowd wavered . [A tall man in the white dress of [a Europeanized native]5742-a europeanized native]5741-a tall man in the white dress of a europeanized native had been hoisted to the shoulders of [some others]5743-some others , not far from [the jogi]3898-the jogi , and so , from this coign of vantage , prepared to harangue [the people]3552-the people . "[163-ramanund] ' Tis [Ramanund]163-ramanund , " said someone close to where [Father Ninian]81-father ninian stood in the shadow of the door . "[3068-he] [He]3068-he is [Brahmin]3069-brahmin , and [a scholar above [scholars]3726-scholars]3070-a scholar above scholars . Mayhap [he]3068-he will tell [us]3072-us what to do these times , when all seems wrong . There is no harm in listening . " Nor good either . For the first words of that appeal of culture to ignorance were drowned in a fiendish laugh , a frenzied rattling of the dread chaplet , a loud defiance . "[3068-he] Hold [thy]3073-thou peace , Baboo - jee ! What is blood to [thee]3073-thou , who hath no God to whom [thou]3073-thou canst give it ? But [we]3072-us have , [brethren]3074-brethren . These be [Her]3075-her drinking - cups , the skulls of [men like [ourselves]3072-us]3076-men like ourselves . Let [us]3072-us give [Her]3075-her pleasure , [brothers]880-brothers , and have blessing from [Her]3075-her hands ; not cursing , as [thou]3073-thou hast had , [Ramanund]163-ramanund , whose head should still be shaven , whose touch unclean from the loss of [a woman]3949-a woman . " The allusion to the death of [[Ramanund]163-ramanund 's wife]5746-ramanund 's wife roused an instant murmur of assent from [those who were of [the city]3556-the city]5747-those who were of the city , and [they]5747-those who were of the city passing the tale on to [others]569-others , the murmur swelled to a roar which effectively drowned the rest of [Ramanund]163-ramanund 's advice . But [Father Ninian]81-father ninian , still at the door , still uncertain , could hear [a man who had been buckling on [his]0-i pilgrim]5750-a man who had been buckling on his pilgrim 's sandals as if for a start , say , as [he]0-i stood up and thrust them back to [his]0-i waistcloth:-- "[163-ramanund] Well ! [I]0-i , for one , go no further without remission , or the blood which brings it . As [jogi - jee]284-jogi - jee saith , [no man]3908-no man should risk [the woman]1071-the woman 's cursing . [No man]3908-no man can hold [his]3908-no man own against that . " "[3908-no man] [He]3082-he hath [a young wife in [[his]3082-he house]2180-his house]3083-a young wife in his house , see [you]3085-you , and all know what that means , " sniggered [a neighbour]3789-a neighbour . But a third voice broke in gravely , "[3082-he] Young or old , what matter ? [Women]479-women sit ever on the knees of [the Gods]3472-the gods , as [[we]3088-we men]3089-we men have sat on [theirs]3089-we men , seeing [they]479-women are [the mothers of [us]3088-we all]3090-the mothers of us all . So , [mother]1437-mother or [wife]3702-wife , [we]3088-we can not escape [them]3089-we men . " "[149-baba] [Baba - jee]149-baba speaks truth , " assented [another bystander]5752-another bystander , "[149-baba] and [jogi - jee]284-jogi - jee also . If [She]3083-a young wife in his house needs blood , [She]3083-a young wife in his house must have it , seeing [She]3083-a young wife in his house is [Woman]534-woman . As for [him]3094-him ? Let [him]3094-him be silent . [He]3094-him hath [no God]3095-no god . No blood sacrifice , no remission of sins . Let [him]3094-him speak who hath [them]3096-them . " There was a faint sound as of the closing of a door , and beyond it , in the darkness of [the arched passage]5702-the arched passage , an old voice said , with a curious note of gladness in it , "[3094-him] Follow [me]0-i , quick , [Akbar]110-akbar ; there is not a moment to be lost . The dawn has come ! " It seemed to have come to [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's face as [he]84-pidar narâyan knelt hurriedly once more beside the body of [the dead girl]558-the dead girl , to fold [her]558-the dead girl dead hands decently as if in prayer , to cover the dead feet with the crimson draperies , [the dead face]5755-the dead face with the flimsy , glittering veil -- the veil which hid nothing of its beauty -- which struck the keynote of the whole . "[3094-him] On whom be peace ! " [he]84-pidar narâyan whispered as [he]84-pidar narâyan rose , stretching out [his]84-pidar narâyan thin old hand in benediction ; and as [he]84-pidar narâyan said the words , the vision came to [him]84-pidar narâyan of [a whole world which had loved , and sinned , and gone on its mysterious quest for something beyond love]5756-a whole world which had loved , and sinned , and gone on its mysterious quest for something beyond love . [A world to which [he]84-pidar narâyan had said farewell with a kiss]5757-a world to which he had said farewell with a kiss . [He]84-pidar narâyan passed on to the Altar , and with swift , steady hands opened [the sanctuary]5758-the sanctuary , and took out the treasure [it]5758-the sanctuary contained ; a star - shaped , star - rayed pyx , set with jewels , relic of the days when singing - birds that sang of themselves , and such like things , with many another , had come to [Eshwara]1-eshwara from [Italy]11-italy . "[3094-him] Take the candles from the altar , [Akbar]110-akbar , " [he]84-pidar narâyan said , "[110-akbar] and walk in front -- just in front , [you]110-akbar know -- as [you]110-akbar used to walk . " [The old courtier]5759-the old courtier mumbled "[110-akbar] Ge - reeb - pun - wâz , " with a caper of alacrity . In [his]84-pidar narâyan confusion , [his]84-pidar narâyan resentful remorse , it was a relief to return to pomp -- to servility . So , with that Bodily Presence which , till then , had always brought the thought of the lost paradise of [a woman]3949-a woman 's love with it , in [his]84-pidar narâyan hands , [Father Ninian]81-father ninian and [[his]81-father ninian strange acolyte]5761-his strange acolyte , [priest of [another cult]5701-another cult]5762-priest of another cult , passed swiftly out of [the chapel]1291-the chapel , leaving the Altar dark , bereft of [its]5758-the sanctuary treasure ; leaving [the dead woman]5765-the dead woman , bereft of [her]5765-the dead woman treasure also , lying in a glitter of gold and crimson on the Altar steps . Passed on a mission of peace to [the living]4051-the living ; on the chance of gaining the ear , the eye , of [that waiting crowd outside in [the courtyard]386-the courtyard]5767-that waiting crowd outside in the courtyard . As [he]84-pidar narâyan went rapidly , yet with the faltering step every now and again of one wearied by long journeying , down [the arched passage]5702-the arched passage , [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian scarcely thought of success or failure . There was a wistful triumph in [his]84-pidar narâyan face -- [he]84-pidar narâyan looked as [a slave]5371-a slave might look who dies in making [himself]84-pidar narâyan free . [He]84-pidar narâyan did not think even of the strangeness of the little procession . The night had been so full of strange things ; but the dawn had come , and [he]84-pidar narâyan had a message to give [those waiting souls]5771-those waiting souls outside -- [the souls who were being kept back from [the "[110-akbar] Cradle of [the Gods " by that fear of the Eternal Womanhood]5774-the gods " by that fear of the eternal womanhood]5773-the " cradle of the gods " by that fear of the eternal womanhood]5772-the souls who were being kept back from the " cradle of the gods " by that fear of the eternal womanhood . "[110-akbar] Set the door wide , [Akbar]110-akbar , " [he]84-pidar narâyan said , and then [his]84-pidar narâyan voice merged into the "[110-akbar] Salutaris . " So , as [the crowd]4412-the crowd turned at the sound of the opening door , the sound of the chanting voice , [it]4412-the crowd saw , raised above it , dim against an arched shadow , seen by the grey light of daybreak and the flicker of two tall tapers , a strange star - rayed cup shining in the clasped hands of [a man]533-a man . [An old man in a strange dress , chanting a strange song]5777-an old man in a strange dress , chanting a strange song . And the sight , by its very strangeness , its claim to something beyond familiarity , was not strange to [that restless crowd]5778-that restless crowd , waiting for a sign , waiting for something not in [themselves]5778-that restless crowd . "[110-akbar] What is it ? What means it ? " The whisper came like the soft hush of a wave ; and above it the chant rose clearly . "[84-pidar narâyan] ' Tis [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan and [[his]84-pidar narâyan God]406-his god ! " said [those of [the city]3556-the city who knew , as [they]5779-those of the city who knew , as they fell back instinctively from the raised path fell back instinctively from [the raised path]5781-the raised path]5779-those of the city who knew , as they fell back instinctively from the raised path . And [those who did not know]5782-those who did not know followed suit in awed bewilderment , till the way was clear , and [the little procession]5783-the little procession passed on slowly above [the jammed mass of humanity]5784-the jammed mass of humanity , above the sea of upturned expectant faces . "[84-pidar narâyan] ' Tis [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , who went with [[my]0-i father]3098-my father , " said [one here and there]5785-one here and there . "[84-pidar narâyan] Mayhap [he]84-pidar narâyan goes now -- let [us]3099-us see . " "[84-pidar narâyan] Yea ! let [us]3099-us see ! " answered [others]569-others . That slantwise limb of the union - jack of raised paths which crossed from one corner to the other of [the courtyard]386-the courtyard -- from the door in [the palace]3477-the palace to the wide archway through which [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims always passed on [their]3444-the pilgrims way to the "[84-pidar narâyan] Cradle of [the Gods"--cleared itself by common consent]5790-the gods"--cleared itself by common consent , edged [itself]5791-itself with a thicker throng of curious faces . Only in the middle it was barred by the big old gun , by [the "[84-pidar narâyan] Teacher of Religion]5045-the " teacher of religion " as its legend boasted , and by [the man who claimed to be its mouthpiece]5793-the man who claimed to be its mouthpiece . For [jogi Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth , recognizing [[his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth adversary]5794-his adversary , recognizing the danger of [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth influence , had slipped from [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth post above , and now stood before the gun , full in the path , defending it with frenzied wavings of [his]141-jogi gorakh - nâth chaplet of skulls . "[84-pidar narâyan] Listen not , [brothers]880-brothers ! " [he]141-jogi gorakh - nâth yelled . "[880-brothers] [Jai Kali Ma]285-jai kali ma ! Blood ! Blood ! Without blood is no remission of sins . " And now a new curiosity , a new interest , came to [that crowd of [mere men]5796-mere men]5795-that crowd of mere men . What would happen ? What would [these two]532-these two , [mere men like [themselves]532-these two]5798-mere men like themselves , do ? Which was backed by divine authority ? That both claimed that authority was clear . [It]5791-itself held [its]5791-itself breath , partly from the desire for a sign from [God]96-god , partly because of the desire which humanity always has for a sign of [the best man]5799-the best man . Let [the two]1064-the two try which was the better . So it waited , ready to approve either , till those two , [the Eastern]5801-the eastern and [the Western sacerdotalisms]5802-the western sacerdotalisms , met face to face , within two yards of [each other]3586-each other , in the centre of [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , on the platform before [the "[84-pidar narâyan] Teacher of Religion]5045-the " teacher of religion . " Then , not till then , [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan ceased [his]84-pidar narâyan chant , shifted the pyx to [his]84-pidar narâyan left hand , and with [his]84-pidar narâyan right drew the rapier hidden till then by [his]84-pidar narâyan long robes . "[84-pidar narâyan] Aha , A - ha - a , " sighed [the crowd]4412-the crowd approvingly . There would be a bodily as well as a spiritual fight , for [jogi]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - jee 's chaplet of skulls swirled dangerously for both attack and defence ; since a swinging blow from it would kill [a man]533-a man , and its circling sweep keep [him]533-a man beyond sword - point reach . Which would be [the better man]5808-the better man -- the better weapon ? But [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan did not attack . [He]84-pidar narâyan only stood , the pyx in one hand , the sword in the other -- alternatives as it were -- and called in a loud voice-- "[84-pidar narâyan] Let [me]0-i pass , [jogi Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth ! " Let [me]141-jogi gorakh - nâth pass [I]141-jogi gorakh - nâth say ! "[141-jogi gorakh - nâth] For [I]0-i carry [[my]0-i GOD]4622-my god ! " Over [the whole courtyard]5809-the whole courtyard , waking now from shadow to light under the coming day , the claim echoed sharply ; and the arrogance of it , the strength , the certainty of it , sank deep into the souls of [those who heard it]2382-those who heard it . There was not a sound , not a movement ; only a vast , breathless expectancy , and [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's fine old face set like the nether mill - stone . Everything that had ever been in [him]84-pidar narâyan -- love , passion , faith , worldly wisdom , sympathy -- the grit of [the whole man]5811-the whole man -- rose up and claimed [the crowd]4412-the crowd . "[0-i] Let [me]0-i pass ! " [he]0-i cried again , in absolute command , and this time [the rapier , twisting like a snake]5813-the rapier , twisting like a snake , caught the chaplet of skulls in its upward swirl , a dexterous unexpected turn of [the old fencer]5814-the old fencer 's wrist followed , sending it flying from [the jogi]3898-the jogi 's hand . The next instant ( the rope on which [they]4412-the crowd were strung severed by the strain , by the rapier 's edge ) , the skulls were clattering , bounding like balls , like useless toys , on the stone platform . "[0-i] A - ha ! A - ha ! " came from [the crowd]4412-the crowd ; but the sigh was but half content , and [men]312-men looked at [each other]3586-each other wonderingly . Since , no matter which [priest]1693-priest was [the better man]5808-the better man , these were [Mai Kali]286-mai kali 's drinking - cups . [The jogi]3898-the jogi , however , had fallen back a step , and [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan was in [his]84-pidar narâyan place by the old gun . [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan and [[his]84-pidar narâyan strange God]5822-his strange god were now the "[0-i] Teachers of Religion . " What had [they]4412-the crowd to say ? [The crowd]4412-the crowd had not to wait long , for [Father Ninian]81-father ninian 's voice , with that nameless ring in it which makes [the orator]5824-the orator and makes [the audience]566-the audience , was already in [its]4412-the crowd ears . "[0-i] Listen ! Listen to [me]0-i , for [I]0-i carry in this cup the Blood of Sacrifice . The Victim required by [[your]3102-your God]3103-your god and [mine]0-i , by [all the Gods]3104-all the gods , is here ! " [We]5826-we are free , [brothers]880-brothers ! [you]3102-your and [I.]0-i [The Eternal Womanhood]5828-the eternal womanhood hath had [Her]5828-the eternal womanhood toll , in full . [The Great Mother]5829-the great mother is appeased . There is no fear . "[3102-your] Lift up [your]3102-your eyes unto [the hills]343-the hills , from whence cometh [your]3102-your help , and follow [me]0-i and [[my]0-i God]4622-my god , to find [yours]3102-your . " [He]0-i pointed with the sword -- as [he]0-i paused a second for breath , for strength -- to [the mountains]2570-the mountains ; to [those far peaks which , now that the storm had ended , the earth - atoms returned to [earth]2790-earth]5831-those far peaks which , now that the storm had ended , the earth - atoms returned to earth , had begun to show spectral in the dawn . To show shadowy , yet clear , with never a wreath of mist or a wandering cloud to hide the hollow whither the feet of [millions]5833-millions had journeyed seeking righteousness , and journeyed in vain . Faint and far they showed against the faint , far sky , but as [Father Ninian]81-father ninian pointed to [them]343-the hills , a ray of light from the still unseen sun below the visible horizon of [this world]342-this world , a ray of light seeking perhaps [another world among the stars]5835-another world among the stars , found [the heights of [the holy hills]5837-the holy hills in [its]5837-the holy hills path]5836-the heights of the holy hills in its path , and dyed their snowdrifts red -- blood red ! At the sight a roar rose from [the crowd]4412-the crowd . "[285-jai kali ma] [Jai Kali Ma]285-jai kali ma ! [She]285-jai kali ma gives a sign ! The sacrifice is there ! [She]285-jai kali ma is appeased ! [He]3107-he speaks the truth . Let [us]3108-us follow [him]3107-he and [[his]3107-he God]406-his god ! " "[3098-my father] Ay ! as [[my]0-i father]3098-my father did , " cried [one]3501-one . "[0-i] And [mine]0-i ! " "[0-i] And [mine]0-i ! " assented [some]3712-some , while [others]569-others forgot all save pilgrimage in the shout-- "[0-i] Râm , Râm , [Sita Râm]61-sita râm ! " "[0-i] Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! " So , on that babel of sounds , [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's voice rose steadily as , preceded by [that ambling figure]5842-that ambling figure -- strangest of [all acolytes]5843-all acolytes -- [he]84-pidar narâyan walked on , chanting the 121st Psalm:-- The words were in an unknown tongue , the rhythm strange , but the spirit , the idea , were familiar . It was the song of someone seeking the "[3472-the gods] Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods , " as [they]3472-the gods were . "[3107-he] [He]3107-he carries [[his]3107-he God]406-his god , and that means all , " said [an old man]1853-an old man , pushing [his]1853-an old man way to follow . "[1012-the other] [The other]1012-the other had none : how could [he]3107-he lead the way ? " "[3107-he] That is true , " assented [many]794-many , following suit . And [some]3712-some , shrugging [their]3712-some shoulders , said , "[3107-he] [He]3107-he is mad . [God]96-god has touched [his]3107-he brain . Then [he]3107-he goes the way [[our]3114-our fathers]3115-our fathers went . [They]3115-our fathers lingered not beyond the second dawn . Why should [we]3114-our ? " "[3107-he] Râm ! Râm ! [Sita Râm]61-sita râm ! " Thus , swiftly , the footfalls gathered in strength behind [the little procession]5783-the little procession , and [no one]3741-no one dared to stop it ; not even [the Mahomedan sentry at the Fort gate , to whom [some of [the agitators]5851-the agitators]5850-some of the agitators ran in [their]5850-some of the agitators disappointment]5849-the mahomedan sentry at the fort gate , to whom some of the agitators ran in their disappointment . [He]3107-he only laughed contemptuously ; though [his]3107-he gravity returned somewhat at [his]3107-he recognition of old Akbar Khân . "[123-lo] [Lo]123-lo ! that is a new walking for [him]3107-he ! " [he]3107-he muttered , in an awed voice . "[123-lo] Truly , [folk]661-folk are right when [they]661-folk say there is magic in [these idolaters]3117-these idolaters . Who would have deemed [him]3107-he pilgrim ? Well ! let [him]3107-he go , [he]3107-he and [[his]3107-he mummery]3118-his mummery . [[We]3119-we [soldiers]4773-soldiers]3120-we soldiers can do without [priests]1963-priests and [Hindoos]287-hindoos ! " [He]3107-he twirled [his]3107-he mustache fiercely , and wondered when [[his]3107-he comrades]5852-his comrades would return victorious from [the gaol]1501-the gaol , and give the word for plunder . That was all [he]3107-he cared for . "[3119-we] Ay ! " assented an angry voice , joining [the group]3887-the group , "[3119-we] [we]3119-we can do without [the fools]3123-the fools . There be plenty of [wise men]4070-wise men left . " "[4070-wise men] Plenty , " put in another ; "[4070-wise men] but [their]3123-the fools mood is different . See how [they]3123-the fools wander ! " It was true . [The crowd]4412-the crowd had broken into [groups]5856-groups , and from these , [pilgrims]1948-pilgrims , singly , or in [smaller groups]5858-smaller groups , were drifting after the lessening sound of that chanting voice . Not so much from any belief in [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan , not even because of [his]84-pidar narâyan lead over , but because it was the old way ; the way worn by the feet of [[their]1948-pilgrims fathers]5859-their fathers , and [[their]1948-pilgrims fathers ' fathers]5860-their fathers ' fathers .
