So jogi Gorakh - nâth , who , now [the coast]4881-the coast was clear , had sprung aloft on the old gun , once more attempting to regain [[his]84-pidar narâyan empire]5862-his empire , failed egregiously . [The crowd]4412-the crowd passed [him]84-pidar narâyan by till [a big countryman , with a lumbering jest]5864-a big countryman , with a lumbering jest , asked [him]84-pidar narâyan if [he]84-pidar narâyan was sure [he]84-pidar narâyan had picked up the right skull to put on [his]84-pidar narâyan own shoulders . Then it laughed uproariously . "[4070-wise men] Best come on to [the Pool of Immortality]4072-the pool of immortality , " suggested [a conspirator]5865-a conspirator , consolingly , as [he]5865-a conspirator hurried past . "[4070-wise men] ' Tis no use here . [The fools]3123-the fools have followed after [strange gods]3127-strange gods and [men]312-men . But at [the Pool]62-the pool there are tens of thousands to one here ; and [they]3123-the fools are weary waiting . Besides , ' tis nearer [the gaol]1501-the gaol . Between the two success will lie . " "[288-ducker] Yea , " added another , "[288-ducker] that was the first plan -- [the soldiers]4177-the soldiers and [the Fort]3493-the fort spoilt it . But [the Pool]2172-the pool and [the gaol]1501-the gaol remain . " [Jogi Gorakh - nâth]141-jogi gorakh - nâth , with a scowl , gathered up [his]84-pidar narâyan skulls to a bundle and followed hastily . [He]84-pidar narâyan would at least be out of hearing of that chanting voice . [It]5866-it had reached the last verse of its Psalm now , and faltered a little over the words:-- "[288-ducker] Dominus custodiat introitum tuum et exitum tuum : ex hoc et usque in saeculum . " But the echo of the footsteps behind filled up the blanks . On [the gaol]1501-the gaol or the Pool of Immortality lay the hopes of those whom [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan had so far discomfited by [his]84-pidar narâyan arrogant claim to stand between [heaven and earth]5868-heaven and earth ; in other words , to be in personal relations with [the Great Awarder of gaols]5869-the great awarder of gaols and immortalities , forgivenesses , and punishments . But the stars in [their]5870-their courses , hidden though they had been by the storm - darkness , had used that very darkness to the due maintenance of law and order as [they]5870-their wheeled serenely to meet the coming dawn . When [Lance]68-lance , for instance -- [his]68-lance heart torn in twain by [his]68-lance desire to follow [Erda]105-erda 's fate at all costs and [his]68-lance knowledge that , if [he]68-lance was to do the best for [others]569-others [he]68-lance must leave [her]105-erda to face it alone -- had struck down stream on [Am - ma]131-am - ma 's strange craft , [his]68-lance sole intention had been to rouse [the police camp]5067-the police camp , and secure what help [he]68-lance could for [the gaol]1501-the gaol . But the darkness set [him]68-lance another task . For , after drifting past [the spit]614-the spit , whence [he]68-lance had meant to cut across by [land]664-land to [the bridge of [boats]2141-boats]2140-the bridge of boats , and so , creeping past [the city]3556-the city , find [the camp beyond [it]3556-the city]5879-the camp beyond it , [he]68-lance had lost [himself]68-lance absolutely in the maze of sand - banks and shallow channels which , when [the river]333-the river was low , as it was now , lay like a network between [the deep stream of [the Hara]2-the hara]5881-the deep stream of the hara , and [the deep stream of [the Hari]3-the hari]5882-the deep stream of the hari . Lost [himself]68-lance so utterly that , realizing [his]68-lance own bewilderment , [he]68-lance had called [himself]68-lance [a fool]4066-a fool for having lost [himself]68-lance ! A curious discouragement came to [him]68-lance . Yet it made [him]68-lance more dogged and persistent , even while the hopelessness of finding [his]68-lance way grew every second . Surely , thought [he]68-lance , [he]68-lance could not be such [a fool as to fail]5884-a fool as to fail ! Sometimes a sudden belief that [he]68-lance really had had some faint indication of [his]68-lance bearings would make [him]68-lance put all [his]68-lance young strength into the paddle , until once more a soft , yielding , yet irresistible , impact came to tell [him]68-lance that [he]68-lance had failed again , that [he]68-lance was on [another sandbank]5885-another sandbank , and another , and another ! The dull concussion of them seemed to pass into [his]68-lance brain ; [he]68-lance found [himself]68-lance fumbling on almost aimlessly , despite [his]68-lance doggedness , [his]68-lance mind busy with imagining the things which might be happening in the dark around [him]68-lance . For all [he]68-lance knew close by-- There lay the sting ! It was suffocating to be set , as it were , in the solid darkness like -- [he]68-lance thought of a fly in amber , the birds [he]68-lance had limed in [his]68-lance boyhood , finally of a death mask . That was more like it -- [he]68-lance felt as the corpse must feel -- clogged , hampered , helpless ! In such conditions minutes seem hours ; and [Lance]68-lance , in reality , had not been drifting about for half of one before the certainty that [his]68-lance mission must inevitably be useless unless [he]68-lance could fulfil it more expeditiously , made [him]68-lance resolve on trying conclusions with [the river]333-the river at first hand . [He]68-lance was [a good swimmer]5887-a good swimmer . As [he]68-lance told [himself]68-lance this , the first pulse of gratitude [he]68-lance had ever felt for [the big bully who had chucked [him]68-lance]5888-the big bully who had chucked him , [a small boy in [his]68-lance first term at [Harrow]63-harrow , into "[288-ducker] [Ducker]288-ducker " to take [his]68-lance chance]5889-a small boy in his first term at harrow , into " ducker " to take his chance , came to [him]68-lance ; for those few minutes of despairing effort had taught [him]68-lance more than mere swimming ; [they]5890-they had taught [him]68-lance to trust [himself]68-lance in water . More , at any rate , than in [a beastly contrivance made of beds and footballs , with no stem , no stern , and a devilish habit of spinning in every eddy like a teetotum]5891-a beastly contrivance made of beds and footballs , with no stem , no stern , and a devilish habit of spinning in every eddy like a teetotum ! The mere condemnation of Am - ma 's craft , being a prelude to better things , raised [his]68-lance spirits . [He]68-lance flung off [his]68-lance clothes , and , knowing [he]68-lance could not hope to keep [his]68-lance revolver dry , improvised a waistcloth out of the silk sash [he]68-lance wore instead of a waistcoat , in which to stick the hunting - knife that was [his]68-lance only other weapon . As [he]68-lance did so , [he]68-lance thought of the deer the knife had killed ; as [men]312-men think idly , irrelevantly , of such trivialities when [their]312-men attention is really concentrated on something that is , as yet , outside experience . And [Lance]68-lance , as [he]68-lance slipped into the water , knew [himself]68-lance prepared to swim or wade , but knew nothing else . So , doggedly as before , and infinitely quicker , [he]68-lance went on through the darkness ; sometimes feeling [himself]68-lance in the cool water , sometimes finding [his]68-lance feet on warm sand , sometimes parting a way , [he]68-lance knew not where , through the low tamarisk and high grass marking [an island]5893-an island . If [he]68-lance could have guessed [which island]5894-which island , or even known which way [his]68-lance face was set , these light swishing touches might have been guides ; but [he]68-lance knew nothing . Until , after a time , a faint far glow , a mere suspicion of something not outer darkness , showed on [his]68-lance left . Even so , [he]68-lance could not guess whether that meant [the gaol]1501-the gaol side , or [[the city]3556-the city side of [the rivers]3592-the rivers]5897-the city side of the rivers . If [the former]1222-the former , could [the gaol]1501-the gaol have been fired by [those devils]5901-those devils ? The thought made [him]68-lance set [his]68-lance teeth , and , dry sand being beneath [his]68-lance feet , run on recklessly towards the glow . Only for a yard or two , however ; then [he]68-lance pulled up short , amazed to find that it was not far , but near ; that it came from the ground , from a leaping fire of tamarisk branches within a stone 's throw of [him]68-lance . A step or two more , in fact , showed [him]68-lance a cooking - pot , the remains of some food , a familiar fishing - net , and a chrysalis - looking figure wrapped in a blanket and half - buried in the sand . [One of [the fisher folk]2198-the fisher folk]5902-one of the fisher folk , by all that was lucky ! If [anyone]3948-anyone could tell , [they]3948-anyone could . It was only a slender stem of tiger - grass which snapped under [his]68-lance feet , but the noise was sufficient . [The sleeper]5905-the sleeper sprang to [his]68-lance like a wild animal , the blanket falling from [him]68-lance , one lithe arm making for the long spear stuck in the sand beside [him]68-lance . [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ! [The missing Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ! [Lance]68-lance had [him]117-gu - gu back in [his]68-lance sand - bed before hand and spear met . There was no struggle . [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , knowing [himself]117-gu - gu helpless , lay limp , slack , every muscle proclaiming capitulation ; in so far showing [himself]117-gu - gu something less than a wild animal , which struggles till it dies , reckless of odds . But , in truth , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , with the certainty of speedy extinction before [him]117-gu - gu , due to [that cursed ghost]5906-that cursed ghost , had given in to fate utterly , all round . Death would come when it came . All that remained , therefore , was to make [others]569-others suffer if [he]117-gu - gu could . Especially [those who were responsible for altering the currents of [the river]333-the river]5908-those who were responsible for altering the currents of the river . With one of these on top of [you]3134-you , this was impossible ; but time might bring opportunity . "[3135-you devil] [[You]3134-you devil]3135-you devil ! " cried [Lance]68-lance , throttling the abject jelly by way of emphasis , "[3135-you devil] [you]3134-you know all about this business , of course ; but now [I]0-i 've found [you]3134-you , [you]3134-you 'll have to do mine,--or [I]0-i 'll kill [you]3134-you . Do [you]3134-you understand ? Now , which way is [the town]331-the town ? " [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu pointed in the direction whence [Lance]68-lance had come . [The latter]336-the latter frowned , realizing that it was impossible to know if [the brute]392-the brute spoke truth , but that , unfortunately , [he]336-the latter must be trusted . "[3134-you] Then get up , " [he]0-i said curtly , taking care to keep the jelly within reach of [his]0-i knife , "[3134-you] and show [me]0-i the way there . [I]0-i 'll give [you]3134-you a hundred rupees if [you]3134-you do ; and if [you]3134-you don't-- " [He]0-i gave the yielding flesh an explanatory prick . "[90-huzoor] Does [the Huzoor]90-huzoor mean [the Pool of Immortality]4072-the pool of immortality ? " asked [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , affably ; and the words made [Lance]68-lance remember that fruitless waiting for [the water]945-the water . "[90-huzoor] Ah ! [you]3134-you did manage that swindle , did [you]3134-you ? " [he]0-i replied savagely , "[3134-you] and of course [you]3134-you were camping out of the way . [I]0-i see ! No ! [I]0-i do n't want to go [there]3509-there yet . To [the bridge]373-the bridge ! So quick , march ! or swim ; [you]3134-you can tell [me]0-i about the other as [we]3140-we go along . It may be useful . " [Another prick]5913-another prick with the knife [he]0-i held in one hand , while [his]0-i other clutched firmly on [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's hemp - strung waist - belt of blue beads , started them . So [they]3140-we went on till the sand grew colder , less resistant , changed to water beneath [their]3140-we feet ; then [Lance]68-lance 's two hands -- and the knife -- came down on [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's bare back . "[0-i] Strike out , " [he]0-i said briefly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll help . " The two pair of legs and the one pair of hands forged ahead into the darkness none the less rapidly because the second pair of hands were resting,--with something in them -- on yielding flesh . The fact indeed , or something else , seemed to make [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu confidential . If [the Huzoor]90-huzoor , [he]0-i said , with a shameless comprehension which made [Lance]68-lance inclined to use the knife then and there , wanted to give the alarm at [the police camp]5067-the police camp , [he]68-lance was taking [a long road]5915-a long road to [it]5067-the police camp . [He]117-gu - gu , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , could show [him]68-lance a shorter , if [the Huzoor]90-huzoor would trust [him]68-lance . For a second [Lance]68-lance hesitated . [He]68-lance could not see [the man]3467-the man 's face ; but there was a sort of cunning anxiety in the tone which was doubtful . Then , remembering that , short or long , [he]68-lance was equally at [the man]3467-the man 's mercy if [he]68-lance chose to brave results -- though there seemed to be no reason why [he]68-lance should -- [he]68-lance said quietly,-- "[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]3141-you to take the shortest . " "[0-i] [The Huzoor]90-huzoor can dive ? " asked [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu . "[90-huzoor] [He]90-huzoor should , since [he]90-huzoor swims so strong . " "[90-huzoor] Dive ! " echoed [Lance]68-lance . "[90-huzoor] Yes , why ? " Because the short way , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu explained , was by [an underground passage]5918-an underground passage which could be only reached from [the river]333-the river . Undoubtedly [the Huzoor]90-huzoor was right , [the passage]446-the passage had to do with the miracle ; but there must have been more than one miracle in the old days , since there was quite a network of [canals]5921-canals and [caves]5922-caves , which could be more or less flooded at will . All [the river people]5923-the river people knew of [them]446-the passage , but [few]5924-few ventured in ; there was nothing to be gained by doing so , as a rule ! And the dive to reach [the passage]446-the passage was long and awkward . But if [the Huzoor]90-huzoor would trust-- "[90-huzoor] Go ahead ! " broke in [Lance]68-lance , sharply . [He]68-lance had to trust ; and time meant everything . Besides , even in diving , [he]68-lance could have [his]68-lance revenge on that sleek , yielding back ! For answer , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu altered [his]117-gu - gu course with almost suspicious alacrity ; though , once more , [Lance]68-lance could see no reason for treachery . A hundred rupees was a big bribe to [a man who evidently had no personal interest in the matter]5926-a man who evidently had no personal interest in the matter ; else , why should [he]5926-a man who evidently had no personal interest in the matter have been on [the island]5927-the island instead of in the row . But then [Lance]68-lance did not know of that call to death . So , through the dark , the one pair of hands and two pairs of legs forged ahead till a sudden arrest of [the former]1222-the former gave [Lance]68-lance a dull shock once more . But this time [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's voice came quite cheerfully : "[90-huzoor] The city wall , [Huzoor]90-huzoor [This slave]4971-this slave must feel if [he]4971-this slave goes up or down . " Apparently it was up , and after a few minutes of crablike edging [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu 's voice came again:-- "[4971-this slave] [The tunnel]378-the tunnel is below , [Protector of [the Poor]538-the poor]537-protector of the poor . Let [the most noble]4523-the most noble take the longest breath [he]4523-the most noble ever breathed , then strike down till [this mean one]3147-this mean one 's legs cease moving . [The most noble one]3148-the most noble one 's must cease also . The rest will this dust - like one accomplish . Save the breath . That is in [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors own keeping . Therefore let [him]4523-the most noble take time for filling ; and when [he]4523-the most noble is ready let [him]4523-the most noble signal [this slave]4971-this slave with -- with a knife - prick if [he]4523-the most noble chooses ! " The cool grasp of the position made [Lance]68-lance smile , though the situation , [he]68-lance knew , was grave enough . That breath to be drawn might be [his]68-lance last ; all the more reason why [he]68-lance could have wished [it]5929-it less full of sand ! For the storm was now at its fiercest . Even here out on [the river]333-the river , over [the water]945-the water , the air seemed solid . And it had a vibration that could be felt on the bare skin . As [he]68-lance drew in that long breath before trusting [himself]68-lance to [the unseen man whom [he]68-lance held within reach of the grim signal]5932-the unseen man whom he held within reach of the grim signal -- and something sharper should there be sign of treachery -- [Lance]68-lance told [himself]68-lance that the water could scarcely be more suffocating than the air . Then -- the sleek skin under [his]68-lance hand shrinking from the knife - prick -- the two pairs of legs and the one pair of arms struck down . It was almost a relief at first to get rid of the stinging dust in [one]3501-one 's face ; almost a relief not to breathe . But when , after a few seconds , the legs in front of [him]68-lance grew rigid , and nothing was left to be done save to hold on desperately to a waist - belt of blue beads and [one]3501-one 's own breath at the same time , the sense of suffocation returned , and the question , "[4523-the most noble] How much longer ? " seemed to throb in [his]68-lance brain . [He]68-lance gripped everything [he]68-lance had to grip tighter . But [his]68-lance own body seemed to grip [his]68-lance mind tighter still . [He]68-lance could feel the clutch of [his]68-lance veins -- a whole corded network of them -- could see them ! A corded , pulsing network edged with prismatic light , sending stars into the darkness , beating time to the singing in [his]68-lance ears , to the fierce duel between the desire to gasp and the determination to hold on,--beating time to the confused rush of thoughts which ended in one--"This[4523-the most noble] is drowning ! " It made [his]68-lance clutch tighter . [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu , at least , should drown too . That was the last conscious thought . It merged into a frantic , insistent clamour for air ! air ! air ! till something cold hit [him]68-lance full on the face and forced [him]68-lance into a quick , gasping cry , that left [him]68-lance senseless . When [he]68-lance came to [himself]68-lance , as [he]68-lance did a moment or two afterwards , [he]68-lance was still clutching the waist - belt of blue beads , and the touch of it lulled [him]68-lance to an instant 's sheer relief . The dive was over ; they must be in [the cave]4331-the cave ; the cold that had hit [him]68-lance in the face must have been the air . But what was [he]68-lance lying upon ? Surely rock ! And the hand [he]68-lance moved to feel it brought the blue beads with it unresistingly . Gu - gu ! where was [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ? Gone ! And the knife too . It had been used to sever the hempen string of the belt . [Curious]289-curious . It might have been used for a different and more deadly purpose ; but [you]5936-you could never count on what [fellows]5937-fellows would do -- even when they were treacherous . [Lance]68-lance thought this dreamily , before [he]68-lance realized more than the fact that [he]68-lance was alive ; not drowned . Then [he]68-lance sat up hastily and faced the truth that [he]68-lance was alone once more ; alone in [that network of underground passages and caves of which [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu]5938-that network of underground passages and caves of which gu - gu had spoken . Was there any chance of [his]68-lance getting out of it ? Not by [the dive]5939-the dive , certainly . Without help that was impossible . [He]68-lance set [himself]68-lance to remember what [[his]68-lance guide]5940-his guide had said in reply to the questions with which [he]68-lance had been purposely plied . First , as to light . If [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu was to be trusted the materials for this must be close at hand . [Lance]68-lance rose cautiously and felt about the ledge on which [he]68-lance lay and the walls of rock about [him]68-lance , and ere long came on what [he]68-lance sought . Flint and steel , a box of tinder , a bottle of oil , and a rag torch hung in an old bit of fishing - net to a peg that was driven into a crevice . So far , good ; and after a minute these enabled [him]68-lance to see that [he]68-lance was in a sort of vaulted well , half hewn out of rock , half built in with brick . [It]5938-that network of underground passages and caves of which gu - gu was filled to some three feet or so with water , except in one corner , where the flooring shelved down to an archway . There it was deeper . This must be the opening of the tunnel through which [they]5941-they had dived , and through which , doubtless , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu had escaped ; for [he]117-gu - gu was not likely to have braved [the intricate passages]5942-the intricate passages without a light . This thought made [Lance]68-lance look to see how much oil the bottle contained . There was only a mere driblet at the bottom . Plainly , therefore , [he]68-lance could pause no longer ; so , instantly , without further thought , [he]68-lance waded across [the pool]2172-the pool and ran along the only passage which led from [it]2172-the pool . [He]68-lance had to stoop as [he]68-lance ran , and from the feel to [his]68-lance feet [he]68-lance guessed that [the passage]446-the passage led upwards first , then downwards ; apparently , too , in a perfectly straight line . [The river]333-the river , therefore , must be behind [him]68-lance , and [he]68-lance tried to make this point a fixed one , so as to give [him]68-lance some notion of [his]68-lance bearings . After a hundred yards or so [he]68-lance emerged into [a second cave or chamber]5946-a second cave or chamber , also nearly waist - deep in water . From [this several passages]5947-this several passages opened , some too small to admit of [a man]533-a man passing through [them]5947-this several passages . These , then , must be [the canals of which [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu had spoken]5949-the canals of which gu - gu had spoken ; one of [them]5949-the canals of which gu - gu had spoken , possibly , that which should have supplied [the Pool]2172-the pool with Immortality . The memory of [that crowd of eager , patient faces]5951-that crowd of eager , patient faces , disappointed by such a miserable trick , made [Lance]68-lance feel pitiful ; then [his]68-lance pity brought a sudden practical suggestion . Why not open the sluice , or whatever it was , now , and give the miracle ? It would at least keep [some of [the crew]967-the crew]5952-some of the crew quiet when it came , at dawn ; the dawn which might be so fatal to quiet -- the dawn which must , surely , be close at hand . [He]68-lance raised the torch and saw , close beside [him]68-lance , a foot or two above the present level of [the water]945-the water , a clumsy closed stone conduit with an iron handle . It was a rude primitive tap , no doubt , by which the levels could be raised . Without further thought , [he]68-lance turned it , and smiled to find [himself]68-lance right , as water poured out , filling [the vaulted chamber]5955-the vaulted chamber with sound . Then , without further pause , [he]68-lance passed on down [the biggest of the passages leading from [the chamber]5957-the chamber]5956-the biggest of the passages leading from the chamber ; since that seemed the most likely one . After a while , however , [the passage]446-the passage narrowed , seemed in danger of ending altogether ; so [he]68-lance harked back . There was no longer any sound in [the chamber]5957-the chamber when [he]68-lance returned to [it]5957-the chamber , and the level of the water had risen almost to the floor of [the passage in which [he]68-lance stood]5960-the passage in which he stood , wondering which of the other outlets [he]68-lance had best try . The choice was a case of sheer chance , of course , [he]68-lance told [himself]68-lance ; a mere backing of one 's luck . But , as [he]68-lance paused to make it , something cold struck on [his]68-lance feet , causing [him]68-lance to look down in sudden surprise . The water was still rising . That must be stopped , anyhow , unless [he]68-lance was to be drowned out like a sewer rat . [He]68-lance stuck the torch into [a cleft in the rock beside [him]68-lance]5961-a cleft in the rock beside him , hung the net to it , and swam over to the conduit , which was already submerged . But the handle which had turned so easily was stiff now ; possibly because of the pressure of the water , possibly because there was some other rude mechanism of which [he]68-lance was unaware . Anyhow , after a few trials [he]68-lance realized that [he]68-lance was helpless until the water had found its own level . But what was that ? Who could tell ? Would it rise , and rise , and rise , till it filled [the whole place]5297-the whole place ? Who could tell ? It was not fear which clutched at [his]68-lance heart -- only a vague self - pity ; almost an amused wonder that this Immortality for [others]569-others might bring Death to [him]68-lance . [He]68-lance looked up into the vaulted arch above [him]68-lance , then to the , as yet , dry passages which [he]68-lance could just see , as darker arches of shadow . Unless one of them rose abruptly to a higher level -- and the chance that [one]3501-one did , or that [he]68-lance should find it , was remote -- [he]68-lance would be wiser to stay [here]3395-here , and see what happened . The roof was at least higher . [He]68-lance swam back to the torch and , holding on to the crevices of the wall , waited . Still rising . [He]68-lance shifted the torch to a higher crevice and waited again , a dull curiosity taking possession of [him]68-lance . Still rising . [He]68-lance wondered , suddenly , whether it would not have been better for [him]68-lance to have gone back the way [he]68-lance had come . [The passage]446-the passage had certainly seemed to ascend , and it was a question of levels . That was all . A mere question of levels . [He]68-lance shifted the torch again . It was dying down now , the rags showing charred , cindery . But as [he]68-lance fed it with oil and it flared up and smoked , the thought came to [him]68-lance that it was using air needlessly , making suffocation more imminent . [He]68-lance blew it out deliberately . If [a man]533-a man had to die , [he]533-a man might as well die in the dark . [He]68-lance was glad , a moment later , of the darkness . It shut out reality and left [him]68-lance to dreams ; to vague hopes , to kindly forgetfulness , to [Erda]105-erda 's face . How plucky [she]105-erda had been ! Well ! even if [he]68-lance had to be drowned like a rat in [a sewer]5968-a sewer , [he]68-lance must not be behind [her]105-erda . The pathetic comfort of kindly memory , which with strange unreason -- since it enhances the value of the life that is being left -- makes the face of death seem less stern to [poor humanity]5969-poor humanity , came to [him]68-lance and absorbed [him]68-lance . If [he]68-lance died and [she]105-erda lived , [she]105-erda would not forget [him]68-lance ; [he]68-lance knew that . And still the water rose . It must be rising now , [he]68-lance thought , in [the Pool of Immortality]4072-the pool of immortality , and the eager , patient faces that had been waiting for it so long must be showing glad in the grey light of the dawn . For the dawn was coming to [the world]404-the world , though [he]68-lance would not see it . Strange , incomprehensible thought , even though the reality of it was so certain , so close . Incomprehensible ? Say rather , impossible ; frankly impossible ! [He]68-lance could not be going to die ! [He]68-lance shifted the unlit torch to a still higher crevice -- almost a ledge in the rock -- and waited incredulously for the water to rise . And as [he]68-lance waited in the dark , [someone else in the grey dawn , to whom death was more familiar , to whom , in a way , it was the one great certainty of Life]5972-someone else in the grey dawn , to whom death was more familiar , to whom , in a way , it was the one great certainty of life , was feeling the same frank incredulity at the thought of the immediate future . For [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , when [he]68-lance found [himself]68-lance alone on the roof of [the gaol]1501-the gaol gate with [an unconscious woman]5974-an unconscious woman and [a child]3605-a child , knew that the end could not be far off . With [Vincent]71-vincent dead , and [Eugene]74-eugene smith cut off by the stern necessity for keeping that door shut , [he]68-lance could not hope for more than a brief , savage resistance -- and then ? Failure , inevitable failure , unless help came ; and that seemed far as ever . As yet , dazed by that closing of the door , that desperate , triumphant death of [the man with [his]5976-the man with his back to it back to it]5976-the man with his back to it -- a death which had gained [them]5977-them nothing -- [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners were still huddled together , crushed out of further action , at the far end of [the alley]3795-the alley . So [the courtyard]386-the courtyard was clear , free from [assailants]5981-assailants . But that could only be for a minute or two . There was an ominous rending and hewing at the gate below ; ere long [those outside]5982-those outside would be inside , and with [a leader who would know what to do]5983-a leader who would know what to do . So life could only be an affair of moments ; yet it seemed incredible , more than incredible , that all [his]68-lance strong will and determination would not avail even to save those helpless creatures in [his]68-lance charge . [He]68-lance stooped hurriedly and lifted [the still unconscious woman]5984-the still unconscious woman in [his]68-lance arms , carried [her]5984-the still unconscious woman into [the turret]3038-the turret , closed the door on [her]5984-the still unconscious woman and [the child]543-the child -- frightened now for the first time at [[her]5984-the still unconscious woman mother]514-her mother 's silence -- and returned to wait and watch . It was all [he]68-lance could do for [them]1510-the prisoners , unless fate gave [him]68-lance a chance of appealing for [them]1510-the prisoners to [Roshan Khân]89-roshan . But even then there could be no bargaining , no compromise , no surrender ! A sharp crash , a sudden rise in the babel of voices below , warned [him]68-lance that the gate had given , partially at least . The next instant [a soldier or two]5988-a soldier or two , ignorant of [that dead man with [his]5989-that dead man with his back against the closed gate back against the closed gate]5989-that dead man with his back against the closed gate , ran lightly down [the alley]3795-the alley calling on [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners to make way . One of [them]1510-the prisoners was [Roshan Khân]89-roshan ; but [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon did not waste a cartridge even on [him]89-roshan . [He]69-dr. dillon was reserving [his]69-dr. dillon fire for that storming of the broken stairs which must come when [the assailants]5992-the assailants found [themselves]5992-the assailants still foiled . In truth [Roshan Khân]89-roshan had this same storming in [his]89-roshan mind as all [he]89-roshan cared for , since it would pit [him]89-roshan against [[his]89-roshan rival]3735-his rival , against [Vincent Dering]71-vincent , who [he]89-roshan knew was on the roof . And so , with that odd acquired sense of honour , fair play , God knows what , [he]89-roshan had been planning , as [[his]89-roshan men]4923-his men battered down the gate , how best to compass those fair odds which were necessary alike to [his]89-roshan sense of justice and injustice -- for the injustice of [his]89-roshan own position cried aloud for proof that [he]89-roshan was worth a better one . So [he]89-roshan had settled to complete that liberating of [the prisoners which , with the help of the keys , ought already to be in hand]5995-the prisoners which , with the help of the keys , ought already to be in hand . This done , [the general rabble]5996-the general rabble would be eager for freedom , eager for plunder , eager to get to [the town]331-the town and raise it , eager for all things for which [he]89-roshan cared no jot . Then would be [his]89-roshan time . Then -- [he]89-roshan did not even try to formulate how -- [he]89-roshan could find [himself]89-roshan face to face , at fair odds , with [Vincent Dering]71-vincent . Wild memories of duels [he]89-roshan had read about in western books , duels with [others]569-others , who had nothing to do with the quarrel , looking on , occurred to [him]89-roshan . Yes ! that would satisfy [him]89-roshan . To have it out , till death ! [He]89-roshan set [his]89-roshan teeth as [he]89-roshan forced a peremptory way through the crowd at the end of [the alley]3795-the alley , which hid the closed door until [one]3501-one actually stood beside it . Then [he]89-roshan stood transfixed , for [he]89-roshan saw [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's dead body still backed by that closed door , still guarding [it]6001-it , unarmed . There was a curious look of content in the dead face , and [Roshan]89-roshan , grasping its meaning by intuition , turned from it with a curse , knowing [himself]89-roshan forestalled , cheated . "[89-roshan] ' Twas not [our]3150-our fault , [Khân]89-roshan - jee , " protested a voice , quickly ; "[89-roshan] [the swine]3151-the swine fought till [the other one]3152-the other one had locked the door in [our]3150-our faces , and so-- " [Roshan]89-roshan struck at the voice fiercely . Not forestalled , not cheated , only ; but outdone , conquered ! [[His]89-roshan rival]3735-his rival had died [a hero]6003-a hero 's death , and [he]3735-his rival -- [he]3735-his rival might live to be hanged ! A rage of despair , of despite , seized on [him]89-roshan . [His]89-roshan one real object gone , the whole hideous folly of the rest made [him]89-roshan fling up [his]89-roshan hands passionately as [he]89-roshan dashed back to the gate , neither knowing nor caring what [he]89-roshan was going to do next . Storm [that feeble garrison on the roof]6004-that feeble garrison on the roof ? [those broken stairs]6005-those broken stairs , every crevice , every foothold in which stood out clear , easy , in the light of the search - ray ? Was that [a man]533-a man 's task ? Confused , dazed , [he]89-roshan ran on , followed instinctively by [the crowd]4412-the crowd , wondering what [he]89-roshan would be at . [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon , seeing the rush , covered the first foothold of the broken stairs with [his]69-dr. dillon rifle , and waited for [a man]533-a man to show on it . But none came . Just as the rush reached [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith 's search - ray , having exhausted itself , went out , leaving , not darkness , but the grey mystery of dawn , in which for an instant all sound , all movement , seemed arrested . There was one utterly peaceful second , and then , from behind the splintered gateway , from the shadows of [the tunnel]378-the tunnel , came a breathless voice:-- "[844-sergeant] Close the outer gate , [sergeant]844-sergeant ; if [you]844-sergeant can , [you]844-sergeant have [them]3154-them in a trap ! a regular trap ! " A trap ! The word reached [those who had followed [Roshan]89-roshan in [his]89-roshan causeless retreat]6011-those who had followed roshan in his causeless retreat . Had [he]89-roshan foreseen this ? Was [he]89-roshan escaping from the trap ? [Their]6011-those who had followed roshan in his causeless retreat eyes flew to [the tunnel]378-the tunnel , but the light which , till then , had lit up its darkness , the swinging lamp by which the batterers of the gate had worked , was dashed down by [someone]498-someone 's hand -- a small , white hand -- and there was nothing to be seen . Only that voice to be heard repeating , "[844-sergeant] [They]3154-them 're in a trap ; keep [them]3154-them there ! " Keep [them]3154-them ! Not if [they]3154-them could fight [their]3154-them way into the open ! The cry rose in a second:-- "[844-sergeant] A trap . Yea ! a trap ! Out of it ! Outside , [brothers]880-brothers , outside , where [we]3156-we can fight free ! " [Roshan]89-roshan , who would have paused at this chance of fair resistance , was caught in the rush from behind , and found [himself]89-roshan through the gap in the gate fighting desperately in [the crowd]4412-the crowd , calling on [[his]89-roshan men]4923-his men to rally . But [they]3154-them had construed [his]89-roshan half - frenzied flight from that look on [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's face into a lead , and [they]3154-them were mixed up inextricably with the horde of [undisciplined conspirators who , having been till now safe under cover of the tunnelled archway]6016-undisciplined conspirators who , having been till now safe under cover of the tunnelled archway , yelled for the open , not so much in which to fight , but in which to run away . [The mere handful of men , whose number was fortunately hidden by the darkness]6017-the mere handful of men , whose number was fortunately hidden by the darkness , could never have prevented the rush , but a quick wit amongst [them]6017-the mere handful of men , whose number was fortunately hidden by the darkness seized on a possibility , and the breathless voice called , "[3154-them] Let [them]3154-them pass -- let [them]3154-them pass ! " So , in a second or two , amid confused yells , and mad slashings at [friends]3433-friends and [foes alike]6019-foes alike , the positions were reversed . The inside was out , the outside in , like [Brian O'Lynn]290-brian o'lynn 's breeches ; and [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's first hint at what the amazing turn of affairs below [him]69-dr. dillon meant came with the words:-- "[3154-them] Barricade that gate . Sharp as [you]3157-you know how . [They]3154-them wo n't give [us]3158-us long . " "[3154-them] Is that [you]3159-you , [Carlyon]68-lance ? " [he]69-dr. dillon called doubtfully , leaning over the parapet and peering into that grey mystery of dawn . [The figure [he]69-dr. dillon saw]6020-the figure he saw , [a woman in a white dress and a scarlet mess jacket]6021-a woman in a white dress and a scarlet mess jacket , made [him]69-dr. dillon doubt the evidence of [his]69-dr. dillon own eyes . But the answer in [a woman]3949-a woman 's voice , with a quick breath in it , sent [his]69-dr. dillon back in something between a laugh and a sob . "[3159-you] Then [he]3160-he is n't here ! Oh ! what can have become of [him]3160-he ? " There was no doubt that this was [a woman]3949-a woman ! Once outside , where [they]3154-them could discern [friend from foe]6024-friend from foe , [the troopers]2375-the troopers instantly realized [their]3154-them mistake , and rallied round [Roshan]89-roshan . But it was too late for that now . As [he]69-dr. dillon stood , centring [them]3154-them , there was a wild contempt , a vague relief , in [his]69-dr. dillon face . [He]69-dr. dillon knew now where [his]69-dr. dillon sympathies lay . Not with [these men]2367-these men , treacherous to [their]2367-these men salt , but with [those who could hold]6027-those who could hold -- who had held -- [their]6027-those who could hold own against all odds . Yes ! even with that dead figure , still with its back to the door that must not be opened . The thought stung and seared like hot iron . No ! Not with that ! not with that ! That was -- What?-- [He]69-dr. dillon could have killed [himself]69-dr. dillon for the unwavering testimony which every scrap of [him]69-dr. dillon gave to the heroism , the defiance of such a death . [He]69-dr. dillon knew [he]69-dr. dillon would give everything to die one like it ; and [he]69-dr. dillon knew [he]69-dr. dillon could not -- not now . [He]69-dr. dillon knew [he]69-dr. dillon must die a useless death , to save [himself]69-dr. dillon from a worse one . "[3159-you] There is no real harm done , [Khân]89-roshan - jee , " broke in [his]69-dr. dillon lance - duffadar in hurried excuse , seeing the expression on [his]69-dr. dillon face . "[89-roshan] [We]3161-we can get in easily again . [Those holding the horses]3162-those holding the horses say there were but a score of [them]3163-them all told -- [the cursed Sikhs]3164-the cursed sikhs -- [God]96-god knows how [they]3164-the cursed sikhs got out of [the Fort]3493-the fort ! [I]0-i thought [we]3161-we had [them]3164-the cursed sikhs safe . And there was [a woman with [them]3164-the cursed sikhs]3166-a woman with them -- [a Miss - baba"--he]6028-a miss - baba"--he laughed savagely . "[6028-a miss - baba"--he] Well ! if [they]3164-the cursed sikhs be brave as [men]312-men , [these infidel women]3168-these infidel women , let [them]3164-the cursed sikhs die like [men]312-men -- the hell - cats ! " [Roshan Khân]89-roshan looked at [the man , whom [he]89-roshan had known for years , as if [he]89-roshan had never seen [him]6029-the man , whom he had known for years , as if he had never seen him before before]6029-the man , whom he had known for years , as if he had never seen him before . And the thought of [another woman]6030-another woman -- with [his]89-roshan own blood in [her]6030-another woman veins -- who had been brave also , and who had died -- died by [his]89-roshan hand -- returned to sweep [him]89-roshan from every bearing , from every landmark , eastern or western , and leave [him]89-roshan rudderless , drifting , in a storm of sheer despair . [He]89-roshan laughed suddenly -- an insane laugh -- at the hideousness , the hopelessness of it all . Laughed like [the madman]6031-the madman [he]89-roshan was for the time , at the horror which drove [him]89-roshan mad . "[3171-thou] Kill [her]3170-her , if [thou]3171-thou wilt , [fool]4037-fool ! [I]0-i have done [my]0-i share of that , " [he]89-roshan cried brutally , striking out at the voice as [he]89-roshan had struck at the other which had told [him]89-roshan of [Vincent]71-vincent 's victory . Striking as [he]89-roshan felt inclined to strike at anything and everything ; most of all at the hateful confusion in [himself]89-roshan , and in [his]89-roshan world . So , without another word , [he]89-roshan broke through the circle of [troopers]2378-troopers , dashed to where [his]89-roshan horse awaited [him]89-roshan , and was off like a whirlwind ; that strange possession of the Oriental races , which , in a way , claims kindred with the Berserk rage of [the north]1348-the north , thrilling to [his]89-roshan finger - tips ; yet held in check , diverted from sheer , mad , uncalculating desire to kill , by that acquired sense of fair play . "[0-i] [He]0-i goes to rouse [the city]3556-the city , " said [some of [[his]89-roshan men]4923-his men]2698-some of his men , following [him]89-roshan hurriedly . "[0-i] And time , too ! " assented [some of [the conspirators]5512-the conspirators]6036-some of the conspirators . "[0-i] The dawn is upon [us]3174-us , and if [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims drift away , [our]3174-us hope is gone ! " But [most of [the crowd]4412-the crowd]6038-most of the crowd , [troopers]2378-troopers and [conspirators alike]6041-conspirators alike , felt vaguely that the dawn had indeed come , that the midsummer night 's dream of madness was over ; that [those who were wise]2166-those who were wise would try , while [they]2166-those who were wise had the chance , to escape from its consequences . And that such a chance existed , even now , was patent . The very madness of the night , its lack of reasonable explanation , were in [their]6038-most of the crowd favour . And its darkness , the outer darkness of the storm , which had sprung up in a minute , must have hidden much . Who , for instance , was to say -- except [those impenitent ones whose evidence , if given at all]6043-those impenitent ones whose evidence , if given at all , must be doubted as the evidence of [condemned men seeking to drag [others]569-others down to [their]569-others fate]6044-condemned men seeking to drag others down to their fate -- whether [such and such a one]6046-such and such a one had been [a rebel]6047-a rebel at first ? Provided , always , that there was no doubt about [his]89-roshan staunchness at the last ; that is , now that the dawn had come -- the dawn which showed doubt , almost a surprise , in so many faces . What had come to [them]6038-most of the crowd ? Why were [they]6038-most of the crowd there ? "[0-i] Kuchch saiya pur gya ! " ( some shadow fell on [me]0-i ) muttered [one man]414-one man below [his]414-one man breath , as [he]414-one man sheathed [his]414-one man sword . And another , with an oath , said boldly , "[0-i] This one is for the winning side , " then gave the cry , "[0-i] To the rescue , [brothers]880-brothers , to the rescue ! Cut down [the mutineers"--so]6049-the mutineers"--so , promptly , began operations on [the nearest defenceless prisoner]6050-the nearest defenceless prisoner . Thus , almost before [those who had galloped in hot haste after [Roshan]89-roshan 's lead]6051-those who had galloped in hot haste after roshan 's lead were out of sight , [the prisoners]1510-the prisoners , even [the resisting warders]6053-the resisting warders , had been driven into [the portico]6054-the portico , and penned like a flock of sheep between [the troopers outside]5542-the troopers outside and [the pioneers within]6056-the pioneers within . "[6049-the mutineers"--so] [The Lord]3177-the lord is [King]3696-king , " said [the lance - duffadar]6057-the lance - duffadar , piously , to a neighbour,--he had started back from [Roshan]89-roshan 's blow with a scowl , and watched [his]3177-the lord retreat resentfully,--"the[3696-king] Handle - end of [His]3177-the lord Sword is safest ! [Lo]123-lo ! Have at [them]3179-them , [brothers!"--he]291-brothers!"--he added aloud--"have[123-lo] at [the evil - born ones who would have killed [the mems]4883-the mems and [the baba - logue]3182-the baba - logue as [such scum]3183-such scum did in the Great Breathing , making the faces of [the soldiery]3184-the soldiery black for all time]3180-the evil - born ones who would have killed the mems and the baba - logue as such scum did in the great breathing , making the faces of the soldiery black for all time ! Show [them]3179-them [our]3185-they mettle . Forward ! ' Gord -- save -- the -- [Ka - veen]3186-ka - veen ! ' " "[292-gord] [Gord]292-gord -- save -- [the -- Ka - veen]3187-the -- ka - veen ! " The cry grew to a shout , and [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon , who , with a great incredulity lessening the values of all [he]69-dr. dillon saw and heard , had promptly swung [himself]69-dr. dillon down into [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , looked through a crevice in the barricade -- which was fast taking form under the willing hands of [the pioneers]5081-the pioneers -- to see what the noise meant . "[292-gord] It is all over , " [he]69-dr. dillon said slowly , [his]69-dr. dillon face pathetic in its bewilderment ; "[292-gord] [the troopers]2375-the troopers are siding with [us]3185-they ! " [He]69-dr. dillon stood for a moment as if unable to grasp the reality , and [his]69-dr. dillon keen , inquisitive eyes seemed to search almost reproachfully for some cause , some hint of reason , in [his]69-dr. dillon surroundings . In the splintered door , in every cranny and foothold of the broken stair , and so , past the parapet , [they]3185-they continued [their]3185-they question to the lightening sky , against which , faint and far , those distant peaks where lay the "[2375-the troopers] Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods " had begun to show dimly . "[2375-the troopers] All for nothing ! " [he]69-dr. dillon muttered to [himself]69-dr. dillon , almost petulantly . "[293-poor dering] [Poor Dering]293-poor dering ! " So , swiftly [he]69-dr. dillon passed down the alley,--swiftly , but hopelessly ; for [he]69-dr. dillon knew what those iron shackles meant on [a man]533-a man 's bare head . [He]69-dr. dillon drew the body to one side with tender care , then knocked at the closed door and called to [the man within]6061-the man within . "[74-eugene smith] [Smith]74-eugene smith , open the door ! [You]74-eugene smith 'd better come out -- [I]0-i think it 's all over now ; be quick , please . " There was a pause , then a fumbling at the bolts and bars . So , in that grey , cold light , [a figure]6062-a figure stood at the open door , tall , gaunt , with a hunted look in its eyes , almost a terror , as [they]3185-they looked down -- down to the threshold -- down for what [they]3185-they knew should be there . "[293-poor dering] [Dering]293-poor dering ? " asked [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith , rather hoarsely ; then , seeing what lay to one side , covered [his]74-eugene smith eyes from the sight with a cry like [a woman]3949-a woman 's , and trembled all over . That strain of patient , idle inaction had been awful . "[293-poor dering] Oh , God damn [them]3190-them ! " burst out [the doctor]334-the doctor , fiercely . "[3190-them] And all for nothing -- for nothing . At least [I]0-i think so . Come on , [Smith]74-eugene smith , and make sure . " For nothing ! For nothing ! The words were echoing in [Roshan]89-roshan 's brain also , as with loose rein , recklessly , [he]89-roshan galloped over the frail bridge of [boats]2141-boats , making it quiver and thunder beneath [his]89-roshan horse 's hoofs , and send curved waves of light and shadow over the clear , steely surface of [the water]945-the water , seen like a polished shield in the dawn . The air was clear also ; [the distant hills]6067-the distant hills steel grey as [the water]945-the water , the sky steel grey as [the hills]343-the hills . And there was the bright keenness as of a glittering sword in the chill breeze that swept from [west to east]6070-west to east . But [Roshan]89-roshan did not feel it ; [he]89-roshan was absorbed in [himself]89-roshan , in the useless battle of [his]89-roshan life . For nothing ! For nothing ! [He]89-roshan did not even hear the soft yet sonorous roar , beginning like the rush of a big breaker on [a beach]6071-a beach , ending with a wild , musical note , like the wail of new - weaned lambs and [[their]3444-the pilgrims mothers]6072-their mothers on [a lone hillside]6073-a lone hillside , which suddenly echoed out over [the water]945-the water , making [those who galloped behind]6075-those who galloped behind look at [each other]3586-each other and whisper joyfully:-- "[74-eugene smith] ' Tis all right , [Khân - sahib]89-roshan , " said [one]3501-one , urging [his]3501-one horse alongside ; "[89-roshan] [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims are waiting still -- hear [you]89-roshan not [their]3444-the pilgrims cry ? [They]3444-the pilgrims grow impatient ! " [Roshan]89-roshan looked at [him]89-roshan with lack - lustre eyes . What were [the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims to [him]89-roshan , or [their]3444-the pilgrims impatience ? What was salvation , immortality , to [one whose only desire was death -- death and forgetfulness]6079-one whose only desire was death -- death and forgetfulness ? [He]89-roshan dug [his]89-roshan spurs into [his]89-roshan horse , savagely glad to give pain , and rode on . "[3444-the pilgrims] Hârâ ! Hârî ! Harî ! Hârâ ! " The roar was articulate now , and [those behind]2333-those behind looked doubtfully at [each other]3586-each other . "[117-gu - gu] If it should be the miracle ? " suggested [one conspirator]6082-one conspirator ; but [another]6083-another shook [his]6083-another head , "[117-gu - gu] How can that be ? [None]403-none know the trick save those two , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu and [Am - ma]131-am - ma , and [they]3193-they are safe . " "[117-gu - gu] Unless it be a miracle , " put in a third , almost timidly . "[96-god] [[God]96-god 's club]3194-god 's club makes no noise , and the night has been full of marvels . " So an uneasy silence fell upon the rest . "[96-god] Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! " There was no mistaking the cry now . [It]6084-it rose exultant , yet with that wailing note in it still , which lingers always in [humanity]3907-humanity 's claim to have found [its]3907-humanity lost Paradise , its lost purity . Yet there was no trace of doubt in the almost frantic joy on every face in the dense multitude which stopped the little cavalcade , as [it]6084-it entered [the square around the Pool of Immortality]6086-the square around the pool of immortality ; stopped it hopelessly , as if [the moving , breathing , living mass]6087-the moving , breathing , living mass had been a dead wall . "[96-god] Hârâ ! Hârî ! Hârî ! Hârâ ! " It was almost a yell . The patience was gone utterly , and far as the eye could reach , in all [the wide square]6088-the wide square , in [every street and alley]6089-every street and alley converging to it , there was the restless ineffectual movement of [the sea]1306-the sea , when , on a summer 's day , it beats itself calmly yet persistently -- rising and falling -- upon [a sheer cliff]6091-a sheer cliff , against the impossible . There was [no one]3741-no one to check [the crowd]4412-the crowd now , to prevent [it]4412-the crowd from finding Death and Immortality at the same time . What matter ? What were a few hundreds of crushed bodies , when the soul found what it sought ? [The riders behind [Roshan]89-roshan]6094-the riders behind roshan threw up [their]6094-the riders behind roshan hands at the sight . No hope here for the littlenesses of life ; for principalities and powers , even for political liberty . This was the bed - rock ; this , in its unalterable aspiration -- not for something better , but for the best -- neither culture nor conspiracy could touch ; this was as much beyond the control of [kith]294-kith and [kin]6095-kin as of [strangers]4240-strangers and [aliens]6097-aliens . "[3197-she] Come , [Khân - sahib]89-roshan ! " [they]6094-the riders behind roshan called to the figure with the lack - lustre eyes which sat its horse like a statue , staring at itself , at [its]89-roshan world , conscious only of the hideous discords which were , perforce , the music of its sphere . "[89-roshan] Come ! [Nawab]122-nawab - jee ! There is still a chance with the ' Teacher of Religion . ' [The jogi]3898-the jogi will have held [[his]3898-the jogi folk]3196-his folk , for sure . [They]3196-his folk will be ready for blood , since [Mai Kâli"--the speaker]295-mai kâli"--the speaker spat [his]3898-the jogi Mahomedan contempt for the idolatry ere [he]3898-the jogi went on--"lets[122-nawab] none go . [She]3197-she 's [a true woman]1551-a true woman for that ! " So , by [back alleys]6098-back alleys and crooked ways , [Roshan]89-roshan -- why [he]89-roshan did not know , since [he]89-roshan meant nothing by it -- led [the cavalcade]6099-the cavalcade past [the palace]3477-the palace , through the archway into [the courtyard]386-the courtyard with [its]386-the courtyard union - jack of raised paths . And found [it]386-the courtyard empty . Empty of all save [the jogi]3898-the jogi , [Gorakh]141-jogi gorakh - nâth - nâth , who was busy , resignedly , in rethreading [his]3199-his chaplet of skulls , [ere]6103-ere starting to seek safety over [the British border]6104-the british border in [some far recess of [the holy hills]5837-the holy hills]6105-some far recess of the holy hills , whence , when this affair had blown over , [he]3199-his could swoop down with added sanctity on some other religious fair . "[3199-his] [He]3199-his and [[his]3199-his God]406-his god stole [them]3201-they from [me]0-i not the saying of a rosary past , " [he]0-i said cheerfully , after [he]0-i had explained the position . "[3199-his] [They]3201-they went by yonder door to [the old road]1646-the old road . So what matter ! [They]3201-they are in [it]1646-the old road . [They]3201-they will come back to [Her]3203-her by and by . It is so always . [Men]312-men follow other leads , other loves . But [they]312-men do not find what [they]312-men seek ; so [they]312-men come back to [Her]3203-her , to the many named [Woman]296-woman . [Jai]285-jai kali ma ! [Kali Ma]285-jai kali ma ! " [Those behind [Roshan]89-roshan]6107-those behind roshan looked at [each other]3586-each other . "[285-jai kali ma] It is the end , " [they]6107-those behind roshan said briefly . "[285-jai kali ma] Come , [risaldar]92-risaldar - jee-- " the change of title was [significant--"we]297-significant--"we[285-jai kali ma] shall have to ride far and fast if [we]3205-we are to live . " Once more , every atom of [the man]3467-the man , soul and body , seemed to strike out furiously at the voice , at the truth and the untruth in it ; at the assertion of failure , the linking of [his]0-i need with [theirs]3206-theirs . "[285-jai kali ma] Ride for [your]3206-theirs lives if [you]3206-theirs want [them]3207-them , " [he]0-i cried fiercely ; "[0-i] [I]0-i seek death . " [They]3206-theirs left [him]0-i , after unavailing protests , and rode helter - skelter on to [the Fort]3493-the fort , warning [[their]3206-theirs comrades]6111-their comrades that the game was up , so , on towards safety . And [the jogi]3898-the jogi , naked but not ashamed , still swinging [his]3898-the jogi chaplet of skulls , followed [them]3206-theirs leisurely ; for [he]3898-the jogi knew [himself]3898-the jogi safe in the superstition and the devotion of [every woman in [India]8-india]6113-every woman in india . Since [he]0-i , [[Her]6113-every woman in india servant]6114-her servant , could not fail of shelter in [every Hindoo homestead]6115-every hindoo homestead , far or near , in which [a woman]3949-a woman 's hand closed on [a man]533-a man 's , holding [him]0-i tight for [herself]6113-every woman in india alone , as [the Great Mother]5829-the great mother holds [all men]6119-all men . [Roshan]89-roshan , thus left alone , rode [his]89-roshan horse on slowly to [the central plinth]6120-the central plinth , dismounted , and , hitching the bridle over the muzzle of the "[0-i] Teacher of Religion " stood staring out dully at what lay before [him]89-roshan ; so quiet , so commonplace ! Nothing changed from the day , barely a month ago , when [he]89-roshan had stood beside the old gun with [Vincent Dering]71-vincent and [Lance Carlyon]68-lance , contemptuous of the ignorance of [others]569-others , satisfied with [himself]89-roshan . And now?--what had come to [him]89-roshan ? The madness , which [his]89-roshan wild gallop from [the gaol]1501-the gaol had calmed somewhat , returned in a fierce rush , and with it that one desire for revenge ; for something by which to show the contempt , which was not now merely for [the ignorant]884-the ignorant ; but for [those others , self - righteous , tyrannical , who had dared to touch [him]89-roshan -- dared to make [him]89-roshan what [he]89-roshan was]6124-those others , self - righteous , tyrannical , who had dared to touch him -- dared to make him what he was -- [a prey both to ignorance and wisdom , savagery and culture]6125-a prey both to ignorance and wisdom , savagery and culture -- a laughing - stock even to [himself]89-roshan ! And who had begun the fooling ? Who had taught [him]89-roshan as [a boy]523-a boy ? [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan ! Who else ? Who else had begun the game giving some things , withholding others ? And who else was within reach ? Who else could be followed up and forced to fair fight ? Forced to admit that [the pupil]6127-the pupil was ahead now of [the master]451-the master . [He]89-roshan laughed a laugh of absolute exultation ; and a wave of purely childish satisfaction swept through the mind in which there were still so many depths of childish ignorance and misconception ; unavoidable depths in the culture of a bare score of years . Leaving [his]89-roshan horse tethered to the old gun , [he]89-roshan ran hastily across to [the palace]3477-the palace , so , finding the door open , [the whole place]5297-the whole place quiet , went on down [the arched passage]5702-the arched passage . It was still dark there , but a glimmer of light showed the entrance to [the chapel]1291-the chapel , and to [the armoury beside [it]1291-the chapel]6133-the armoury beside it , which was [his]89-roshan goal . [He]89-roshan had no other thought except for [that armoury]6134-that armoury , until , with the tall tapers burning at the head and feet , [he]89-roshan saw the dead body of [the woman who had deceived [him]89-roshan lying on the Altar steps]6135-the woman who had deceived him lying on the altar steps . Then the pitifullest clashing of satisfaction and despair , of desire and disgust , came to [him]89-roshan that ever rent [a man]533-a man in twain . For a moment [he]89-roshan fought for bare reason between [them]6137-them , then with a savage cry , [he]89-roshan flung [himself]89-roshan beside [the dead girl]558-the dead girl , caught [her]558-the dead girl to [him]89-roshan , covered [her]558-the dead girl with frantic , cruel kisses , and , almost flinging [her]558-the dead girl from [him]89-roshan again , ran on into [the armoury]5140-the armoury , the red of [her]558-the dead girl dress , [her]558-the dead girl bosom , in [his]89-roshan eyes -- the red of blood ! [The armoury]5140-the armoury ! Where [he]89-roshan had had [his]89-roshan first lesson in the foils ! There [they]6137-them were , harmless in [their]6137-them buttons , crossed on the wall , and above [them]6137-them something more murderous ; the dangerous delicate rapiers to which [those others were but the prelude]6141-those others were but the prelude . No ! one was gone ! One [Father Ninian]81-father ninian had used against [the jogi]3898-the jogi ! One [he]89-roshan must have with [him]89-roshan . So much the better ! [He]89-roshan tore down [its]3898-the jogi fellow , and passing [the dead girl]558-the dead girl without a look , dashed out into [the courtyard]386-the courtyard again , [his]89-roshan last trace of sanity gone . The next instant [his]89-roshan horse 's feet were echoing madly along [[the pilgrims]3444-the pilgrims ' road]1648-the pilgrims ' road . [[His]89-roshan enemy]6147-his enemy must have a quarter of an hour 's lead , but that was nothing ; [he]89-roshan could overtake [him]6147-his enemy , anyhow , at [the first station in the pilgrimage,--a temple under [a vast banyan tree at the foot of the first rise]6149-a vast banyan tree at the foot of the first rise , where [the pious must pause to make offerings]6150-the pious must pause to make offerings . [The road]3494-the road]6148-the first station in the pilgrimage,--a temple under a vast banyan tree at the foot of the first rise , where the pious must pause to make offerings . the road was almost empty at first ; for the news that the miracle had only been deferred had spread instantly through [the unrestful town]6152-the unrestful town , so to a space beyond [it]3494-the road , making [those who heard the tale]6153-those who heard the tale turn back to see for [themselves]6153-those who heard the tale . But after a few minutes ' wild gallop , [he]89-roshan came up with [those who had been beyond recall , who had gone on content with that strange lead of a strange God]6154-those who had been beyond recall , who had gone on content with that strange lead of a strange god ; of [a saint]4348-a saint , [a sinner]6156-a sinner . Yet , after a time , forgetful of that leadership utterly . For [they]6154-those who had been beyond recall , who had gone on content with that strange lead of a strange god needed it no more . The danger of novelty had passed with [their]6154-those who had been beyond recall , who had gone on content with that strange lead of a strange god first step along [the beaten track which [[their]6154-those who had been beyond recall , who had gone on content with that strange lead of a strange god fathers]5859-their fathers had followed]6157-the beaten track which their fathers had followed . [Father Ninian , wise with the wisdom of long years , of secret sympathy]6159-father ninian , wise with the wisdom of long years , of secret sympathy , had known this ; had counted on it in [his]89-roshan forlorn hope of leading [them]6154-those who had been beyond recall , who had gone on content with that strange lead of a strange god into familiar bondage . [He]89-roshan had told [himself]89-roshan that [he]89-roshan need only go as far as [that first station]6160-that first station ; that then , during the pause for offerings , [he]89-roshan might return , as it were , to realities , to something more consistent with the nineteenth century ! But to [him]89-roshan , also , as [he]89-roshan led the way , chanting [his]89-roshan offices for the day , had come a strange peace , a strange desire to go on to the end of the pilgrimage ; a strange desire to leave those realities behind [him]89-roshan in a world from which [he]89-roshan was taking nothing , not even [his]89-roshan love . Surely it was time . Surely [he]89-roshan was old enough to claim rest . No ! not rest . It was something more than that . Surely , now that [he]89-roshan had left every atom of earth behind [him]89-roshan lying with [a dead woman on the Altar steps]6161-a dead woman on the altar steps , [he]89-roshan also was free to find the "[3472-the gods] Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods " ! "[0-i] [My]0-i soul fleeth unto [the Lord]3426-the lord ! before the morning watch [I]0-i say , before the morning watch , " [he]89-roshan chanted ; [he]89-roshan had gone on blindly from psalm to psalm intent on the desire to lead those voices behind . "[0-i] Have a care , [baba]3210-baba - jee ! [thou]3211-thou and [[thy]3211-thou God]804-thy god ! " said a half - tender , half - jesting one as [he]89-roshan stumbled among the stones , and a dark hand stretched itself out to steady [the old priest]1250-the old priest , and a dark face turned to nod approval at other saffron robes ; since here was [a true pilgrim]6163-a true pilgrim , [a true madman]6164-a true madman , forgetful of [this world]342-this world , to judge by the face lifted towards [those distant hills]6166-those distant hills . Yet the desire in [him]89-roshan to reach [them]6166-those distant hills seemed to [the wise old heart]6167-the wise old heart something that must be set aside . [He]89-roshan must return . Yes ! [he]89-roshan must return . To do what ? What could [an old man]1853-an old man do who had left life , a useless life , behind [him]1853-an old man ? [He]89-roshan crushed down that thought also , and stumbled on . "[804-thy god] [Man]298-man is like a thing of nought , [his]298-man time passeth away like a shadow ! " [His]89-roshan voice spent itself tremulously on that one certainty , and those behind [him]89-roshan joined [their]6166-those distant hills testimony to [his]89-roshan all unwittingly , as [they]6166-those distant hills called on Hârâ or [Hârî]299-hârî ; on [the Creator]1359-the creator , [the Destroyer]1731-the destroyer , as [One]3501-one and Indivisible . And in the rear again , [Roshan]89-roshan in [his]89-roshan search for Death , for annihilation , bore witness also , as [he]89-roshan came , cursing [those who stood in [his]89-roshan way]6172-those who stood in his way , [his]89-roshan horse slithering among the stones in its effort to obey whip and spur , and sending a dry clangour of hoof - beats through [the little stony valley]6173-the little stony valley to startle the sleepy snakes coiled on the distant rocks , and drive [them]6166-those distant hills back to [their]6166-those distant hills crannies with a hiss . So , every instant , the distance lessened between [the old man]3483-the old man and [the young one , both weary of life]6175-the young one , both weary of life . It was broad daylight now , though the sun was still low on the horizon . The mystery of dawn had left [the world]404-the world , [the very pilgrims]6177-the very pilgrims , between [their]6177-the very pilgrims recurring cries , were chattering , laughing , over the every - day details of life which would make to - day as trivial as yesterday , to - morrow as trivial as to - day . There had been a "[0-i] Breathing " in the night , [they]6177-the very pilgrims told [each other]3586-each other . Some shadow had fallen . [Some God]6179-some god or [Devil]283-the devil had had power . But the shackles of custom , of familiarity , were back again , the despotism of detail . Only in those two strangely different minds in [the van]6180-the van , in the rear , the mystery still clouded the reality . And the distance between [them]6177-the very pilgrims lessened as [Roshan]89-roshan drove [his]89-roshan way through the saffron robes recklessly . Yet , fast as [he]89-roshan went , when [he]89-roshan reached the end of the dry watercourse up which the last part of [the rough track]6181-the rough track had wound , and stood in the hollow , backed by [a further rise of [the hill]6183-the hill]6182-a further rise of the hill , where [the quaint , dumpy , black temple]6184-the quaint , dumpy , black temple hid itself under the huge blotch of the banyan tree -- the only green thing visible , far or near -- the figure [he]89-roshan sought was not to be seen among [the crowd]4412-the crowd . [Akbar Khân]110-akbar , indeed , [he]89-roshan saw , utilizing one of the tall tapers as a pipe - light before casting [himself]89-roshan on the ground to suck contentedly at the screwed banyan leaf full of tobacco which [he]89-roshan had gathered by claiming a pinch in return for the loan of that same light to [others]569-others . But with a curious shame [Roshan]89-roshan avoided [him]89-roshan , and passed on in [his]89-roshan search among [the jostling crowd]6187-the jostling crowd , the continuous babel of trivial talk ; for this was resting - time , when [men]312-men and [women]479-women could be [men]312-men and [women]479-women , and forget that [they]4412-the crowd were on a pilgrimage ; when [they]4412-the crowd could even dream [themselves]4412-the crowd back in [the village]6192-the village under [the familiar shelter of some village tree]6193-the familiar shelter of some village tree , asking no more than the familiar round of life . But above the babel came every now and again the insistent clang of a bell , telling that [some new petitioner]6194-some new petitioner was seeking a favour of [the Gods]166-the gods , and making a golden oriole , which sat in the green leafage , flit to [another bower]6195-another bower with a sudden fluting note , full , joyful , mellow . "[0-i] What dost seek , [Musulmân]300-musulmân ? " cavilled [a saint]4348-a saint , drawing back from [Roshan]89-roshan 's shadow , as [he]4348-a saint gabbled invocations , all [he]4348-a saint knew , on a rosary , ere solacing [himself]4348-a saint with the pipe which [[his]4348-a saint disciple]6197-his disciple had prepared . "[300-musulmân] If ' tis [the madman]6031-the madman and [[his]6031-the madman God]406-his god -- [he]6031-the madman hath gone yonder . " [He]4348-a saint pointed to a side track , which was [a short cut to [the road above]6199-the road above]6198-a short cut to the road above . [Roshan]89-roshan flung [himself]89-roshan from [his]89-roshan horse without a word , and followed . The distance lessened at every step now , for [the old priest]1250-the old priest 's breath failed [him]89-roshan at the steepness of the rise . Still , it would not delay [him]89-roshan long , [he]89-roshan told [himself]89-roshan , to take that one look at the soft , white cloud which generally hid the goal of pilgrimage , before [he]89-roshan turned back over [the hill]6183-the hill , as best [he]89-roshan could , to find what task remained for [him]89-roshan in [the world]404-the world . [He]89-roshan might have that one look , surely ! So , reaching [the summit of [this first bulwark of the unattainable]6204-this first bulwark of the unattainable]6203-the summit of this first bulwark of the unattainable , [he]89-roshan sat down , breathlessly , beside an upright black stone which showed strangely distinct amid the redness of [the surrounding rock]6205-the surrounding rock ; a plain black stone , not three feet high , chipped rudely to a blunt point . [Father Ninian]81-father ninian did not need the scattering of dead marigolds and dry basil leaves about its base to tell [him]81-father ninian that it was a fragment of an older faith than that of [the temple below]6206-the temple below ; a faith sterner , purer , founded on a clearer perception of what humanity needed in that search for [the lost Paradise]6207-the lost paradise ; on a closer memory of the cause which lost it . [He]89-roshan laid one hand on the stone almost caressingly , as , holding the pyx in the other , [he]89-roshan sat down facing [the distant peaks]6208-the distant peaks . But there was no cloud upon them . The day had dawned clear and still , and as [he]89-roshan sat looking wistfully over [the valleys]6209-the valleys on [valleys]6210-valleys , [the hills on hills]6211-the hills on hills , which lay bathed in light between [him]89-roshan and [the "[6031-the madman] Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods]4614-the " cradle of the gods , " a sunbeam -- still slanting from [the curved edge of [the eastern plains]6214-the eastern plains]6213-the curved edge of the eastern plains -- caught the jewelled star of what [he]89-roshan held , and stayed there . [It]6215-it was peaceful beyond words . The hurry , the strain , not only of that long eventful night , but of the whole long eventful life , seemed over . All things seemed behind [him]89-roshan . The passion , the pride , the courage , the manhood -- all things that had made [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian what [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian had been -- where were [they]6216-they ? Only wisdom , only a tender knowledge , seemed to remain . The clank of steel upon stone roused [him]89-roshan , the clank of [Roshan]89-roshan 's spurs upon the rocks ; and [Father Ninian]81-father ninian turned to see [him]89-roshan , a yard or two on [the path below]6217-the path below , outlined clearly against the distant view of [Eshwara]1-eshwara , against [the world in which [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian had lived and loved]6218-the world in which ninian bruce had lived and loved -- [the Ninian Bruce whom [he]89-roshan had left behind]81-father ninian . Behind ! No ! It was [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian and [none other who was on [his]81-father ninian feet in a second]6219-none other who was on his feet in a second , a flush on [his]81-father ninian face -- the face that was like the nether mill - stone in its stern passion , and pride , and power . For , in a second , [the old man]3483-the old man 's soul was back in [a world where [a dead woman belonging to [him]81-father ninian]6222-a dead woman belonging to him lay waiting for revenge]6221-a world where a dead woman belonging to him lay waiting for revenge . [His]81-father ninian hand was on [his]81-father ninian hidden rapier , as [he]81-father ninian flung [his]81-father ninian first word of defiance at [the man who had killed [her]6222-a dead woman belonging to him]6223-the man who had killed her . "[3216-murderer] [Murderer]3216-murderer ! " "[3216-murderer] [[Your]3217-you pupil]3218-your pupil at that , even ! " gasped [Roshan]89-roshan , "[3217-you] [you]3217-you began [it!--your pupil whom [you]3217-you taught]3219-it!--your pupil whom you taught -- curse [you--]3217-you " The words failed [him]81-father ninian -- [he]81-father ninian paused inarticulate -- but the keen eyes and ears opposite [him]81-father ninian took in [his]81-father ninian meaning with the swift comprehension which had been [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's always . A sort of contemptuous pity fought with the passion of [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian 's face . "[805-my pupil] [[My]0-i pupil]805-my pupil , certainly , " [he]0-i assented . "[805-my pupil] Have [you]3217-you come to ask [me]0-i for a final lesson ? " [Roshan]89-roshan glared at [him]3217-you . "[3217-you] [You]3217-you understand -- [you]3217-you always did -- that is the worst . Yes ! [I]0-i have come"--here [he]0-i laughed wildly--"for[3217-you] what [you]3217-you taught [me]0-i -- fair play and no favour -- and [I]0-i mean to have it . " In [his]0-i fierce excitement [he]0-i pressed closer , flourishing [his]0-i rapier . "[0-i] Pardon [me]0-i , " came a cold , courteous voice ; "[0-i] [I]0-i did not teach [you]3217-you that method of assassination , surely ? [I]0-i thought [you]3217-you desired fair play . If so , [you]3217-you might allow [me]0-i to meet [you]3217-you on equal terms . " [Roshan]89-roshan drew back with a flush from the figure which had stood its ground , which looked at [him]0-i with bitter disdain . [He]89-roshan scarcely seemed to recognize it . No wonder ! For this was [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian [himself]81-father ninian . [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian as [he]81-father ninian might have spoken to [an over - hasty antagonist]6224-an over - hasty antagonist in the days when [he]81-father ninian was [the most reckless swordsman in [Rome]4-rome]6225-the most reckless swordsman in rome , when [the world]404-the world held [him]81-father ninian body and soul . The years , [his]81-father ninian very priesthood , had slipped from [him]81-father ninian . "[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]3217-you pardon , [sir]3491-sir ! " muttered [Roshan]89-roshan , standing aside . There was a savage satisfaction in [his]89-roshan heart . [This man]2070-this man was not old , the odds were equal ; there was enough fire and passion here to please [any opponent]6228-any opponent . So , after a pause to lay aside the pyx -- it found a strange resting - place on [the blunt summit of that upright black stone]6229-the blunt summit of that upright black stone -- [a slim , still elegant figure , divested of its priestly robings]6230-a slim , still elegant figure , divested of its priestly robings , took its stand , [its]6230-a slim , still elegant figure , divested of its priestly robings back to [the hills]343-the hills , [its]6230-a slim , still elegant figure , divested of its priestly robings face to [the world]404-the world . Still upright , still active , with its black soutane caught up and tucked into the sash to give free play to its limbs . "[0-i] Now , [sir]3491-sir , " came the courteous voice , "[3491-sir] [I]0-i am ready . " Something in the proud grace of bearing , the reckless contempt , made [Roshan]89-roshan follow suit . "[3491-sir] The sun will be in [your]3217-you eyes , " [he]89-roshan said , "[3491-sir] let [us]3223-we fight lengthwise to [the ridge]3224-the ridge . " "[3223-we] [We]3223-we will -- by and by ! " came that icy voice , as [the speaker , without moving]6233-the speaker , without moving , stood on guard . "[3223-we] [We]3223-we can omit the salute . If [you]3217-you are ready , [I]0-i am .
