" For an instant [Roshan]89-roshan hesitated , realizing what the life that [he]89-roshan meant to take had been , what [the man]3467-the man [himself]3467-the man whom [he]89-roshan meant to kill had been and was . [The man whose figure stood out like a black shadow against the distant blue of]6235-the man whose figure stood out like a black shadow against the distant blue of [the hills]343-the hills ; and as [he]89-roshan realized the fine fibre of [[his]89-roshan enemy]6147-his enemy , a sense of powerlessness to touch , to harm [him]6147-his enemy , kept [Roshan]89-roshan motionless . "[0-i] Shall [I]0-i count five , and give [you]3217-you a start ? " The question came with a shrug of the shoulders . The taunt told . [Roshan]89-roshan pulled [himself]89-roshan together , and stood on guard also . But the sense of powerlessness was intolerable ; [he]89-roshan lowered [his]89-roshan rapier for a word more -- a word to raise [his]89-roshan own self - esteem . "[0-i] [I]0-i warn [you]3217-you , " [he]89-roshan said haughtily , "[0-i] that the sun is in [your]3217-you eyes . That [I]0-i have learnt more than [you]3217-you ever taught [me]0-i -- that this is to the death . " "[0-i] It could scarcely be anything else , could it ? " came the instant reply , in a voice that vibrated harshly , like a harpstring struck to its fullest , "[0-i] with [a dead woman]3225-a dead woman between [us]3226-us ! Engage , [you]3217-you devil , or [I]0-i will kill [you]3217-you as [you]3217-you stand ! " [Roshan]89-roshan gave a short , sharp cry , like a wild beast . The next instant the curious hiss of two meeting blades sliding along each other was the only sound . It is a strange sound , which , to [the listeners]6238-the listeners , [the onlookers]6239-the onlookers , seems to say "[0-i] hush " to [the whole world]6240-the whole world . "[0-i] Hush -- hush -- sh -- sh . " Then , short and sharp as that cry of [Roshan]89-roshan 's , came another sound ; the beaten , baffled clash when steel meets steel instead of flesh . [Roshan]89-roshan , with an inward curse , gripped [his]89-roshan rapier closer . [He]89-roshan had almost been disarmed,--disarmed in that first encounter . Strange that [he]89-roshan should have forgotten [his]89-roshan foe,--forgotten the deadly insistence of [the master]451-the master 's blade , slack as a snake in curves , firm as a vice in grip . Then that almost invisible turn of the wrist which had so nearly done for [him]89-roshan . [He]89-roshan had forgotten -- these , in years of [meaner adversaries]6242-meaner adversaries . [He]89-roshan remembered [them]6243-them now , and would not forget again . And [he]89-roshan had such things ; ay ! and more , in reserve for [himself]89-roshan . So had [[his]89-roshan master]3639-his master ; in reserve for both of [them]6245-they , if needful . And the knowledge that it would be needful came to [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian at the first touch of [[his]0-i adversary]5794-his adversary 's sword ; for there was that in it which told [the old hand]6247-the old hand that [the young one]2039-the young one was [a master]6249-a master 's also . "[0-i] [[My]0-i pupil]805-my pupil has improved , " [he]0-i said quietly , as , abandoning the attack , [he]0-i parried [Roshan]89-roshan 's furious onslaught with scarcely a motion of the hand , held level to [his]0-i heart . That [he]0-i could do . But the other must surely come in the end , since [he]0-i was old , and [Roshan]89-roshan young . If in the end , therefore , why not now ? The sooner the better . A minute after the sun was no longer in [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan 's eyes . As [he]0-i had said , [they]6245-they were fighting lengthwise to [the ridge]3224-the ridge ; and [he]0-i drew back , choosing [his]0-i ground , until under [his]0-i feet [he]0-i felt the dead marigolds , the withered basil leaves that lay about the upright stone,--that strange pedestal on which the star - shaped pyx stood as on an altar , glittering in the sun - rays . [He]0-i seemed to see it , to feel it , standing there between [the world below]6251-the world below and [those faint , far peaks]6252-those faint , far peaks . And the eyes which had seen so much felt [they]6245-they need see no more . "[0-i] [Sta ' alerta]65-sta ' alerta , [Signor]301-signor ! " [he]0-i cried jibingly , flinging [himself]0-i savagely forward . "[301-signor] And may [the Lord]3426-the lord have mercy on [your]3229-your soul , " [he]0-i added in a lower tone ; as , in an attack which held in it all the wildness , the fire , the passion of [his]0-i youth , [he]0-i drove [Roshan]89-roshan back a step,--one step down the faint slope on which [he]0-i had counted . A fierce lunge or two , a swift parry , and then,--then an inch beyond safety -- given purposely -- yielded room for the riposte [he]0-i sought from [that other rapier]6253-that other rapier . It came with a quick cry of triumph , as [Roshan]89-roshan felt that thin , cold steel slide silently on through a dull , faint resistance . A cry that ended in a gasp , as the hand which held the rapier dropped for a second , then flung itself upwards . For [Pidar Narâyan]84-pidar narâyan had given the reprise ; and ' [L'Addio del Marito]113-l'addio del marito ' had done its work . So , for an instant -- held upright by the lingering force of [the old man]3483-the old man 's hand -- [the two]1064-the two stood within a sword 's length , [their]1064-the two faces glaring at each other,--stern , implacable , [the one in death]6256-the one in death , the other still in life . Then the strength , the life , ebbed ; the balance between it and death wavered , and [Ninian Bruce]81-father ninian , overborne by [[his]81-father ninian enemy]6147-his enemy 's dead weight , sank to [his]81-father ninian knee , then backwards . But [his]81-father ninian hand still gripped the rapier . So [Roshan Khân]89-roshan 's body , as it fell forward , slithered down the sharp blade , sending a little jet of crimson blood backwards , till it stopped with a dull thud upon the hilt . So [he]89-roshan lay , face downwards , beside [the old man]3483-the old man , whose face looked skyward ; whose head rested among the withered marigolds and the sweet , dead leaves of the basil , which [generations and generations of pilgrims]6259-generations and generations of pilgrims had offered to an unknown wisdom on [their]6259-generations and generations of pilgrims way to [the "[3426-the lord] Cradle of [the Gods]166-the gods]4614-the " cradle of the gods . " "[3426-the lord] And to look at it now , " came [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner 's rich , round brogue , "[3230-you] [you]3230-you would think butter would n't melt in its mouth ! " [He]1009-the commissioner waved the cigar [he]1009-the commissioner was smoking towards [Eshwara]1-eshwara . It looked sleepier , more sun - saturate than ever , as it lay reflected in the still lagoon between [it]6256-the one in death and [the tent in which [he]1009-the commissioner was sitting]6262-the tent in which he was sitting ; [a double - poled , [Commissioner]302-commissioner 's tent , which two days before had swooped down like an avenging angel with broad white wings to take possession of the just and the unjust in the name of [Victoria Kaiser - i - Hind]303-victoria kaiser - i - hind]6263-a double - poled , commissioner 's tent , which two days before had swooped down like an avenging angel with broad white wings to take possession of the just and the unjust in the name of victoria kaiser - i - hind . [It]6263-a double - poled , commissioner 's tent , which two days before had swooped down like an avenging angel with broad white wings to take possession of the just and the unjust in the name of victoria kaiser - i - hind was pitched on [the site of [the Viceroy 's camp]3419-the viceroy 's camp]6264-the site of the viceroy 's camp , for the convenience of being close to [the gaol]1501-the gaol where [the late disturbers of the public peace]6267-the late disturbers of the public peace had taken up [[their]6267-the late disturbers of the public peace residence]6268-their residence . In fact , the mast from which the royal standard had floated , still reared itself , bare , undraped , from its roundel of roses . But the flowers were withered , dead . Even the palms , [their]1009-the commissioner work of welcome over , were wilting fast ; but they still gave a doubtful shade to [some groups of manacled men , who , guarded by yellow - legged constables]6269-some groups of manacled men , who , guarded by yellow - legged constables , were placidly awaiting [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner 's leisure and pleasure ; both being , at the time , occupied with lunch and [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon . So , the wide white wings of [the tent]857-the tent being set open and supported with bamboos to let in the breeze , [the representative of law and order]6272-the representative of law and order could be seen -- [his]69-dr. dillon feet on the table among [his]69-dr. dillon law books -- drinking an iced whiskey - and - soda . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon -- [he]69-dr. dillon looked careworn chiefly because in [his]69-dr. dillon care for [others]569-others [he]69-dr. dillon had , as yet , been able to take no rest -- nodded . "[3230-you] Yes ; and it does n't , as a rule . [A more peaceable spot]3231-a more peaceable spot never was . [You]3232-you ca n't account for these sudden idiotic outbreaks . One reason is as good as another . And so [old Mother Campbell]304-old mother campbell , with [her]3233-her assertion that it all came because [Miss Shepherd]105-erda would talk about [Jean Ziska]184-jean ziska 's drum-- " [The Commissioner]1009-the commissioner smiled . "[3233-her] Yes , [the good lady]3953-the good lady has an endless circle of unfounded beliefs , all dependent on [each other]3586-each other for support . It 's the most comfortable way of getting through life . [An ' miracles]3236-an ' miracles are like drams -- [ye]3232-you ca n't stop them , once [you]3232-you begin . " The keen whimsical face hardened . "[3232-you] [I]0-i shall follow the usual official routine , [sir]3491-sir , " [he]0-i said cynically ; "[0-i] for , look [you]3491-sir , there never was a row like this in [India]8-india but there is something in it about [a woman]3949-a woman , which [we]3237-we 've got to hush up . An ' that 's [God]96-god 's truth . Yes , [we]3237-we pay a heavy toll-- " [He]0-i broke off , took up a pen as if to write , threw it down impatiently , and stared out into the hot , yellow sunshine . " "[3491-sir] Do n't think so . Let 's see . " [The Commissioner]1009-the commissioner drew a list towards [him]69-dr. dillon , and ran [his]0-i eye over it . " So saying , [his]117-gu - gu brogue took possession of the sun - bright , sun - dry air-- "[0-i] [I]0-i , [Am - ma]3733-am - ma , of [the river folk]2493-the river folk , solemnly affirm that , knowing [the Dee]161-the dee - puk - râg - puk - râg to be in the power of [the Huzoors]118-the huzoors , [I]0-i several times warned [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu not to follow [other masters]3258-other masters . But [he]117-gu - gu had learned books , and become ignorant . [He]117-gu - gu could not even feel when a current changed its course ; and then [he]117-gu - gu thought [he]117-gu - gu must die , because of the ghost , and that made [him]117-gu - gu wild . So when [I]0-i refused , and set off , as ordained , for [the raft]4626-the raft , [he]117-gu - gu took [the Brahmin]3260-the brahmin 's money and stopped the miracle . Of [a surety]3261-a surety , [the Awarder of Justice]3262-the awarder of justice is right . [This slave]4971-this slave knew what was to come . [He]4971-this slave did not tell of it because , where [the Dee - puk - râg]161-the dee - puk - râg is , there is victory ; so there was no fear . Yet when [the Miss - sahiba]3264-the miss - sahiba bade [me]0-i help [her]3264-the miss - sahiba , [I]0-i obeyed , because [she]3264-the miss - sahiba has power over [devils]2365-devils , and [[my]0-i son]4595-my son , [Huzoor]90-huzoor , is still in the first week of life . " So [I]4385-the miss - sahiba returned to [[my]4385-the miss - sahiba home]6279-my home and ate [my]4385-the miss - sahiba bread . And the day was quiet , as [the Huzoor]90-huzoor knows ; only [the folk]6280-the folk reviled , because [I]4385-the miss - sahiba had no fish to sell . "[4385-the miss - sahiba] But , at night , at the waning of the sunset stars , about the third jackal cry , came [the Miss - sahiba]4385-the miss - sahiba to [[my]0-i hut]3274-my hut . " [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon ceased twiddling [his]69-dr. dillon hat , and looked up in sudden interest . "[4385-the miss - sahiba] To [[my]0-i hut]3274-my hut , " reiterated the reading voice . "[4385-the miss - sahiba] [I]0-i deemed it because of devils first ; but it was not . " ' [He]260-carlone - sahib has not been killed , ' said [the Miss - sahiba]4385-the miss - sahiba ' [He]260-carlone - sahib would not have fought with [his]260-carlone - sahib clothes off . ' But , as [I]0-i spoke , [the son at [[his]3284-the son at his mother 's breast mother]531-his mother 's breast]3284-the son at his mother 's breast left sucking , and cried aloud . Thus at the dawn -- the dawn after the dawn of darkness -- [I]0-i , [Am - ma]3733-am - ma , set out with [my]0-i nets , seeing that fish , anyhow , could be found , and [the market]3656-the market would be dear , because none had come to [the bazaar]372-the bazaar during the commotion . So , remembering where [my]0-i craft had stranded , [I]0-i went first to [mid - channel]3298-mid - channel ; thus , working up , came to where it had stranded once before . Then , seeing footmarks , [I]0-i followed [them]3299-them , till in [an island]5893-an island , eating [his]3280-his bread , [I]0-i found the evil - begotten [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu . " [He]3280-his had a knife in [his]3280-his bead belt , at the sight whereof [I]117-gu - gu gave glory to [gods]6284-gods and devils alike , for [I]117-gu - gu knew the handle of it . "[117-gu - gu] So [I]0-i said , ' Where gottest [thou]3301-thou [Carlone - sahib]260-carlone - sahib 's knife , [Gu - gu]117-gu - gu ? ' thinking to startle [him]3280-his . And it did . [He]3280-his said no word , but came at [me]0-i with it . " So [we]6286-we fought . [His]3280-his right hand and [mine]0-i on the knife , and [our]6286-we left arms round [each other]3586-each other 's throat , choking [us]6286-we ; and [our]6286-we legs wrestling . Till the water grew too deep . Then [we]6286-we swam with [them]6288-them . But [he]3280-his said nothing , nor did [I.]0-i There was no need . [We]6286-we understood , as dogs do , that it was foe and [foe]6289-foe . "[3280-his] Then [he]3302-him yelled , and let go ; but [I]0-i was after [him]3302-him as [he]3302-him dived . It was a long race . Wherefore not ? since [we]3303-we are [the best swimmers in [the river]333-the river]3304-the best swimmers in the river . But [I]0-i felt the cleave of the water from [his]3302-him foot at last , and spent [myself]0-i in one stroke . " And when [I]0-i came up , leaving [him]3302-him there , [I]0-i found how long the race had been , for [my]0-i right hand struck the city wall . But most of all [I]0-i thought of [[my]0-i little son]6294-my little son , and the devils longing for [him]3302-him , and for [a woman]3949-a woman longing for the sight of [a man]533-a man 's beauty , and [I]0-i knew [I]0-i must go and see if it lay there . So [I]0-i dived , and found [him]3302-him , as [the Awarder of Justice]3262-the awarder of justice knows , sitting high up , with the water about [his]3302-him feet , waiting for death , and brought [him]3302-him back as [I]0-i promised . So [the Miss]6300-the miss is pleased , and the devils do not come near [[my]0-i son]4595-my son . "[0-i] The brogue ceased , and there was a pause . " Well ! what do [ye]69-dr. dillon say , [Dillon]69-dr. dillon ? "[1009-the commissioner] asked [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , fretfully . "[69-dr. dillon] [The Commissioner]1009-the commissioner laid aside Am - ma 's affidavit with a soft " damn , "[1009-the commissioner] and [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon paused on [his]69-dr. dillon way out at the sound . " Quite so,--I entirely agree with [you]1009-the commissioner , "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon said sympathetically ; " but , unfortunately , there is only one person who has a right to tell that story , [sir]3491-sir -- and [she]6302-the miss - sahiba wo n't ! "[69-dr. dillon] " Why not ? "[1009-the commissioner] interrupted [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , militantly--"why the blazes should n't [a woman]3949-a woman tell the truth ? "[1009-the commissioner] " Because [women]479-women do n't know it , "[334-the doctor] broke in [the doctor]334-the doctor , " or [men]312-men either , for that matter . Because [we]6309-we [men]312-men and [women]479-women have got [ourselves]6309-we on such false lines , into such an absolutely false position towards [each other]3586-each other , that the only course consistent with propriety and les convenances is to -- to hush the thing up ! So hush - a - bye baby , [sir]3491-sir , to [your]3491-sir heart 's content . So long as [the mother]768-the mother can tell [[her]768-the mother blessed infant]6315-her blessed infant that [she]768-the mother is [a lady]1059-a lady , what does the real fact matter ? "[1009-the commissioner] [He]1009-the commissioner spoke with a concentrated bitterness , an almost fierce resentment , and [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner nodded , finished [his]1009-the commissioner whiskey - and - soda at a gulp , and returned to work , tossing [his]1009-the commissioner papers about recklessly . " It 's [a quare world]6317-a quare world , certainly , "[1009-the commissioner] [he]1009-the commissioner murmured , with a lack of originality which sat ill on [him]1009-the commissioner . Then , catching sight of something in a file , [his]1009-the commissioner humorous , kindly self returned . " Listen to this now , for quareness , "[1009-the commissioner] [he]1009-the commissioner laughed , beginning to read:-- " ' The petition of [Mussumat Mumtâza Mahal'--that]306-mussumat mumtâza mahal'--that 's Roshan Khân 's grandmother , [you]3491-sir know--'sister , ' etc . , etc . , ' humbly [sheweth]6318-sheweth that [she]768-the mother has endured grievous wrong and hurt , by loss of [[her]768-the mother grandson]3784-her grandson in the late deplorable mutiny ( of which [she]768-the mother was utterly incognizant , being helpless , veiled , [old woman perpetually confined in [house]4551-house]6320-old woman perpetually confined in house ) . Therefore prayeth that whereas one [Mussumat Ashrâf - un - nissa]135-ashrâf - un - nissa , [[her]768-the mother neighbour]3958-her neighbour , is in receipt of pension rupees twenty - five per mensem for similar bereavement of [male protector]6323-male protector and head of [family]6324-family lost in ' 57 mutiny , therefore [her]768-the mother pension of rupees twenty per mensem , only , for exile of [husband]5584-husband to [Calcutta]12-calcutta , be commuted to similar sum of twenty - five , seeing that [[your]3491-sir poor petitioner]6326-your poor petitioner is in floods of tears and wholly heartbroken through this most nonregulation , premature death of [promising young scion of [[her]768-the mother noble house]6328-her noble house , on whom , as on blessed [Victoria]303-victoria kaiser - i - hind , [Queen]6329-queen , [her]303-victoria kaiser - i - hind hopes were fixed]6327-promising young scion of her noble house , on whom , as on blessed victoria , queen , her hopes were fixed . [Said petitioner]6330-said petitioner being able to prove alibi , absolute incomplicity , and continuous remaining at [home]3521-home during late devilish disturbances . ' "[1009-the commissioner] " [Poor old soul]6332-poor old soul ! "[334-the doctor] laughed [the doctor]334-the doctor , " give it to [her]768-the mother if [you]3491-sir can , [sir]3491-sir . And as for remaining at [home]3521-home , [everybody]939-everybody except [the actual conspirators]6336-the actual conspirators did that . Even [Dya - Ram]142-dya ram , the disaffected -- though [he]142-dya ram has preached armed resistance to tyranny in [his]142-dya ram paper for years . Fact ; jammed [his]142-dya ram fingers in so doing , and came to [me]334-the doctor in a blind funk for a professional certificate that the wound could not have been caused by any lethal weapon . "[334-the doctor] " But [Ramanund]163-ramanund seems to have attempted a lead , "[1009-the commissioner] put in [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner , judicially . " Exactly . " That is another thing [I]334-the doctor should like to have seen -- [dear old Pidar Narâyan--]136-pidar narâyan-- "[334-the doctor] The hard voice found even softness too loud ; and in the silence which fell between [the two men]5348-the two men , only [the Commissioner]1009-the commissioner 's pen could be heard . " [You]334-the doctor 'll look in at [the palace]3477-the palace , perhaps , and see all is right , "[1209-the brogue] came [the brogue]1209-the brogue , after a bit , " and give [my]1209-the brogue love to [old Smith]74-eugene smith . "[334-the doctor] put in [the doctor]334-the doctor ; so , with the pith hat turning [him]334-the doctor into an animated mushroom , [he]334-the doctor passed out into the blaze of dry yellow sunshine , on [that dry yellow sand]3317-that dry yellow sand . The sky above was molten with light and heat , [the gaol]1501-the gaol positively shimmered in the glare . Not a sound , not a sight , told of that midsummer night 's dream of wild , useless revolt , save when one of [the shackled prisoners awaiting trial]3319-the shackled prisoners awaiting trial sought a better bit of shade under the wilted palms , which , not a week before , had welcomed [the Hosts of [the Lord - sahib]3420-the lord - sahib]1003-the hosts of the lord - sahib on [their]1003-the hosts of the lord - sahib way to [the hills]343-the hills . The whole thing seemed incredible ; yet , as [he]334-the doctor crossed [the road]3494-the road to enter [the Smiths ' compound]3324-the smiths ' compound , the footsteps of [those other Hosts who had passed on to [the hills]343-the hills]3325-those other hosts who had passed on to the hills also remained to dimple the dry yellow sand . [[The Smiths]85-the smiths ' bungalow]5234-the smiths ' bungalow lay calm , peaceful ; [the drawing - room]3545-the drawing - room , as [he]334-the doctor entered [it]5234-the smiths ' bungalow , struck [him]334-the doctor with the old , familiar sense of refinement , indexing the refinement of [its mistress]1541-its mistress . Only one change caught [his]334-the doctor observant eyes . [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's photograph was no longer on the mantle - piece , whence it had always looked out with a certain challenge in its very prominence . Where had it gone ? What matter ? There was no need for such defiance now , thought [George Dillon]69-dr. dillon , with that curious half - cynical , half - resentful smile [he]69-dr. dillon kept for one subject only . [She]3330-she might keep the photograph where [she]3330-she chose , now , and [none]403-none would blame [her]3330-she . So thinking , [he]69-dr. dillon set aside the curtain which hung at [[his]69-dr. dillon patient]1548-his patient 's door , and as [he]69-dr. dillon did so , resentment , cynicism , vanished in quick sympathy . " Ah ! fever again , [I]69-dr. dillon see,--that 's a bore , "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon said , going over swiftly to the bed where [Eugene Smith]74-eugene smith 's long length lay visibly shivering ; for something,--the exposure , the excitement , the strain , perhaps , of that awful inaction behind the door against which [Vincent Dering]71-vincent was making that heroic stand,--had knocked [the big man]3333-the big man over , a prey to [an old enemy]3334-an old enemy -- malarial fever . " When did it come on ? "[151-muriel] [Muriel Smith]151-muriel , who sat on the bed , [her]151-muriel hand in one of [[her]151-muriel husband]3787-her husband 's shaking , trembling ones , looked up . [She]151-muriel was very pale , but very calm . " Half an hour ago . It is a pity . [We]3336-we hoped it was broken , did n't [we]3336-we ? But [he]3333-the big man will fret [himself]3333-the big man so , [Doctor--]307-doctor-- "[151-muriel] [Her]151-muriel eyes , on [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's , were telling [their]3336-we tale , so that it scarcely needed the rambling , quivering voice to show that the fresh onset of fever had once more clouded [the sick man]1528-the sick man 's brain . " But [I]3338-the woman beside him tell [him]3333-the big man , [Doctor]3435-doctor -- and it 's true , is n't it?--that it was hardest for [him]3333-the big man -- and that -- that [Vincent]71-vincent would rather have had it so -- because [he]71-vincent had to leave [no one]3741-no one , and [Eugene]74-eugene smith had [Gladys]276-gladys -- and [me]3338-the woman beside him . "[3338-the woman beside him] [Her]3338-the woman beside him voice seemed to bring comfort , and the glistening , feverish eyes closed . But the tragedy of [her]3338-the woman beside him face remained in [his]74-eugene smith memory as [he]74-eugene smith drove over [the creaking , groaning bridge]3340-the creaking , groaning bridge to [Eshwara]1-eshwara . [The bazaar]372-the bazaar was full as ever with drifting humanity , busy in the details of every - day life . There was no hint anywhere of the past storm ; not even in [the palace]3477-the palace . [It]3477-the palace lay , as ever , silent ; [its]3477-the palace blank walls seeming to hold the sunlight back from some secret within,--from some veiled , hidden beauty . The door was closed , but [old Akbar Khân]110-akbar came capering at [his]110-akbar call , [his]110-akbar back roached , in bowing , like a caterpillar 's . " [The tomb]6346-the tomb is finished , [Ge]282-ge - reeb - reeb - pun - wâz , "[110-akbar] [he]110-akbar mumbled , in blubbering importance . " Ala ! the sad day ! But [this slave]4971-this slave , knowing all customary things , hath remained insistent on [the workmen]3714-the workmen ; therefore all is befitting [the noble people]4042-the noble people , as [the Huzoor]90-huzoor will see . "[110-akbar] So , down [the shadowy passage]3343-the shadowy passage [he]110-akbar led the way , crablike , to [the chapel]1291-the chapel ; for hither , long years before , [Father Ninian]81-father ninian had brought the body of [Pietro Bonaventura]148-pietro bonaventura , and here , just in front of the Altar steps , [he]81-father ninian and [[Pietro]148-pietro bonaventura 's granddaughter]3345-pietro 's granddaughter -- the last of [the old priest]1250-the old priest 's charges,--had been buried the day before . [The masons]3347-the masons had been busy , building up [the vault]3348-the vault again ; but , as [Akbar Khân]110-akbar had said , the work was finished , [the chapel]1291-the chapel restored to [its]1291-the chapel original state , swept , and garnished . Even the candles were lit on [the Altar]5145-the altar , and four of the tallest tapers had been placed , one at each corner of the stone slab on which two more names would have to be cut ; while from these tapers long strings of jasmine flowers , such as [native women]3351-native women wear , had been hung in drooping chains to form an enclosure . On the slab itself great bossed yellow marigolds were laid to simulate a cross . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon turned to [the cringing figure beside [him]69-dr. dillon]3352-the cringing figure beside him sharply ; but there was something almost pathetic in its simper of conscious merit , its certainty of satisfaction . " Did [you]3352-the cringing figure beside him do that ? "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon asked . " [Ge - reeb]282-ge - reeb - pun - wâz ! "[69-dr. dillon] There was a world of pride and of servitude in the voice , and in the folded , prayerful hands which shot out under the bowings . " [This slave]4971-this slave made it ! Has [not this dust - like one]6351-not this dust - like one spent [his]4971-this slave life in preparing amusements and spectacles for [the noble people]4042-the noble people ? [He]4971-this slave knows that [tombs]6353-tombs require flowers , as [women]479-women do . "[69-dr. dillon] Through the arches behind the old pantaloon [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon could catch a glimpse of [the garden]433-the garden , ablaze with colour , could smell the perfume of the now fading orange - blossoms , could see the water - maze , with [its]3354-its marble ledges , among the lotus , just wide enough for the flying feet of [a laughing girl]471-a laughing girl . "[3483-the old man] The phrase asserted itself again , and [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon looked at the wicked old face , so comic , so pathetic , with the hopeless recognition of the humour of tragedy which comes to all save the invincibly dull . " [You]479-women would do as well as [anyone]3948-anyone , "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon said gravely . " [I]69-dr. dillon 'll mention [your]479-women name . "[69-dr. dillon] " Ge -- reeb - pun -- wâz ! "[69-dr. dillon] The title prolonged itself abnormally , and [Akbar Khân]110-akbar , a mask of toothless smiles , darted , in instant assumption of [[his]69-dr. dillon anticipated office]3357-his anticipated office , to remove a fallen jasmine flower from [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon 's path as if it had been a deadly reptile . [Dr. Dillon]69-dr. dillon turned so sharply that [the old courtier]5759-the old courtier began instantly on asseverations that , without orders-- " Have everything ready , of course , "[334-the doctor] interrupted [the doctor]334-the doctor , impatiently ; so strode off across [the courtyard]386-the courtyard , [his]69-dr. dillon head down , [his]69-dr. dillon hands in [his]69-dr. dillon pockets , with a jerk , as of irritation , in [his]69-dr. dillon walk . [He]69-dr. dillon found [Lance Carlyon]68-lance in [the balcony over [the river]333-the river]3364-the balcony over the river , very apologetic at being caught [there]3509-there against orders . " Does n't seem to have done much harm ! "[334-the doctor] admitted [the doctor]334-the doctor , gruffly , as [he]334-the doctor sat feeling the ankle and looking at [Lance]68-lance with the oddest air of impatience , irritation , and kindliness . " It must be beastly dull , too , "[334-the doctor] went on [the doctor]334-the doctor , loudly , suddenly . " [You]68-lance -- [you]68-lance might get [them]6368-them to help [you]68-lance over to [the palace garden]3504-the palace garden this afternoon ; about four , [you]68-lance know , when it gets cool . That would be a change . "[334-the doctor] [Lance]68-lance positively gasped . " Rath - er ! Why ! [you]68-lance told [me]68-lance yesterday [I]68-lance was n't to move a muscle for ten days ! "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon said fiercely . " Not what [you]68-lance call moving . But gentle exercise and -- and congenial society -- and all that ! [You]68-lance know the treatment ! "[69-dr. dillon] [He]69-dr. dillon was at work undoing the bandages already , and the last part of [his]69-dr. dillon remarks came , argumentatively , to [himself]69-dr. dillon . " If [you]105-erda really think it might injure [me]68-lance permanently , "[68-lance] began [Lance]68-lance , soberly , in some surprise . "[69-dr. dillon] But as , half an hour after this , [he]69-dr. dillon came out from saying good - by to [Erda Shepherd]105-erda , [he]69-dr. dillon paused as [he]69-dr. dillon passed [the Pool of Immortality]4072-the pool of immortality , and looked down into it as if [he]69-dr. dillon felt some need of salvation . " ' If [I]69-dr. dillon be not damned for this ! ' "[69-dr. dillon] [he]69-dr. dillon quoted softly , shook [his]69-dr. dillon head , and went back to [[his]69-dr. dillon prisoners]3373-his prisoners . So it came to pass that when [Erda Shepherd]105-erda -- after laying the wreath [she]105-erda had brought as a sort of crown to [Akbar Khân]110-akbar 's ' crass'--went into [the garden]433-the garden for a last look at [the familiar places]3375-the familiar places , [she]105-erda found [Lance Carlyon]68-lance comfortably settled in one of the balconies overhanging [the river]333-the river . " This is luck ! "[68-lance] [he]68-lance cried , forgetting the starched bandage until reminded of it by a sudden twinge of pain . " [I]68-lance thought [I]68-lance was never to see [you]105-erda again , and it seemed a bit rough -- on -- on [us]6377-us both ; considering what a lot [we]6377-us did together , [you]105-erda know . [I]68-lance 've been writing [you]105-erda a letter , to say how disappointed [I]68-lance was at not being able to get over and see [you]105-erda all this morning . "[68-lance] " That was very kind of [you]68-lance , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda said feebly , conscious that the surprise had made [her]105-erda feel a little limp . Though , of course , [she]105-erda regretted nothing ; nothing at all ! " [I]68-lance 've been wanting to know such a lot , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance went on . " Of course [I]68-lance heard about [the others]3977-the others , but not about [you]105-erda -- [you]105-erda need n't go away immediately , need [you]105-erda ? "[68-lance] [he]68-lance asked , as [he]68-lance watched [her]105-erda face,--"if -- if [you]105-erda could stop a bit , it would be so jolly . "[68-lance] The frank wistfulness of [his]68-lance tone was too much for [her]105-erda . " Yes ! [I]105-erda can stop , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda said quietly ; " what is it [you]68-lance want to know ? "[105-erda] " Lots of things ; but about [yourself]105-erda first of all ! "[68-lance] [Herself]105-erda ! That would be the hardest task , [she]105-erda felt ; and the memory of that senseless flight from [her]105-erda own reflection in the mirror came back to bring a quick flush to [her]105-erda cheek . " Of course , if [you]105-erda 'd rather not-- "[68-lance] began [observant Lance]68-lance . " [I]105-erda was only thinking there was very little to tell , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda put in quickly . [She]105-erda was not even going to allow that , in keeping this incident to [herself]105-erda , [she]105-erda was giving it any importance . [She]105-erda had told [herself]105-erda during the last few days that it had been unfortunate , that was all . Otherwise it was trivial ; since it did not , could not , alter [her]105-erda decision . On the contrary , it strengthened it ; just as a temptation resisted always strengthened that resistance . So , in the balcony where [lovers]556-lovers had sat and talked of love , [those two]1341-those two sat talking of that midsummer night 's dream , of everything but love . Of [Vincent Dering]71-vincent 's song , of the raft , of [Lance]68-lance 's experience as [he]68-lance clung to the highest crevice , and felt the water stop steady between [his]68-lance knee and [his]68-lance ankle . Of [his]68-lance incredulity when [Am - ma]131-am - ma appeared , and [his]68-lance immediate lapse into unconsciousness ; chiefly , [he]68-lance supposed , because there was no need for further endurance . Of how [he]68-lance had no notion of anything till [he]68-lance found [himself]68-lance lying on a string bed in the sun , right away on [the other side of [the town]331-the town]3379-the other side of the town , whither [Am - ma]3733-am - ma had brought [him]68-lance , by Heaven knows what secret passage . So , as the shadows grew long , they seemed to invade [Lance]68-lance 's face , and bring a doubt to it . " [I]68-lance have n't seen [Am - ma]131-am - ma since , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance said , " so [I]68-lance have n't found out yet why on earth [he]131-am - ma came to look for [me]68-lance ? "[68-lance] [Erda]105-erda rose and held out [her]105-erda hand . " [We]6379-we were all looking for [you]68-lance , [Mr. Carlyon]106-mr. carlyon , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda said quietly , " and [we]6379-we were all very glad to find [you]68-lance . And -- and [I]105-erda am very sorry to -- to lose [you]68-lance . "[105-erda] [He]68-lance rose too , stiffly , and , taking [her]105-erda hand , held it while [he]68-lance looked into [her]105-erda face steadily . " Good - by , [Miss Shepherd]105-erda -- I'm -- I'm sorry it has to be that -- but [you]105-erda know best . And thank [you]105-erda for telling [me]68-lance -- so much . "[68-lance] [He]68-lance paused , and [his]68-lance hand tightened on [hers]105-erda a little . " Thanks all round , for that ! It has been the truth between [us]6380-us , has n't it , always ? And so -- though it has been a bit rough -- Good - by ! "[68-lance] There was a pause , a curious pause . " Good - by , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda echoed dully , [her]105-erda face grown very pale . [His]68-lance hand left [hers]105-erda gently . [She]105-erda turned and faced [the garden]433-the garden , where the shadows were invading the blaze of colour , and the coming cool was sending the scent of the orange - blossoms into the air . The water - maze , with [its]3383-its marble ledges , where there was but room for the feet of [a laughing girl]471-a laughing girl , lay still and glistening before [her]105-erda . [The palace]3477-the palace , with [its]3477-the palace fanciful nooks , [its]3477-the palace illogical recesses , [its]3477-the palace suggestion of elusive pleasures beyond the pale of solid reality , rose up into the sky . And something in the scene came home to [her]105-erda with the sense that all this , in its way , was real also . That this was part of the truth . The truth which [she]105-erda had not told . " It has been the truth between [us]6381-us , has n't it , always ? "[105-erda] [She]105-erda turned suddenly to where [Lance]68-lance stood ; turned to find [him]68-lance leaning over [the balcony]644-the balcony , looking down into the water with a listlessness [he]68-lance had held in check till then ; and a great wave of remorse swept through [her]105-erda . " It has not been the truth between [us]6381-us ! "[105-erda] [she]105-erda cried impulsively , recklessly--"not quite -- but , [I]105-erda will tell it now -- if [you]68-lance like . "[105-erda] [He]68-lance looked up , startled . " If [you]68-lance think [I]68-lance -- [I]68-lance ought to know . "[68-lance] [She]105-erda gave a queer , half - impatient laugh . " Ought ! How do [I]105-erda know ? Yes ! [I]105-erda suppose so -- as it 's true -- absolutely true . [I]105-erda ca n't help that , can [I]105-erda ? "[105-erda] There was a forlornness in the confession ; almost a despair . " Then tell [me]68-lance , please , "[68-lance] said [Lance]68-lance , deliberately making room for [her]105-erda to lean over the balustrade beside [him]68-lance . [His]68-lance heart was beating fast at something in [her]105-erda face , and yet [his]68-lance uppermost thought was for [her]105-erda ; for that forlornness , that despair . " [I]68-lance can forget it afterwards -- if [you]105-erda want [me]68-lance to , "[68-lance] [he]68-lance added consolingly . [She]105-erda came to the place beside [him]68-lance , and looked down , hiding [her]105-erda face from all but [the sliding river]3387-the sliding river ; and [he]68-lance , seeing [her]105-erda desire , looked into it also . " It was about [my]105-erda starting on [the raft]4626-the raft , "[105-erda] [she]105-erda began with a little sob . " [I]105-erda did n't tell [you]68-lance the truth about that . [I]105-erda -- [I]105-erda did n't come to give the warning at first -- [I]105-erda -- [I]105-erda was coming to [you]68-lance . "[105-erda] " Yes ! "[68-lance] [he]68-lance said quietly ; but [his]68-lance hand found [hers]105-erda and held it . " [You]105-erda were coming to [me]68-lance , [dear,--why]308-dear,--why ? "[68-lance] That touch seemed at once to help [her]105-erda , and to make [her]105-erda desperate . " Because -- oh , [Lance]68-lance ! it was so foolish ! [I]3388-i saw [myself]3388-i in the glass -- all in white with the orange in [my]3388-i hand -- and [I]3388-i thought of [you]68-lance -- of what [you]68-lance said -- of -- of [the World]31-the world 's Desire , and -- and [I]3388-i felt [I]3388-i couldn't -- so -- so [I]3388-i was coming to [you]68-lance -- first -- when Am - [ma]68-lance -- don't [you]68-lance see-- "[3388-i] There was a long pause . [His]3388-i hand , firm , strong , did not tighten , it simply held [hers]105-erda as [they]3389-they both looked down on [the sliding river]3387-the sliding river . " Thanks ! "[3388-i] [he]3388-i said after a time ; and then there was another pause until [he]3388-i added , " It will be a bit rough , [I]3388-i 'm afraid , on [the Reverend David]190-david , but [I]3388-i do n't see how [we]3389-they can help that -- do [you]68-lance ? "[3388-i] And this time [his]3388-i clasp tightened . [Erda]105-erda said nothing ; [she]105-erda felt there was nothing more to say , now that the truth had been told between [them]3389-they . So while the sinking sun flared red on the " Cradle of [the Gods]3472-the gods "[3388-i] [another man]1875-another man and [woman]534-woman consoled [themselves]3389-they for [the lost Paradise]6207-the lost paradise .
